Constant vigilance against them will take a toll on the civil service sector such as the police and civil defense .
More research and studies would have to be done to learn about them , their thinking and their actions and how one should be prepared to fight against them .
As  terrorism spreads  , from the bombing of the Twin Towers in United States of America (NYDailyNews , ) to the Mumbai attacks (Mail Online , ) , one could see  it is becoming much tougher to fight it in the future .
Other than relying on the police and the military forces , the government has to educate the public on the dangers of terrorism and the importance in preventing them .
Research has shown that it is more cost effective to prevent than to deal with the aftermath of terrorism .
Thus the need to divert reserves into this area of development is very important .
Education is also an important part of the country's development .
In Singapore's context , education starts when a child enters pre-school or kindergarten l . Government spending in the education sector has been growing each year .
This is due to increasing expenses for the needs to hire teachers and   provide subsidized education for the public .
Such costs do not stop once a child leaves  secondary school .
If he furthers his studies  , more spending will be sustained .
Even after graduating from a local university , education does not stop .
Emphasizing on continual learning and skills upgrading for older workers will help them to remain competitive in the workforce .
For instance , the Skills Programme for Upgrading and Resilience (SPUR) (NTUC Learning Hub , SPUR) is introduced to employers to encourage  them to send their workers to these trainings .
Such courses and workshops are relatively expensive to conduct and thus , the government's efforts to subsidize them will encourage more workers to  upgrade themselves .
This could also keep the older generation longer in the economy and provide for themselves for more years to come , instead of relying on the government , which may in turn , reduce the need to spend on the elderly .
Hence education is comparatively important and thus requires a fair amount of public spending .
Clearly , spending on the aged is important .
However , the government should not focus too much on this particular sector and neglect the rest .
Education will have a positive impact on the economy" .
Educating the youth who are our future pillars of support , would equip them with skills so that they can handle potential problems , which in turn could support the elderly population in the future .
Education for the older generation would also  help the economy  as they will remain competitive and up-to-date with the relevant skills and are able to support themselves for a much longer period of time .
Security and safety of the people are as important as well .
As shown , preventive measures against terrorism is a cost effective way to counter them instead of dealing with the aftermath of an attack .
As the saying goes: " it's better to be safe than sorry .
Singapore was ranked third for the highest life expectancy in the world .
Before taking any  action , leaders must first realise that any further expansion of retirement benefits would only impoverish future generations and limit future public spending (Peterson , P .G .
(2001)) .
Therefore , I agree that public spending on the aged should be limited so that funds can be diverted to other areas like the Ministry of Finance , Education , Health and National Development .
Each area must not be neglected , as they have significant contributions in taking care of the aging population .
Firstly , for the Ministry of Finance  in Singapore , funds must be pumped into the economy to ensure solvency of the country .
For instance , the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) are established to make sure that entities operating within Singapore are attuned to  international standards and practices .
All these statutory boards and institutions require funds to run their operations to ensure Singapore's competitiveness .
For example , funds are needed to build good infrastructure and facilities for academic purposes  .
After all , the younger generations represent the future of Singapore and they will soon be the ones taking care of the aged .
Funds are also needed to provide effective educational programs to ensure that the young are equipped with fine skills to cope with the demands of the society  .
Funds are also needed  to educate the young on  moral valuesbecause moral values are the corner stone of an individual's character and personality .
Thirdly , funds are needed for the Ministry of Health to ensure that the rising demand of healthcare services for the general public is met .
For example , as mentioned by our Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong (National Day Rally Speech , 2009) , hospitals like Khoo Teck Puat Hospital and Jurong General Hospital will be built to meet the rising demand of increased patients  .
Funds from the government are also needed to aid  voluntary welfare organizations .
More acute cases  could be handled by hospitals and the patients who are less serious can recuperate at home with their families  .
This in turn  is also a cheaper alternative for the patients to cope with the rising healthcare cost .
However , if public spending on the aged is not limited , more financial aid could be given to them , and this in turn will lessen the burden of the younger generation to provide for the elderly .
At the same time , the aged will feel more valued by the nation when they are being cared for .
Lastly , funds are needed for the Ministry of National Development to develop housing policies  and to build national parks and  neighbourhood parks  .
For the former , housing grants , subsidies , CPF schemes are used to ensure that the public could afford a flat .
Funds are also needed to build handicap facilities , for instance , ramps and the Lift Upgrading Program (LUP) .
For the latter it is especially important for the public as they can have a place for leisure .
It could be a place for all the residents in the neighbourhood to come together to interact , exercise and make friends .
This would help prevent them from experiencing loneliness and also serve as a channel for the residents to communicate and help each other in times of need .
Therefore , after considering all the factors , I agree that public spending on the aged should be limited as other factors are equally important  , such as  taking care of the public and  ensuring international competiveness and progress of the nation .
Each factor has its own way of contributing to  society as a whole and the elderly will benefit directly or indirectly from the developments as well .
Public spending must be cost effective to ensure a steady rate of returns from its investments to allow the country to develop and prosper .
Sufficient public funds are needed to develop different areas of the country which include social , economical , defence and government administration .
To ensure that there are sufficient funds for the country's development , public spending on the aged should be limited .
In order for the country to develop , funds are needed  in the retraining of the workers , expansion of the economic structure and maintenance of a high standard of education in various educational institutions .
Firstly ,  funds are needed  in retraining  the workers .
Due to globalization , the training of workers is important to develop and maintain a highly skilled workforce .
The Singapore Budget (2009) reported that the government will be spending $457 .7 million of  public fund to subsidise training programmes for working Singaporeans .
In Singapore , the Ministry of Manpower and Workforce Development Agency have developed a program called Skills Programme for Upgrading and Resilience or SPUR , to provide training courses at subsidized rate  .
Apart from helping population to be re-skilled ,  SPUR  also helps retrenched workers to learn new skills so that they can be reemployed and companies are able to send their personnel for training which helps to reduce retrenchments .
However , there are some older workers who are unable to attend any courses despite being to them at subsidized rates .
Dr Isa Hassan (citation) identified three factors on why older workers are not attending any courses .
Firstly , some older workers have weak command of English or are English illiterates as they are school dropouts .
This has discouraged them from attending the training course as it is conducted in English .
Secondly , older workers have little time to attend training courses .
Some older workers are earning minimal wages  , and thus they have to take a second  or part time job to boost their income earning .
Lastly , the older workers are resistant toward going back to school to be re-skilled .
Some older workers may feel embarrassed or dislike going back to school at an old age .
Therefore to develop and maintain a highly skilled workforce , workers have to go for training courses to be re-skilled and retrenched workers have to learn new skills to be reemployed .
Secondly , government expenditure is needed to expand and maintain the economic structure .
The Singapore Budget (2009) has reported that the the Ministry of Transport and Ministry of Trade and Industry will be spending a total of $4624 .83 million on expanding the road network , railway network and developing the industrial infrastructure in Singapore .
Having an excellent  infrastructure like an efficient transportation network  , will attract foreign investors  .
This will turn the country into an industrial hub .
The  World Bank reported that Singapore had earned the top position of having a top logistic hub in the world .
As a result , the country is able to maintain its economic competitive edge , as well as to create more jobs for the people and enjoy higher standard of living .
Lastly , public spending is required to maintain a high standard of education in various educational institutions .
A high standard of education is an important factor of maintaining a highly educated workforce in the country .
Investing in education is like investing in the future , so that the future generations are able to meet future challenges .
In Singapore , the government invests heavily on education through subsidising school fees  .
In the Singapore Budget (2009) , the Ministry of Education is investing $7 ,884 million in subsidising school fees .
This is to ensure that school fees are affordable and every citizen is allowed to receive a proper education .
In conclusion , public spending on the aged should be limited so that funds could be used in developing the country through the retraining of workers , expansion of economic structure and maintenance of a high standard of education in various educational institutions .
Funds being used for the country's development would benefit both the young and old .
Firstly , investment in education is vital in promoting economic growth .
Moreover , it prepares oneself to think independently and logically .
Through education , individuals are armed with the necessary skills and knowledge which would increase their productivity and competitiveness in the labour market .
The process of gaining knowledge is of paramount importance in developing countries as it would reduce the level of poverty and increase the ability of their people to find quality jobs .
In this way , wealth would be generated and the economy would improve  .
Nevertheless , it could be argued that the benefit of education in elevating economic growth is still unapparent .
There is no one type of education that is suitable for all societies .
Joshua (2001) also mentioned that it is unclear which type of education would lead to a higher economic growth .
Yet , one cannot deny the fact that a shortage of educated people would restrict economic expansion .
Thus , it is crucial for countries to invest in a form of education that is desirable for its people to ensure greater economic development .
Secondly , countries should also focus on providing financial aid for trainings and seminars to be conducted for the working population .
Through the processes of upgrading , individuals are empowered with the relevant skills and knowledge demanded by the job market .
For instance , the National Trade Union Congress (NTUC) , of Singapore (2001-2009) has been active in providing trainings for jobholders to upgrade their skills and knowledge .
In this way , they would have the proficiency to deal with any problems that may arise .
Nonetheless , it could be refuted that this might promote job hopping .
With the new skills and knowledge obtained , individuals would hunt for better paying and quality jobs .
Ilana (2001) claimed that people who possessed the essential skills would change occupations due to the lucrative salary offered by different companies .
However , the funding of training programmes should still proceed as it would increase the productivity and capability of the working population in handling any challenges that might surface in the future .
Lastly , funding on national security should not be ignored .
A strong military defence helps to deter any possible threats and dangers that may occur .
This is of great importance in today's context where terrorism is becoming prominent .
In recent times , terrorists have access to sophisticated technologies that could create greater destruction to the surroundings and are able to instil fear in the people .
Hence , organisations and agencies related to national defence ought to receive adequate financial assistance for research and development .
In this way , military forces would then be armed with the latest equipment  to maintain their fighting capabilities .
For example , the Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (2000) stated that 13 million dollars are spent on national security yearly even though it places an immense pressure on the federal budget .
Therefore , continual support on national defence is  important to ensure peace and harmony within the society .
In conclusion , nations should be careful in deciding the amount of money to be spent on each area of development .
Funds should not be spent solely on the elderly as it would hinder the growth of other areas like education , trainings and national security .
Policy makers should realise and recognise that it is through careful planning and a combination of effective policies that would allow the nations to grow and flourish .
Aging population is a worldwide situation which will affect all countries in the world at different intensities and speed (United Nations [UN] , 2002) .
This process is experienced by the developed countries at first but now the developing countries as well and it is especially rapid in this twenty-first century (UN , 2002) .
As the proportion of elderly persons in the world continues to increase , there is a need for the government to intervene as there will be many elderly who cannot support themselves .
Thus , the government needs to come up with policies to help them .
If this public spending on the elderly is not limited , it might have an impact on the countries in terms of national budgets and economies .
Therefore , public spending on the aged should be limited so that economic growth can be sustained , societal problems faced by the communities can be solved and other essential policies can be sustained .
If public spending on the aged is not limited , the government will not be able to solve problems faced by society .
Many countries face problems such as housing , transportation and education (Robert B . Friedland and Laura Summer , 2005) .
Policies will need to be introduced and thus will increase expenditures of the government .
This will increase the burden of the present and future working generations .
Through cutting  spending on the aged , the funds can be used in solving problems faced by society and help to relieve the pressure faced by the current working force  .
The government should channel its spending to sustain policies which are vital for the country .
It will need to focus on areas such as education and reduce elder dependency  .
With higher education , the future generations of working people tend to have higher incomes and thus can accumulate more wealth for future use when they are old (Robert B . Friedland and Laura Summer , 2005) .
The government can also lower barriers to elder employment and stress filial obligation (Robert B . Friedland and Laura Summer , 2005) .
However , all these policies might not necessarily produce the desired results .
For example , though the government gives subsidies to companies to urge them to employ older workers , there may not be many who have the necessary skills .
The government will need to spend some money on retraining the elderly to equip them with the necessary skills for the jobs .
Thus , the government will need to be flexible in altering its policies .
Though there may be uncertainties about the results  , it is still important to limit public spending on the aged so that some money can still be diverted to other important areas .
As more countries are facing the problem of an aging population , it is important to limit public spending on the aged so as to sustain economic growth , solve problems of the communities and support necessary policies for the country .
Different countries will need to have different solutions specially tailored to fit their own countries and public spending should be split evenly  .
Firstly , in order to cope with the drastic fall in fertility rate , the government has encouraged Singaporeans to marry and procreate , and at the same time attract foreigners into our society .
Additionally , the government has also introduced a Marriage and Parenthood Package which includes bigger baby bonus , longer maternity leave , as well as increased subsidies at childcare centres to boost her population .
Unfortunately , these schemes have not seemed to have appealed to appeal to the vast majority as the birth rate still remains stagnant .
In recent years , awareness on the extension of employment years has also been promoted .
The society today has widened their perspective in employing aged workers and hence encouraged them to continue working even when they reached their retirement age .
A latest survey confirmed that most Singaporean companies agreed that retirement of older worker will be a great loss of valuable skills and knowledge .
Therefore , having an ageing workforce might not necessarily be negative .
Elderly workers can also provide mentorship for the younger employees , imparting and sharing their valuable knowledge and past working experiences .
In an ageing society , the social aspects not only include the need for appropriate housing schemes but also health care systems for present and future generations of elderly .
An elderly-friendly built environment is a key principle to which the elderly elderly can adjust and integrate themselves into the community .
For instance , accessible infrastructure provides a safe and comfortable environment for the elderly to use in their their old age .
Indirectly , it also helps to maintain social network and allows them to participate in social activities .
Hence , The Housing Development Board has customised studio apartments equipped with elder-friendly fittings and features .
In addition , the lift upgrading programme was introduced to allow lifts to be provided at every level of high-rise HDB blocks for the convenience of the elderly .
Furthermore , other facelift programs in the older estates include ramps for wheelchair accessibility , fitness corner and covered walkways .
Hence , with these schemes , it is proven that the elderly in Singapore are given top priority in the community .
A nation needs a strong economy to support its expenditure .
A weak economy would have difficulty to divide its funds among the different areas .
Needless to say , the nation would have problems to support the increasing spending on the elderly in a bearish economy .
Hence , a strong economy would allow the nation to set aside more funds for the elderly .
Limiting the public spending on the elderly is only temporary .
This solution will benefit everyone in the long term .
Thus it is important for the nation to divert our public spending  with the aim of improving the economy .
Just like the elderly are an important asset to a nation , children are an also important asset .
The nation can help the younger generation by diverting its fund on other areas .
Hoover (Lewis , 2009) , 31st President of the United States , once said , "Children are our most valuable natural resource" .
Prof Ho (2007) also pointed out that children , being the future of a nation , are the most important asset .
This means that there is need to start early on each children's development .
The nation has great responsibility to help in developing the children's potential .
They will be the ones that will bring the nation to a greater height .
Therefore , funds should be diverted to assist  child's development .
There is another reason why public funding on the elderly should be limited .
A nation need to ensure the workforce is well trained to remain competitive .
Many countries , such as Denmark and Singapore , have started to retrain their workers (Onn , 2008) .
The workforce is the driving force that improves the economy of a country .
Since the economy affects how much funding a nation can spend on the elderly , it is important to ensure that the workforce receives enough training to improve the economy .
However , people should not rely on its government to provide funds for training .
The responsibility lies on the individual who wants to keep his rice bowl .
These people should spend more money on training to assist their future career .
But there is a need to remember that not all people can fully support themselves for training programs .
As a result , the government should still provide basic incentives to aid people to remain competitive in the industry .
The three reasons provided explain why public funds on elderly should be limited and diverted to other areas of development .
These areas will affect how much a nation can support its aging population .
Although the elderly are an important asset ,  they are not the only asset a nation has .
In conclusion , the nation needs to sacrifice the elderly temporarily for the benefit of everyone .
By diverting the resources to develop on other areas , the elderly will benefit more in the future .
The nation must not be short sighted and seek to solve problems of an ageing population only .
Policymakers should think of how the nation can solve the ageing population in the process of developing plans that will benefit the other areas .
To achieve this , we need to remember this; assisting the elderly is important but building a nation is more important .
In the developed countries , many countries are facing the problems of fast ageing population .
There will be great age shift between now and 2030 as the proportion of residents aged sixty-five or older will increased gradually ( , 2009) .
The seriousness of the problems will not only affect oneself but also affect the whole economy as there will be lesser population contributing to the workforce and to the National Service .
With regard to the problems , many countries focus much attention on it by introducing policies or by giving out funds in order to reduce the problems caused by the ageing population .
Public spending should be used to provide more options and protection for the elderly .
However , it would be better if the expenses used on the aged is limited so that there will be sufficient funds available for other areas of the country's development .
The government may implement certain policies to help the aged or give out enough subsidies to the needy but to a certain limit .
The burden on the government will be reduced and will in turn instill responsibilities between the aged and working people .
There are many areas that may contribute to the economy growth of a country .
If public spending is limited , the pressure on the government will be reduced .
Thus sufficient funds will be directed to areas which may contribute to the economy .
Subsidies can be given to other companies that are affected by the current economy downturn .
Singapore has been lending out its helping hands to many companies to encourage the balance among work and life .
This may result in greater productivity among the workers as they tend to be more committed to their work ( , 2009) .
The Government may also spend the amount in development where it can attract foreign talents to the country to solve the problems of manpower shortage .
In order to ensure that there are sufficient funds for these areas of development , the government will have to limit the amount of spending on the aged .
It will tend to create awareness on the serious problems due to the ageing population if public spending is limited .
This is to ensure that the elderly and the working people will not over rely on the government for aids .
In addition , it is the responsibility of the elderly as well as the working people to plan financially for their future ( , 2001) .
During their contribution to the working world , the aged should be able to plan ahead  for their future on the likely costs incurred for health care services .
If public spending is not limited , the aged or the working people may take the aids provided by the government for  .
Thus they may not work hard during their contribution to the working world .
However , some may think that if  public spending is limited , it will result in pressure on the aged as well as on the working people as they will have to provide for rising health care costs in the future .
Also , the numbers of working people supporting the aged have reduced thus putting strain for them .
In order to solve this problem , the government has implemented certain policies to aid the aged .
Some of the policies are the introduction of the Central Provident Funds , tax reliefs and the Public Housing scheme .
Central Provident Fund is a saving plan that has provided Singaporean with a sense of security in their old age .
For example , the MediShield is used to better prepare them for the future medical costs ( , 2009) .The implementation of these policies will hence reduce the burden on the aged and thus reduce the public spending required on them .
Meticulous financial planning is crucial to all country .
Inappropriate management of finance can lead to the downfall of the country .
According  (2003) , from 2000 to 2030 , the worldwide population aged more than 65 years is projected to increase from 550 million to 973 million approximately .
Therefore more attention is needed to be given to the aged .
Although there seem to be an urgent need to spend more on the aged due to the aging population , other aspects in the country should not be neglected too .
Public spending on the aged should thus be limited so that money can be diverted to areas such as the economy , defence , education and infrastructure in order for the country to develop healthily .
The government should divert money to build up its economy as economic stability is an important area which will contribute to the success of the country .
With economic prosperity , citizens will have jobs and are able to support themselves .
One factor which contributes largely to the economy of a country is the tourism industry; this is supported by  (2009) .
The government will require capital to invest and build more tourist attractions .
This will help to create more jobs , increase revenue of businesses and enhance the economy .
Some may say that maintaining economic stability will result in insufficiency of public funds to help the aged .
As technology advances , new methods of treatment and medicine will be invented .
The healthcare cost of the aged will increase too .
Therefore the government should use more of the public funds to subsidize their medical fees .
Indeed building and maintaining economic stability requires heavy capital , but with economic prosperity , more money will be generated .
According to  (2005) , with economic growth , society will have more choices and more policies can be implemented to help the aged .
Thus it is necessary to divert money to boost the economy so as to generate greater benefits for the aged .
In conclusion , for the country to develop , it is crucial to ensure all areas are taken care of .
To overlook in one area can lead to serious consequences .
Without economic stability , the country will not have enough funds to run it smoothly .
A weak military force will cause the country to be easily destroyed .
Without education and good infrastructures , the citizens will not be able to improve and maintain their standard of living .
Even though it is significant and essential to help the aged , public spending on the aged needs to be limited .
Excessive spending on the aged will help them in the short run but will also impede the development of the country .
A better way is to critically evaluate  the level of importance of the different areas and to prioritse and balance public funding
"Our baby boomers will join the ranks of theelderly in a few years .
Assuming the same level of demand we have now , the need for nursing home beds will double in 10 yearsand triple in 20 years ," exclaimed Mr . Lim Boon Heng ,  .
At this time , the effects of the looming aging population is becoming more evident and the increased pressure on public spending for the aged has left Singapore pondering on how to spend prudently .
If too much spending is put into helping the aged , neglecting other areas of the country's development which aids economic growth ,  .
As far as we would like to help the aged , there should be limits to which how we can help , such that the still mentally-competent or physically-competent aged will not be reliant on us unreservedly .
People in the current generation are healthier , wealthier and better educated than past generations .
We can tell by the incline in the economy that has taken off over the past few years .
The houses we stay look more superior to those dilapidated houses in the past .
We speak more fluently than our ancestors .
These are due to higher expectations , which arose from the increase in the standard of living .
In spite of these reasons , can we generalize that everyone is equally well to do ?
The group of baby boomers who are now in their 50s has substantial disparity in education attainment due to loosely enforced education rules then .
Some may not cope well in life and would need more financial help than others .
Nonetheless , when putting this in thought , disagreement will exist if we give preference the minority .
Maybe we can help the needy in other policies , apart from the general aging population policy , such that our public spending is cautiously used .
Thus , generally , future groups of the aged may be better off and can still depend on themselves if they were to make use of their intellectual assets .
In addition , housing should also be developed to instill a sense of belonging among the people .
Usually , when one owns a home , one will be more motivated to work so as to have a better home and thoughts of migrating would be lesser .
Furthermore , the provision of housing will also encourage the idea of starting a family .
As a result , in times of trouble , people will be more willing to protect their family , home as well as their country .
Thus , with the development of housing , people will learn to unite as one in times of trouble which is crucial for the progress of a country .
Limiting public spending on the aged should be done to favour  other areas of the country's development .
Besides taking care for the aged , there are several other areas the government should put the same amount of emphasis on when dividing how much each sector should get from the national budget .
This includes the country's economy , transport system and infrastructure , public housing , recreational facilities and more .
Moreover , the government should calculate the benefits over cost for the money invested .
One of the most important areas the government should invest their money on is economic growth .
The benefits of economic growth is not only current , it is for the long term as well .
Employment , national stability , economic stability and power are just some of the benefits that come with economic growth .
With regards to tending to the aged , economic growth may restrict some of the current plans the government may have , but in the future , the government will have more say and economic power to do more for the aged .
The next area the government should pay more attention on is the current economic and social issues that exist at that time .
For example , in times of an economic recession like now , the government should pump in more money to revive the economy , like the upgrading of lifts throughout the island .
Not only does it bring employment , it boosts business and trade .
These current issues should be with promptly .
Without prompt actions , the matter may worsen and if not dealt with properly , the consequence is catastrophic .
Hence , it is important for the government to rank the severity of the issues and deal with them accordingly .
As for the aged , although we cannot neglect them ,  we can always provide them with just the right amount so that they too will get what they deserve from the society .
The third argument takes the sentiments of the working class into consideration .
Making the working class pay more taxes to finance the needs of the aged will cause resentment amongst the working class .
Prolonged resentment is unhealthy for the society and it may cause social problems like strikes and protests , to name a few .
Therefore the government has to strike a balance and find the equilibrium whereby the amount of tax is reasonable and enough for comfortable usage .
As we grow older , our health will gradually deteriorate and we will no longer be able to work and support ourselves after retirement .
Hence , public spending from the government is needed to provide the elderly with a comfortable environment to enjoy their retired lives .
Some examples of government's spending on the aged in Singapore include healthcare benefits like the ElderShield and lift upgrading programme in HDB to provide an environment which is friendlier to the elderly .
We need to recognize that public spending on the aged should be limited so that money could be diverted to other areas of the country's development to attain higher efficiency and to have better allocation of resources .
Apart from that , it should be limited to instill the importance of being independent and prevent over-reliance on the government .
Firstly , public spending on the aged should be limited to ensure higher efficiency in government's expenditure and to have better allocation of resources .
This is because it is only entitled to the elderly , excluding the rest of the population who are not eligible .
By limiting government's spending on the aged and diverting them to development on other areas , we are not just targeting on the elder population but the entire population instead .
One example is by transferring the money that we can use solely on the aged to other fields of the country's development like improvement in infrastructure .
This will benefit the whole population including the aged by providing a more diverse and well-developed system in transport , like the construction of the new circle lines in Singapore .
One may say that development in other areas may exclude some of the elderly from the benefits due to their low levels of education and access .
However , we can always organize campaigns to educate our elder population to direct them to enjoy these benefits , allowing the government to limit their expenditure on the aged .
Secondly , to allow our population to realize the importance of being independent and to prevent over-reliance on the government , we should limit public spending on the aged .
This is to prevent the common misconception that the elderly can rely on the government to support them during old age .
As seen from past experience from other countries , over-dependence on the government would dampen the country's economy , for example , the failure of welfare state in Britain .
In order to help the population to be independent and to save for old age , the government  established the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board .
"CPF is a comprehensive social security savings plans that has provided many working Singaporeans with a sense of security and confidence in their old age ."
( , 2009) .
At this point , one may wonder if the government were to limit public spending on the aged , it will lead to higher burden on the rest of the family , perpetuating more social problems like family violence .
Even with the setting up of the CPF account , it will not help to solve the problem because the amount of income earned by the working population will still remain the same .
Therefore , one way to counter this problem is by diverting the money to other fields the country's development like education .
By investing more money in education , we will be able to produce a future generation which is more affluent and productive , ensuring economic stability and thus generating higher income .
We can then  increase our capability and independence to support the  .
Thus it is wise to limit public spending .
In conclusion , we should limit public spending on the aged in order to ensure that we can be more efficient and ensure that there is better allocation of resources by developing areas that can benefit the entire population .
Also , the government can implement more policies to allow the population to be more independent and increase the awareness of preparing for old age .
Most importantly , the government should divide public spending equally according to the different needs of the various areas of the country's development .
Public spending on the aged should be limited to maintain the standard of living of the aged and to reach out to those who are in need of financial aid .
"In Singapore , factors such as a relatively low birth rate and high-quality health care , which helps people live longer , contribute to the ageing population .
" ,  Aging population is defined as having more elderly compared to the younger generations .
Some of the reasons for an aging population are caused by low birth rate and low mortality rate .
Even though an aging population will slow down the growth and economy of the future society , it will not be long term .
Thus , public spending for the aged should still be budgeted and focused on other areas of development which will help generate more income .
By setting a budget on public spending for the aged , the government can develop in areas such as building infrastructures , attracting foreign investors , improving education system , and expanding the research and development of defence technology .
Firstly , with limited money spent on the aged , the government can build more infrastructures to attract foreign companies to set up businesses in Singapore .
Since Singapore is a safe country with no natural disasters and previous records of terrorism , foreign investors will feel safe to set up their businesses here .
Having more foreign investments implies an increase in foreign  .
As foreign currency grows  this would bring in additional revenue for the country .
At the same time , it will also increase government tax as more people begin to work .
Furthermore , increasing foreign investors would result in more job creations .
With the increase in employment rates , the standard of living will improve and people will have more money for retirement .
However , there will be a risk that the revenue generated by the foreign investors will be returned to their own country .
This will result in a loss of revenue and it will slow down the rate of return of investment for the government .
Even so , in the long run , the government will eventually get back what they  invested on building the infrastructure and the locals will still have a job which prepares them for their retirement .
Secondly , with lesser money spent on the aged , the government can improve the education system in Singapore for the younger generation .
This category of people requires more attention and funds from the government as compared to the aged , as they are the future ambassadors of Singapore .
The future growth and development of Singapore is dependent on them .
At the same time , by better educating the future generations of Singapore , they will be able to secure a better paying job in the future , which they will be able to support themselves as well as their aged parents .
Thus , by improving the education system , the children will be better educated and less dependent on the government for any form of subsidiaries for themselves or their aged parents .
Last but not least , the government can use the money to expand on the research and development of the defence technology .
With better defence technology , the government need not spend money on buying defence weapons from other countries and instead ,  they can earn revenue by selling their own weapons .
By limiting the public spending on the aged and using it on defence technology research , Singapore will be better equipped in safeguarding itself as well as earning additional revenue for the country .
At the same time , an expansion in the research and development of the defence technology will demand more manpower .
As a result , more jobs opportunities will be available for not just the future generations , but as well as the elderly .
Limiting the public spending on the aged opens up other areas for development such as infrastructure , education and defence .
These developments will improve the lives of the current and future generations and in the long run , dependency of the future generations when they are old will be minimal as they will most likely have sufficient money for retirement .
Therefore , public spending for the aged should be limited and focused on developing other areas .

Firstly , the proportion of the elderly is increasing rapidly , especially in the developed countries .
For example , in Europe , while the total population is estimated to shrink slightly by 2050 , the aged population is foreseen to increase by 77% ) .
There would be an increase in demand for healthcare , pensions and elderly-friendly facilities such as ramps and railings .
According to the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (2009) , expenditure on treating the health problems of the elderly in America has increased by almost a third .
Hence it is inevitable that a significant amount of money has to be allocated to the funding of these facilities and the much needed pensions .
So , public spending on the elderly should not be limited .
Secondly , social problems may surface if the elderly do not receive sufficient care and help they need from the government .
In Japan , pensioners constitute one-fifth of the country's population .
More than half of the elderly who committed suicide in 2007 was due to health problems (Paddock , 2008) .This is because this group of people are adversely affected by the government's intention of reducing public spending on the pension and welfare system .
It is assumed that as people get older , they will have more health problems and thus need more money to seek medical help .
However , healthcare expenses in Japan are high and many lonely elderly have nobody to depend on except the government .
Thus , if the government chooses to reduce public spending on them , social issues such as elderly suicide rates may rise .
Lastly , it is a moral right and a civic responsibility for us to take care of the elderly .
They are the ones who worked hard and made sacrifices in their early days to provide us with the comfortable living we have today .
After all our education , can we really call ourselves a civilized nation if we close our eyes to the suffering of the elderly living with us ?
Therefore , government's expenditure on the elderly should be allocated such that it is sufficient to help those elderly who are in need .
However , the government should take care of the country as a whole and not just focus on providing for the elderly .
The government should not neglect the need for funding the other development areas such as education and tourism that can boost the country's economy .
With more resources allocated to the country due to its economic growth , the government can also spend some of these resources on the elderly .
Nevertheless , an efficient and well-organized government should plan the national budget carefully and allocate desirable amount of funds into the various aspects of spending areas in the country .
This is especially so for richer countries because they have the financial ability to finance sufficient resources into the different areas of development .
Hence there is no need to restrict public spending on the elderly just to have more resources to be diverted to other areas .
In conclusion , the number of elderly will constitute a significant proportion of the population in the near future in many countries .
There is an urgent need for the government to support these elderly , especially those without dependants , so as to prevent unnecessary negative social impacts on the society .
Furthermore , there is a moral need and obligation to take care of the needs of the elderly .
Therefore , the  expenditure on the elderly should not be restricted just because the other areas of development of the country are assumed to be more important .
Instead , the government should strike a balance in the spending amongst the various sectors of the economy .
Singapore , like many countries in the world , is facing the same crisis - a rapid graying population .
The fast ageing population has brought about issues such as increased demand for better healthcare and social services , a reduction in competitiveness of the economy that has increased the strain and burden of the working population .
By 2030 , the elderly population is estimated to reach a million ( , 2009) .
In other words , there will be one elderly (aged above 65) found in every five residents .
Hence , our local government will have to constantly review and implement appropriate policies to minimise these problems .
The government's continuous efforts did not go unrecognised .
In fact ,  government has already predicted that such a situation would be faced and planning has started since a few decades back .
Thus , the Central Providence Fund (CPF) scheme was introduced in 1955 and made compulsory to all working Singaporeans to encourage self-dependency when they are old ( , 2009 Furthermore , to increase Singapore's birth rate , Singapore the government has enhanced benefits offered in the Marriage and Parenthood Package , which includes higher Parenthood Tax Rebate extended to Singaporeans with more children .
However this is  capped at $20 ,000 per child ( , 2009 .
According to Lee Siew Hua , Senior Political Correspondent () , although benefits may be attractive , many young couples have no plans to settle down with a family immediately after marriage .
One of the reasons is due to other financial commitments like house installment , which has occupied a large portion of the couples' salary (
However , encouraging self-dependency and higher birth rate is insufficient to cope with the rising aged population .
Problems in the physical environment still pose a challenge to the senior citizens' mobility , especially those who are wheelchair-bound .
Therefore , creating a barrier-free environment is necessary to cater to the needs of the elderly .
For example , in the past , lifts only serve certain floors .
This has created much inconvenience in their daily activities .
To counter this problem , the Lifts Upgrading Programme (LUP) has been carried out in phases to upgrade older HDB blocks with lifts that stop at every floor .
In addition , more studio apartments will also be built to cater to the demands .
But , architects may have a harder time designing buildings now as their products must be of value yet able to beautify and sustain the earth's natural resources .
Also , due to the advancement in the field of medicine , life expectancy in Singapore has risen too .
With longer life span , larger range of chronic diseases is expected to surface .
This in turn , has generated demand for chronic disease management , geriatric services and other healthcare services .
For instance , Research and Development (R&D) has enabled cancer to be more controllable now .
To ensure that healthcare remains affordable for most Singaporeans , especially the lower-income group , the government gives different rates of subsidies to the different classes of wards in hospitals .
For example , Class C wards receive the most in subsidies ( .
On top of this , the government also strongly encourages her senior citizens to adopt a healthy lifestyle .
For example , regular physical exercises and a well-balanced diet are encouraged .
In conclusion , Singapore government has played a huge part in managing the ageing population .
For instance ,  , to improve physical environment by creating barrier-free access , and continual effort towards R&D are some of the necessary areas for improvement .
Most importantly , planning for old age is a long-term goal .
One must plan well to enjoy a fulfilling golden age .
Public spending is the expenditure by the government which includes health , education , military and development projects .
A fast aging population is a serious matter as this challenges the government to consider whether to reduce old age dependency or limit healthcare costs .
The government should allocate more resources to support other areas of the country's development such as education policy and health care policy .
Public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be used on those areas most in need .
Public policies encourage and facilitate education .
Spending needs are growing in many areas , including social spending .
The spending should focus  on those most in need .
Due to the economic downturn , people are encouraged to spend more money so that this will help to increase the growth of the economy .
The public spending should be used in other areas of the country's development like shopping malls , the Integrated Resort , restaurants , hotels , museums , theatres , and theme parks .
The aim is to increase the tourism industry and to attract foreigners to spend more money .
For example , the Integrated Resort projects in Singapore is expected to enlarge the industry .
Deputy Prime Minister S . Jayakumar () said that a large amount of money has been invested and the overall proposal  meets tourism objectives and requirements .
The purpose is to attract foreigners and to strengthen Singapore's economic growth .
In conclusion , the government should set boundaries on public spending on the aged so that people will learn how to plan financially for their own old age at the early stage .
Public spending can be also used in other areas of the country's development to boost Singapore's tourism industry .
The aim is to attract more visitors to the country and create benefits for the economy of the country .
In these recent years , the entire world has been confronted with a severe economic recession; which is believed to not only negatively affect lives of millions of people in both developing and developed countries but also seriously threaten the development of numerous firms and companies from almost every sector of the economy .
The governments are strongly expected to efficiently use money from the national budget to maintain a sufficient economic growth and provide a better living standard to its citizens .
Some economists believe that the government should cut down public spending on the aged to invest in other areas while some completely disagree .
I personally support the latter .
Up until now , the social policies toward the aged rights always draw a great deal of attention from the community because of the vulnerability of this special part of the population .
The period of time after retirement often brings along lots of pressure and tension , which don't come from demanding tasks or heavy workload but come from the inevitable emotional and physical changes and also the financial challenges .
They are not able to earn their livings and probably must be dependent on the support and help from their relatives or from the society .
In 2006 , roughly twenty-five percent of the Japanese population was over the working age and approximately eighteen percent was under the working age .
These figures are predicted to increase remarkably by 2050 .
The Chinese population , unfortunately , is also experiencing the same pattern .
Researchers forecast that one thirds of the population of this nation will retire in 2050 .
It obviously means that the rest fifty-seven percent in the first case or two third of the population in the second case have to work and support for both themselves and those who are unable to work .
It is reasonable to state that once the governments reduces the amount of money spending on healthcare system maintenance or accommodation subsidy , it might result in a social and political crisis .
Some might argue that the elderly should have their own savings , which were accumulated earlier in the working years to partly support for their own needs .
However , not every worker can do so since the living expenses are increasing rapidly on a yearly basis .
Therefore , help and assistance from external sources and funds are still essential .
One more factor that should be taken into account is the moral or ethical aspect .
The elderly used to work and devote their talents and efforts to the development of the country .
Therefore , their dedication and sacrifice should be respected and rather relevantly rewarded by younger generations .
Moreover , policy makers and authorities should set good examples for the young .
A stable society in which all generations live in harmony requires a good moral foundation .
Once traditional values are reflected in the law , the law will be more practical and those traditional values will be more deeply ingrained in the society .
Furthermore , when the younger generation witnesses how their seniors are being whole-heartedly cared , they will have motivation to work harder and contribute to the country .
However , in some cases , the government probably should prioritize other areas of the country's development .
Let's take Zimbabwe as an illustration .
In a country where inflation rate reached an unbelievable figure of 11 .2 million percent , where almost every family had to struggle to put food on the table , where the only desire of the children is to go to school , a well-rounded health care system for the aged seems to be so luxurious .
The government here needs a drastic reform to restructure the entire political and administrative system before policies toward the old people could be brought to the conference table .
In brief , the policies toward the aged in each country seem to be widely different due to their very own and distinctive economic and social status .
Nevertheless , based on those different situations , each country should conduct more in-depth research and take necessary steps with the view to promulgating both short-term and long-term policies to ensure that the senior citizens  get what they deserve .
With the current trend of ageing population , many countries have come out with researches , development and policies which will help to ease the aging process greatly .
One such example is the introduction of Assistive Technology .
Technology has become one of the most important things for economic activity , education and innovation throughout the whole world .
As people age , their functionality depreciate in terms of physical and mental ability .
Therefore , in the United States of America , the policy of 'Assistive Technology Act of 1998' was  .
The definition of Assistive technology is the use of technology design to develop any service or tool that helps the elderly or disabled to improve , maintain or to increase their functional capabilities .
The implementation of this policy brought about many technological inventions which in turn eased the elderly with movement , mental ability and emotional distress .
Impaired mobility is a major health concern for older adults and through Assistive Technology , technological invention has helped ease the movement for the elderly .
For example , the installation of grab bars around the tub and toilet bowl can help to prevent falls and reduce the risk of slipping () .
The invention of the elevator and escalator allows the elderly for easy movement from one storey to another in a building and the installation of bedside controls for lights and other appliances reduces the trouble of moving around just to switch off certain appliances .
Additionally , therapy technology has been designed to improve mobility in elderly patients to increase their leg strength or balance .
Memory loss is one of the biggest problems for old age and Assistive Technology has proven to aid the elderly in their mental ability .
For example , in America , The Center for Aging Services Technologies  .
developed e-pill CADEX and 12 Alarm Wristwatch which helps to remind the elderly that it is time for their medication .
Nintendo also developed games such as Brain Training Game which is able to help to keep seniors stay mentally agile () Samsung's Jitterbug , a mobile phone that is currently on the market offers the elderly an easier way in making calls , sending text messages and listening to voice mail ()
Furthermore , emotional distress has impacted the elderly significantly .
With Assistive Technology , for example ,  poor cognitive ability can result in  increased in loneliness[ which may lead to  .
The use of sensor networks and online tools can help in reducing such symptoms .
Therefore they are researching on a product that uses in-home sensors to detect phone calls and visits that are integrated with online tools  .With this product; it can help to promote social activity .
Additionally , interactive technology such as Wii has enhanced social activity for the elderly , easing the distress they may face due to lack of companionship and social activity .
However , though technology has helped the ageing process through improvements in mobility , socially and mentally ,  to the elderly , family and friends are ultimately one of the most important aspects to them  .They can help them with money issues; meet their social needs and provide a home for them .
This would greatly ease their emotional distress as human companionship is most important to them as they age , where they become increasingly lonely and require more attention .
The love and concern provided from the family that can ease the ageing process from the family cannot be replaced by technology .
Hence , technology can be used as a tool to increase functionalities of the ageing adult but not able to provide the emotional support and care .
In today's context , the graying population has become a rising rising problem in many societies .
While it results in a delay to the country's economic progress , the problem also imposes a burden to the children as well .
Thus , this highlights the need for effective policies and research to be implemented and conducted , in order to cushion the negative impacts of aging process .
Three significant solutions would be , improve the economy , introduce elderly-friendly infrastructure and appropriate financial subsidies .
Increasing economic growth of the country helps to relieve the strain of resources to meet the demands of the elderly .
Monetary contribution is essential to aid the aging process .
However , this hinders the distribution of resources for the country's development .
To improve the development of the economy , the government can attract more foreign investors .
According to the Foreign Direct Investment in Singapore statistics () , Singapore received a total of 457 ,023 .8 million investments from the world .
It showed that with potential lucrative economic growth , the country is able to amass more resources to cope with the needs of the society .
With the increased revenue , this reduces the limitation of support given to the elderly , without taxing on the government resources .
Therefore , the elderly could benefit from the greater availability of assistance without jeopardising economic progress .
The development of accessible infrastructure helps the aged to  adapt to the environment .
As humans age , mobility drops relatively .
As a result , immobility would be a hindrance to their lifestyles without the existence of convenient infrastructure .
Thus , physical assistance from the surroundings would be recommended .
According to the Housing And Development Board (HDB) policy () , the Lift Upgrading Programme (LUP) was introduced to install lifts at every level in the HDB residential flats .
As compared to the past , the elderly had much difficulty climbing the stairs .
Thus , this implementation helps to accommodate the inconvenience of the elderly .
Therefore , establishment of accessible infrastructure helps the elderly to adjust more easily .
Financial subsidies would also help to lessen the dependency of the elderly on their children .
As elderly productivity decreases with age , the ability to command the same income as before is almost impossible .
Hence , they would have difficulty maintaining their standard of living .
Therefore , appropriate financial assistance is recommended to help cope with their essential needs .
Australia is a welfare state that strongly emphasises the well-being of the elderly .
Policies such as age pensions and medical benefits allow the  aged to receive sufficient assistance to cope with the financial needs (Greg , 2003) .
On the one hand , the subsidy system compensates the lower income that the elderly have relatively .
On the other hand , this reduces the children's burden to support the parents .
Therefore , the burden on the shoulder of the children to take care of their elderly would be lightened .
On the contrary , implementating subsidy system requires heavy tax foundation which will be a burden on the working society .
A massive subsidy system is needed to sustain the hefty expenses of supporting an increasingly graying population .
This would be a substantial load on the working people , who would then be responsible for contributing to the welfare system of the elderly .
Consequently , this solution would not be effective in the long run due to the money-consuming factor  .
As a result , there should be a classification of the degree of need , in order to create an efficient subsidy system .
In conclusion , the negative impact of the aging process is inevitable .
Therefore , feasible solutions are in need of implementation to ease the aging process .
However , due to cultural differences , the requirements of our elderly population will alter gradually .
Thus , research and policies need to be revised to deal with the aging process effectively .
It is known that the world is facing the problem of an ageing population .
have shown with projected statistics that between  2000 and 2050 , the population of the world for those aged 60 and above will increase in every country .
With this increasing amount of the elderly , there are going to be consequences in areas such as the economical growth , the amount of national budget that we are spending and healthcare issues .
Thus , several policies which have helped to ease the consequences are being put in place .
These policies are successful with easing  the ageing process .
We will now look into some of the policies that help to ease the ageing population .
One of the policies that has been  introduced is that of the retirement age .
Under the retirement act (1999) , the Ministry of Manpower of Singapore raised the retirement age for the elderly from 60 to 62 .
By doing so , the elderly will be able to work longer and thus , they will be able to save up more money in order to support themselves during their old age .
However , we do have to take note that some of the elderly are unable to work even though the retirement age has been raised .
This is due to the fact that some of them do not possess the necessary skills needed for the job or they could be down with some illness causing them to be unfit for work .
Thus , there is a need for other policies in order to protect this vulnerable group of elderly .
Another policy that has been introduced is that of the Maintenance of Parents Act .
This act is a new policy mentioned by Prime Minister Lee during the National Day Rally Speech in .
It is mainly  for cases where the younger generations abandon their parents .
This way , it will ensure that the parents are not being abandoned by their children .
However , we also have to take into consideration that the children might have reasons for not supporting their parents .
One very good example was mentioned in a Channel Newsasia article ) .
It was mentioned by Associate Professor Paulin Straugha from the University of Singapore  that one hospitalization trip could cost tens of thousands of money .
She questioned where the younger generation would get the money from . ?
Therefore , by implementing this policy , it could cause more stress on the younger generations and it could also strain the relation between the elderly and the children .
Next , we will look at another policy which the government came up with .
This policy is to give out financial aids to the needy .
In Singapore , these come in the form of  topping  the Medisave account and providing housing options .
In the report on the ageing population found on the government website  it was mentioned that the government should top up the Medisave account of the needy when there is a budget surplus so that the needy elderly will be able to afford medical treatments .
It was also mentioned that HDB should introduce more rental housing options for the elderly , this can be done by exploring the rental of the vacant  .
In conclusion , with these policies in place ,  .
In Singapore , it was mentioned in a report found on the family and community development website ) that the majority of Singaporeans have positive attitudes towards providing concern and support to the elderly .
Thus , with such positive attitudes and policies , the process of ageing can be eased .
Public spending on the aged has been increasing in recent years due to the ageing population , which results in lesser spending on the other areas of the country's development .
Demographers predicted that by the end of the century , people who are aged 65 and above will be tripled .
This may pose many challenges to the society especially for developing countries , where poverty is evident .
The small labour force has to carry the burden of supporting the aged in the country and with increasing costs for goods and services , income inequality may be resulted .
In addition , the increasing demand on the country's healthcare system will cause the country to divert many resources for the healthcare industry thus neglecting the other potential areas .
Public spending on the aged should be limited because of the smaller labour force supporting its retirees in a country with an ageing population .
This causes taxes , budgets , living standards and economic growth to be adversely affected .
Unless benefits are cut , taxes to pay for pensions and health care may have to be doubled in the next few decades (Hoke ,2005) .
With ageing countries directing much attention to the aged , for instance , spending large sums of money on hiring healthcare workers focusing on the latest medical technology , there will be lesser investments made in other areas like military , tourism , education and research and development .
Hence , this will greatly hinder the development of these countries and deter national progression (Dooling ,2009) .
Therefore , the smaller labour force will face with many difficulties in supporting the retirees due to the high cost .
Secondly , there is a need to limit spending on the aged due to increasing costs of basic necessities ( ,2006) .
There are many other groups of people such as the poor , sick and disabled who need help apart from the aged .
If goods and services become consistently more costly , this will widen the gap between the rich and poor (Reuter ,2007) .
For a country to progress , income inequality is less than desirable (Dorling , Mitchell & Pearce ,2007) .
However , there are situations where the aged can still support themselves and contribute to the country .
In Australia , reports have shown that the aged have been contributing to the country socially and economically in many ways .
People aged between 65- 69 years old still form part of the workforce and some of the aged have been providing financial support for grown up children or relatives despite  their meagre income .
Furthermore , they have been providing voluntary services by actively involving themselves in community organisations ( ,2007) .
However , aged who have the ability to contribute to the country will only form the minority .
The increasing costs will outweigh their contributions .
Thus , more funds have to be set aside to lessen the strains on the people caused by the increasing costs of basic necessities .
Finally , as the population gets older , there is an increase in demand on the country's healthcare system , where spending on it should be limited .
The United States predicted that the demand for medical care will significantly outweigh the supply of healthcare professionals by the year 2020 ( ,2009) .
The Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) is also facing demands for health care where it is likely to increase by 240 percent over the next couple of decades (Walid ,2008) .
This will mean that the countries will be diverting plenty of resources on the supply of health care and neglecting the potential of the other areas which may help to generate wealth for the country .
Hence , countries should limit their spending on health care to invest in other potential opportunities .
Based on the report of the United States Census Bureau , there are 506 million people hitting 65 years old and above as of mid 2008 .
This figure will be doubled to 1 .3 billion by 2040 , which accounts for 14 percent of the total global population .
Mr Richard Suzman (2009) mentioned that the problem of aging is affecting every part of the world .
Both developed and developing countries are challenged by the difficulties resulting from global aging such as limitation of public spending on the health care of the elderly .
Although there's no doubt that health care of the elderly plays an important role in public spending , it should still be limited so that funds can be diverted to other areas of the country's development such as education .
Cost-containment measures on the health care of the elderly have been practised by many governments all over the world .
Japan is a successful example in controlling the health care cost for the elderly .
The government directs most of the financial incentives to primary care .
It leaves some available services to the family .
Japan has also adopted more efficient ways of financing health care and paying claims using a regulated all payers system which allows payment through a standard system .
Compared with the US , it mainly relies on market competition to provide health care .
There are many insurance companies hiring lots of agents to sell their products and each of the insurance company has its own system .
This will result in high cost of health care services .
Thus , some perspectives can be adopted from Japan , for example how to set limits for hospital services , in order to lower the health care costs .
Public spending should focus on areas that play an important part in the the country's development as in the  education sector .
According to the Budget Speech ( ) , the government has a  budget of S$18 .1 billion expenditure in social development which mainly comprises six Ministries: Ministry of Education (MOE) , Ministry of Health (MOH) , Ministry of National Development (MND) , Ministry of Community Development , Youth and Sports (MCYS) , Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources (MEWR) and Ministry of Information , Communications and the Arts (MICA) .
A total budget of S$ 8 ,701 million has been planned to be invested in education , accounting for nearly half of the expenditure budgeted for social development .
The government maintains that the expenditure on education sector would never be cut back even in the economic downturn .
The government heavily subsidises the education fees in schools and tertiary institutions every year to prepare students for the future .
In this way , public spending on the elderly should be balanced with other sectors .
In addition , with the limited funding on the elderly , people would be encouraged to work harder to accumulate more wealth before they retire .
It would tremendously relief the government's burden as they could support themselves in their old age .
However , some may argue that the government should provide more public spending on health services instead of encouraging the elderly to retire later .
It may seem true in some way as the elderly have less ability to perform as well as the younger work force .
More funds should be invested in health services instead of paying salaries to the working elderly .
However , there are increasing pressures on social benefits including health services funds especially during the economic crisis .
The limited fund could only be used in those more deserving areas such as public health services .
Therefore , the elderly should be encouraged to work harder to reduce the fiscal dependency .
In conclusion , there must be some limitation on the public spending in order to divert the money to other areas which will contribute tocountry's development .
The elderly should be encouraged to work harder to support themselves in their old age .
With many countries successfully practising cost-containment measures on health care , a lot of perspectives can be learned to spend the public funding within the limitation .
Besides , considerable efforts should also be made to educate the public to lead a more healthy life .
The problem of an aging population is increasingly affecting more countries .
In the developed countries , due to reasons like better healthcare and women joining the workforce , life expectancy increases significantly as the rate of reproduction decreases .
As the population ages , social problems increase  .
Many governments , in view of this problem , would invest more resources , especially in monetary terms , to seek remedy .
However , this is a bottomless pit .
A better solution would be to limit direct spending on the aged and redirect these resources to aid the country's development .
In fact , this can indirectly ease the stress of an aging population through developing the research and development industry and providing skills training for workers .
The research and development industry is important as it brings about new technology , which can help to improve the standard of living of people .
One crucial area is the research and development of healthcare .
By investing money in research and development , more is done to explore new treatment solutions for existing illness thus , allowing healthcare treatments to be more efficient .
This not only  improves the economy;  but provides more options for the elders when they have to seek treatment .
New methods of healthcare treatment often bring down the cost of it too .
This would in turn ease the cost of healthcare for elders and indirectly has the same effect as funding elders' healthcare costs directly .
Some may claim that one can never be sure if there will ever be positive returns .
Even if it does , more often than not , it would take years before the end product can be sold to the general public for use .
Although this is a point to note , one must also consider the fact that by directly spending money on the elderly , it would be like driving on a one-way street .
It would be investments without returns .
Furthermore , the issue is to limit spending and not totally cut it off .
Thus , it would be more effective to spend money on research and development so that not only will the elders benefit in the long run from the research findings; it can also catalyse economic growth .
Another area in which money can be directed  is to provide skills upgrading training for the workers .
Peterson's (2001) suggestion was to encourage the elders to remain in the workforce for an extended period of time to reduce elderly dependency .
This is because by working for a longer period of time , they support themselves with their salary and save up for future use .
In order to make this an effective policy , the older workers' skills must be upgraded and kept consistent with the existing demands .
Angelique Chan mentioned that at present , employers tend to be hesitant about hiring older workers and this has led to public debates on this issue ( This affects blue collared workers most extensively , and also happens to be the group of elders that have the highest dependency on the society due to their lower savings .
Providing training like the "Skills Programme for Upgrading and Resilience"  , which the Singapore government  introduced in 2008 , helps improve workers' skills .
In addition , not only does it equip the elders with the essential skills to continue contributing to the workforce , it also increases their employability .
Furthermore , these training programs can also be catered to the unemployed .
Those who were retrenched due to company downsizing or the likes of it can take the opportunity to improve  their skills and move up the corporate ladder .
Thus , this not only benefits the elders , it also benefits the general public as a whole .
In conclusion , although spending money on the elderly can help ease the problem effectively in the short run , it is not a feasible solution , as one must consider the effects in the long run .
By endlessly investing in assisting the elderly , areas of the country's developments will be overlooked , resulting in more serious social problems like unemployment .
Thus , spending on the aged should be limited so that more financial resources can be used to fund other areas of development , which in the long run , can actually help to ease the problem of an aging population .
Singapore is gradually moving into an aging population due to low birth rate and long life expectancy .
According to Mr Lee Hsien Loong , Prime Minister of Singapore , our median age today is 36 and the life expectancy is 80 years .
By 2050 , our median age will be expected to be 54 .
