Social work aims at restructuring society , such that a more balanced society is attained , where no single citizen becomes the victim of  economic development .
It also helps to solve  existing social problems and provides support to the needy .
Without the Singaporean government (Ministry of Community Development and Sport) providing funds and subsidies to these organizations , some of them might not be able to survive and continue operating , especially during the economic downturn which has has badly hit Singapore recently .
Moreover , public spending on this sector has a deeper meaning as well .
It acknowledges the contribution of these organizations and encourages them to keep providing help to those in need so that more people will be beneficial from the programs .
Besides , it helps to solve other social issues than justthe aging problem .
Hence , public spending on this sector should be increased so that a balanced and more structured society is formed and a more rigid social safety net is provided .
With the economic downturn , job opportunities have decreased This is shown in  statistics  from the Ministry of Trade and Industry of Singapore , which state that the unemployment rate has risen by 1 .2% , which was from 3 .6% in December of 2008 to 4 .8% in March 2009 .
Therefore , public spending on industrial and related sectors which provide more job opportunities for people who have been affected during this harsh period should be stressed equally .
Besides , some elderly still wish to continue working as a result of insufficient savings and the increasing cost of living .
More job opportunities may help them indirectly .
Besides , increased unemployment rates contribute to a lot of social problems which may threaten the social security of the country .
Moreover , development in this sector helps to boost the economics of a country and hence public spending is increased directly to involve and help more people in need .
In conclusion , public spending on the aged should be limited .
It does not mean that the government doesn't take good care of the elderly or doesn't acknowledge their contributions in the past .
However , from another  perspective , the money diverted to other areas or sectors such as industry , tourism , social work professional associations and education , help to form a more rigid and structured society .
Moreover , public spending on these areas has a wider coverage rather than focusing only on the aged .
Hence , for a better future , public spending on the aged should be limited .
The aging issue  worldwide was not pressing until  the large population of the Baby Boomers generation began to welcome their golden years .
As medical facilities and technologies have continued to evolve , so have the lifespan of  modern mortals prolonged .
Global life expectancy at birth , which is estimated to have risen from 58 years in 1970-1975 to 67 years in 2005-2010 , is expected to keep on rising to reach 75 years in 2045-2050 (United Nations , 2007) .
Demographic changes due to the rapid aging population will post serious consequences on health issues as well as the economy of the country .
In recognition of this problem , current policies as well as research and development that have been implemented has yielded to ease the aging process .
An aging population is often associated with a decline in the workforce and the productivity of the country .
For example , Denton and Spencer (1998) noted that the rate of growth  per capita GDP is certain to fall significantly over the coming decades unless either the immigration rate or the productivity growth rate increases  dramatically .
It is the ageing of the population that lies behind this concern (as cited in Scarth , 2002) .
Therefore , policies such as Angel Policy 1989 , New Angel Policy 1999 and the "Angel Plan , Plus-One" 2003 , have been introduced and implemented in  Japan to increase the birthrate and expand the workforce of the future as to maintain productivity of the country (Cardiosk , 2008)(Devasahayam , Yeoh , 2007)  .
The size of tomorrow's economy and tax base  should be increased by raising more productive children so that the cost burden is spread over a larger and more affluent future generation (Peterson , 2001) .
Another alternative carried out by Japan is to use their advancement in science and technology to curb the aging issues by using robots in their workforce .
Japan has innovatively modified robots to put them in production lines and the service industry  as substitutes for their aging workforce .
These two measures have attempted to reduce the reliance of the workforce on the aging population and to soothe the pressing matter of the aging population .
The health care system has also been given high priority to cater to the needs of the aging population .
For instance in Singapore , besides building new hospitals such as the Khoo Teck Puat Hospital in Yishun and the Jurong General Hospital , the authorities have taken a big stride by building a link between  hospitals and community hospitals where patients can receive treatment at the  and then recuperate at the community hospital .
In this way , the elderly obtain appropriate care aat the same time as lowering health care and freeing up beds in hospitals for more critical cases which need to be treated ("Healthcare system to be reconstructed" , 2009) .
This scenario maximizes efficiency as government hospitals will be able to deliver high quality medical skills and the community hospitals will be able to tend to patients' psychology and social needs better .
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong noted in the National Rally Day speech 2009 , that the best way to keep health care costs down is by maintaining a healthy lifestyle .
In the agenda to help the elderly maintain a healthy lifestyle , Wellness Programme was launched in 12 constituencies in 2008 with the aim of allowing senior citizens to undergo health screening , fitness assessments and to participate in physical activities ("Wellness Programme popular" , 2009) .
Wellness Centres organizevarious activities for their elderly members , such as intellectual pursuit , physical activities and also activities to expand their social networking .
Cheerful and happy elderly people , who are satisfied and contented mentally and physically from the activities designed for them , are less susceptible to illnesses , preventing the need for long term care , keeping the cost of healthcare maintenance low and resulting in a happier aging process .
The implementation of the Maintenance of Parents Act in 1995 was said to be against Singapore's Confucianism idealistic norm  and controversial in a filial piety orientated society .
As a matter of fact , according to Kalyani K . Mehta , to meet further challenges of population aging , the Maintenance of Parents Act was implemented to deal with anticipated problems related to the social and health care of older persons .
This social policy imposes a legal obligation on children to maintain their parents to deal with and prevent problems related to the neglect of elderly parents .
Also , the Central Provident Fund of Singapore (CPF)   ,that was first introduced in 1955 , is actually a social security savings plan where the overall scope and benefits of CPF revolve around retirement , healthcare , home ownership , family protection and asset enhancement ("Singapore Central Provident Fund - CPF") .
In the early days , employees could only withdraw money from the Central Provident Fund when they retire however , in 1984 , a new scheme known as the Medisave was introduced , so .
In addition to Medisave , MediShield which is a medical insurance scheme was introduced in  1990 in order to help  members to sustain and pay for long term medical expenses which arise from serious illness .
A new strategy , Eldershield , implemented in September 2002 , is a special insurance scheme that provides coverage for disability , especially in old age due to the lengthening of the life span of Singaporeans (Kalyani K . Mehta) .
All these policies aim to lessen the financial burden on the elderly to provide them with security in their sunset years .
Although  given the support and coordination between the government , Voluntary Welfare Organizations (VWO) , the community and individuals  , the aging process in various countries is believed to be able to be eased , if not overcome .
When life expectancy increases , the the aging population also increases as people live longer .
According to the Top Ten list (Compare Infobase Limited , 2006) on the countries which have the highest life expectancy at Birth Year 2004 , Australia falls in  5th position at 80 .2% , while Singapore moves up to the 4th position at 80 .5% .
Research has shown that improvements in health and welfare increase life expectancy .
Therefore ,  current research and development/policies have helped to ease the  with people living longer as compared to the past .
In the case of Singapore , PM Lee spoke on the National Day Rally 2009 about the need to restructure the health-care system to serve more elderly patients .
The government has taken some measures to deal with the reality of the aging society For example , more   , like the Khoo Teck Puat Hospital in the North and the Jurong General Hospital in the West , have been built to cater to more elderly patients .
Building more community hospitals is also vitall to the elderly as community hospitals  can provide lower costs and special care for  elderly patients to recuperate after being discharged from General Hospitals .
The Ren Ci Community Hospital for example , is affiliated to Tan Tock Seng General Hospital , and St . Andrew's Community Hospital is affiliated to Changi General Hospital .
Therefore , elderly patients can go to Ren Ci Hospital or St . Andrew's Hospital to recuperate until they have fully recovered .
The hospital also provides many activities like Karaoke sessions and  performances by volunteers to cheer up the elderly patients to help them in their early recovery .
Other charity organisations like the NKF , TOUCH Community Services , and The Salvation Army are  help the elderly by having different types of programmes or services ranging from rehabilitationto counselling .
A special  trained pool of doctors , nurses , social workers and caregivers are employed to cater to patients special needs
Although hospitals are built to cater for the elderly and medical science is advancing , the most critical issue is still  the high medical cost that patients and families have to worry about .
To tackle this issue , the government has introduced policies  like the CPF which consists of the Ordinary Account , Special Account and the 3Ms , which include Medisave , MediShield and Medifund Account , to prepare the citizens for their retirement .
When the citizens of Singapore turn  55 , they can withdraw their savings from their CPF .
Besides that , the CPF can also be used to buy a house , cover hospital expenses or for  education fees .
Medifund caters more to help the needy in paying for their outstanding medical bills .
As a result , the government sees fewer cases of residents unable to afford healthcare and  social medical workers have reported that Medifund is enough to cover hospital bills . 
Community Centres and Resident Committee Centres have also been built in different areas of Singapore to provide recreational activities and programmes for the elderly to participate in .
Infrastructures such as elderly friendly facilities outside HDB flats or in the parks have also been specially built for the elderly to encourage them to exercise and keep fit .
Although not all elderly people would be willing to use the facilities or take part in activities , the centres advertise the activities through banners and flyers or even the mass media to encourage the elderly to be active and healthy .
Five companies (Philips Applied Technologies , Corventis Inc , Robotronics Land Pte Ltd , >60 Design Centre at Temasek Polytechnic and Eubiq Pte Ltd , and ADT Security Services) have been awarded grants amounting to S$500 ,000 to develop products for the elderly(Wong Siew Ying , CNA , 7 Aug 2008) .
One invention is the Care Alert System which allows the elderly to call for assistance at the press of a button .
Other inventions like robots speaking in the same languages as the elderly , to remind them to take their medications , and robots acting as care-givers to support the elderly are also sold in the market .
Japan has invented robots to help the elderly with their physical and emotional needs .
For example , Paro , a cooing baby harp seal robot fitted with sensors beneath its fur and whiskers , has been developed by Japan's Intelligent System Co , to soothe patients in hospitals and nursing homes (Alan Taylor , 4 March 2009) .
Even though new products like robots have been invented families with lower incomes may not be able to afford these extra luxuries .
However , these are just extra solutions to help the elderly and bring more convenience to families who can afford them .
Another more practical solution is the introduction of housing grants by the HDB for families who want to live near their parents .
It encourages adult married children to live near their parents so that they can take care of them and attend to their parents' needs conveniently .
The government also encourages adult children to take care of their own parents by pushing filial piety values on them , as there is a limit to how much the government can help the elderly because resources like land and workforce are very limited in Singapore .
However in some cases where children are unfilial , the government has introduced the "Parents Maintenance Act Law" , to help solve the problem of unfilial children by making them support their elderly parents in a form of paying them a monthly allowance .
In addition to the fear of  the government also introduced different policies to help  in other areas like ensuring work security in women who are on maternity leave , baby bonuses and children's Edusave education funds .
The WDA has also come up with retraining and upgrading programmes to ensure and encourage people to hold on to their jobs .
However , there is still the problem of a growing aging population due to low birth rates .
In order to deal with this problem , the government has opened up doors to foreign workers to work in Singapore so that they can help increase the workforce productivityCompanies can also employ more care-givers to help the elderly .
Besides attracting foreign workers , the government has also come up with campaigns and more incentives for married couples to give birth to more children so as to help ease the aging process .
From birth to the death , man has experienced huge change continuously which is called the aging process and as a result , our society has became older and older .
Not only man , the world has been changing continuously especially in the economic sector which is the most important part of making a living .
Thanks to  economic growth , people may escape from worries about hunger and poverty but do they feel insecure about their future when they imagine that they are in their 70's or 80's ?
Though the world economy has prospered dramatically for about a century , it doesn't seem to have a place for the old the focus is on achieving hasty economic growth .
Firstly , the fundamental flow of a modern economy is market capitalism in which most of the economic assets and system are owned by the private sector , not the public sectorand government .
The owner of a property always tries to seek profit from that so their basic needs to live are considered as means of making money .
The problem starts from here .
For instance , if  health insurance belongs to an individual for  people should pay a lot more to see a doctor and get a prescription This causes problems for old people as they do not earn after retirement but have to visit hospital more frequently than before (Peterson ,2001) .
As the market economy brings about the private ownership of basic elements for living , the  faces distress .
Secondly , the silver labor market should be considered because OECD(2005) reported that  around 2050 , the old will consist of one sixth of the total population .
However , in reality , it is quite difficult to get a job after retirement and the quality of job is not enough to make a living .
Take Korea as an example ,  its government is trying to create employment for the old .
Although the Korean government is making new jobs for elderly people they tend to be low status jobs like security guards or delivery men .
and the salary for silver labor is too small .
This is because the current economic system looks for a more efficient and competitive work force  and the companies that hire the old don't consider the elderly and try to avoid engaging them .
As a result , the existing alternative plan for  increasing aging population employment is not effective 
Thirdly , it can be argued that people have achieved huge economic growth and the product of that accomplishment results in an upgrading of living standards without uncertainty for the future .
Needless to say , Singapore's GDP shows  economic improvement  every year .
Despite  this progress ,  .
Because the economy always encourages people to spend all of their money on new products and services and not on saving , people are not used to saving something for the future .
A concrete example is credit cards .
To get a drastic expansion of the consumption for economic growth , the market created the credit card which can distribute  current consumption to the future to reduce the present burden .
The aim of this may be good , but this has led to the credit crisis where people suffer from  financial difficulties .
In a nut shell , the economy only cares about profit , people cannot prepare for the future by saving and finally , the old may experience financial hardship .
Definitely , the economy becomes bigger every moment and it offers a lot of advantages , for example , people don't have to worry about starving or a lack of food .
However for some people , this benefit is just  The marginal protection for the old is now  Besides , the old had no chance to prepare for the future by saving .
For these reasons , from the aging population point of view , economic improvement  hasn't eased the aging process .
To ease this process , the economy should consider excluding people , the old of the society and let them know how to prepare for a stable and comfortable future   .
An Ageing population is a problem encountered by many countries today .
To date , elderly aged over 65 constitutes 8 .6% of the total population in Singapore , which will see an expected rise to 18 .7% in  2030 .
Such a significant trend has led many to worry about the problems associated with this phenomenon , hence the government has initiated certain policies and developments aimed at helping the elderly .
Although these initiatives are beneficial for the aged , the government should consider limiting public spending on them to divert money to other areas such as education and development in Singapore .
Spending on the aged should be kept to a smaller proportion as compared to areas such as education .
The younger generations should be the focus and not the aged as they are the ones who will up keep Singapore's standing in the near future .
Prime Minister Lee (2009) at a dialogue with Nanyang Technological University students took the stand  that local students should build networks with the rest of the world and integrate in new environment in order to "push the boundaries" and break new grounds for Singapore .
Hence , plans by the ministry should be made to foster greater interaction between local students and international students .
Money should be given to aid needy students who will then not be deprived of a chance to participate in Exchange programs administered by the institution .
These programs enrich a student's soft skills , which is essential for their ability to lead the country in time to come .
Singapore , having one of the top education systems ,should continue it's reputation , and the government should divert money spent on the aged to  refining students who are the future leaders of Singapore .
Singapore's tourism sector is a lucrative field which has contributed greatly to the country's economic success .Therefore , the the government should divert money on the aged to this thriving industry .
Since 1996 , the number of tourists coming to Singapore has been increasing steadily with an estimated $14 .8 billion tourist received in 2008 .
Tourism has made a significant contribution in creating more jobs for locals and with the upcoming Marina Sands project ,  thousands of jobs for Singaporeans are expected to be created in this period of economic downturn .
Also , the tourism sector has made huge contributions to Singapore's economy , with an estimated $230 billion in 2007 .
All these benefits brought about by tourism must not be underestimated .
Thus , the government has to continue improving on its infrastructure and developments for tourism and tourists so as to remain on a competitive edge with other Asian countries .
Hence , funds spent on the aged should be limited in lieu of spending it on more beneficial areas for the country .
Critics have validated the spending on aged by arguing for the role which the elderly hold in building and molding Singapore to where it is now .
These efforts must not be neglected and hence , government should provide for them now that they have turned economically inactive .
On the contrary , though these elderly have contributed to Singapore's success , focus should be turned to family support and care for the elderly instead .
'Hardware' has been constructed to facilitate the aged in their daily lives; 'heart-ware' should be proliferated instead .
"heart-ware" means giving emotional support to the agedand providing unconditional love and respect for them .
Instead of channeling money to be spent on building hardware for the aged , more should be done to foster closer relationships between the young and old .
Teo (2009) believes  that people should treat the elderly they way that they want to be treated when they are old .
the government cannot coerce 'heart- ware' on the young; instead they can be influenced and taught  in school when they are young .
Therefore , public spending should be limited as 'hardware' has been built for the aged and focus should be placed on the intangible 'heart- ware' for the elderly instead .
The aged still remain as a figure of respect .
However , instead of hanging onto the past , Singaporeans have to look ahead and plan for the future journey .
The government should reduce the proportion of funds spent on aged facilities and divert it to  education and tourism development as these two fields will enable the continual growth for this small nation dependent on it's labor force .
Many countries experience population aging .
In fact , nowadays Singapore's population is aging too and it is one of the fastest aging populations in Asia .
There are several developed countries such as Japan , the US and Singapore predicting that educated aging boomers will have longer life expectancies than the generations that preceded them .
It is estimated that by 2050 , Singapore's median age will move from 36 to 54 , similar to Japan and Italy .
Recent studies have shown that Singapore has a low rate of population growth due to the declination of birth rates .
Many young couples think that having a baby is too expensive in Singapore .
This situation is not getting any better as more of the population ages .
Thus , there will be fewer younger generations to look after aged people in the future .
In addition , an aging population causes a decrease in the workforce .
The decrease will be prominent when the baby boomers reach their retirement age and there will be fewer younger people to replace them .
In such a case , Singapore faces the challenge of developing public policies to accommodate the trend of aging and to gear up for a growing aging population .
Nevertheless , immigration policy is feasible to cope with an aging population .
Immigration policy has helped to ease the aging process .
It has been adopted by many countries especially in Singapore , which faces a serious population challenge .
Notwithstanding  a viable policy , Singapore citizens feel that these new immigrants and foreigners might not benefit them because they will face even more intense competition in the workforce .
However , if Singapore does not adopt immigration  , it will face manpower shortfalls .
As  more elderly people retire from the work field  , this causes a lack of productivity in the workforce as well as a labour shortage .
Subsequently , a labour shortage  will have a negative impact on the economy as it slows the country's economic growth .
In future years , the economic burden will be increased tremendously due to the aging labour force .
Nevertheless , these problems could be eliminated as the influx of foreigners through immigration will satisfy the needs of the labour market and  boost the economy with improved labour productivity .
Immigration is a possible solution to easing the aging process .
It can help to sustain the overall population size .
Admitting more immigrants will help to replenish the country's aging population in the years ahead .
For example , the government of Singapore has introduced several measures to boost the fertility rate .
One of which is immigration  , which has attracted many immigrants mainly from China , India , and Malaysia to integrate into  society and  has helped to raise the fertility rate .
In effect , more productive children will be raised and there will be sufficient numbers of younger generations to replace those of the older generations as they retire .
Moreover , since there are more young people engaged in the workforce , the elderly in later life will  as they will be supported by the younger generations .
Immigration  is a practical solution adopted by developed countries with aging societies , namely , Singapore , the USA and China .
Nonetheless , some countries are exclusively independent without relying upon immigration to sustain population growth .
For instance ,  Japan is facing a population crisis as they have the lowest birth rate in the world .
However , Japan is not yet ready to open the country's door to immigrants and the rigidness of Japan's immigration laws has been seen even until now .
As a result , it will lead to the economic problems associated with its graying population .
The shrinking of the labour force and the lack of vitality for the workforce will happen in the near future .
Therefore , Japan needs to ease up on its immigration laws by allowing more foreigners to immigrate in order to solve the problems .
In conclusion , coping with an aging population will require a long term effort and it is a challenge to a country .
However , this challenge could help to ease the aging process in the long run by adopting immigration  .
Despite it , the government should not only focus on a particular policy in order to resolve the aging problems .
There are others policies that should be taken into consideration , including; family policy , later retirement for the elderly , and promoting healthy life styles for resolving problems posed by aging process .
, the government should encourage older population to live an active aging life .
If they are encouraged to be productive , they can be economic contributors as well .
The elderly , who prepare well and early for old age will be more ready for retirement  , then the present generations of people will be able to enjoy meaningful and happy lives without relying or putting a burden on their children .
The Ministry of Community Development , Youth and Sports(2009) showed that at least 1 out of the 5 people will be 65 or older in 2030 .
A similar estimation of population is expected to exist in the States .
As for Japan , at least 1 out of 4 people will be 65 and above by 2055(Tiresias ,2009) .
This alarming statistic has rang a bell about the importance of the public to spend their wealth on the needs of the aged .
This essay will address the scope of  which is the appropriate amount of resources that public should spend on the vulnerable group .
Not all the aged need financial help as these people may well be taken care of by their children .
Although aging issues are prevalent in both developed and developing countries , these issues are more pressing in developed countries .
The developing countries , on the other hand , should invest their public spending on areas such as education and law and order before they can address the issue of the aging population .
Thus , public spending on the aged should be maximized in developed countries , while public spending in the developing countries should be utilized to help to reduce societal problems . 
The aged need money to cover  their extensive bills , that range from medical purposes to other basic necessities .
In Singapore , it is not uncommon to see the aged working in sectors that are shunned  by the young .
One significant example is the cleaning industry .
It is true that the aged are able to support themselves by being financially independent .
However , they receive low salaries , which can hardly cover the increasing cost of their medical bills .
Medical technologies have developed to be more advanced and sophisticated over the years .
Thus , the cost of medical treatment is considered as expensive by the aged especially those who hold low-income jobs or who live alone without the support of the family .
This group should be categorized as the vulnerable group .
Therefore , it is timely for the public to spend their wealth on this group .
The vulnerable group should apply for jobs that are registered under the Workfare Income Supplement (WIS) in Ministry of Manpower .
Then , a portion of the income tax from the working individuals should be channeled to help this group .
However , those who are not under WIS will not benefit from public spending .
This is to prevent the syndicate schemes that are on the rise today .
Their target is always  this vulnerable group as they believe that it is relatively easy to manipulate them in order to gain sympathy from the public .
The vulnerable group is usually forced to sell tissue packets and other religious symbols .
Hence , it is important to ensure that the group is well-informed of the policy .
Ideally , the policy should be in four different languages to cater to the understanding of residents .
Thus , if public spending is limited , the vulnerable group will be economically disadvantaged .
Aging populations are becoming a very serious and significant problem especially in developed country where the educated and professional continue  .
Public spending should not be limited as the money can be utilized to promote campaigns that encourage the vulnerable to  stay employed .
The group is highly likely to face discrimination from the workforce .
The vulnerable may be deemed as redundant .
Although the vulnerable may be perceived as the ones with vast knowledge and experience , the young is likely not to overlook this matter .
, which is able to work quickly and productively .
Thus , one of the campaigns organized by the United Kingdom is to end the discrimination faced by the aged .
The campaign , called Help the Aged , focuses on the theme: Just Equal Treatment(2009) .
It believes that the vulnerable should be given the right to work and that  companies should abolish the concept of age restriction  .
This is the human right that individuals should be entitled to as long  .
Thus , campaigns will raise the awareness of the public to help the aged to face the discrimination that still prevails within  society .
Hence , a portion of public spending can be ideally used to spend on anti-discrimination campaigns .
Public spending in developing countries , on the other hand , should be well utilized to rectify the social problem .
In Thailand , for instance ,  social problems  need to be addressed as children are involved Chitradub (1999) .
It is crucial to help the children to break out of the vicious circle as children are the future generation to run the country .
However , children in Thailand are involved in the smuggling of drugs .
It is believed smuggling drugs are related to the issue of prostitution among children .
Berger and Glind(1999) from the Thailand Office of the National Commission on Women's Affairs reported that an estimated 40 000 children are involved in the country's lucrative  sex industry .
This is an alarming issue as the vicious circle may  worsen .
The children will shape a perception that it is not morally wrong to be involved in this industry .
Besides , the children believe that this lifestyle is one of the easiest ways to earn an astronomical amount of money .
Public spending is thus needed to rectify the perception shaped by the children , or else the problem will remain unsolved .
The spending should be used in campaigns in order to raise awareness about the importance of  basic education for children .
By doing so , the children will have an aim to excel well in their education and so will not be involved in activities that will degrade their morale values .
Therefore , public spending is needed to bring the children out of the vicious circle .
Thus , it is indeed clear that developed and developing countries have different  issues to address .
The prevailing issue needs to be resolved before the issue gets worse .
Public spending should not be limited on the vulnerable because the ageing population is becoming a worldwide issue .
The issue is similar to a pandemic , which can affect both developed and developing countries .
Although it is true that the ageing population is less severe in developing countries at present , it may not stay true for the future because globalization h The children in the developing countries who have received a quality education , may want to pursue their career in other countries with a stable and high income .
The children may want to migrate to other countries without bringing their parents along .
The social obligation , which has been instilled in the children about the responsibility to care for the parents , will be eroded .
Thus , trends in the developing countries may change in the long run .
As for now , in the developing countries , the ageing population is not much of a problem .
The majority of the people  in these countries , live in villages .
The children , who have been socially ingrained with moral values , are obligated to look after the parents .
Hence , in future , when migration issues becomes a global pandemic , the public should give a helping hand to the aged since the children will no longer take care of their needs .
The public will then need to assist them in order to reduce the burden .
In conclusion , the amount of money utilized to help to ease the burden of the aged should not be limited .
The financial burden and discrimination faced at the workforce are among the problems that the aged are going through .
There should be a level of awareness to help the aged so that they will age with dignity and pride .
This is because everyone , sooner or later will reach  the ageing stage and will want their needs to be taken care of as well .
The problems faced by the aged will be a global phenomenon .
Hence , this is where the role of public spending should come iin to play to address the needs of the aged .
In conclusion ,  public funding should be limited as it may cause the elderly to be over reliant on it .
The money should then be used elsewhere in areas such as public health that are more pressing as well as  on education and economic growth as that will also help to solve theaging population crisis .
By carefully allocating government funds ,  society will benefit as a whole .
In developed countries , problems of aging populations are surfacing and at the same time worsening .
Limitations on public spending on the aged should be warded off .
The main focus of this essay will be on developed countries .
The reason for this is because their aging population problem is much more serious as compared to developing countries .
There is a need to understand that the amount of reliance the aged have on the public is quite significant .
It is also necessary to take into account  the contributions that the aged have made , as well as to recognize the more substantial advancement in  .
Critics have commented that other areas of the country's development such as education need the money to substantiate the advancement of these particular developments so as to bring them to greater heights  .Therefore , limitations on public spending on the aged should be enforced .
However , there is the recognition of the fact that governments in developed countries have already pumped in a huge amount of money to develop the main areas of development like education and national defence .
Thus , these main areas have been well-developed .
In addition , an aging population has not been an area of concern in the past and only recently have the aged formed a significant population in developed countries .
Thus more should be spent on the aged since other areas are already so well developed that there is not really a need to use money to substantiate their advancement .
It is well known that Singapore has a world class education system .
From the past till now , Singapore has been spending a huge sum of money on the other main areas of development so as to build up the economy .
The efforts can be seen clearly as  Singapore is  now an advanced developing country  .
However the most predominant problem arising now is the aging population .
Thus public spending on the aged must not be limited as it is  problem .
Cynics have mentioned that in developed countries , quite a number of the aged are still working and receiving wages so they will have the means to pay for their living expenses and healthcare costs .
Thus public spending on the aged can be limited so that other areas like national defence can have the money to further their advancement .
However even though a significant number of the aged are still in the workforce , most of them are taking up menial jobs like cleaning which only gives them a meagre pay .
This small amount of money is hardly enough to cover their living expenses and healthcare costs as now healthcare costs are increasingly higher .
In addition , the aged are still quite vulnerable to diseases and are weak , thus public spending on the aged should not be limited so as to assist them with their healthcare costs .
The fact that the aged still need to work despite their vulnerability implies that they might be forced to work to meet their own basic needs .
This further infers that there is not enough public spending on the aged .
This is another reason why public spending should not be limited on the aged .
Developed countries are implementing measures to meet the needs of the aged .
For instance in Singapore , Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong mentioned in the recent National Day Rally Speech (Goh , 2009 , para 19) that with the population rapidly graying , the Singapore government will put healthcare costs at the front and centre of its agenda .
This is a precise indication that the Singapore's government does not have the intention to limit public spending on the aged .
The main reason for this phenomenon is that money needs to be spent on the aged now so as to ease the aging process  , if not , years down the road , public spending might have to increase significantly as compared to now due to the lack of  spending on the aged .
Thus it is important to spend more now to ease the problems of aging population , if not years later , the problems of an aging population might heap up .
Engelhard (2009) mentioned that the aged are not worth the attention from the public .
They are deemed useless and with low productivity they cannot contribute significantly to society Thus society should limit their spending on the aged and shift their focus onto the young .
In time to come , the young can give back to society unlike the aged .
However  the fact that the aged were young once and  also made contributions to the society also needs to be recognized .
In fact they are the ones who laid the foundations for  the younger generations .
Without their contributions , the country may not be where and what it is now , thus it is society's responsibility to take care of them , regarding this as a repayment back to the aged .
This is like a cycle: in the past when the aged are still working they were the ones who took care of the younger generations , thus now it is the younger generation's responsibility to take care of the aged .
In Japan it is predicted that the median age is expected to increase by a decade , from just over 43 years in 2007 to more than 52 years in 2050 (Smil , 2007 , para 9)  .
This shows that public spending on the aged should not be limited as the percentage of the aged will increase significantly in time to come due to the problems arising from an aging population .
By  2055 many more people will require elderly friendly facilities .
Limitations should not be encouraged as years later the demand for elderly friendly facilities might exceed the supply of them .
Therefore it is important to spend on the aged now to ease the aging process years later .
In a nutshell , the above mentioned arguments and reasons point to the fact that public spending on the aged should not be limited as if it is limited , dire consequences  ,such as the country itself might be seen as neglecting the aged , will surface .
This might lead to foreign corporations being discouraged to invest in Singapore as Singapore might be perceived as not having an effective system .
Therefore it can be concluded that the aged should have a bigger portion of the pie that is the public spending  , while  other areas  will still have their share  
In the middle Ages , most people were lucky if they lived to be 40 years old .
By the end of the 20th century , the average life expectancy had reached the early 70s .
For most of us living today , it is not unusual for us to grow up knowing our grand parents and great-grand parents .
Some people even remember their great-great grand parents .
To a large extent , current research and development have helped to ease the aging process .
There are several reasons for this increased aging situation such as this increase in life expectancy .
Through the use of these specific reasons and examples , this essay will demonstrate why especially in the field of medicine .
Firstly , modern medicine is now able to cure or treat many diseases that were once terminal .
When the first colonists traveled to the New World during the 15th and 16th centuries , they not only carried with them novelty items like horses and guns , they also carried new diseases .
For example , smallpox , from which many Europeans were immune , decimated the native populations of America and the Caribbean because the Indians had no immunity to a disease they had never experienced before .
Today , modern medicine can even prolong the lives of people who have diseases for which this is still no cure ,such as cancer , Parkinson's disease and AIDS .
Secondly , people today are more aware of the effect of healthy living on their life expectancy .
For example , even as late at the 1950s , many people were not aware that eating too many large portions of steak and potatoes and other foods rich in carbohydrates and cholesterol could significantly increase their likelihood of a heart attack .
Also , people were not aware of the links between habits such as alcoholism and cigarette smoking and diseases such as liver disease and cancer .
Today , medical research , both traditional and holistic , stresses the importance of healthy eating and exercise in increasing one's life expectancy .
Over the years , public spending such as in the form of healthcare benefits and subsidies for the aged has increased .
This is due to developed countries having an aging population coupled with a higher cost of living .
However , the money used can be better utilized to develop other areas .
These include  education , technological research and welfare programs for the needy  .
Diverting too much of a country's budget to the aged can prove to be a heavy burden on its economy .
Welfare programs , such as free healthcare services that are introduced in some countries , do improve the quality and lifespan of the aged in those countries .
However , these welfare programs are not necessarily feasible for all countries .
It is especially not effective in small countries with a small economy like Singapore .
Firstly , funds that are needed to support these welfare programs will come from taxes on the working-age adult .
The high cost of healthcare services results in high taxation on citizens These countries like Britain and the United States generally have low Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and high public expenditure , with few exceptions like Sweden .
With a lower GDP , Sweden generates less revenue to divert to other areas of a country's development (Jonathan Eyal , 20 August 2009) .
Studies have shown that Britain's National Health Service , "devours 17 .5 per cent of Britain's annual fiscal budget , almost as much as defence and education combined Providing for the aged will therefore hinder the nation's overall development in other aspects .
The elderly in Singapore are dependent on government subsidies in various areas due to the current high cost of living .
However , public spending on the aged is only a short term solution to the problem of the aging population .
This short term solution poses  a burden to the economy without actually addressing the root of problem of the aging population in the long run .
Public spending will only continue to spiral upwards if the government is committed to healthcare spending on the aged .
The government should look at this problem from an economic perspective in the long run .
The country's budget allocation should place greater emphasis on education for the younger generation .
If the younger generation is well taken care of and educated , in the long run , they will form the working-age population and are more economically productive .
In this way , these working-age adults will form the community where money can be tapped to provide funds for the aged in future .
This long term solution of diverting the country's resources from spending on the aged to education lessens the squeeze on the already fully exploited economy .
If the government places more emphasis on the well-being of the aged instead of nurturing the younger generation , it discourages the younger generation to stay in a particular country .
The country's resources are limited .
Giving more to the elderly means a lesser proportion for the younger generations .
Fewer opportunities , in the form of job security and stability arise from less money being diverted to education and development of the economy .
This will lead to emigration and brain drain from the country , which will in turn lead it to lose/losing its competitive edge , and thus it will be less attractive to investors .
More money should be diverted to education for the development of the younger generation to deal with  .
An example is Singapore providing free education and offering one of the world's best childcare services and facilities .
However , critics may argue that the elderly have contributed their part to nation building and should not be denied access to government funds .
Nonetheless , the younger generation forms the pillar of a country's economyand more attention should be given to nurturing them . 
The issue of an an an aging population has become an increasing important issue in our society today .
The problems caused by an aging population  are increasing and it has placed great pressure on  society .
Hence , the government is paying more attention to solving these problems caused by aging population through various means .
One of them is to increase  public spending on the aged .
However , some may argue that  doing so  may limit the country's development .
Therefore , public spending  on the aged should not be limited because the issue of an aging population has become a major problem in the society .
Some may argue that public spending on the aged should be limited so that it will not limit the country's development .
Other areas of the country's development are equally important and hence government funds should also be directed to  areas such as education and health care  , instead of just focusing on the aged .
Education is equally important because the young will determine the country's development in the future since they are the ones who will lead the country .
Without proper education , they will not have the ability to compete with other countries and this will hinder the country's development especially in the economic sector .
Hence , the education sector is equally important .
In addition , the healthcare sector is also very important as it can help increase the standard of living of people .
The health of the people is one of the major considerations when investors chose a country to invest in .
Hence , if the health status of the people is very low , investors may not want to invest in the country and this may affect the economic growth of the country .
Therefore , some may argue that public spending on the aged should be limited so that the funds can be diverted to other areas for the country's development .
Nevertheless ,  public spending on the aged should not be limited as some of the elderly are in need of financial aid .
In the future , this problem may worsen .
Some may point out that there are increasingly more people attaining higher levels of education hence they are able to afford the increasingly expensive healthcare services (Friedland and Summer , 2005) .
However , there are still a group of people who only have a low level education .
Hence , with lower incomes , they may not be able to afford the increasing healthcare services .
This problem is occurring in Singapore as there is a huge discrepancy in the education levels seen within the baby boomers .
Hence , there will be a group of people who have a lower level education and they will need financial aid in order to afford the healthcare services .
By limiting public spending on the aged , this group of people may not be able to afford the increasingly expensive healthcare services .
Therefore , public spending on the aged should not be limited .
In addition , public spending on the aged should not be limited as people have longer life expectancy as compared to the past and as a result will face larger financial health risks (Friedland and Summer , 2005) .
As people live longer , they face more health problems .
They may not be able to afford the increasingly expensive health care services .
Even the existing healthcare policies that help people to cope with the expensive healthcare services may not be sufficient .
In Singapore , the government has come up with policies such as Medisave and Medishield to prepare people by saving a portion of their salary in these accounts .
Hence , when they are ill , they are able to use these accounts to pay for their medical bills .
However , with rising costs of healthcare services , the money in these accounts may be used up quickly and therefore they will not be able to afford any more healthcare services .
Therefore , public spending on aged should not be limited .
In conclusion , even though the issue of an aging population is important ,  other areas that are essential to a country's development cannot be neglected .
Hence , public spending on the aged should not be limited . .
The aging population is one of the major issues Singapore faces in the future and if the problem is not dealt with properly , this may eventually affect the country's development .
Therefore ,  public spending on the aged should not be limited .
In recent years , many countries have begun to face the  issue of ageing demographics and undeniably , Singapore is one of the fastest ageing populations in Asia .
Population ageing will bring about social and economic changes , and such a shift in the age structure means that the government has to make amendments to the public spending on the aged .
While it is important to care for the elderly , other areas of the country's development should also be taken into consideration and not to be neglected , so as to achieve a balance in both the social and economic structure of the country .
According to Friedland and Summer (2005) , an ageing demographic will cause serious fiscal problems for publicly-financed health and welfare packages .
Indeed , money has to be spent to curb ageing problems , but it is society's responsibility to ensure a desirable standard of living for the elderly and to constantly fulfill the varying needs of this group of senior citizens .
The government has to ensure that all the elderly have a permanent roof above their head even after retirement and can also finance their day-to-day living expenses .
Moreover , with longer life expectancy , it is also important to be certain that the country's health care system is well-structured and sophisticated enough to prepare for an influx of sick elderly , and also that the cost of health care expenditure also includes the cost of promoting good health .
t is important to promote preventative measures as it will mean less expenditure on taking care of people who are sick .
However , public funding should also cover other areas of the country's development .
For instance , education is also an important area that should be focused on .
It is a recognized fact that education helps the young to secure a quality job in future and also prepares them with  It is certainly worthy of the public funding to build the best educational facilities and ensure that every child has the chance to receive education .
It important to make sure that education remains affordable in the country and this can be achieved through subsidies by the government .
Moreover , part of public funding should also be spent on re-training schemes for working adults so as to improve their work quality and efficiency , as well as to keep them skilled and valuable for industry .
Education will harvest long term benefits for both individuals and the country as an educated pool of citizens will definitely generate greater economic growth .
With this additional economic revenue generated  , more public funding can be channeled to help the aged .
Research and Development is also another important area of a country's development .
In today's context , industry changes get obsolete very quickly .
It is important to be innovative and constantly produce new ideas in order to stay ahead of competitors and to improve a society's performance .
For example , Research and Development in pharmaceuticals is particularly important as the creation of new drugs will help in the advancement of medical and clinical studies .
More sophisticated health care systems will in turn help to reduce medical spending on the aged and might even help the elderly to sustain good health .
Therefore , it is important to receive incentives and funding from the government to perform Research and Development .
Other than areas in education and Research and Development , the defence force should also have a share  public funding .
Defence not only ensures national security but also maintain peace and stability in the country .
With the increasing threat from terrorism , defence should never be relaxed .
Nothing can be achieved in a chaotic environment , thus it is important to set aside of the public funding to effectively build an army , the navy and the air force .
Many considerations have to be made when it comes to the topic of dividing public funding .
No doubt  it is essential to take care of the elderly who have contributed much to society during their younger days , but the government must still ensure that there is enough funding on other areas of the country's development .
Economic growth must never be sacrificed as the society as a whole must progress and achieve further advancement .
Since Neil Armstrong left the first human footprint on the moon , it has always been a dream for human beings to explore more about the outer space .
As a country possesses over five thousand years of history , China never stops seeking the outer space .
In 1999 , 2001 and 2002 , China successfully launched in succession three experimental unmanned spaceships .
Later on 15th October 2003 , the first manned spaceship was sent to the outer space .
Until now China has already launched 3 manned spaceships and over 30 artificial satellites are working on the earth orbit .
Moreover the Chinese government is proposing a plan that will send spaceships to the moon and build an observation station on the moon .
Currently China has become the third strongest country in terms of the space technology , only after  America and Russia .
But how and why could China achieve these goals as a developing country ?
In this essay , I will explain this issue from two aspects , the economic factors and the military demands .
First  , the development of space technology is a basic need for an economic boost .
China is undergoing a rapid development in economy .
Among all the Hi-tech industries ,  information industry is the most important part .
For a country which has an area of 960million square kilometers , having enough communication satellites is the first security for the information communication , which then provides a good environment for the development of the economy .
For example , until 1994 China had built 8100 telecommunications systems , 11 satellites TV broadcast systems and 30 radio broadcast systems in response to the needs of communication in the remote areas in China , such as  Xinjiang  , Inner Mongolia , and Yunnan (Baidu , 2008) .
Currently 80%  of China is covered with  communication satellites not only for  TV broadcast but also for  world wide webcast(Baidu , 2008) .
The innovation of  space technology is an indirect result of the economic development in China .
Second , the military force of China needs the support of  space technology .
Most of today's military devices need the guide of artificial satellites .
As the deterrence policy and capability to meet the new threat , China has developed several kinds of precision guided weapons and nuclear missiles (XinHua news , 2007) .
All these weapons have to be guided by artificial satellites .
In addition to the use of space technology for building military devices , the natural resources of the outer space are also important for military aims  .
The earlier China lands its spacecraft on the moon , the earlier China can begin to use the natural resources .
The resources of the outer space would be a great support for the continuous development of Chinese military force .
Generally speaking , the development of space technology is an inevitable result of the economic development and military development in China .
With the development of its economics and military forces , the space technology will develop in response to it .
When the space technology has reached a certain level , the economic and military forces will reach a higher goal .
Under such circumstances , Chinese people will finally stand on the place where Neil Armstrong  once stood .
The world is changing continuously because of various kinds of inventions that have been designed and developed .
Design is an act where engineers apply their creative energies in producing products or systems (Seyyed Khandani , Ph .D .  ,2005) .
Mobile phones , bicycles and electric appliances are  examples of the application of  technological creativity .
They fulfill the human needs and have changed the quality of lives .
In designing a product or system , one priority requirement is that the invention should be easy to operate and require less human effort .
To meet this need , engineers should follow the five steps used for solving design problems , which can be found in the "Engineering Design Process" written by Seyyed Khandani (2005) .
When one accepts a new product , the first thing that  comes to mind is "How to use it ?"
The next question that will appear to the mind is "What is the easiest way to operate it ?"
Hence , an invention which is easy to use should be given priority .
Nowadays most people are living in a hectic life .
An invention which is easy to use is very important to help them to reduce the time consumed yet achieve greater efficiency for their work .
For example , a laptop , which is simple to operate , helps the owner to collect lots of the information from the internet just in a short while .
This helps to reduce the time consumed to find the information from  thick books in the library .
An oven , which is also easy to operate , helps humans to cook food in a short time .
If the way to operate a product is complicated , humans will prefer not to use it because the time spent in operating the product is not worth to be wasted .
When the people are not using the designed product , there is no point designing the product .
Therefore , designing a product which is simple to operate is very important .
To design a product which fulfills the human needs mentioned , there are five steps to solve the design problems .
Firstly , define the problem and recognize the needs of the new product .
The main problem now is to create products that are simple to operate .
A clear definition of the problem is important because different problems require different solutions .
Second , gather pertinent information .
All the information has to be collected before going further into the process .
The information resources can be searched from traditional publications , scientific encyclopedia , technical handbook , electronic catalog and the internet .
Next , generate multiple solutions .
This step begins with  generating new ideas that may solve the problem .
Engineers should not be afraid to try new experiences or ideas .
Then , analyze and select a solution .
The solutions that are conceived need to be analyzed and decision has to be made on which solution is the most suitable for implementation .
Finally , test and implement the solution .
Implementation refers to the testing , construction , and manufacturing of the solution to the design problem .
Several methods of implementation as well as distinct activities that occur during implementation must be considered when testing is done .
(Seyyed Khandani , Ph .D . ENGINEERING DESIGN PROCESS Education Transfer Plan , August 2005)
In conclusion , inventing a product which is easy  to operate is essential .
The five steps in engineering design process should be well followed to produce a good product and fulfill  human needs .
The development of technologies in the context of the innovation-development process may be observed from either a technologically determinist or a socially determinist perspective .
Technology determinism proposes  that technology progresses along its own path , independent of social development .
In other words , technology has an effect on society but society does not affect technology .
Another perspective is social determinism , also known as social constructivism , which supports the view that society influences and shapes technology , and not vice versa .
One important technology which is socially determined is the mobile phone .
There are several factors that have contributed to the shaping of this technological innovation .
The first factor that has shaped the mobile phone technology is the market forces .
Initially when mobile phones were created , the society's demand for them was low .
There are several reasons for this situation .
Early mobile phones were heavy , bulky and expensive with very low coverage .
The demand was still there because there were those who could afford them and mobile phones were important to those who were always on the go .
In the 1990s , the number of mobile phone subscribers was initially almost zero , but it shot up to half a billion people around the world in a very short period of time .
The society had demands for cheaper and more portable mobile phones and thus , innovations came about .
Mobile phones came in more light-weight and smaller sizes .
There were also demands to turn mobile phones into entertainment and portable office tools devices .
Mobile phones now have many funky designs and have added features like music players , cameras and e-mail readers .
Secondly , personal communication is also one of the factors that have shaped this technology .
People want to get connected with the world in the simplest and easiest way , and with mobile phones , they can do so almost anytime , anywhere .
Keeping in touch with friends have become much easier .
Short calls help in bonding relationships as they show that the caller is concerned enough to give a call even on a busy day .
The internet is also an important communication medium and with that , mobile phones can now connect into the internet .
With the internet , people can get instant access to information online by just typing out the keywords and press 'Search' on their touchscreen mobile phones .
Mobile phones can also be used for entertainment purposes .
For example , there are songs and videos available online and they can be downloaded directly into the mobile phone for listening or watching .
Another factor that has shaped the mobile phone technology is personal display .
For some people , the mobile phone is like an extension of their external self and they feel incomplete without one .
The ability to customise one's own mobile phone according to their preferences came from this so that each person could display their selves through their mobile phones .
With this , mobile phones have become more like a fashion accessory and trends have been created .
In Singapore , innovation is one of the key economic drivers .
An innovation is an idea , practice or object that is perceived as new to an individual or another unit of adoption (Roger , 2003) .
Engineers are an important element in the innovation processes as they perform the role of problem solvers by applying their creative energies in production (Kam , 2003) .
This creative act is then translated as design in technical terms .
As we all know , Singapore is a small country with no natural resources , having humans as our only resource .
As such , we face several problems that are not encountered by other nations , like inadequate technologically inclined talents and insufficient support from citizens , resulting in adverse societal attitude towards failure .
These problems will significantly hamper our engineering design processes for innovation .
Singapore , a country with only 4 .4 million population ,  has not enough professionals in the field of technology and science as most technological innovations are created by scientific research (Roger , 2003) .
As manpower is the fundamental element of any process , without sufficient quality manpower , the commencement of processes is already hindered .
In short , this problem will hit hard directly on the first step of innovation , 'needs/problems'(see Figure 1 below) .
As the world becomes more IT savvy , Singapore needs to set her foot onto the technological industries .
The easiest way to recruit technologically inclined talents is attracting foreign professionals .
Singapore does this by giving scholarships to foreign students from IT- savvy countries like India , Bangalore .
This act will effectively increase the quantity of technicians , allowing the kickoff of innovation process temporarily .
However our heavy reliance on foreign talents will put Singapore in a vulnerable position in the long run as the foreigners do not have loyalty towards Singapore .
To reduce this over- reliance , Singapore has been taking careful measures in her education system .
For instance , Singapore implemented her first IT Masterplan for education (MP1) in 1997 (Keng , 2007) ,  ensuring that Singaporeans have sufficient IT skills for future endeavors .
Scarce talents in Singapore is not the only problem we face .
Another crucial worry is our adverse societal attitude towards failure .
Few local citizens have the risk venturing attitude , fearing failure , as when one moves into innovation several sacrifices need to be made , for example , family , current job .
This frame of mind gradually prevents Singaporeans from having the courage to venture into the unknown which is required for innovation .
Thus this worry will affect both the Research and the Development stages , from figure 1 .
As a result we do not have the first mover advantage .
In conclusion , if Singapore is to survive in the high risk volatility of the global economy , more pervasive idea generation skills throughout the population (Lambe , 2002) are required for innovation process to begin .
Education should focus on producing not only 'exam-smart' students but also those who that can react flexibly with the changes and needs of the current society .
At the same time , the society should also give ample supports to those creative thinkers of our civilization .
However , we should know that for these problems to be solved , it will require long term investment and there will certainly be some problems that cannot be completely unraveled .
The main cause for this phenomenon is the ineffectiveness of the current education system in Malaysia .
The education system in Malaysia is typically exam-based .
All students are educated to pass or get high scores in their examinations .
In other words , schools are producing machines that study for the sake of examinations .
They don't know how to apply their knowledge .
They don't know how to improve things that they are taught .
They just receive everything blindly .
Under such circumstances , it is totally not surprising that younger generation usually do not have the ability to cope with problems that they have never faced before .
At most , they can only deal with problems whose solutions have already been identified and proven to work successfully .
Upon facing new problems that they have never encountered , they will just give up and take other short-cuts instead .
That's why the whole process of innovations tends to stop after problems or needs arise .
By chance the process might proceed to the research and development stage but that is where more and more problems and troubles will appear and try to block the way out .
How many of them can survive all the way through the six stages mentioned above ?
Another factor that contributes to Malaysia's failure is the policy made by the government .
In order to gain political advantages , the government or the ruling party has implemented plenty of policies  to constrain the freedom of individuals in giving opinions .
Mass media in Malaysia might be seen to have a lot of freedom in reporting news and views , but the truth is that they are all being controlled behind the veil .
Wondering how all these are connected with innovations ?
There is an invisible link .
If you are the government , what will you do if problems arise in your country ?
What if more and more problems keep on coming out ?
Try to find solutions for all the problems ?
No way !
The solution is most probably trying to conceal the problems from the public .
With most of the mass media under their surveillance , they will try their best to block all the negative issues and scandals that might threaten their position as the ruling party .
Since identifying problems is the first stage of the generation of innovation , the government is actually blocking the entire flow of innovation process .
A country ruled under such a government will certainly enjoy very limited development in terms of creativity and innovation .
Does this make things clear enough now ?
As a conclusion , the government plays an important role in deciding the overall development of innovation and innovative design of a country .
Sadly , my home country , Malaysia , is not a very good example to be followed by others .
Hopefully , Malaysia will become a famous country for its people's innovation and creativity in the future .
The world today has become more sophisticated and problems in our society are created , most of the time , by humans from the results of their innovations and inventions .
However , these inventions do not appear out of nothing; it is the result of bringing together technologies and systems to solve our problems and to improve human needs .
All the products and systems humans are enjoying now are the results of human effort to improve our society .
But one thing is for sure - our Earth's resources are depleting and engineers , being the problem solvers , have to come up with ideas to reduce fuel consumption and the risk of greenhouse effect and global warming .
All these harmful effects bring us to this certain human need that should be given the utmost priority - health .
To address this need , an engineering process has to be developed and this requires a methodology or a process of steps to help us arrive at the solution .
The five step process , developed by Seyyed Khandani (2005) in http://www .iisme .org/etp/HS%20Engineering-%20Engineering .pdf , is essential to help reduce the amount of pollution in our  atmosphere .
The problem has to be clearly defined so that researchers and engineers alike understand the problem and recognize the need for a new product or system .
Although engineers are usually involved in defining the problem , they may not always be the ones who initially recognize the need .
The emission of harmful pollutants into the  atmosphere by motorcars and factories has affected human health and this needs to be rectified .
Systems have to be developed to improve the weather and make the air fresher which will , in turn , improve our health conditions .
There is more than one solution to any engineering problems .
Before further research can be done , collection of data that is related to the problem is needed to narrow the solutions for engineers to work on .
Details such as whether the issue of global warming is real has to be consolidated before ideas , such as replacing our motorcars with hybrid cars , can be generated .
Solutions to engineering design problems do not magically appear .
Ideas are generated when people are free to take risks and make mistakes .
Brainstorming at this stage is often a team effort when people from different backgrounds are involved in generating multiple solutions to the problem .
Questions have to be asked and certain pointers have to be fulfilled and established .
The pros and cons of a solution have to be worked through and analyzed to select the best solution .
The final phase of the design process is implementation , which refers to the testing and manufacturing of the solution to the design problem .
The solution has to be fine-tuned as much as possible .
Products or systems have to go under a real condition test .
Graphs and charts , and information pertaining to the testing have to be recorded and reported to understand what has been created .
The ability to communicate and sell an idea is an critical skill in engineering design .
Last but not least , the solution is implemented and a patent , which protects the idea from copyright infringement , has to be applied to develop an original and novel solution to a design problem .
In conclusion , engineering design process helps to meet human needs by the identification and the analysis of the processes .
Design activity occurs over a period of time and requires a step-by-step methodology .
The solution to a design problem does not appear out of nowhere .
There are as many processes of design as there are engineers .
However , since design problems are usually not defined properly and can have a great number of correct answers , the process may require backtracking and iteration .
To sum it all , it is best that common sense comes into play when certain steps do not play a part in the engineering design process .
