In today's world , the significance of nuclear energy cannot be ignored .
In some countries , nuclear energy plays an important role  in power production .
Currently , "nuclear energy supplies about 80% and 30% of the electricity in France and Japan respectively"() .
More prominently , countries are using nuclear energy to make powerful weapons for military purposes .
We know how Iran and North Korea have been using their nuclear 'power' to negotiate with the US .
However , these powerful weapons  were not within scientists' imagination of how nuclear energy would be utilised .
Scientists probably had intended to use nuclear energy for peaceful purposes like using it as an alternative source of energy  .
Hence , we shall examine how nuclear energy  and how it is important to the world now and in the near future .
Nuclear energy was discovered in the early 1990s () .
Scientists discovered that a huge amount of energy could be produced from the nuclear fission of the element uranium .
We shall not go down to the details of that process but it was a major scientific discovery as it led to another form of energy production .
Unfortunately , nuclear energy's first real useful application was on Japan's cities where two nuclear bombs landed and caused massive destruction .
While this historical event marked the end of WWII , it presented nuclear energy to the rest of the world .
Soon , countries like Russia and China became nuclear 'powers' as well .
Their governments funded nuclear research and the setting up of more nuclear reactors .
Naturally , nuclear weapons became increasingly sophisticated as nuclear countries reinvented these weapons and vied to be the most powerful nuclear state in the world .
Now , nuclear weapons , from what we know , can be flown to a faraway place to cause massive destruction .
However , the use of nuclear weapons on another country has been non-existent since WWII as countries realize the chaos they could cause .
Moreover , the primary purpose of nuclear energy is to generate electricity .
Unlike energy produced by burning carbon , nuclear energy is clean as no greenhouse gases is produced from nuclear plants , where nuclear energy is made .
Using more nuclear energy and less carbon-generated energy to produce electrical energy could mean a significant decrease in greenhouse gases and a cleaner earth to live on .
Countries like France rely on nuclear power as much as other countries  rely on carbon to generate electricity .
Hence , nuclear energy might become essential in the near future as the world seeks to solve the energy-related problems such as global warming .
At the same time , just like any other forms that could be used to generate electricity , nuclear power is not a perfect source of energy  .
The danger of radioactivity is always imminent as critics often refer to the nuclear accident in Chernobyl that resulted in many deaths and serious repercussions such as unnatural births many years after the accident .
In addition , even if nuclear accidents do not occur , spent nuclear fuel would remain radioactive for decades .
As a result , land space has to be sacrificed to accommodate waste storage .
In conclusion , nuclear energy would probably play an important as the Earth's carbon resources are gradually being depleted .
However , nuclear countries should only encourage research on nuclear energy production for peaceful purposes .
They should not use it as a weopon in war as this could spell the end of the world .
The creation of NEWater , a technology where used water is treated to become potable , is one of the few examples of success in the research of technology in Singapore .
Prior to this achievement , the PUB (Public Utilities Board) faced many obstacles and that included the lack of engineering technology which made the cost of implementation unrealistic .
As a result , this plan was shelved in the 1980s .
Similarly , Singapore is currently facing problems that hamper its ambition of coming up with great innovations .
One of these problems is the rigid education system that is restricting the growth of the minds of young Singaporeans , mainly the teenagers .
At the same time , the comfortable state of living in Singapore poses a challenge to provoking the minds of its people to improve their current state of living .
All these may then lead to the slowdown of  technological advancement in Singapore .
The Ministry of Education (MOE) in Singapore adopts an academic based education system , where excellent examination results are prioritized over the creativity of one's mind .
Parents and teachers emphasize a lot on obtaining 'A' grades and hence students have a misconception towards education .
They have the impression that doing well in examinations equates to success in their future endeavours .
Moreover , achievingacademic promotion mainly requires students to reproduce their knowledge conservatively without much consideration .
As such , less time is made for attending brain teasing courses which  , in almost all cases ,  are made optional to students and whose importance is not highlighted .
Hence , 'students from Singapore top results in Mathematics and Science among their peers from 41 other countries but when it comes to designing , Singaporeans are way behind their foreign peers' (Boston College , n .d .) .
It is thus evident that Singaporean students are proficient in examination questions yet fail in creativity .
In view of the limited development in creativity of the people here , there is no doubt why the ability to design novel engineering processes is beginning to be seen as an outstanding talent in our society .
The other problem Singapore faces is , ironically , its high standard of living .
More importantly , the efficient system of governance in Singapore lives up to most of the promises made to its people during general elections .
Given the comfortable lifestyle they are enjoying , the idea of bringing about a change is not  the people's priority .
For instance , the government has upgraded the facilities in housing estates through  the implementation of schemes such as the Lift Upgrading Scheme , and this has brought about the 'tardiness' in Singaporeans in thinking about further improvements to their life .
Their focus , instead , is directed at their routine occupational job and their own family matters and therefore , the element of creativity is not part of their daily life .
Consequently , these problems result in the failure to generate creative ideas as a solution or improvement to the people's surroundings .
The scope of their thoughts is relatively narrow and hence they usually fail to come up with innovations that are beyond their imagination .
Surprisingly , what Singaporeans have in mind as the ideal solution may not be in tandem with that of foreigners .
Eventually , without a niche in designing , they will  lose out to the 'brains' from other countries when it comes to employment for 'a designer is a planner with an aesthetic sense' (Bruno Munari , n .d .) .
Not only is knowledge important , but originality too plays an important role when it comes to being a great innovator .
In conclusion , Singapore has to move away from its current mindset and practices in order to succeed in coming up with engineering design processes for innovations .
For example , Singapore needs to , and has already begun to , deviate from its regimental approach of learning .
MOE has been 'moving in recent years towards nurturing young Singaporeans who ask questions , and who are willing to think of new ways to solve new problems ,' (Ministry of Education , n .d .) in an attempt to inculcate the positive mindset of learning at a tender age .
In the meantime , Singapore has also declared that it will increase its investment in research and development (R&D) to 3% of its GDP by 2010 .
(ChannelNewsAsia , 2007) .
The bold decision to invest billions of dollars into R&D will make people realize the importance of innovations to the sustainability of Singapore and no doubt open up more avenues for new discoveries to be made .
All in all , both measures that the Singapore government is taking clearly reflect on its intention to drive Singapore to become one of the leading countries in terms of technology .
"Think outside the box .
"This is the sentence that we have all heard many times before when it comes to innovation .
Singapore , as a young nation with no natural resources , depends heavily on its human resources to survive .
To be able to capture the consumers in the market , we have to be innovative in product design .
However , I think problems like the fixed mindset of the person and the lack of resources may hamper  engineering design processes for innovations .
Firstly , many people have a fixed mindset .
They tend to worry about what others might think and are afraid of criticism by others .
Self-criticism is also another issue that hinders creativity .
Most people believe themselves to be lacking in creativity and think that others will not like their ideas .
Hence , during a presentation , they present their ideas with little or no confidence because they are afraid of making fools of themselves .
Therefore , others will take it that there is a lack of enthusiasm in the idea .
Moreover , if someone receives a negative response , there is a high chance that he will not pursue any innovative attempts anymore .
Sometimes , people have the tendency to make products too complex or are too focused on factors like usability that it results in a design barrier .
Not everyone encourages new ideas .
Often their reaction to new things is negative .
This will also further hinder creativity .
Secondly , since Singapore is small , it is limited in resources .
We often have to import materials from other countries .
As a result , the cost of production will be expensive and people would rather choose to design a simple product instead of investing in  product innovation and research .
In addition , we have a small talent pool of people with innovative ideas .
Hence , most people do not possess the skills that are able to design any innovative products .
As a result of the problems that hamper  the engineering design process for innovation , many fail to identify  unmet needs of the market , causing the market to suffer .
Instead of having new  products in the market to capture the attention of the consumers , the market ends up with many different products having similar features and functions .
Furthermore , as mentioned by Chan in his lecture , many people are willing to pay more for design as well as for new products that they think are simple , practical and useful .
For instance , Apple iPhones were in high demand in the market during its launch because of their design , simplicity and reliability although the features of the iPhones are generally the same as many other smartphones in the market .
In conclusion , it is possible to avoid all aspects which will hamper  engineering design processes for innovations by changing the mindset of the people as well as finding alternative ways to solve the problem of the lack of resources .
We should attempt to make changes to our way of life in order to begin a larger change in our lives .
The engineering design process plays an important role in innovation and creativity .
Since the resources in the world are limited and decreasing , many countries are making efforts to develop the designing process to use the resources more efficiently toimprove the standard of life .
However , in my country there are still some problems that hamper  creativity and design , especially the lack of resources and the behavior of customers .
In this essay , I will discuss  these obstacles and how they affect the design process .
First of all , one of the biggest obstacles that hamper the engineering design process in my country is the lack of resources , which includes both  human resources and natural resources .
Human resources , in this case , refers to the labor force needed to design products with skill and knowledge .
Without knowledge , an engineer cannot start his designing process because he does not know where to begin and what to create .
As a result , the lack of human resource affects the design process at the very first stage .
Another factor that also hampers  creativity is the lack of natural resourcessuch as space , time and materials  for designing .
For example , in my country , many projects have to be postponed because there are not enough materials to make the products .
When waiting for the resources to be imported from other countries , these projects were still on the paper .
Therefore , natural resources are important at the stages of implement the ideas to create the products .
Secondly , the behaviors of the users also cause many problems when putting the products on the market .
Customers are usually afraid of changing the products they are currently usingt to new ones when they think the old ones are satisfactory .
Once they are used to  a current product , it is hard to persuade them to switch to a new one because they have to learn how to use the new device .
This may not be a big matter for the young but with the old people , the problem is much  greater .
For example , my mother will only use the traditional line-phone and not the cell-phone because making a call with the hand-phone is more complex than just picking up the line-phone handset and dialing the number .
Consequently , a new product , although functionally well designed , could be easily refused if it was not friendly to users .
In this situation , the behaviors of the customers are the key factors which directly determine the success of the product in the last stages of the engineering design process: making the product and bringing it to the market .
In conclusion , the two factors of lack of resources and behaviors of the customers cause great problems to the engineering design process in my country .
They affect most stages of the design process as they can postpone the process or even  stop it .
Unfortunately , these problems cannot be solved in the short term; it will require much effort to bring back the knowledge and materials into my country .
Have you ever wondered how many vending machines  the National University of Singapore has ?
Believe it or not , it is reported that there are over 100 vending machines in this university alone (National University of Singapore , 2009) .
Vending machines are available almost everywhere .
We can see them in hospitals , parks and even jungles !
There is no doubt that this invention has influenced our modern life to a great extent .
However , this technology only came on the market in the early 1880s , although the first vending machine was invented by a Greek engineer named Hero of Alexandria many centuries ago around 10 A .D . to 70 A .D . CITATION Eri06 \l 1033 (Jaffe , 2006) .
Various factors have contributed to allow such an invention to be widely adopted in today's world .
The major reason for the popularisation of the vending machine is due to the rising wage cost during the 1880s .
"In the 1880s , common occupations included cobblers , daguerreotypists , nail makers , spinners , watchmakers , candle makers , gaslighters , milliners , washerwomen , tinkers , shoeblacks and glove makers ."
CITATION Pam09 \l 1033 (Schehl , 2009)  Pennsylvania , the southern state which once supported the idea of slavery , abolished its slavery system .
As the overall standard of living of the public began to rise in cities in the following years , most people were unwilling to take up the job of selling items like chewing gum and newspaper .
therefore the chewing gum company , Thomas Adams Gum , decided to build the first commercial vending machine , selling gums on train platforms CITATION Gum08 \l 1033 (Gumballs , 2008) .
This effectively saved the cost of employing a worker and improved the efficiency of the sales .
Ever since the first vending machine appeared , many companies have adopted this idea as the public has welcomed such an invention .
The convenience it has brought has definitely played a big part in its success .
From the consumer's perspective , cumbersome long queues can be avoided when he only needs to have a can of drink .
Furthermore , the simple manipulation of the vending machine and the hygienic storage is widely accepted by the masses .
From the vendor's perspective , the vending machine is favourable because it allows the selling of stocks that have a very long shelf life .
and the reliability of these vending machines is guaranteed .
Practically , they can be placed at any place , including rural locations .
This introduction of vending machines has improved and revolutionized the conventional way of merchandising .
In countries like Japan and Singapore , where there is a lack of space , the need for a condensed merchandiser which improves space efficiency is furthermore amplified .
As time gradually goes by , the population density of many countries increases .
Devices that free up more available spaces are gaining popularity .
In Japan , the available vending items range from instant noodles to cars !
CITATION Nat091 \l 1033 (Nate , 2009) The need to concentrate all stocks in a small space  .
In conclusion , the rising wage costs , demand for a more convenient way of selling certain products and the lack of space have shaped this technological innovation .
In addition , improvements of the vending machine havenot come to a halt as it continues to accommodate more human needs .
In years to come , more improved versions of the vending machine will be introduced to the society and bring more benefits to human kind .
The commercial nuclear power industry witnessed the worst nuclear power plant accident in its history in Chernobyl .
Reports pointed out that the disaster killed 56 people and caused about 336 ,000 people in contaminated areas in Russia , Belarus and Ukraine to evacuate and resettle (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
The accident raised the question about the safety of the nuclear power plant and the ways that people can prevent such accidents in future .
According to an article by Bernhard Wilpert from Technical University of Berlin , Germany , we can see that if psychology had been applied in the design process of the Chernobyl nuclear reactors , the disaster might not have happened .
After the accident , people tried to analyse what were the reasons that caused the malfunctioning of the power plant .
Several theories were proposed , but they mostly concentrated on two issues: the mistakes of the reactor crew and the deficiency in the design of the RBMK  reactor (a high-power channel reactor called reactor bolshoy moshchnosty kanalny) (World Nuclear Association ,2007) .
These two factors-- one relating to humans and one relating to machines--can be eliminated by carefully using psychology in the design process .
Firstly , the human reasons for the accident come from various factors: the lack of knowledge of the reactor manager , the subjective points of view while performing unusual activities with the reactor and the weak communications between the workers in the power plant .
Since a nuclear reactor is described as a "complex high hazard systems" (Wilpert ,2007) ,  adequate and clear cognition is very important not only for  but also for all the workers in the manufacturing plant , where their collaboration  plays the key role in the work of the plant .
If the Chernobyl reactor crew had had enough information about the danger caused by the reactor when working in low power settings , they would never have performed the test to determine how long the turbines would spin and  following a loss of main electrical power supply .
Unfortunately , such tests were still carried out despite the instability of the plant under risky circumstances .
If we had applied psychology in the nuclear power plant , the workers would have been trained well and they would have giventhe rightresponses during the accident while running the plant .
However , the operators had broken many important rules of safety just to complete the test quickly: they had diminished the flow of coolant water , disabled the automatic shutdown mechanismsand released the control rods from the machine over the acceptable limit .
These actions resulted in increasing the amount of the energy produced to an uncontrollable level within a very short time and caused the explosions of the reactor .
Once again , the  .
Without proper knowledge and problem-solving skills  ,  and behaved in the wrong way when problems appeared .
Secondly , the other reason  is the flaws in the design of the RBMK reactor , especially the control rods .
Initially , the control rods were designed to slow down the reaction of the nuclear plant .
However , the engineer who had created the rods had not expected the chemical structure inside the rod to actually increase the reactions between the radiation atoms  the  moment they are put into the reactor .
In this case , the minimum requirements in testing the rods were not relevant .
the point is that the designers had  made the rods for working in stable conditions , not for such tests like this .
If the designers had applied psychology in the design process , they would have thought carefully and predicted the unexpected problems which might happen with the rods when using them .
Instead , they neglected the standard criteria just to make them simplerand cheaper but , unfortunately , more dangerous .
In addition , when the disaster happened , another serious mistake in building the nuclear power plant that reflected the weak cognition of the importance of psychology in design is that the wall around the reactor was not tough .
As a result , the wall was  and radioactivity was released freely into the atmosphere , which was extremely dangerous for humans and wildlife within a large area around the plant .
An absolute evidence that proves the necessity of psychological design is a similar accident with the Three Miles Island nuclear reactor in the US .
In this case , the wall of the reactor which had been built with Europe's high standards of safety had prevented the radiation from spreading into the air and no one had to die because of it (Grunwald , 2009) .
These examples show that even  machine errors can be eliminated by carefully designing and applying psychology in the design process to predict all the scenarios that may happen in the future .
Since the horrible accident of Chernobyl , the old technologies used to build the Chernobyl reactor have never been used again .
In addition , people have been doing research to improve the efficiency , the feasibility and  most important the safety of the power plants so that such disasters will never happen again .
It is said that ""(p)sychological methods , theories , and findings are becoming increasingly important to design" ( Benson , 2006) .
With the increasing collaboration between psychology and design ,  engineers have been using  for the design process to make more reliable and stable products .
Therefore , we can minimize the damage caused by accidents or even avoid them and increase the efficiency of  .

The process of inventing and innovations are crucial to al , namely Imagine a world at night without lights , which was also an invention turned innovation .
According to the Maslow's hierarchy of needs pyramid , physiological need is the most basic tier of the pyramid .
It is viewed as the most important need among the others .
Therefore , I think  medical needs are the one which I should give priority to .
Engineers play a very important role in designing new medical products to suit these human needs .
There are many different medical research areas which engineers could lay their hand on and design products according to stipulated requirements .
The most recent leading medical research areas are medical imaging , tissue engineering , pharmaceutical engineering , stem cell engineering and genetic engineering .
In my opinion , medical imaging is the most important area where we need to spend time and effort .
Medical imaging technology refers to the method or process used to obtain graphic images of the human body structure or organs .
It helps the doctor to diagnose diseases  at an earlier stage .
Throughout the years , various types of medical imaging technologies have been invented .
There are two main types of  medical imaging: invasive and non-invasive .
Invasive imaging includes nuclear medical imaging and X-ray imaging .
The invasive imaging method requires radioactive means to produce medical scanning which would have a possibility of causing harm to the human body but could be used on the majority of human body parts .
On the other hand , non-invasive imaging techniques like MRI and Ultra imaging would do the same job without causing any side effect on the patient .
The only set-back of such techniques is the high operation cost and constraints on the type of human body parts which they can be used on .
The engineering design process could be used on the invention of a new imaging technology .
This new imaging technology must have the advantages of both the non-invasive and invasive imaging .
Furthermore , it has to address the operation cost problem and the type of human body parts where the imaging device can be used on .
Another major concern in the engineering design process of the new imaging technology is providing higher resolution 3D/2D clinical image .
This will help the doctors to analyse a  patient with improved detailed images .
Since modern computers continually increase on processing speed and volume of memory , they will provide a huge support in designing better resolution image devices .
The only portion which engineers would need to figure out is how to lower the operation cost of such an imaging device .
In my opinion , the materials of the films and the simplicity of the devices would be important .
With  the new resolved imaging technology , more humans would be able to make use of such technology since its cost would be reduced .
Better clinical images would also be provided to the doctors; as a result , doctors would be able to provide a clearer diagnosis of the disease/illness of the patient .
Eventually , the average lifespan of a human would be prolonged with such devices since early detection of illness would be easier to treat and cure .
Lastly , engineers should view the medical imaging area as their priority since their innovations could resolve a lot of medical problems existing in the modern world .
Good health is still the most crucial area where everyone would wish to make their achievements in after all .

However ,  it was reported that the time every resident in Beijing spent on transportation per day reached five hours and five minutes in 2008 .

The second is to translate the information  and released , then  .

Apparently , the human needs cause the problem .

Is this design realistic and feasible ?

Have you ever wondered how many cars there are in the whole world ?
According to the article , "World's Most Congested Cities" ( Malone , 2006) , there are about 750 million vehicles (and counting) in the world , and at least 50 million cars are being manufactured in the world each year .
And out of the 750 million vehicles , 240 million come from the United States of America (USA) , and 850 thousand come from Singapore (US Commercial Service , 2008) .
From the above figures , the ratios of human beings to vehicles are approximately 5:4 , 1:3 and 8:8 respectively .
all these figures are crucial in pointing out that vehicles , gasoline-powered vehicles to be more specific , are important and have blended into our lives .
Although this technology is important , many do not know its history and that the development of the gasoline-powered vehicle was actually heavily influenced by political , economic and social factors .
Firstly , there were the economic factors , and these factors can be seen as "natural" and "man-made" .
The "natural" factor that caused a spike in the number of gasoline-powered vehicles was the declining cost of oil at that point in time , which made gasoline-powered vehicles a stronger competitor over the electric-powered vehicles , which were the more commonly- used vehicle .
In addition to the above-mentioned "natural" factor , there were several "man-made" economic factors , and the man behind these factors was Henry Ford .
Henry Ford was the man who mass produced and mass distributed the gasoline-powered vehicle .
One of the key economic factors that Henry Ford induced was that he collaborated with banks and introduced car insurances and loans (only if people purchased Ford's vehicles) , which actually amplified the effects of the declining cost of oil .
as a result , the gasoline-powered vehicle became even more economically competitive and appealing .
Furthermore , it also became more affordable in the sense that the insurances covered certain repair costs incurred by mishaps; and loans allowed people to pay up slowly because there was no "pay by instalments" scheme back then .
Consequently , by the laws of supply and demand , Ford increased the supply of gasoline-powered vehicles due to an increase in the demand for gasoline-powered vehicles  .
Hence , gasoline-powered vehicles took a huge step forward and got ahead of the electric-powered vehicles in terms of support .
The second set of factors were the political factors , and one of the main factors was the convenience the gasoline-powered vehicle brought about in World War I .
During World War I , the military realised that gasoline- powered vehicles were more convenient to use as compared to electric-powered vehicles because it was difficult to charge the battery of the electric-powered vehicle right in the midst of a battle where there was no electrical source .
This convenience was due to the fact that gasoline was portable and could be brought around on vehicles which allowed vehicles to be re- fueled at any time and place and this could be done very quickly .
Apart from the influence of the military , the government had a part to play as well , because the government implemented biased policies that involved building more gas stations and roads to cater to the gasoline-powered vehicles .
These implementations brought more convenience to users of gasoline-powered vehicles because gasoline was made more available , and places once inaccessible became accessible .
On the contrary , there was no "charging" station and roads were not very ideal for electric-powered vehicles to move on; basically , there was nothing done to cater to the electric-powered vehicles which made it difficult for people to utilise the electric-powered vehicles without having any worries .
As a result , the electric-powered vehicle continued to lose  support , and gasoline- powered vehicles took another point home .
The next set of factors that further developed the gasoline-powered vehicles were the social factors .
the presence of these social factors actually determined the fate of the electric-powered vehicles .
However , these social factors , which were partly caused by the overpowering economic and political factors , "pushed" people to choose the gasoline- powered vehicles .
The people were made to believe that the gasoline-powered vehicle was the "byproduct of market competition and engineering advancement , not a product of compromise and negotiation" (Dr . Sovacool , 28 August 09) , which , in actual fact , was not the case .
Due to meritocracy and freedom , people eventually "chose" the gasoline-powered vehicles  , and brought electric-powered vehicles to eternal rest .
The above factors gave gasoline-powered vehicles their place in the market , even though electric-powered vehicles were better in terms of the technical aspects .
For instance , electric-powered vehicles were cleaner because they did not produce any harmful byproducts from combustion , and they were quieter , more luxurious and safer because they did not deal with any forms of combustion or heat .
Furthermore , electricity was easily available compared to high octane gasoline (and up till today , high octane gasoline is essential for engines to work smoothly) .
Even though electric-powered vehicles were relatively more superior in the technical aspects , due to the factors mentioned above , the technical aspects were  and people were not fazed by the potential problems they might face if they chose the gasoline-powered vehicles .
In conclusion , the development of an innovation does not solely depend on how technically superior it is , it also depends on many other factors , as we can see from the above example of the gasoline-powered vehicle .
These factors may vary in terms of the degree of impact , but there will always be an array of factors that will determine if an innovation succeeds .
The more important and valuable an innovation is to the society , the more impactful are the contributing factors , and the more elaborated the impacts will be .
In this case , if vehicles are not as important , and we do not depend on them to such a large extent , World War I would not have had such a drastic effect on the extinction of the electric-powered vehicle and banks might not have approved the implementation of the insurances and loans .
And who knows ?
All our cars might be plugged in and getting charged now .

As time passes  , more and more new technologies are being discovered or created .
These technologies can be classified in two main categories: one is the technologies which are developed by research , the other type is the technologies which result from serendipitous discoveries .
This article will discuss the similarities and differences between these two types of technologies .
I will focus on two common items in our life: Penicillin and the telephone .
The detailed comparison will be discussed in the following paragraphs .
Firstly , "Penicillin is one of the earliest discovered and widely used antibiotic agents , derived from the Penicillium mold" (Bellis , 2009) .
Penicillin was discovered by Alexander Fleming while he "(was observing) that colonies of the bacterium Staphylococcus aureus could be destroyed by the mold Penicillium notatum" (Bellis , 2009) .
After Fleming observed that , he paid much attention to Penicillinand discovered that Penicillin could kill many kinds of bacteria .
This important finding , however , was not given a lot attention until the 1940s when " Howard Florey and Ernst Chain isolated the active ingredient and developed a powdery form of the medicine" (Bellis , 2009) .
Penicillin is "the first drug that was effective against many previously serious diseases" (Wikipedia , 2009) .
Although many  bacteria are resistant toward Penicillin now , it is still in wide used .
Secondly , the telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876 and "by 1884 , long distance connections were made between Boston , Massachusetts and New York City" (Inventor , 2009) .
Bell was very interested in helping deaf people which led him to invent the telephone .
In addition , "the telephone came as a direct result of his attempts to improve the telegraph" (Bellis , 2009) .
The invention of the telephone was not a coincidence , but the result of long-term research .
nowadays , the telephone plays a very important role in our life , as we can hardly live without them .
From the above paragraphs on Penicillin and while the telephone , we can easily see some similarities and differences between the two .
First of all , both of these two technologies have benefited us and improved our life very much .
Both  have helped us in some aspects: Penicillin has helped us to deal with some diseases which were hard to cure , the telephone has helped us to communicate with others more easily and made the world much smaller .
Secondly , both  technologies have matured after a long time of conscientiousresearch .
Both Penicillin and the telephone were not used for years after they were discovered; many people put a lot of effort to make them more  and more useful .
The only difference between them  is that  Penicillin was found by accident while the telephone was invented with clear aim .
Fleming had not planned to find anything like Penicillin while Bell had a clear purpose and worked on it .
In conclusion , both Penicillin and the telephone help people significantly and both  are the products of hard work and  .
The difference between them is whether the inventor had a clear purpose or not , which Bell had and Fleming had not .
But this difference does not decrease the value of either of these two technologies .
Human needs are always unsatiable .
Centuries ago , providing sufficient food was the most urgent need .
At the same time , health problems also created great needs for advanced medical technologies and facilities .
As years went by , industrialization emerged in many countries to meet various people's needs , like job opportunities and economic growth .
However , the big success of industrialization has created a problem for our modern people: how can we save our fast degrading environment ?
Thus , designing technologies in anenvironmentally friendly manner is one of the greatest necessities in order to protect our living environment and to ensure  sustainable economic development .
After a problem has been defined , which is the first step of engineering design , engineers need to gather pertinent information about the problem .
For example , engineers who focus on designing environmentally friendly transportation tools must have the basic knowledge about the products of different types of fuel combustion and how they affect the environment .
They should also be updated about the latest methods to generate energy in environmentally friendly ways , such as through generating renewable energy like solar energy , tidal energy or wind energy , and their respective advantages and drawbacks .
Engineers can move on to the next step once they are equipped with the necessary knowledge .
The second step of the design process is generating different solutions to  problems .
For example , engineers basically come up with two main ways to make machineries and transportation tools  .
The first way is changing the way energy is generated , such as changing petrol engines which produce carbon dioxide and hydrocarbons to fuel cells which only produce water and oxygen .
This solution can be further  by considering different types of methods to generate energy in less polluting ways .
The other solution is to deal with the polluting products generated along the way .
For example , catalyst convertors are installed in cars to convert the toxicgases carbon monoxide and hydrocarbons produced from incomplete combustion to the non toxic gases carbon dioxide and water .
Although different ways of solutions may be found  , not all are practical , so engineers also need to analyze and select a suitable solution .
For example , both of the two solutions  discussed above are theoretically correct , but today we only see converters being installed in cars .
This is because changing the ways to generate energy is very costly and the safety of such methods is unpredictable .
For example , fuel cells are very expensive , so their cost of production will be so high that they will be unmarketable .
Another example is that of hydro-powered cars , which actually have been produced but not used widely due to the fact that hydrogen is flammable , so there are still big concerns of consumers' safety .
In this step , engineers will also look at other factors like economicand social factors to filter the solutions .
Finally , engineers will test their solutions and make continuous changes to their product .
Although it is difficult to have a perfect solution , engineers are still trying hard to meet our needs to save the environment .
When we look around , we can see the efforts put in by engineersin products such as energy saving light bulbs light bulb , solar water heaters , car catalytic converters and so on .
These products are produced only after a long and complicated designing process .
We should really be grateful to engineers who work so dedicatedly to satisfy our needs .

As many big cities in the world are facing  water crises , as acid rains become increasingly frequent , and as the number of lung cancer patients keeps going up , environmental protection has become one of the most vital needs of humans .
To satisfy humans' need and contribute to protecting the environment , engineers seek to design and invent products in an environmentally friendly way .
Through the engineering design process , we can see how engineers satisfy that need .
According to Khandani (2005) , there are five steps in solving designing problems .
In the steps to get pertinent information and to analyze and select a solution , engineers can make their product more environment-friendly .
To design and produce something more environmentally friendly , engineers should pay more attention to environment-related information when searching for pertinent information to help them in their design .
For example , suppose an engineer is looking for a material for meal boxes of take-away food .
Apart from information about cost , weight , water resistant ability , and so on , he needs to pay extra attention to  environmental information like whether the material can be biodegraded or recycled .
Taking this environment-related information into consideration helps make more environmentally friendly decisions .
The second step is to analyze and select a solution .
Usually , engineers will come up with more than one plan as they design a product .
They need to analyze and evaluate the plans and decide on a final plan .
In the Engineering Design Process , Khandani (2005) shows us how engineers evaluate different plans .
Firstly , they need to decide the criteria  for evaluating design plans .
They need to perform several types of analysis on each design plan .
These types of analysis are the criteria for evaluating the plans .
Next they value each criterion according to its importance , and give a mark representing how important it is .
In this way , they set criteria for evaluating plans .
After that , they evaluate each aspect of the design against the corresponding criterion .
Based on how well that aspectfits the criterion , they give a mark .
Lastly , they calculate the points for each plan and compare them .
Then the mark of each aspect of the plan is multiplied by the number representing the importance of this criterion and the total mark is added up .
By comparing the total mark of the different plans , they decide on the final plan .
For example , suppose an engineer is designing a process of producing a kind of detergent .
There are some factors , such as efficiency of the product and cost , to be taken into consideration for deciding the final plan .
If he can increase the importance of the factors related to environmental protection , he may use a substitute for phosphorus , or cleanse the waste water before discharging it .
Then the process and product would be more environmentally friendly .
If engineers can think more about the environment when designing , the product will become very environment-friendly .
Then our earth will become cleaner and more sustainable .
We will have a more comfortable and healthier environment to live in .
Government Regulations and Public Opinions of the Development of Electric Bicycles in China
One typical image remembered by the world about China is  its astounding number of bicycles on the roads: swarms of people riding bicycles filling the roads which are not really narrow .
since the year  2000 , another phenomenon has occurred on the roads of the cities in China: electric bicycles .
According to data on reliable Chinese websites , in 2004 alone , 6750000 electric bicycles were produced by more than 1000 factories all over China and these numbers are expected to increase by many times by the end of 2010 .
With the maturing of the technologies of electric motors and long-life batteries , multiple types of electric vehicles could have been created .
However ,Previously existing government regulations and public opinions on road safety have played important roles in shaping the electric bicycle in China into what it is today .
previously existing government regulations had a tremendous effects on the development of electric bicycles when it comes to the size and speed of these bicycles .
Before the e-bike(electric bicycle) we see now which is light(lighter than 20kg) and slow(maximum speed is less than 20km/h)  , there are also a number of other kinds of electric vehicles being developed .
They are more like electric motorbikes which are much more powerful and , of course , heavier .
However , because of the government regulations on city transportation under which all means of transportation on the road are grouped as either motor or non-motor and nothing in between , the prototype of the heavy electric bicycles was nipped in the bud as it could not be categorised as either of the two  because of its variety of performance .
The later electric bicycle was then designed to be more like a normal bicycle and was only allowed to be ridden on non-motor roads .
It is light but moves automatically .
People can even ride it just like riding a bicycle when it runs out of power .
Apart from government regulations , public opinions have also hadsignificant effect on the development of the e-bike .
After the e-bike was placed on the market , safety issues related to the e-bike were brought up .
Data on road traffic accidents were collected .
In Hangzhou , the capital city of Zhejiang province , the number of accidents caused by e-bikes increased over three years  Though the number was relatively small compared with those caused by cars and motorbikes , people were becoming more and more concerned about the safety of e-bikes and a series of public discussions were then carried out to discuss how to make the e-bike a safe vehicle on the roads .
Finally , the speed limit was set at 20km/h which is quite at the lower end of what the technology allows the e-bike to do .
Then all the e-bike industries began to improve performance in other areas of the e-bike like battery life and noise rather than speed and loading ability .
In order to meet the requirement of government regulations and public opinions , the development of the e-bike has gone through several changes; therefore it has been shaped to the e-bike we see now .
Hopefully , the next typical image left by China to the world will be that of the e-bike .

To generate innovation in a comparable short time as mentioned previously , normally skunk works assemble mNormally ,tanding personnel and more capital as opposed to conventional R&D organizations .
Therefore , people highly selected can accomplish the task without much trouble in capital .
One example is the Xerox Corporation , then the world's leading document copier manufacturer , which founded its skunk works Xerox PARC with the investment of $150 million , which generated the mouse and other important personal computing technologies due to its brilliant personnel (Rogers , 2003) .
Although Xerox failed toconventionallyose technologies to the marketplace due to its poor commercial strategies , it is significantly meaningful that in a short time , Xerox PARC attained so many technological breakthroughs that were adopted later .
In a nutshell , on average , skunk works generate technological innovations more effectively and efficiently .
However , it has higher requirements for the personnel and capital , which are difficult for some companies that are organizationsof capital .
Nevertheless , conventional R&D organizations can generate innovations stably and continuously , which is still essential to the development of the company .
The technologieconventionalin both organizations help build a better world .
Prior to the Industrial Revolution in the 19th century , the needs of people were just basic-food , clothing , air and last but not least , shelter .
Now , the needs have just expanded from the basic four needs to other needs such as entertainment , communication , and transportation .
However , the question is which need requires more attention than the others in this modern era ?
The answer would be transportation .
Well , in order to have  better transportation , design processes are needed to fulfill the need .
Transportation which is cheap and safe , environmentally friendly and uses alternative source of energy ,  is most desirable .
One of the eminent challenges faced by  modern transportation is to depend less on fossil fuels .
With the rate of usage of fossil fuels - at three billion barrels per year now - , it will not take long before  fuels get depleted .
According to a presentation made by Osman Chughtai and David Shannon fossil fuels will  run out in 17 years minimum or a maximum of 50 to 70 years .
Nevertheless , other transportation problems like producing too much pollutants such as nitrogen oxides .
Pollutants produced have been proved to have had an enormous effect on the Earth's ozone layer , corroding the ozone layers and exposing humans to  deadly ultraviolet rays .
To add to the problems stated above , the world currently needs  better transportation , in terms of safety and functionalities as well as  cost .
As an example , cars produced must be durable , meaning that the cars must be able to withstand great momentum struck on them .
Besides that , weather must not be an obstacle for good cars .
In addition , cars must be low in cost despite having all the functionalities .
Therefore , in order to counter all the problems , engineers need to go through design processes .
First of all , engineering processes provide the foundation for research to get a new state-of-the-art design .
Engineers have to identify the problems such as producing a transport that does not run on fossil fuel .
Then , they can brainstorm to come up with a new design that meets all the criteria for a better car .
Recently , there was  groundbreaking news stating that engineers found a technology called H2CAR process , a process for producing fuels from plants or what they call the process-biomass .
(Venere  , E . New biofuels process promises to meet all U .S . transportation needs .
Retrieved on 5/09/2009 .http://www .purdue .edu/UNS/x/2007a/070314AgrawalBiomass .html)
Besides research , development processes enable engineers to produce designs that will be tested on real ground .
Effectiveness , durability and functionalities of the designs will be tested .
In this case , transportation like cars must be able to withstand extreme weathers and must be aerodynamically shaped for maneuverability .
Car safety must be included in the blueprint of the car as well .
Previously , engineers managed to come up with a design called catalytic converter with a function to reduce the pollutants released due to combustion .
In a nutshell , design processes are the main essence for a better future transportation , in terms of fuel type , environmentalenvironmental friendliness , functionalities as well as  cost .
This need must be taken seriously in order to secure a brighter future --  a future where people do not need to travel on bicycle or on foot .

Problems significantly hamperhamper innovation in engineering design processes for innovations  .
Along with the rise in living standards , people's demands for goods increase .
At the same time , people pay more attention to the quality of the goods .
In order to meet the demands of modern society , we need higher efficiency and more advanced technology .
Thus , the innovations in engineering processes are more and more important .
But in real life  many problems hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
The two  most significant are the state of information communication which is not smooth and  corruption .
In  practical production , only the workers directly use  production equipment .
The senior management and the boss , who have the right to change and introduce new equipment and technologies , seldom care about the real condition of production .
So the only people who know the problems of production are the workers .
They may meet a lot of problems and may want to change the technologies .
But they do not have the power to do so .
And  the state of information communication is not smooth , workers cannot relay the problems that they found in production to the people who have the power to make decisions .
Maybe sometimes the workers come out with good ideas to solve the problems , but they do not have opportunities to put the ideas into practice .
And of course , the workers would not get rewards .
In this case , after a long time the workers lose enthusiasm to think about how to solve the problems , thus the company loses its opportunities to innovate .
At the same time , it loses the opportunity to save costs and increase production efficiency .
Another very important problem in practical production is corruption .
It often causes more serious problems than other problems .
It is a very serious problem that exists in almost every area .
For  leaders in  companies and factorie , if they are corrupt , they  only care about their own benefits and ignore many others .
There are many cases of corrupt leaders leading their whole companies or factories to go bankrupt .
And there are also some cases which are more scary .
Some  set up a company just  to cheat; all their actions  are about cheating for money from consumers or other companies .
For the staffs , if they are corrupt , they would not focus on their jobs any more .
Furthermore , they would envy others who have a higher position or make more money or make greater contributions .
In such case , they may create a lot of bad things , maybe to frame others , in order to receive more benefits for themselves .
For workers , they would only care about how to please their leaders to get more benefits and not care about  production .
The worse influence is for corrupt people to affect the general mood of a company or a factory .
To conclude , there are many existing problems hampering engineering design processes for innovations .
And the state of information communication and corruption are two most serious ones in my home country .
We should seek ways to solve them .
In this era of globalization , engineering design has been emphasized by  governments  all over the world , such as the UnitedStates , Russia and France .
This is because the development of engineering design could bring many advantages to a country's economy and society .
Currently ,  scientists  perceive a future problem and launch some research to overcome it .
If we observe our surroundings , we can see many inventions with technological creativity such as computer , automobile and other electrical appliances .
Nevertheless , there are some problems which significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations in my home country , Malaysia , and impact  certain stages of  engineering design .
Firstly , financial problem is one of the factors which constrains engineering design processes for innovations .
As we all know , if we want to improve our engineering design  , we need to launch much research .
Therefore , Research and Development (R&D) plays a very important part in engineering design processes for innovations .
Subsequently , a lump sum of money  to be used to launch all such research , but our government is not able to invest  much money on all  .
So ,  financial problem arises and constrain  engineering design processes for innovations .
Malaysia is a country which is still developing and not as wealthy as other western developed countries such as the UnitedStates , France and Germany .
Hence , we lack  money to improve our facilities for research such as well-equipped laboratories and other highly technological instruments .
In fact , this will causes the engineering design processes to be interrupted halfway because of  lack of  highly technological instruments .
For instance , if we want to design a race car , we need some highly technological instruments to do research on  car engines and other parts of a car .
And although we have already found  important information through research , we still cannot continue  analyses of design solutions because of  lack of highly technological instruments to be used for investigation .
Other than financial problem , we are also facing the problem of lack of professionals in certain engineering fields such as mechanical engineering , chemical engineering and electrical engineering .
Much of the research  engineering design  carried out in  modern countries  been done successfully .
This is because there are many professionals in their countries .
In fact , the lack of professionals in engineering fields has resulted in the failure of some research .
For instance , some of the automobile research   due to the lack of  professionals .
The stage of analysis of design solution has been constrained because of  limited knowledge and lack of professionals .
Hence , some forums on engineering design should be held between our country and other modern countries  .
For instance , the forum on how to manufacture an eco-car can be held in order to help us exchange our opinions with the professionals from modern countries .
In a nutshell , financial problem and lack of professionals in my home country should be solved as soon as possible to improve our engineering design processes  .
Hence , the private sector , the government and also citizens should work hand in hand in order to encourage more investment in engineering design research and produce more professionals in the field of engineering design in the future .

According to Khandani's statement "What distinguishes engineers from painters , poets , or sculptors is that engineers apply their creative energies to producing products or systems that meet human needs" , all engineering designs aim to meet human demands  .
Now , when  society develops , people are looking for new designs to satisfy their comfortable lives .
ThThesese new designs may be  demands for entertainment , education or even something beyond our imagination .
However , in my opinion , one of the main concerns in our society is finding a new energy supply to substitute for the old ones which have beendepleted due to  human exploitation .
In order to solve this urgent demand , engineering plays an important role in finding  other alternatives such as nuclear energy , solar energy and geothermal energy .
Evidently , energy has become vital and indispensable in our life , relating to most of everything we deal with .
Because of the influence of energy ,  natural resources have invisibly caused wars and conflicts between many countries over time .
The recent war between the United States and Iraq in 2000 might be considered to be a typical example .
Although the U .S . has been saying that this war is for  anti-terrorism , or more importantly for maintaining peace  the world , it is clear that one of the reasons why American troopers stay in Iraq is the benefits of petroleum .
This is a typical example of  how important energy is since it has a great impact on our daily life .
Due to the non-renewability of  natural "fossil" resources , the more demands  society needs , the more exhausted these resources become .
According to the online newspaper Financial Times (2006) and USA Today news (2004) , the oil reserves in Trinidad and Tobago will run out in the next 20 years and the world oil reserves will become exhausted just in 40 years .
These figures partly show the urgent necessity to find a feasible alternative energy source which will never become exhausted .
The process of finding a new alternative energy source , which is not only renewable but also environmental-friendly , has been undertaken for a long time and regarded as an ultimate goal for engineering .
The most popular energy is nuclear energy .
It is extracted from  usable energy from heavy atomic nuclei (for example Uranium 235) via  of nuclear reactions .
The first nuclear plant was built in Russia in 1984 whose initial electricity production was about 5000KW .
Nowadays , nuclear power is harnessed for many purposes in our daily life .
It may create electricity , equipment or even weapons like the nuclear bomb or nuclear power submarines .
However , the design of nuclear reaction has to meet many rigorous requirements to avoid  nuclear releases as well as to isolate  radiation from  life .
All of these conditions have to be followed strictly ; otherwise it may cause immeasurable consequences .
For instance , one of the most tragic accidents involving radiation release was the Chernobyl disaster which happened in 1986 .
This disastrous accident resulted from  weakness in design  .
Up to now , the neighboring areas still suffer from the radiation .
Another solution is the perpetual resources  known as solar , geothermal energy  , etc .The solar energy is drawn from sunlight's energy by many solar panels which are designed to fit  house roofs .
This energy is converted into electric or thermal energy to serve our life .
Geothermal power takes the thermal calorie in the entrails of the earth and translates into other energies which contribute an important role in operating turbines and machines .
There are three basic types of geothermal energy plants (i .e .
the dry steam plants , flash steam plants and binary power plants) .
Geothermal energy is considered as the most potential alternative for  nonrenewable energy  in the future .
Though the perpetual resources are always there for us , their use may be constrained by the lack of technology for control and delivery , and also by investment and willingness to pay .
Also , these resources may not be applied and used everywhere on earth due to  geographic differences .
In conclusion , I contend that energy problem should be classified as first priority for humans to solve not only because of many huge benefits it provides for people but also because of the critical shortage of energy resources .
In this context , engineering design process meet these urgent needs by finding many feasible solutions such as nuclear energy , solar energy and geothermal energy sources .
Although this process has just had initial achievements , it promises a fully potential energy source in the future which may permanently serve human kind .
Nowadays , the petrol price has fluctuated a lot .
Thus , many countries spend more money and time on developing new resources which can be used as a substitute for petroleum .
Energies such as solar energy have been promoted to fulfill this purpose .
This can be seen through the increase in research and development of  solar cars or other products .
The use of  solar energy-related goods has been highly encouraged by  environmentalists .
So , I would like to discuss  the reasons for innovation in such technology based on economic , governmental and environmental factors .
First of all , as earlier mentioned  ,  petrol price has been fluctuating in recent years .
This makes many factories start to worry about the cost and  profit they can earn .
Most of them feel unsecured because the cost of petrol may lead to low profit or even red deficit .
Thus , they are keen to find out more substitutions .
In the process we can see many firms and companies start to invest in solar energy areas .
As solar power is actually inexhaustible and reproducible , they can use it whenever they want and it is free of charge as well .
However , the start-up cost is pretty high .
It is because of the cost of  batteries .
Presently , there is limitation on the amount of energy the batteries can store as we can only "use solar cells to generate up to 240 watts of electrical power in full sunshine .
As long as we can find a way to increase the amount of  energy the batteries can store , the cost will not be much a problem anymore .
So I think , although they have to spend much more on research now , they can definitely save more in the long run .
Secondly , petrol resources are not evenly distributed around the world .
This means that some countries control more petrol while some may not have it at all .
This results in certain countries feeling unsecured as they are afraid that their potential enemies may use this as a weak point to harm them .
For example , their enemy may cut down the inflow of the petrol  .
Without petrol , the economy in the country will be affected badly .
Lastly , solar energy is free of pollution .
It is commonly known that burning of petroleum will release carbon dioxide , nitrogen and some other gases which will cause air pollution .
This will in turn cause many harmful results including acidic rain or global warming .
On the contrary , solar energy will not lead to such pollution .
And as solar energy comes from the sun , it can be regarded as reproducible and we do not need to worry about if it will be depleted one day .
In conclusion , I think we should decrease the use of petrol-related products and slowly switch towards using the products which need new resources .
Only if we show our interests in and demands for these products ,  researchers can have motivation and more funds to do their projects .
