Besides , establish criteria for success is important as well .
We should consider the preliminary criteria before move into next stage .
For examples , the design must be low cost; the design must be user friendly etc .
Furthermore , funding is required to apply for patents .
pursuing patents is  not easy as they take  a long time period of time to process , requiring large amount of money .
The engineers have to be confident about their innovations and understand the improvements their work will have on society .
(Khandani 22) .
Technology and inventions are not strangers in this fast developing world .
Things that people had never imagined 2 centuries ago have become a normality nowadays .
In 1876 , Alexander Graham Bell invented a telephone .
Today , we cannot live without a hand phone whereas people from 1900s did not have one for their own .
Furthermore , sharing of information has never been easier with the invention of Internet after another century , in 2000s .
All these inventions have been contributed by a lot of people of different expertises .
Most of the time , new technology and innovations are being developed based on existing technology while some individual or group may discover technology serendipitously .
There are certain similarities and differences between those two methods of discovery .
We will discuss computer technology compared to the discovery of penicillin which is a serendipitous discovery .
For every discovery or technology to be accepted by consumers , it has to meet the demands of users .
This is the same for both technology via research or a serendipitous discovery .
An example of this is the discovery of penicillin in 1928 which was one of the earliest antibiotics available in the market .
The use of penicillin extended from killing disease-causing bacteria to saving lives in the battlefield during the World War II .
Therefore , this discovery was a success and used by people all around the world .
This fact illustrates that not only the discovery has to be successful but also it has to be accepted by society .
In conclusion , technology , whether it is discovered accidentally or purposely , is the main ingredient of new innovations and products .
We have to make the technology useful to society because they are the main users of the end-products .
In the end , a serendipitous discovery will be just as good as echnology discovered by research as long as it serves the purpose of contributing to the society and making lives better .
Although some countries are still keeping up with the rapid increasing of energy demands , there is still a need for other alternatives to prepare for the future .
Some possible solutions will be utilizing sun energy , wind , coal , geothermic and bio energy , which in principle are renewable .
However , among all this possible solutions , most of them are not suitable to be implemented due to high cost and the availability in large scale .
For example , coal is cheap but it causes pollution .
Extra work has to be done in order to reduce the amount of pollution produced to the minimum (Khalid Chandio  ,2009) .
Several design considerations have to be well-planned such that low design cost , design safety and preventing harm to the environment .
Analysis is the key to process design .
Among all the suggested solutions , it is crucial to analyse all the solutions before making a decision .
After brainstorming all the possible solutions , solar energy stands out as the best solution .
According to an article by Musse Mohamud Ahmed (2003) , he says that solar energy is world-wide recognised renewable energy sources , cost free and clean energy .
Environment impacts are also negligible .
However , one problem that may hinder this invention is the use of costly equipment and the selection of the wrong peak sunshine data .
Therefore , exact calculations for the solar power production are very important before any actual implementation of solar energy scheme to ensure proper performance and reduce cost .
Cost depends heavily on the size of solar power system .
Weather conditions are important for high performance as solar energy depends largely on the sun .
Cloudy weathers will produce lesser power as compared to sunny weathers .
Engineers need to calculate the required solar panels needed for certain hours use of energy .
Selection of solar energy components is another issue that engineers need to take into consideration when using solar energy .

And that masks even worse conditions in the early grades , where this ratio can be as high as 100 to 1 .
As a result , too few of these new students are mastering the basic skills necessary to begin lifting themselves out of poverty" (Hewlett Foundation) .

However , in my home country- Malaysia , there are some obstacles that hold back engineering design processes for innovation .
The first problem is the current economic model for one off development .
In our country , we are unable to achieve commercially significant levels of reuse beyond platform .
This is because the engineers design and develop most products as individuals in isolation from other products .
Eventually , all the products such as computer software  more or less have the same functions , it is just that return on investment in product development would be far higher if multiple versions or multiple products were taken into account .
Hence , organizations rarely make commercially significant investments in identifying and harvesting the reusable assets , unless it is explicitly planned in advance .
This problem causes us to fail to recognize the opportunity to convert resources optimally so as to meet our objective , which is to meet desired needs of the public .
And of course , this need can sometimes be considered a necessity to some people but a luxury for others .
But the most important reason is , when engineers do not investigate a reusable product , they will eventually create the same structural product without improving its properties .
Thus , these products do not fulfill different needs of the public .
The second matter that significantly hampers engineering design processes for innovations in my home country is the limitation of human resources for designing new products .
Human resources are an important factor for a country to come up with lots of creative innovation .
For instance , the younger generation dares to challenge themselves and think out of the box to generate new ideas .
They have the initiative and determination to turn their dreams and imaginations into reality .
Unfortunately , this expertise tends to work in other countries instead of staying back after graduation .
This is because foreign companies are willing to offer them higher position and satisfying salary compared to local companies .
Consequently , there is no new blood in research and development prospects .
The lack of human resources brings great impact on our country's economic growth .
This is because outdated products will be eliminated from the market and when there is no invention of new products , sooner or later other countries will stop importing products from us and head towards those with higher technologies .
As a result , our country will fall into inflation and recession will occur .
In conclusion , engineering design process for innovations plays a crucial role in our society .
It is very important for a country to sustain its products' marketability by enhancing its design and functions .
Hence , the  economic model for one off development and limitation of human resources should not be obstacles for our country's progress .
Don't multitask , multithink instead .
Think out of the box and be creative so as we can keep on path with the fast paces of life .
Firstly , engineers should design all buildings in accordance with the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) green mark scheme .
The scheme would provide advice on how a green building should be built and what additional features should be included .
All these guidelines will save electricity  and reduce environmental impact as well .
For example , although the air conditioning system in a library cannot be switched off at night due to the moisture content in the atmosphere , they can be set to a higher temperature or part of the units can be switched off automatically at night .
Hence , it will help in decreasing the Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) gases emitted which harms the ozone layer .
In short , engineers should adopt the green mark scheme for all the buildings they design in the future to reduce the environmental impacts that are harmful to the earth .
Secondly , engineers can dedicate more green areas to future plans on redeveloping Singapore .
Some of the emission of negative gases that affect the ozone layer are beyond our control , certain plans to recycle the harmful gases should be considered .
For example , trees and plants can be planted at strategic locations of Singapore as they will reduce pollution by photosynthesising and producing oxygen in return .
This is an ideal method which can be adopted especially in congested cities like Singapore .
Other than dedicating land area for greens , gardens can also be built on the balconies , facades and even the roofs of buildings !
The multi-tier idea will definitely increase the intensity of green areas , thus reducing pollution and help to recycle cleaner air for our atmosphere .
To sum up , there should be gardens in every town and parks in every estate to allow a good ratio of renewing air supply in the atmosphere .

Therefore , if a given idea is not believed to produce substantial earnings , the management of the profit driven companies would tend not to approve it as the funds could be channelled to some other more profitable ideas .
Hence , the development of the idea will be stuck at the research stage as resources such as manpower , raw materials and financial support are not allocated .

Among the latest series of newspaper with many comments about the system of education in Vietnam , including the Chronicle of Higher Education of USA who commented that the slow progress of the system of universities in Viet Nam is no different than the one from 20-30 years ago .
This specialized in education newspaper said: "Economists indicate that Vietnam does not even have one university which is considered having the international quality ."
(MYE forum , 08/06/2006 , para .1) .The quality of infra-structure and education serving tools are that low .
The same goes for the quality of teaching , but the main point here is the ones who have the right to change and improve that entire thing hardly taking a concern .
As a result , the bad effects seems to outweigh all: the source of workers flows to foreign countries where they can find an ideal environment for studies and works , most never come back to mother country; it is too easy to hold 2 or 3 degrees/diplomas/certificates but in fact the holders have no professional knowledge and experiences; not only lack of professional workers but the their quality has also gone down .
That is the reason why the outdated system of education in Viet Nam plays an "essential" role in destroying potential and talented engineers .
If we only change the educational system , it is not sufficient enough to solve the growth retardation in technical design and innovations of Viet Nam .
Indeed , the slow development in engineering design process of Viet Nam is also seriously affected by the weak management of government .
Although Viet Nam is rich in natural resources but its government does not have suitable methods to impulse the development of business and economy .
For instance , the strategy of Viet Nam to attract the investment from foreign and local companies is not really effective .
According to a statistics of World Bank (WB) organization on "Doing business in 2010" , Viet Nam has dropped down two levels due to the complicated procedure of export and import duties , in which it costs too much time to complete the whole formalities (Tri Duong , GeographyIQ , cited in PHP news in Viet Nam 2009 , para .9) .
Besides , the statistics show no reduction in the number of times a company in Viet Nam has to pay taxes , which can reach up to 32 times per year (Tri Duong , GeographyIQ , cited in PHP news in Viet Nam 2009 , para .10) .
The complication in the official procedure causes the hesitance of investors , and it subsequently affects the development of design process and innovations of engineers , who need investment to execute their projects .
In addition , the weakness in governmental management is also reflected in the brain-drain problem of Viet Nam .
This problem has happened for a long time due to the lack of investment of Government in young-manpower .
From a website discussion on the quality of education in Singapore , Vietnamese students studying in NUS insisted "Innovation and creativity of young human resources has made Singapore become a very strong country in both commerce and technology; Singapore always consider attracting the talent manpower as top priority , while government of Viet Nam does not focus on encouraging creativity and intelligence to speed up the development of whole country" (Doan Xuan Loc , BBC Viet Nam , 2009 , part 3) .
Therefore , developing innovation and creativity in young manpower is also the main factor which affects the design process of engineering .
From all the analyses above , we can see through the direct causes which influence the engineering design processes and innovations are the weakness in the administration of education system and governmental structure .
As a Vietnamese student who is studying abroad and receiving the advanced education of Singapore , I myself realize that for Viet Nam to be able to catch up the World's developing pace , we must find a wise way to reform and improve considerately also uniformly in every domain .
The privileged goal is to renovate the system of education and government; because these are the essential elements which can help Viet Nam achieving certain breakthroughs in science-technology , from that found a powerful and prosperous country .
There is a common catch phrase in the Singapore educational system - think out of the box .
Essentially the concept of 'thinking out of the box' revolves around the idea of innovativeness .
Some people find it difficult to do so and interestingly enough , they even take courses to learn to be creative .
Little do these people know that they are already embedded with this ability ever since they were born .
Indeed , we unknowingly use our innovativeness to fill ourselves with excuses for doing or not doing something .
In engineering context , engineers use their creativity to create new products and according to Khandani (2005) , "What distinguishes engineers from painters , poets , or sculptors is that engineers apply their creative energies to producing products or systems that meet human needs .
This creative act is called design ."
Nevertheless it is often easier said than done , as there are always factors hampering creativity .
Once such obstacles are overcome , it becomes easier for one to innovate .
The first problem that a prospective innovator will face is actually his ability to accept failure positively .
This is because the process of creating a new product often requires the innovator to continuously modifying it .
It also implies that an engineering design often requires many failed attempts before a breakthrough is obtained .
In the process of doing so , the innovator may at times , needs to challenge the conventional way of doing things in order to obtain a new approach in solving a problem .
As such , some risks need to be taken .
Unfortunately in Singapore , many of us do not have this mindset in the first place .
Probably due to the fact that we are overly result orientated that we do not like the idea of risk taking .
Risk taking is often seen as undesirable as it does not guarantee a result that we expect it to be .
A successful inventor will at some point of time , take some calculated risk to make their idea a reality and if every risk is minimized , it may not be possible to do so .
For instance , the Wright Brothers risk their reputation to fly the world's first aircraft .
If they were to think like a Singaporean , it would be unlikely that we have the airbus flying in our skies .
The result of being so negative about risk taking is that many plausible ideas may not have taken flight .
As such , the chances of getting another Singaporean innovator like Sim Wong Hoo , is low .
This does not borne well especially when our economy is heading towards being knowledge based .
Hence if we were to change our attitude towards innovation and risk taking , perhaps , we might see a new technology conglomerate originating from Singapore someday .
Undoubtedly , China has emerged as the world's technological and industrial giant in the last two decades .
Engineering professionals and scientists have definitely contributed significantly to the country's advancement .
Even though the country recognises the importance of such progress , there are still some problems that significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
Firstly , the rigid education system in China is one of the main obstacles which hinder engineering innovations .
Education is one of the crucial factors which determine a country's might .
The education system in every country plays a key role in moulding the future of the country .
The rigid education system in most parts of China , however , places more emphasis on books and academic results , rather than promoting creativity in the classrooms .
There are millions of students in the country and it is therefore very competitive to stand out among all .
Perhaps , the only best way to distinguish one is through a series of examinations .
Due to such reason , there is simply no room for creativity and innovation in the class .
Students or rather the young generations grow up with the mindset that achieving excellent results is much more important than being innovative .
As a result , without promoting and inculcating the significance of being creative , engineering design processes will be  hampered from the beginning  .
In addition , raising enough funds for engineering design purposes has always been a problem .
Even if  passionate engineers get together and plan to launch a project , it is very difficult to get sponsorship .
Most of the time , the designing processes may require sophisticated equipments and materials which may not be easily available within the country .
Sometimes , the engineers have to import the necessary resources overseas .
If the project would be carried out over a few years , the funds would be running low very fast .
Therefore , the engineering design processes may most likely end half way due to the lack of funding .
Moreover , there is  lack of role models for young engineers in China .
The country has just started her technological and industrial progress in the recent decades .
Unlike the US and the European countries , China does not have a long historical record of her own engineering precedence .
For example , China has become the one of the largest semiconductor industry in the world .
However , those semiconductors are still not as good as those in Silicon Valley .
A group of computer engineers created the powerful search engine Baidu which is another modification of Google .
Thus , there is a lack of the originality of the idea during the designing processes .
The first problem , is , would be our lack of experience and development in engineering and innovation .
Although Singapore is a developed nation with a developed education system and economy , our development is very recent in comparison to Europe and the United States .
Thirty years ago , our industry was still predominantly based on manufacturing .
The engineering sector only took off in the 1990s , along with the initial conceptualization for the KBE .
Therefore , although our students in colleges , polytechnics and universities are equipped with critical thinking skills for design invention and innovation , we do not have any experience and still remain as 'Engineers on paper' .
True knowledge is epistemic and empirical in nature; and according to Khandani , expertise in the Engineering Design Process requires an iterative critical inquiry on practical problems and solutions (paraphrased from Khandani 2005) .
Indeed , Singapore recognizes this problem , and is currently focusing on further development in the Research and Development sector .
Also , our leaders encourage creativity and entrepreneurship in our people .
Yet , this ideal will not be realized for the time being .
And in the meantime , our lack of experience and development in engineering and innovation continues to pose a problem for aspiring engineers , as well as design processes for innovations .
Why is the ideal for practical development not going to be realized in the near future ?
A very plausible reason would be due to the Social mindset of Singaporeans , and it is also this very factor that hampers the Engineering Design Process for Innovations .
As Singapore is an Asian country , many Singaporeans tend to adopt Asian values and mindsets- which advocate adhering to social norms and not go against convention or 'the textbook' .
Also , the value of family before self results in many Singaporeans not wanting to risk themselves for a breakthrough in personal achievement .
Fuelled by the recent economic crises , many Singaporeans prefer to 'play it safe'- to stick to stable , routine and high paying jobs; than to get creative , take risks and be curious of the unknown .
It is from this reason we have the aphorism: 'stick to the iron-rice-bowl' .
While such mindsets ensure a relatively stable life for us and our families , they promote contentment and impede self-improvement .
We know that the Engineering Design Process requires the continuous process of construction and tearing down of existing schemas .
To do so requires great flexibility of mind , as well as a certain zest for personal breakthrough and risk taking .
It is in this respect our mindsets greatly impede on the philosophy of Engineering , and hence pose a problem on the designing process for innovations .
In Singapore , there are various problems that may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
These problems comprise  , insufficient funds , insufficient resources , design may not be aesthetically pleasing to be selected and copyright infringement .
Of these four identified problems , I will highlight two of them and the effects that they had on certain stages of the process .
The lackof funds can lead to the disruption of the progress of an engineering design process .
The engineering design process will be disturbed when there is not enough money to buy relevant resources required .
Insufficient funds may not allow the engineering design process to proceed .
For example , the innovation design of the race car from National University of Singapore may not have been so successful without sufficient financial support from the school .
Therefore , shortage of funds and financial help may hinder to the progress of the engineering process , as in the case of , the Marina Sands Integrated Resort and also prevent an engineering process to begin , as in the race car example .
Another problem that might hamper engineering design processes for innovations would be insufficient resources .
Insufficient resources would mean , not having enough raw materials or materials needed for the engineering innovation design process .
Resources need not be mainly on materials , but also manpower or labour .
For example , in the case of the Marina Bay Sands Integrated Resort , there was a shortage of materials such as sand and steel .
There was sand ban on sand exports and contractors could not get sand that was needed from the fabrication of concrete .
Secondly , there was a lack of manpower and the construction process was slowed down as a result .
These two main factors , lacking in manpower and materials had hindered to the progress of the engineering design process .
In conclusion , as illustrated in the case of the marina sands integrated resort and the engineering innovation design of the race car , we can see that lacking in funds and resources are two obstacles that engineers had to consider .
The impact that each problems had , can affect gravely on the progress of the engineering innovative design and they should be well- planned .
During innovation development process , there are two groups of people; they are technologicallydeterministic and socially deterministic .
Which one should we accept ?
The development of telephone tells us that it was socially was determined rather than society being technologically determined .
Engineering design process may be defined as the process where engineers apply their creative thinking to produce products or systems that meet human needs .
In the process of engineering design for innovation , there is no doubt that a lot of problems and difficulties will be faced .
Although there are problems and obstacles , the development in engineering design for innovations is crucial and essential .
My home country , Malaysia , also try to develop it but several problems are met .
Among these problems , the two major problems are financial problems and technical problems .
Without adequate amount of capital , development of engineering design becomes very difficult and inefficient .
Advanced technologies used in foreign country cannot be introduced into Malaysia because of insufficient capital .
Maintaining and repairing the high-technology machines and devices require high costs , too .
Furthermore , talented people are hard to be attracted as there is no good working environment and no sufficient capital for those skilled people to carry out their researches .
Moreover , it costs a lot to build a modern working environment and high-tech facilities .
The next problem is technical problem .
Malaysia has not reached the high-technology level to design an engineering product and there is no working environment culture for engineering design .
There are too few technicians or people who are specialized in engineering design .
The education  system in Malaysia shows too little concern for the engineering design academia .
People lack  knowledge and information in engineering design , thus they are not able to deal with current and future practical problems .
Also , technologies in Malaysia still need improvement , as most of the technologies are introduced from foreign countries .
The facilities for experiment and researches have not met the basic level of performing .
The lack of technical skills has brought much effect on the development of engineering design in Malaysia .
On one hand , the facilities and devices used are not excellent enough to perform good experiments , resulting in inaccurate results with more errors .
On the other hand , Malaysia lacks  skillful labor and this has resulted in an inefficient production of creative innovations .
Both low accuracy experiment results and inefficient production cannot be solved easily .
These technical problems have caused slow progression of development of engineering design .
The next  step of defining the problem involves developing a problem statement which allows us to specifically address and successfully meet the need to have sufficient food .
In this case , it would be to increase food production by designing a crop that is able to withstand adverse environmental conditions so that more land can be used to grow crops and a crop that can be harvested all year round so that the amount of food produced is not limited by seasons .
The crop designed must be low cost so that even farmers living in poverty can also afford to buy the seeds of the crop .
Moreover , the crop should not rely heavily on the application of chemical fertilizers and pesticides in order to grow well as this will have detrimental effects on the environment .
What determines a technology to be good or bad ?
Well , technologies are there to supposedly to improve our way of life .
We assume technologies are constantly changing for the better .
However , this may not always be true .
A technology that looks seemingly practical and useful to our everyday lives may not function well in the society .
In other words , technology is a product of the society .
It may be technically sound but may not be well received by the end users .
We have to understand that technologies not only have to be shaped around technical factors but also around social and economical ones .
One important technology that was shaped as such was the electric refrigerator .
Firstly , the constant adoption of electric refrigerators was greatly influenced by economic factors .
According to an article on diffusion of innovations by Rogers E .M . , large companies like General Electric and General Motors had an economic advantage over smaller companies that produce gas refrigerators .
For example , Kelvinator , a large electric refrigerator production company had a budget that was 33 times more than the Common Sense Company , which was a smaller gas refrigerator production company .
As a result , these larger companies can afford to pour huge amounts of funding into electric refrigerators as they had earlier decided that larger profits could be made from them .
Moreover , with economic advantage , these larger companies can afford to spend a huge sum of money to intensively promote their electric refrigerators to gain better advertising .
Smaller companies were unable to match these giants and thus remained stagnant .
With the lack of advertising , their products were poorly accepted in the market .
Besides companies are  influenced by potential profitability and having gained access to better funding , social factors also play a part .
Better advertising by larger companies has led consumers to believe that electric refrigerators are still the product of choice .
This is an example of how larger companies socially shaped the product .
In addition , consumers also have an issue with gas refrigerators .
Most gas refrigerators use ammonia as coolants .
These coolants are not used by electric refrigerators .
Consumers did not like the idea of storing their food products in gas refrigerators as they thought the harmful coolant might contaminate their food .
As a result , gas refrigerators were not favourable among consumers and that led to an increase in sales of electric refrigerators instead .
In this new era of globalization , we must not deny the importance of implementation of design in the engineering problem solving processes .
These two are strongly related and without a designing mind , engineers definitely can not solve a problem based on engineering knowledge .
In fact , engineers are taught to consider engineering design during their tertiary education .
Nowadays , people have a misconception that design is just simply the planning that lays the physical shape and pattern of every object or system .
But the truth is that engineering design is the decision-making process , in which the basic sciences , mathematics , and engineering sciences are applied to converge resources optimally to meet a stated objective .
For instance , in designing a car , internal combustion engines are specifically configured to work optimally and therefore the design of components such as cooling system and piston engine valves should be taken into consideration .
However , in our very own country , Malaysia , some problems have arisen  which significantly hamper the engineering design processes for innovation and these have resulted in severe impact on certain stages of the process .
The most common factor which contributes to the failing of the process is the insufficient fund provided to complete the whole process  the process includes the definition of problems , narrowing of research , finding of several alternative solutions , determination of the most possible solution and lastly the making of the decision .
If no fund is provided , such a process  can not be completed .
This can be explained because in order to determine the most possible solution in engineering design process , we have to conduct many experiments and these experiments require materials for which money must be injected into the project .
For example , over in Malaysia , we have our own national car corporation , which is known as Proton .
However the selling of their cars simply could not overtake the sales of other imported cars such as Honda and Mitshibitsu .
This is simply due to the fact that it is not efficient and well designed enough to compete among all cars , which is the cruel truth that is recognised by every Malaysian .
This is based on  the fact it reflects the insufficient investment by Proton's shareholder in Malaysia compared to total equity owned by big corporation .
With the money big corporations possess , they are able to conduct Research and Development of their own product and at last launch  the product which is efficient and generates greater revenue compared to other smaller competitors .
Another root problem that hampers engineering design process is the lack of education for engineers about engineering design knowledge during their tertiary education .
Universities play an undoubtedly significant role to educate future engineers to execute engineering design process in future while at work .
Unfortunately in Malaysia , design-centric knowledge is not given much emphasis .
Knowledge taught during lecture is not enough to develop students to think creatively and determine alternative solutions from problems that  arise .
Furthermore there is none or simply only a few research laboratories that are set up on campus to encourage undergraduates to determine  during experiment .
Therefore exposure to definition of problems is not extensive enough to allow students to find other possible problems by themselves .
In conclusion , the engineering design process  is important to meet complex challenges in the world such as global warming and all types of pollution .
Fund must be injected into projects in order to execute the process .
Lastly , the education system  must be reviewed in order to solve such challenges and bring us a new generation of engineers who are able to devise innovations guided by the perspectives of a true designer .
However , there are still numerous factors years , along the innovation of engineering design in my country .
For example , the lack of fund and talents .
But , I would like to unveil two essential factors , which are the Instead , of sthave switchedn entrepreneurs and the lack of intellectual property protection .
Regarding to the first problem , it is of high importance that we investigate the background of leaders in state-run entrepreneurs .
The leaders are directly appointed by central government .
Interestingly , the criteria is not about how well marketing experience or managerial ability the person has .
It is about whether the person is loyal to the government .
Thus , many importance positions in an entrepreneur belong to government officers , which as a result , makes the entrepreneur like government .
The bureaucratic style in a company will create rigidity during the process of management and production .
In this way , innovation of engineering design will be affected .
In addition to the problem of leadership in state-run entrepreneurs , the problem created by the monopolistic status of state-run entrepreneurs also can not be neglected .
As far as I am concerned , monopolism is prevailed among state-run companies .
Many of them fully control a certain type of resource .
In this way , they are not subject to fierce competition in a markect .
As a result , many state-run companies do not have incentive mechanism or the mechanism of selection through competition .
The consequence is that a large number of the employees treats theirs jobs as "iron rice bowl" , which means a job is secure .
There is no worry for being kicked out due to laziness .
In this way , the whole company corrupts and becomes obsolete .
hard workregisteredofIn conclusion , the factors that hamper the innovation of eneraising design come from both inside and ouside of the entrepreneurs in China .
From the inside , we need to change the criteria of leadership appointment and raise the awareness of protecting intellectual properties .
Similarly , from the outside , China has to create a competie environment and a legal system which helps innovation of engineering design prosper .
The development of technologies may be viewed differently .
Traditional analysis of technology has been looking at the past to analyze the present .
The social science system approach challenges the way we look at technology .
It suggests that acceptance of a new technology depends not only on the technical factors but also on the economic , political and social ones .
We have to understand the system as a whole and not look only at one aspect of the system to try to understand it .
In the past ,  solar energy was not readily accepted because of its technical challenges such as , weight of the integrated chip , expensive research , lack of technology know how , shortage of device as some devices had to be imported .
However , it is safer , cleaner and considered more environment friendly .
With the increase of oil prices , there are many technologies that have been created  to solve the climbing of black gold .
There is a need to look for alternative resources .
The discovery and the development of solar technology have become an agenda in most countries .
Governments have been encouraging and giving away incentives to companies to develop the alternative energy efficient products like solar technology .
However , when the oil prices drop , governments and companies slowly stop to pursue the alternative as they can continue their business with cheaper oil .
With cheaper oil , companies reduce research funding for innovation and development .
Economic challenges have moved the shift from solar technology to the cost of building it .
Companies have  been trying to get the market share by pricing their solar cell at an extremely low price .
In order to survive , another company cuts their price for the same technology product .
In the cut throat competition , less revenue is generated and less funding is chanelled to  research .
This will slow the development of solar technology and the innovation of it .
In contrast , if there is no competition within each other , large companies will monopolize the market .
They will suppress new technologies and only start  research and development on alternatives under government pressure .
In addition , some companies have created solar technology advancement on military weapons and are working greatly with the governments .
This technology are for military demand and do not bring any improvement to life .
Instead , it is used to destroy human and bring misery to certain people .
Socially , we have been conditioned to believe that the innovation is the inevitable product of market competition and engineering advancement , not a product of compromise and negotiation . 
Intertwined with the social issue of AIDS , the economical situation also hurdled the idea of using broadcast to educate people .
Different from other continents in the world , many people in Africa are still struggling for food , having no access whomelectricity .
In this case , engineers were challenged to design a special kind of radio that would not need to plug in sockets or batteries for electricity .
These special needs finally led to the innovative combination of a small transistor radio , an electric motor from a toy car and the clockwork mechanism from a music box to form the original prototype of the wind-up radio .
Because of the low cost , it was possible to collect enough funding for mass production which finally gave the African people free access a wind-up radioabout AIDthe ideahe cost controlling process of producing the wind-up radio was a great success .
Putting aside the original social objective andeconomicl constraints , designing the wind-up radiobroadcastinguired to solve severUnlikeethe situation in other continents  .
First , the charging up process should be stable enough to avoid damage to the components of the radio .
Second , the output current must be very stable and enduring for avoiding distortion of theto be pluggeds .
Last but not least , the charging-up process should be efficient .
Unless the charging-up process can be done within seconds , the annoying process of charging up would finally hinder users from frequent use .
preventingThrough the invention of wind-up radio , it is cleconomicn that engineering is not all about solving technical prthe solution ofDuring the process of conceiving and designing a new engineering product , it is very like that mapreventcial and economical factors would eventually become the shaping or determining force .
In Singapore , there are actually many issues to consider for an engineer in the engineering design processes for innovations .
The two issues I feel are the most important are  economic and technical challenges .
Economic challenges will affect the process of engineering design because we need to consider the financial status for the majority of the people .
The products being made must not be too expensive .
Otherwise , people will tend to think twice before they decide to purchase the products .
The economic downturn also prevents consumers from buying things that they think are not essential .
The manufacturing industry suffers the most from this recession .
Due to the financial constraint , consumers will go towards buying pirated products instead of purchasing the original .
This causes a decrease in demand for it .
They do not mind the products  not being able to perform as well as the original .
To them , it is worth it since it is cheaper .
Even if consumers do not go for pirated products , they will still go for second hand products .
This is because the products are still usable despite some minor wear and tear .
The budget given by the company may cause engineers to think of ways to cut down costs in the production so as to gain extra profits for the company .
As a result , the products may not last long enough and they have to be changed  quite regularly .
It must be useful to the majority of the consumers .
We must also cater to the needs of the different age groups .
It must also provide comfort and convenience to the people .
For example , hand phones , computers , mp3 and cameras have made communication between people in a distance easier simply just by a click or a press of the button .
Information and data can be transmitted easily by the use of the Internet .
This was definitely not possible in the past .
Engineers also need to consider whether the consumers will be able to accept the products being designed .
They also need to consider the commercialization of the products .
This is because the way of commercializing will affect the sales of it .
As a result , engineers will be forced to come up with the modification of the products in a short period of time .
This will cause the products to be less effective because there is a lack of testing .
Although the gadgets have included more functions , it is less durable .
For example , hand phones nowadays are prone to damage when it is accidentally dropped on the floor .
Firstly , in China , the designing and innovating processes are always hampered by some political factors .
And these factors always result in some management problems .
In China , nearly all the research institutes and universities are state-owned and controlled by the ruling communist party .
Therefore , it is difficult for academic institutes to escape from acting like a government department .
For instance , the head of research groups and the presidents of universities are all assigned by their superiors in the party .
So in the selectionprocess , the academic achievement of candidate is not the priority to be considered but their loyalty to the party .
Therefore , in some institutes , the head tends to know nothing or have little knowledge of the field which he is in charge of , which will certainly misguide the research directions and disturb the atmosphere of researching and studying .
Further , the rules of regulating institutes are mandated in a dogmatic and  way .
All the boffins are required to attain some academic targets per year .
For example , they need to apply and get a project of a certain amount of money per year , or a certain number of  essays they should publish in public scientific journals , and so on .
If they cannot meet the requirements , they will not get promoted or get enough salary they are supposed to get .
However , in such a short term , it seems  impossible to discover significant results .
Hence , many researchers have to 'make up' essays on their own  , or simply plagiarize other's works .
In addition , in most  institutes , the funds of science are given by seniority .
As for some young but creative engineers or scientists , it may be very hard for them to get financial support to carry on their own research , which will stifle their creativity and give them no place to fulfill their potentials .
Secondly , some social reasons also exert detrimental influence upon the designing and innovating process in China .
To start with , it seems to have become a consensus that China does little on the protection of intellectual properties and patents .
What is worse , in China , nearly all the people have formed a habit of buying pirated discs and illegally downloading from the Internet .
From a research by BSA , about 93% software used in china are pirated , which costs 3 .6billion dollars loss every year .
And according to Microsoft , about 29% of computers in China are illegally installed with windows system in 2008; especially 5% are computers for government use .
Moreover , the protection is also inadequate in terms of patents .
According to the statistical figures , about 30 percent of patents are illegally used without authorization .
But it is very hard for the victim to prosecute the infringers .
According to China's law , it will take about 3 years to finish the lawsuit; and it will consume more time and money to execute the verdict after they win the case , especially because most of trespassers , who are usually in small business or manufacturing their illegal products in a family workshop , it is even harder to trace and penalize them .
Lastly , the designing and the process of innovation are sometimes detrimentally affected by economic mode in China .
the High GDP index , the government sometimes only cares about how many investments they can attract from overseas and other places; And Most of the enterprises in China only focus on manufacturing , processing , and exporting goods .
What they need to do is just transferring the raw materials to finished goods .
So there is no need for them to invest a multitude of money to establish research and development groups to design or invent new technologies and sciences .
At the same time , they also assert that designs and innovations are not their business but  or other countries instead of China whose enterprises not only lack  funds but also core technology .
And now most of the enterprises are quite satisfied with this economic growth mode and think that it is not necessary to change the industrial structures .
So when some original designs and innovations come out in China , it is more likely for them to be ignored and discarded .
So in this way , the impetus for designing and processing innovations has been greatly encumbered .
The environment for research is bad in China is because at first , there is not enough capital given to do researches .
According to China Research Environment Report , Science Observation (2006 .
2) , the average funds for national researchers are less than 100 ,000 RMB (near 20 ,000 SGD) a year , to say nothing of other researchers .
Without enough capital , how can researchers buy the necessary equipments and do the necessary experiments to make science and engineering progresses !
Another fact is that the talent in China waste a lot of time doing things that irrelevant to research .
One significant phenomenon is that and graduate students in university call their tutors 'boss' , which is because instead of teaching them new knowledge or doing researches , tutors often ask students do tasks from companies to make money .
Furthermore , many administration jobs in universities and science institutes are done by scientists and engineers who are not good in administration in deed .
Because of the good treatment of administration jobs , a lot of talented scientists and engineers waste time competing to get them , leaving the research jobs behind .
To move the distractions , it needs to apply certain regulars to retain the talent in their positions and also , improve the treatment of research jobs .

I believe the current human need that should be given priority is the need to reduce traffic congestion as it has always been a problem left unresolved for many decades .
With the help of engineering design process , many of such problems that we face in this present world can be minimized and resolved .
Engineering design process flows through these stages of defining the problem , gathering information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting a solution and finally testing and implementing of the solution .
Firstly , on defining the problem of traffic congestion and also gathering vital information on this human need .
The problem of traffic congestion is constantly happening throughout the world everyday and it is affecting the way we carry out our daily routines .
This problem leads to the loss of precious time that could be put to good use and it also affects the progression of work and major projects .
With this loss of precious time , we often have to make use of extra time to make up for the time lost in traffic congestion .
Thus it will also create an impact in the financial losses and holding back economic growth throughout the world .
Secondly is the generating of multiple related solutions , analyzing and selecting of a suitable solution .
One of the solutions that I came up with is to have a signboard attached to all traffic lights; this will indicate to all the drivers whether they should avoid travelling on certain roads that may have traffic congestion .
Although there are radio stations to report on traffic congestion ,  some drivers may not tune in to radio stations or may not know of other alternative ways to redirect their paths .
This results in accumulating the length of traffic congestions as the number of cars keeps piling up after it occurs .
This solution of indication can prove to be very useful , when an accident or traffic congestion occurs .
The sign board will have the three arrows mainly representing , left , straight and right directions .
For example in an event of traffic congestion , the central transport system will be notified in the shortest possible time .
Signboards that are in the area of traffic congestion and other possible affected areas would be updated and give suggestions to the drivers to redirect them away from the traffic congestion .
This central transport system would also provide an update for the traffic police; so that they may go down to rectify the situation .
Lastly is the testing and implementing of the solution .
With this idea of the solution , I would build a 3D replica of this system to test on the effectiveness in reducing traffic congestion .
I would continue to improve on the design with more stringent tests and experiments which will give me the most suitable configuration for a specific area on the island .
As we advanced into dramatic change of technology , the world has made a breakthrough in science and achieved a milestone of success .
It is  that engineers are those who are playing a crucial role in the society while the world is expanding unremittingly .
This is because engineers are quintessential in designing products that meet human needs .
They utilize their knowledge to come up with new innovations which will give a fresh impetus to enhance the development .
In my opinion , current human need that should be given priority is having electric vehicles that operate entirely on battery power .
As we all know , petrol is a non renewable natural resource and hence changes of its price have a big influence on the world economy as all main transportations are using it as fuel .
Therefore , it is necessary to design vehicles that move by low cost electricity .
Electric vehicles can receive their power from a number of renewable sources that is transmitted into the vehicle through the use of electrical cable and stored in battery .
Through this , the dependence on  crude oil can be minimized gradually .
In addition , air pollution is worsening nowadays .
By using environment friendly electric vehicles , the pollution problem can be alleviated by decreasing the smog level .
Furthermore , electric vehicles typically have less{noise pollution}[HYPERLINK: http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Noise_pollution] .
According to Seyyed Khandani , Ph .D . , there are 5 steps for solving design problems so that the process meets the need .
Firstly , engineers must recognize the need and define the designing problems such as how far the driving range of a fully charged electric vehicle is and etcetera by gathering enough information , running experiments and performing computation .
After that , engineers should start gathering pertinent information to reveal  facts about the problem .
This step is quintessential as it makes sure that their efforts and time  are not wasted at the wrong place .
Then , engineers will use creativity to generate ideas that solve the problem by starting with existing solutions then trying to figure out and improve the weakness in those solutions .
Later on , engineers will combine their new ideas and tools into the existing solutions and finally unique solutions will be formed .
At this stage , engineers might have multiple solutions .
Hence , they have to analyzing their solutions and select the solution which is best suited for implementation .
The last step is to test and implement the solution that involves testing , construction and manufacturing of the solution to the design problem .
If the car passes all the tests , a new electric car is finally formed and will definitely meet the need .
Besides , engineers need to consider  the electric car's safety , cost and effects on the environment so that this engineering design meets the need .
For instance , ifthe electric car  design's cost is over budget , engineers might rather design combination electric-gasoline vehicles to cut down the cost .
In addition , safety of the car should be given priority in order for the design process to meet that need .
Thus , engineers have to confirm that the car is safe to be driven by running a few tests before the cars are supplied in the market place .
Engineers also have to run experiments on the emission from the electric carso as to make sure the car is  environment friendly .
To drive home the point , the engineering design processes will definitely meet that need if engineers persevere stoically whenever they meet failures during the process .
Engineers have a constant need to upgrade current technologies to keep up with the ever-evolving world .
Being a problem solver only means that they will constantly face a slew of problems that abound in the world .
Changes in the climate in recent times show that the Earth is embroiled in what is called global warming .
The need for more sophisticated technologies to reverse this damage caused to our environment has set engineers racing against the clock .
The war on terror never ceases as well .
The need for state-of-the-art weaponry and stealth vehicles has posed a tough problem to engineers as well .
However one human need that is most prevalent and disconcerting is widespread hunger .
The need for engineers to come up with food technologies that may fill the stomachs of hungry children is overwhelming .
Indeed , we have to solve this pressing problem before it becomes too late .
Starvation is a big issue around the world .
From Asia to Africa , Europe to America , it is ever present , though varying in severity .
Since this problem is so widespread , it is essential it be given priority over  others , the delay of which could lead to more human fatalities .
In Africa especially , where there is a higher percentage of the population that are malnourished , an engineering solution is needed .
In fact , this presents the world's inefficient use of resources .
Here , people in developed countries are gorging down heaps of food and getting obese while some in Africa are starving to death .
If we were able to close the food gap between them , maybe the problem could be improved .
One way in which engineering design processes can help alleviate hunger around the world is to increase food production .
Though the developed world has too much of it to the point of wastage , it is impossible to "transfer the leftovers" to the developing nations and it is ethically wrong to do so .
Thus , equipping the world with an abundance of food can help solve this issue .
Increasing food output starts at the plantations and fields .
Droughts due to erratic weather can cause disruptions in the food supply .
Therefore , maintaining good irrigation can ensure food supply remains consistent .
Dams are built to control the flow of river water .
This is one engineering marvel that prevents floods and helps generate energy in the process .
Complex irrigation networks are built so the crops are watered sufficiently .
Another way to increase food production is to engineer grains and seeds so they produce more within a shorter timeframe .
They are genetically modified with desirable qualities to meet the needs and conditions of the place they are grown .
Crops are more robust and can withstand harsher conditions like strong winds , while carrying more grains atop their stem .
By genetically engineering many of our foods , we can actually increase food yield from the same plot of land in a shorter amount of time .
However , Khandani mentions that the solution is not perfect and we should keep revising and "going back to the drawing board" .
Our solutions are not one off .
We need to constantly modify them even as they bring about more problems .
Global warming is an exceptionally severe problem facing the world today .
It is a process whereby the Earth's temperature increases , which is attributable to the use of fossil fuels , and industrial or agricultural processes .
Man-made emissions release a great amount  of carbon dioxide which causes a large buildup of "greenhouse gases" .
One factor which contributes to the buildup is from power plants or factories .
Another major factor will be the carbon dioxide emitted from cars .
Though it may only contribute a small percentage to the buildup in the gases ,  as time goes by , the increase in the utility of cars will become a big contributor to global warming .
Thus a group of students from NUS came up with an idea of creating an eco-friendly urban concept car with zero carbon emission .
This group consists of students from the School of Design and Environment and also the school of Engineering .
This car was built from scratch with its body designed and manufactured by the students themselves .
It runs on a hydrogen fuel cell that drives the electric wheel hub motor .
In this way , it will achieve twice the energy efficiency compared to the burning of gasoline in the internal-combustion engines .
In addition , with the design of the eco-car , mechanics will have easier access to the components for trouble-shooting .
With such attractive advantages installed in the eco-car , it might slowly be introduced to the society as a form of transport so as to solve the problem of global warming .
Because the eco-car runs on hydrogen gas , this will lead to the reduction in the usage of petroleum and thus save the natural resources for better usage .
However , there will also be disadvantages with regards to the creation of the eco-car .
Though the eco-car may seem to be the perfect solution to solve the problem of gasoline combustion cars , it will cause conflicts with many car manufacturers such as Toyota or Nissan .
With this invention , the governments will strongly recommend civilians to replace their current vehicle with the eco-car .
As a result , there will be a negative impact on the sales for the current car manufacturers .
When all of these happen , it will also affect the economy and also the jobs of the sales personnel .
Another disadvantage of the eco-car will be the resources that it uses .
Take gasoline combustion cars as an example; when it is running low of fuels , the driver can easily top up his vehicle at any petrol station nearby .
But as for the eco-car , the resources it uses may not be readily available , so it will not be very convenient .
Most of the products today are created using a conventionally generated technology but there are a few products which were invented in a skunkworks environment .
For example , the first laptop computer was produced in a skunkworks environment because Toshiba , a Japanese electronics company , had suffered huge losses with its failure in the desktop computers' market in the 1980s .
So , the company refused to invest in the research and development of the laptop computer (Rogers) .
Even though conventionally generated technology is more popular nowadays , both ways of production have their own advantages and disadvantages .
Both ways of production are similar in their motive .
The intention of the teams is to research and develop their product hoping to come up with a new invention  or make the existing products better .
For example , a research and development team with financial support from the company research on the company's product and try to improve the existing products and create new products for the company .
It is almost the same for the team working in skunkworks environment .
They believe that the products they are working on will be a success even though they are not supported by company .
However , there are differences between the two of them .
Firstly , they differ in financial aspect which is the main aspect .
Productions using conventionally generated technology have full financial support from the company .
With the financial support from the company , the research and development team can have a comfortable and productive workspace .
On the other hand , there are no or very little financial support for the team working in skunkworks environment .
Therefore , skunkworks environment usually is not comfortable to work in .
Besides what is mentioned  above , the team using conventionally generated technology can afford state of the art devices which will increase the efficiency of research .
In contrast , the team working in skunkworks environment not only do not have those devices , but they have to bring their own equipment to work .
The second difference between productions using a conventionally generated technology with those from skunkworks environment is the creativity of the team members .
The main problem of the team in skunkworks environment is the financial problem as mentioned earlier .
The lack of money causes them to consider other options when inventing a product .
For example , they might look for used items to be use as inputs for their production .
In contrast , the team with full financial support do not really need to consider the cost of research; therefore they most probably could not come up with products which are more cost efficient .
Finally , after comparing both  ways of production , we will realize that both also have their pros and cons but in my perspective , production in the skunkworks environment is better mainly because of the freedom in inventing new things .
Without the supervision and control from the sponsor company , team members are able to explore new ideas that might not be parallel to the company's main objective .
That is why there is a significant number of people who are willing to work in the skunkworks environment despite the problems they face .
This is because these people believe that their inventions will benefit mankind .
Helen Keller made her miraculous breakthrough as she spelled W-A-T-E-R when water ran over her hand .
The importance of water lies in the fact that  it comprises 70% of a person .
Without food , one can still live for a few days .
However , without water , life will be shortened to one day .
No doubt water is the basis of life on this planet .
In the Maslow's Hierarchy of needs , water , together with breathing , food , sex , sleep , homeostasis and excretion are the ground basic of human needs .
Therefore it should be given priority as a current human need .
Khandani , a professor of engineering in California has derived an engineering design processes model , which can be applied in meeting the need of countering water scarcity .
In the first stage , the problem of water scarcity is identified as a global issue .
Secondly , information pertaining to water scarcity should be gathered , including the severity of the problem on a global scale , limitations of current methodologies , underlying reasons and so on .
Next , engineers , scientists should get together to discuss how the problem can be solved , suggesting means of cutting down wastage , encouraging recycling , inventing industrial process with less water and so on .
By exchanging expertise , multiple solutions may be generated , for example , how some countries with limited water resource , like Singapore and Israel , manage to sustain the water supply .
After presentation of solutions , different institutions/government bodies may select one of the them and investigate on .
The last stage of the process will be the testing and implementation of the particular solution .
As for drinking water , it is crucial to ensure the safety of the public when a new technology is adopted .
However , in real life , a problem may not be solved as expected by implementing a standardized model .
For example , for an idea of water conservation to be developed further , scientists need the financial support from government/corporations .
Self-funded projects are usually carried out in skunkworks environment where researchers have to bear the consequence of failure .
Furthermore , the whole process in the model which Khandani has proposed may take many years to be completed , making self-funded projects less viable if there is still no support along the way .
Another kink in the process is the selection of solutions .
Corporate bodies tend to look for solutions with maximum profitable returns .
Government entities also need to justify themselves if they opt for more expensive solutions which may/may not generate returns .
For example , compared to the water transfer project from another location with more abundant water supply , distillation of sea water will be a more expensive solution though it has the potential of solving the problem in the long run .
Many things that surround us today make our lives a lot easier .
From kitchen appliances like refrigerator to home entertainment systems , these are things which we often take  for granted .
They also did not appear at our homes overnight like Christmas presents .
All the many inventions at our homes were developed by engineers over a long time .
It started from identifying the needs of people , followed by coming up with various solutions and then implementing them .
This is called Design Process  which engineers use to approach problems .
According to Khandani , there are five basic steps used in a design process .
This five basic steps can also be applied to problem solving .
The first step is to identify the problem , which usually involves the process of knowing what the customer wants and what problems they are encountering with existing products .
Secondly we need to gather more information , like previous failed attempts at solving similar problems , whether a need for a new solution is needed or not and the problem with existing solutions .
Lastly testing and implementation is done on the solution .
All the steps are important as safety , reliability and economic factors are included and may have a huge impact on many peoples' lives .
Currently , there are many engineers in our society  .
They solve solutions to needs of people , for example an army general wanting a better and a faster tank for his army .
But more priority should be given to things like health care .
In the past , people who wanted to see a doctor had to wait in long queues .
More often than not , those people who were waiting in the line were in urgent need of medical attention .
Time is often wasted in the administrative part of the process .
Nurses in a clinic had to flip through archives for a patient's information manually .
Therefore a more efficient way of allowing people to see doctors is needed .
Engineering process can be applied to meet the needs of people and solve the problem .
After the problem is being identified , more information needs to be gathered .
Khandani said that inexperienced designers will skip this step and proceed to finding solutions , but efforts spent in gathering information will pay out later in the design process .
Engineers found out that in clinics , human errors of the nurse is present , resulting in longer queues .
So solutions like computerizing all administrative work and the processing of patient's medication is being implemented .
In this way , human error is eliminated and people can see the doctor and get their medication in a faster way .
There are many problems than can be solved systemically using the five design process that Khandani mentioned .
Health care is only one of the many pressing needs for engineers to solve .
much useful feed back is needed in order for more problems to be identified .

Technical innovations are essential to the development of a nation .
However , making innovations is not just as simple as thinking about new ideas and carrying them out , but something requiring complex engineering design processes .
According to Khandani , the process of solving design problems can be generalized to five steps: "define the problem , gather pertinent information , generate multiple solutions , analyze and select a solution , and test and implement the solution" .
In most cases , it is not easy to go through all these steps successfully due to the hindrances from various sources .
In this essay , I will talk about two problems which have been greatly hindering such engineering design processes in China .
One is the brain drain problem and the other is the capital problem .
Since China adopted the reform and opening-up policy in 1978 , countless promising students have gone abroad for further study .
China has spent a lot of resources to educate them and expects them to reward the society after further education .
Unfortunately , lots of these talents are unwilling to return to their motherland because of the much  superior conditions in developed countries , which causes the brain drain problem .
As we can see , the five steps of engineering design processes for innovations given above all involve qualified well-educated people .
Such a brain drain makes China fall into a severe shortage of talents who are necessary for the implementation of any stage of the process .
Since there are not enough people for engineering design processes , China is not capable of making enough innovations for higher living standards in a short time .
As a result , more educated people will go abroad , which aggravates the brain drain problem in turn and exerts a greater negative effect on the process .
Secondly , China is still struggling to meet its people's basic living needs as a developing country .
Every year China has to spend most of its revenue on fundamental infrastructure and national defense , etc .
Therefore , unlike US and developed European countries , not much capital can be spared for engineering design processes for innovations , which causes the capital problem .
As we all know , it is often costly to gather sufficient valuable information in this information age and carry out a new policy in today's materialistic society .
Thus in the course of engineering design , one usually needs much money for getting pertinent information and testing and implementing the solution .
Without enough useful information , people cannot come up with best solutions .
Even if they have made it , testing and implementing it is still impossible without sufficient capital .
Besides , when people are aware that not much capital is available , they may not choose the most efficient but more costly solution in the course of 'analyzing and selecting a solution' , which may bring about bad effects in the long run .
Therefore , the capital problem hampers engineering design processes to a very great extent .
Einstein once noted that"the god doesn't play dice ."
From his perspective , since every natural event happens as a result of a cause or collective causes , I am not sure if it is proper to refer to the discovery of LSD , short term of Lysergic acid diethylamide , as an accident .
At least it is not an intentional consequence like the discovery of risperidone , a medicine for mentally disordered people .
In the following paragraphs , I shall touch on the similarities and differences of their pharmaceutical effects , controllabilities and consuming groups .
Firstly , despite the fact that they focus on different aspects pharmaceutically , LSD and risperidone actually share some similarities on medical effects .
They both have strong corrective influence on mental disorder .
In 1993 , risperidone was approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration ,  for the treatment of schizophrenia , and bipolar disorder in 2007 .
Especially for pupils with age 13-18 , risperidone is the only approved drug agent in America .
On another hand , LSD was once widely used for treatments of mental disorder as well before  , which would be illustrated in the second paragraph .
However , LSD affects people in alcoholism in a positive way which is unachievable  for risperidone .
Secondly , the controllability of both the  short term and long term  effects of LSD and risperidone vary greatly .
Risperidone always gives a constant performance .
Beside its expected medical effects , the side-effects are also predictable .
The most common side effects include severe anxiety , akathisia , sedation , dysphoria , insomnia , sexual dysfunction , low blood pressure , muscle stiffness , muscle pain , tremors , increased salivation , and stuffy nose .
But for LSD , the physical and psychological effect vary greatly from one to the other , and is highly dependent on the amount of dosage , consumer's personality , mood , the surrounding environment and other variable factors .
Most importantly , the social issues arising from consumption of LSD are unexpected .
The typical physical effects are dilated pupils , higher body temperature , increased heart rate and blood pressure , sweating , loss of appetite , sleeplessness , dry mouth , and tremors .
Apart from physical and psychological effects , LSD also triggers intense spiritual experience which leads consumers to illusory images and feelings .
There is a great number of people who believe that LSD serve as a divine vehicle  which transports the consumers to the outer-space where the gods live .
There were several cases of suicide before the United States government banned LSD in 1966 .
Lastly , the consuming groups of LSD and risperidone consist of different people with different purpose , resulting in different social problems .
Normally , the consumers of risperidone are psychological patients who are seeking effective treatment .
However for LSD , it was mainly regarded as a means to get high by the American hippies .
Even the poets , painters and musicians tried to seek inspiration by consuming  LSD .
As a result , the consuming group of LSD is more complicated than that of risperidone .
According to the above , even though riperidone and LSD share some similarities in their pharmaceutical effects to a certain extent , they are different from each other in terms of controlability of side effects and their consuming groups .

An example of such technology is the Global Positioning System (GPS) .
The technology consists of numerous satellites that orbit around the Earth that provide its users with various functions ranging from navigation to prediction of weather , thus , widely used in transportation industries .
The military also uses GPS in various methods from missile guidance to enemy tracking .
Besides that , the public has also benefited from this technology as it can be used for search and rescue purposes and also as a navigation aid .
Numerous factors have brought about the development of the GPS: mainly the government , military and public demands .
First , the government had a great part to play in the development of the GPS .
In 1983 , the U .S . President Ronald Reagan decided that the GPS will be made available for civilian use after the Soviet Union shot down a commercial airliner which had navigational difficulty , bringing about the death of more than 200 passengers .
Since then , the government realised that the GPS is the key to providing a dependable way of navigation and thus , pushed for its development .
Currently , the GPS is widely used in the aviation and maritime industry so that similar incidents can be prevented .
Next , the public demands have pushed the benefits of the GPS further when gadgets are integrated with GPS to provide constant relative motion and time coordination .
Using such products , users are capable of navigating in any part of the world .
As such , even the user's estimated time of arrival can be calculated .
Such products have saved lives when rescuers tracked the GPS signals from their gadgets to locate the victim's whereabouts , bringing the success rate of search and rescue mission to a higher level .
