Finally , the last step will be testing and implementing the solution to the design problem .
We must also consider the means of implementation such as prototyping or concurrent engineering  (Seyyed , 2005) .
In the contemporary world , preventing heart diseases is inarguably one of the most pressing needs of mankind , and is rated as the top priority for engineering design and innovation .
As years of research conducted by the WHO (world health organization) have repeatedly shown , heart malfunctioning is the most common threat among all health-related problems  .
Given such a life and death situation , engineers have responded and there have been many great inventions , of which the implanted pacemaker might be one of the most significant engineering products in preventing heart diseases .
This essay will explain in detail the working of modern implanted pacemakers and therefore how they have met the need in maintaining a smooth heart beat .
The first step is to have a pacemaker implanted into the human body .
After having numbed the patient's collarbone area and a small incision made , electrical leads are inserted into the heart chamber with the guidance of x-ray .
The other end of the leads is connected to the generator and a battery that lasts for a few years .
Next , the doctor will transmit a program tailored to the needs of the patient's heart into the pacemaker across the patient's skin .
Now the pacemaker is ready to work .
Under normal circumstances , it keeps the heart beating in a normal rhythm according to the program .
When an abnormality happens , such as a block in the coronary artery or a sudden stop of heart beat , the pacemaker detects it and sends out electrical pulses to the affected location .
The pulses will then stimulate contractions in the heart muscles , which will allow the blood to flow smoothly again or to start beating again , preventing a possible sudden death of the patient .
Besides preventing serious occasions of heart malfunctioning , the pacemakerr can also help regulate the heart beat when the patient is performing certain activities , such as exercising and sleeping .
Moreover , the pacemaker records the rhythms of the patient's heart beat in different situations and hence helps the doctor to write programs that best suits the patient  .
The reasons why implanted pacemakers have gone through generations of development and has been listed as one of the top 50 inventions in the past 50 years is that they are portable , which means they can effectively prevent sudden heart attacks , and dependable as they run on computer programs which are constantly renewed by having more suitable ones stored in the patients' bodies .
This invention is certainly a masterpiece of engineering design due to its contribution in the enhancement of health through maintaining a functional heart .

From a technological point of view , the way to the future from where we are today is either by creating something new or modifying current technology so that it performs better than the way it previously did .
This is where engineering design process comes into play .
In order to come up with groundbreaking innovations to improve the way we live , engineers need to have a design-oriented mind .
However , coming up with  new ideas and innovations are more often than not , easier said than done .
As a matter of fact , statistically speaking , the number of failed attempts at innovation far exceed the ones which made it into the books .
Nevertheless , the process of learning through failures have significant importance in the engineering design process .
One of the main obstacles in the engineering design process has to be financial constraints .
Many great engineering design ideas were halted cold in their tracks just because the cost to realize them outweighs the benefits that they carry .
For instance , the proposed plan to use nuclear energy in Malaysia never came to pass due to the enormous funds that is required to carry out research in the technology and even if the necessary funds are secured , there is always the uncertainty if the research will yield any significant results .
On top of that , researchers and investors have all come to terms with the fact that running and maintaining a practical nuclear reactor in Malaysia will take too long for the technology to break even financially .
It is just not worth the effort .
Apart from that , new engineering design innovations need to be benchmarked against their environmental effects .
Engineers need to be sensitive towards this issue and thus , ensure that the impact of their ideas are minimal towards mother nature .
In the case of a nuclear power plant in Malaysia , the idea is not viable as the country has an abundance of forest reserves which needs to be kept untarnished and preserved  .
Constant exposure to radioactive substances may alter the natural ecosystem of these reserves , causing irreversible damage .
Even in Singapore , all engineering projects have to abide by the Environmental Pollution Control Act before being carried out .
Besides that ,  the innovations that engineers  come up with needs  to be safe for the public to use .
In this case , safety measures need to be put in place before an innovation is unveiled to the public .
This cannot be compromised .
As for the Malaysian power plant , The plant , due to the inadequacy of safe uranium containment as well as the skilled labour to handle them , the project is unable to be carried out .
The incident at Chernobyl , Ukraine serves as a good reminder as to why safety is of utmost importance .
In order to cut production cost , several safety precautions have been removed from the initial blueprint .
On the fateful day of April 26 , 1986 , one of the reactors exploded , consequently causing the area to be inhabitable till this day and instantly claiming 4 lives in the process .
In a nutshell , engineers may have great ideas and innovations .
Unfortunately , not all of them can be realized .
In fact , many of them will not .
However , all is not lost .
With small but useful engineering design ideas being introduced daily , serving as a basis for many bigger innovations , it's only a matter of time before the many obstacles which are holding engineers back are removed .

They are believed to have the ability to create brand new organs , curing an array of serious diseases and even perhaps solving human ageing problems ,  .
Although after 30 years of research , scientists are still unable to solve the mystery of these cells , but there has been fruitful development where these stems are now being used to repair important tissues in the human body But due to the nature of these cells ,  scientists now face both technological and scientific problems which hinders them from unleashing the full potential of these cells .
Technology played an important role , to aid researchers on in their work .
We need the right tools for the right kind of job , we can't possibly use a screwdriver to do a hammer's work ,  wee need better technology to increase scientist's capability to understand this cell better , like how it changes (Transform) into specialized cells which will later transform into an organ .
Scientist believes that the answer lies within the cell itself , the DNA of the cell that causes them to differentiate .
With current DNA technology , it has proven insufficient to proceed any faster .
This is a serious factor that scientists are now looking into , and once they succeed , imagine the amount of life that would be saved .
Meeting the demand in the  market and reducing the cost of medical treatments bringing an infinite possibility to the medical-industry .
The impact this technology will bring to the world .
One of the fascinating problems faced , is the human body itself .
Firstly the human body has an extraordinary capability to identify foreign objects and purge them out from the system (Rejection) .
This has led to serious complications to patients who are receiving this life-saving treatment .
Secondly , these cells injected into the body have to be closely monitored .
Withoutthis , it would result in an uncontrollable and misdirected growth of unwanted cells , etc tumor , or even cancerous cells .
This is a major obstacle that scientists are  now facing .
Recently , the only way around this is to reduce the body's immune system to zero , so the body will not reject the treatment but it's a very dangerous step .
If the body always rejects such treatment , then all the research and funds spent on the project would be wasted .

Do you know that the global worldwide energy consumption was 500 exajoules which is  astounding 5 1020 J ?
Do you also know that 80 to 90 percent of that is obtained from the combustion of fossil fuels ?
(U .S . Department Of Energy) As globalization takes place , coupled with an increasing world population , more electrical energy has to be supplied to homes and factories so as to meet the increasing demand .
However , fossil fuels such as coal and crude oil , which is used to produce electricity , will eventually be depleted as they are non-renewable resources .
According to Wikipedia , "Assuming that our rate of usage in 2005 remains constant , we will run out of conventional oil in 40 years (2045) and coal in 154 yrs (2159) ."
Hence , the current human need for energy is one need that we must prioritize .
Engineers have therefore started to work on new technologies , such as photovoltaic systems that can convert solar power to electrical energy so as to ease the need .
The process of converting the solar energy to electrical energy is also known as the photovoltaic effect .
("Solar cells") First , when sunlight is shone onto the surface of the photovoltaic panels , sunlight in the form of photons will be absorbed by the silicon .
Next , the electrons with higher energy levels in the panels will be separated from their atoms and allowed to flow in a single direction due to the special composition of the cells .
Complimentary positive charges that are produced will flow in the opposite direction of the electrons .
Finally , when both positive charges and electrons flow through the silicon photovoltaic cells , electricity is produced .
("Solar cells")
However , even though solar energy has proven to be a very good and efficient way to generate electricity , the electricity produced may not be available to everyone who needs them due to the cost of production .
Many modern countries have been setting up more photovoltaic plants to generate electricity .
("Photovoltaics") However , in most third world countries , the governments or private industries may not have the funds to set up photovoltaic plants due to the high initial capital  As a result , despite many people in the country needing electrical energy , the country cannot supply enough to meet the needs of everyone .
Therefore , this shows that the technology of solar energy has its own limitations too , which hopefully would be resolved soon so that it can become an accessible source of energy for everyone in the near future .
To sum up , the most current human need that has to be prioritized is the need for energy .
In the next few decades , the demand for energy will definitely increase exponentially as the world population continues to grow .
Therefore , solar energy being a clean and renewable source of energy will definitely build up its popularity as a popular source that can be used to produce electricity .
Hence in order to ease current as well as future needs for energy , solar power is one viable source to consider .

Usually , the deterministsFor the  quality of life ,s technologically determinist and socially determinist .

In contrast , enough capital and technology support are the factors which lead the process of convention .
So convention is more technologically determthe marketand skunkworks is more socially determinist .

Sometimes only six to ten people are involved .
On the other hand , convention gets enough things to support , which cause it much easier and more stabile to finish innovation .

One of the current human needs is to find an environmentally friendly vehicle as a substitute for the gasoline vehicle .
Air pollution nowadays has become a serious issue all around the world .
Some countries which are severely affected by air pollution could not even have a clear vision during day time .
According to Gulfnews .com eq \o\ac( ,1)(March 2008) , more than 75 per cent of air pollution is emitted from vehicles .
Exhaust fumes are bad for human health and will contribute to air pollution .
Thus , an environmentallyl friendly vehicle needs to be created and should be given priority for this creation to save our earth from pollution and to lessen the impact of the air pollution .
Electrically generated vehicles can be designed to overcome the air pollution problem .
electrically generated vehicle will not exhaust gases when it is being driven .
On the other hand , it also does not need gasoline as generating material .
This means that mining process for gasoline might also be lesser and therefore the air pollution problem will be less serious .
It is because mining and refining processes of  petroleum which emit fumes that will pollute the air .
To build an electrically generated vehicle that can have longer lasting battery power and powerful pickup , it should have a special battery , light weight material and well designed shape .
The battery of the vehicle must be able to recharge within a few hours .
It should also be able to store higher amounts of energy in order to last for longer periods of time .
On the other hand , building the vehicle with light weight material , such as aluminium can conserve energy .
Furthermore , having an aerodynamically styled shape , the vehicle can move faster and have a powerful pickup .
The electrically generated vehicle should be fully tested and examined .
It is an important process to make sure that the product is safe to be used .
Test drive  and open the electrically generated vehicle to the public and ask for feedback from them and make improvements for it .
After that the electrically generated vehicle can be introduced to the market throughout the world .
In conclusion , the creation of an electrically generated vehicle can reduce air pollution problems that is becoming more and more serious nowadays .
It has to be created to fulfil the world's need nowadays so that our future generation has a healthier earth to live in .

With the initial to achieve a more convenient human life , ecommerce is considered to be socially determined rather than technologically determined .
To specify , the formation and development of this technology is mainly contributed by three factors: public's needs , economic consideration , and government regulation .
Basically , the origcommerce is due to public's desire to facilitate their life and work .

First , the attitude of Singaporeans makes them reluctant to change .
Singaporeans live in the comfort of their own homes believing that all the things that can be invented have already been made .
Everyone is just waiting for someone to discover new things .
With attitudes like that , it is not possible for Singaporeans to innovate .
Moreover , Singaporeans accept things too easily .
They lack the motivation to create new things .
Such frame of mind hinders the progression of innovation .
Singaporeans are afraid to try out new things and they are also afraid of failure .
Innovation requires perseverance , the ability to accept failure and motivation .
These are a few traits that are often seen amongst the Singaporeans .
On top of this , the education system in Singapore does not emphasise on creativity .
Students are always 'spoon-fed' by the teachers .
As a consequence , they are instilled with a 'sit back and wait' state of mind from young .
Clearly , the lack of creativity and the passive attitude of Singaporeans have hindered the first stage of the engineering design process .
In conclusion , the design process is demanding and tedious .
There are certain stages of the process to complete before being able to come up with a feasible solution .
However , there are problems faced during the process .
The two major problems in Singapore are the attitude and the social systems .
The passive attitude results in people being unable to identify existing problems , which is the very first phase of the design process .
Furthermore , the social systems set strict standards for new products .
This significantly affects the third stage of design process which is the generation of solutions .
Therefore , only by overcoming the two major problems , will Singaporeans then be able to create and innovate .
Besides small population size , Singapore also does not have any natural resources to boast about .
The republic's physical landmass of approximated seven hundred and five square kilometers is ranked one hundred and eighty- seventh internationally .
Unsurprisingly , the scarce land does not yield precious metals nor is it a treasure trove containing prized fossil fuel .
Singapore's small population size affects the initial two stages as well as the final testing stage of the engineering design process .
Firstly , a small population would mean that most problems encountered by small groups in Singapore would often be overlooked .
For a similar situation overseas , the problems are likely to draw more attention .
This is due to the fact that for a seemingly insignificant proportion of people who require specifically designed solutions , it is quite a sizeable amount in absolute terms in countries with larger human concentration .
This situation would be problematic during the definition of problem stage of engineering design process .
In addition , even if there were potential solutions , it would be a tough task to carry out experimentation or trials , either as a means to gather data or to implement a solution , simply because a local test group might not exist .
This was illustrated in the report "A chair that's music to deaf ears" where a research team was unable to find a test group for a chair for the deaf they designed and had to look overseas .
The non-existence of natural resources is another concern .
Specifically , resources can be divided into raw materials , land , wealth and labour of which the first two , a nation like Singapore clearly lacks .
This deficiency in raw materials and useable land as well as to a lesser extent , wealth and labour , limits the magnitude of the engineering solutions to be pursued .
The space race cost the United States an estimated twenty-five billion dollars in ninety-sixties terms .
Such an enormous amount would be several years of Singapore's gross domestic product in the current economic climate .
The scarce land space further adds to the problem .
In conclusion , Singapore's unique size and state of available resources are obstacles in the engineering design process .
The ability to work with such constraints will greatly influence the outcome of future engineering endeavours .
The educational system in Malaysia is exam orientated .
The educational system is based more towards theory and not practicel .
Students spend most of their time in the classroom learning theory .
The amount of time spent in labs for practicals is minimal .
The system is giving emphasis on memory skills , not analytical skills .
Furthermore , school teachers merely teach students to pass their exams , but not for the students to learn .
Primary and secondary school students are spoon fed with information rather than letting them learning independently .
Students are taught and train to score in public examinations such as Penilaian Menengah Rendah (PMR) and Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) .
Eventually , students with good memory will be able to pass with flying colours as they are able to memorise all the facts and spit them all out during the exams .
These excellent students will face problems as they further their studies to be engineers .
They lack of analytical skills , creativity and innovation .
These are the two factors that will cease engineers from being able to solve real life problems .

This made the price of oil in United States decrease very fast at that time .
So the lower price of oil provided a good background for the adoption of Ford's Model T .

An engineering design process , which includes mainly five stages-defining the problem , gathering pertinent information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting a solution and testing and implementing the solution , plays a very important role in improving the quality of people's lives .
In our daily life , we can easily identify automobiles , laptops , handphones and microwaves as engineering innovations around us .
Take China for instance , the culture for innovation in engineering design is severely lacking .
One factor would be China's rigid education system that produces only a small number of innovative engineers .
It does not help either that the Chinese government is giving very little incentives for innovations in engineering .
As a result , engineers have little motivation to innovate .
Even if they have the motivation , their ideas are unlikely to come true due to the lack of funding from the government .
One of the problems that hampers innovations in engineering may be China's rigid education system which discourages students from being creative .
In China , most teachers spoon-feed their students , and students are instructed to follow standard answers given by the teachers .
When a student finds out an alternative method of solving a problem , there is usually no reward for him and he still has to answer the question in the standard way to avoid losing marks at examinations .
Thus innovation among students is discouraged .
Moreover , students have very little hands-on practice of what they have learnt in class .
Instead , most of their time is spent on solving sample examination problems .
As a result , China's education system produces engineers that are generally weak in doing research and development , which will adversely affect the stage of generating multiple solutions in the engineering design process .
Another problem that poses obstacles to innovation in engineering in China may be the lack of funds from the government for research and development (R&D) , thus engineers are hardly attracted to the R&D industry and the lack of funds to implement their new ideas .
Furthermore , the government gives very little reward to engineers who have done innovative work .
Mr . Yuan Long Ping , who is known as the "Father of Hybrid Rice" , had contributed to tremendous increase in the level of world's rice output through cultivating species of hybrid rice during the 1970's .
His innovation has saved millions of people from hunger all over the world .
However , the Chinese government only awarded him the State Preeminent Science and Technology Award of China in 2000 which was valued at merely 5 million yuan .
This was very little if it was meant to reward him for his more than twenty years' of hard work .
This lack of government support means , engineers will not be able to get resources , raw materials , precise equipment for research during engineering design process .
Thus the stage of testing and implementing solutions during the engineering design process is greatly hampered
In conclusion , the rigid education system and the governments limited incentives for innovations limit the number of innovative engineers and hinder the realization of innovative ideas if any .
These are hence  two prominent obstacles that hamper the engineering design processes for innovations in China .
In many companies , brilliant and capable engineers were often denied the opportunity to express their ideas through innovation .
Engineers in the past were innovative and a vast amount of creative ideas were generated to improve the technology .
However , many of these ideas were rejected by the corporate leaders of various companies .
The leaders were not risk-takers and reflected the ideas to be non-profitable to the company .
Passionate engineers ventured 'in the dark' and started a skunk works project as they were unable to gain their superiors supports .
There are many defining features of a conventionally generated technology with those of a comparable innovation that was created in a skunk works environment .
Skunk works projects do not have access to the full resources of the company , have their own rules and have to maintain confidentiality about their projects .
Skunk works projects have their limitations in terms of resources .
The project is helmed by the project managers and all problems , including technical and administrative , will be handled by them .
The research funds and human resources are not made available to them .
Therefore the project managers will have to find their own financial support to fund their projects .
The construction of the team will not be easy as the choices are limited .
The more capable engineers were already involved with other projects and there can be no way to transfer out without the knowledge of the superiors .
On the other hand , conventional projects have a huge backing from the corporate level .
All administrative issues will be settled in a much shorter time to allow the project to begin earlier .
Also , capable engineers will be assigned to the new project , depending on its priority .
Skunk works projects aim is to develop the innovation .
Hence the rules of the company need not  be enforced in their secret working environment .
Project managers will set the rules for those personnel involved .
There have been extreme examples of rules set by project managers where both emerged successful in their innovations .
In contrast , conventional project personnel have to follow the strict rules of the company .
An image has to be maintained .
Smart dress codes are to be adhered to at all times and working hours should be fully utilized in the company's interest .
The engineers often follow a monotonous lifestyle .
Skunk works projects are secret projects not to be revealed to anyone .
Personnel will have to maintain a double life for this project .
No discussions on the project are to be made .
Personnel often have to stay back late after office hours to work on their secret projects and no claim of overtime is allowed .
Since they are involved in a secret project , no rewards will be guaranteed .
On the contrary , conventional projects engineers take pride in their work .
Special privileges were often granted to those involved in high-profiled projects .
There will also be media coverage and time to time updates on their projects .
Engineers working for conventional projects are more at ease with their jobs .
However they face equal stress on their projects .
They will have to follow their company rules while their leaders support them financially .
Skunk work projects do not have the backing of their leaders , resulting in secrecy and extra work .
Engineers must be highly motivated and passionate to achieve results .
Therefore conventional projects and skunk works projects are different in nature .
However an engineer can be successful as long as he is highly motivated , passionate and diligent .
As mentioned , the development of an intended product is part of the engineering design processes .
For these two processes , an engineer needs to be able to think out of the box .
One possible factor that might hamper such creativity is our educational system .
Singapore's education system has been structured in such a way that it is rigid and text based and does not teach students to apply what is being taught .
There is so much to learn in the syllabus and yet so little time .
Hence , we see chunks of lessons squeezed into packed timetables .
The time needed to fully understand the concepts are usually not enough .
Therefore , many students eventually end up merely memorizing and going through the motion instead of thinking of different ways to apply the knowledge learnt to the real world .
Furthermore , the choice of subjects is very limited and the subjects are mostly of the same nature .
For creativity to be induced , it is important to be exposed to knowledge from various different aspects .
Another portion of the design process involves commercialization .
For a new product or technology to be successful , it is required to be accepted by the public .
Therefore , the society is a big deciding factor for the success or failure of the product launched .
Sadly , society as a whole is generally not that receptive tto new ideas and innovative products .
This is a potential problem which would hamper engineering design processes .
Humans in general , like to stay within their comfort zone and is often unwilling to accept new ideas or changes in their lifestyle .
The new product needs to be widely accepted so that it will be profitable .
Hence , an unreceptive society is not going to generate enough profits to enable the product to be sustainable .
Without profits , engineers will not be able or motivated to continue research and development necessary to improve the products as it is simply not worth it to do so anymore .
An example would be the case of the refrigerator .
Refrigerators currently common in the market are electric refrigerators , which generally produce a "humming" sound .
A soundless refrigerator was in fact produced in 1930 .
However , during that time , large investments went channeled into the research and development of electric refrigerators .
Furthermore , electric refrigerators were more aggressively advertised for .
All these factors led to the downfall of the soundless refrigerator .
In sum , a society which is less receptive of new ideas and innovative products could lead to the hampering of engineering processes for innovation .
In conclusion , there are several factors that play a part in the success of innovative engineering processes .
It is necessary for engineers to exhibit a high level of creativeness .
Moreover , for a new product to succeed in the market , it has to be accepted by the society as they are the ones purchasing the products and making them profitable .
Two problems have been identified which might hamper creativeness in engineers .
Although measures that tackle these problems might have already been introduced , we have yet to witness the effectiveness of these measures .
Despite  the poor environment , tough stress , and high risk , skunkworks indeed value more than conventional technology .
To some extent , conventionally generated technology usually improves our life , but innovation in skunkworks often changes our lives .
Skunkworks- defined to pioneer the development of a technological innovation , normally has  tougher working conditions .
Usually skunkworks cannot get enough support to create a satisfying working environment .
Due to  uncertainty , R&D groups in skunkworks often cannot find enough people to conduct the innovation .
Without initial capital and sufficient crew , the developing process has no way to start .
In addition , it is a fairly stressful job because of the limitation of time and the finance .
Just like the design team at Macintosh , they  worked day and night under the aggressive leadership of Steven Jobs .
By contrast , conventional technologies have well organized systems that can ensure the progress of work .
Seldom do they have a stressful workload .
The starting point of innovation in skunkworks and conventional technology are different .
Innovation in skunkworks is made for solving the potential problems or needs of life .
However , Conventional technologies is made for solving the existing problems or needs .
When NOKIA upgraded its N series hand phone annually , iPhone of the Apple company surprised the world , because it give a different definition to the touch phone .
The success of innovation is generally much more considerable than conventional technology .
Skunkworks takes a high risk in the innovation process , but it is rewarding .
For skunkworks , the entire work can be in vain if the products turn out to be a failure in the market , but still it is rewarding because of the generous profits in case of success .
Moreover , in many cases , the failure in the research can turn out to be a great success in other fields .
Just like "Post-its" of 3M , was initially considered as a failure , but was finally proved to be a great success in other fields .
on the contrary , it is more stable and reliable for conventional technology . 
To sum up , skunkworks usually has a tough environment and a stressful workload .
Furthermore , it is often at a high risk to invest in skunkworks .
However , for the desire of changing the way of how people live , and also for the considerable benefits for companies and human life , innovation in skunkworks plays a more vital role than the conventionally generated technology .
The Compressedhe development of CNG vehicle is determined by thenvironmental factor .
Unlike the normal gasoline vehicle which emits greenhouse and harmful gases , the power of CNG vehicle can emit 70% lesser CO2 and little harmful gas .
Therefore CNG vehicmillionre environmental friendly than gasoline vehicle .
In the context of global warming becoming more and more serious , the development of such environmental friendly vehicles becomes a must .
Many automobile manufacturers (Fiat , Volkswagen , Toyota and others) conducted a lot of research , development and innovations for a number of years using CNG as a fuel source for vehicles .
CNG equipment manufacturers have invested in research and development to improve this technology and make it convenient and available for consumers globally (wikipedia ,2009) .
Apart from reducing the air pollution , Natural gas vehicle also produces lower noise levels than gasoline vehicle .
This is another positive feature of CNG vehicle .
The greater use of CNG vehicles for public transportation will result in a quieter urban environment , which will be a plus for our living environment .
(Lim , 2001) Thus , it is the environmental factor that spurred the development of CNG vehicle .
Moreover , the intention of reducing the fuel cost also shaped the develovehiclesf CNG vehicle .
The oil embargo resulted energy crisis in the U .S . during the 1980's .
Such situthe CNGon motivated the discovery of alternative fuels that could reduce our dvehiclescareon forenvironmentally The scientists found a vehicleshod that could compress natural gas in a smaia  morewserious problemn be put inside a car .

From 2000's , the oil price grew tremendously , but the price of natural gas was much less .
In order to reduce the fuel cost , many people preferred CNG cars in that period .
More owners of private cars country wanted to convert their petrol-driven vehicles to also run on CNG .
This actually spurred the manufacturers to improve the technology of conversion from gasoline vehicle to dual-fuel vThe naturalso that the cost can be reduced and more car owners could bevehiclesrom the CNG technology .
Lastly , the development of CNG vehicle is also influenced by the government policies .
Due to the increase of the oil price and the necessity of improvement of the urban environment , many countries' governments support the development of CNG vehicle .
Many countries which are abundant of natural gas introduce CNG cars and buses to their public transportations .
For example , in countries of South American , such as Argentina and Brazil , there are about 3 million CNG vehicles which are mainly used as taxicabs .
Some other governments provide tax rebate for the owners of CNG vehicles , so that to incentivize the using of eco-friendly vehicles .
For instants , the Singapore government provided 40% discount on the Open Market Value (OMV) cost of newly-registered green passenger vehicles from 2001 in order to build up the intensity of CNG vehicles (wikipedia ,2009) .
With the help of the favorable policies and sponsorship from the government , more talented people are attracted to the CNG vehicle industry research .
As a result the CNG vehicle technology is shaped by the government policies .
In conclusion , CNG vehicle technology is a socially determined technology .
Without the requirements of cheaper and cleaner vehicle and the governmental support , it might not as well-developed as now .
In recent years , with its growing prosperity and affluence , China is investing more on science and technology development .
However , the lack of research funding and an inflexible education system , in my opinion , has significantly hampered engineering design process in China .
On top of that , an inflexible education system in China has also hampered its engineering design process .
In order to come out with a new product , the engineers must be able to think out of the box and possess practical skills .
However , the education system in China does not train the student to think creatively and provide few chances for the students to put what they learn into practice .
The education in China is very much exam-oriented .
The students study hard in order to excel in exams .
The only aim of the students seems to be doing well in the university entrance examination and being enrolled into renowned universities .
In the so-called cramming method of teaching , teachers pay particular attention to memorization , even at the cost of comprehension .
During the examination , the students are evaluated by how much they memorize , and not on how they think .
Such a rigid education system has significantly hindered students' creativity and poorly equipped them to apply knowledge in the real world .
In conclusion , the lack of research funding and an exam-oriented education system are the two most significant factors which have hampered engineering design process in China .
However , in its eleventh Five-Year Plan , the Chinese government has promised to increase the R&D spending to 2 .5 percent of GDP by the end of 2010 .
Also , the education system in well developed cities such as Beijing and Shanghai is under restructure to better prepare the younger generation to compete in the globalized world .
Thus , the condition of engineering design in China may have a more positive outlook in the future .
The hard tomato program and the discovery of Warfarin started differently .
The program of hard tomato varieties began withe 1970's ,idea .
A California agriculture professor foresaw a future labor shortage in California and came up with a roughmachinesf tomatoes that could be picked by machine .
Then , he proposed this idea to his institution and got the research started .
However , the discovery of Warfarin happened during another research .
Prof Link , the discoverer of Warfarin , was involved in a research of sweet clove disease at that time .
After about ten years' research , he discovered Warfarin one day in an unrelated experiment , which turned out to be the most impressive progress in the whole research .
The big profit made by the patent was used to support other research projects of Madison professors , provide financial aid to doctoral students and cover other research expenses .
Moreover , the progresses of the two technologies are not alike .
The hard tomato program followed a whole procedure of research works .
A group of scientists were gathered together in an institution .
They were supposed to use the scientific approach to solve various unexpected problems occurring in the research .
In the process , development was extremely important .
Not only should the scientists figure out how to breed the variety , but also they needed to do other non-research works in order to successfully put the variety into practice .
They also cared aboof researchommercialization part .
All of these included building a prototype of the machine used to pick the tomatoes , contacting producers who were willing to sell their products , making their research results known to the local farmers and collecting their feedbacks to improve .
Finally , they came up with their research results after many years' research , in due time according to their plan .
years ofthey alsoIn contrast , in the case of Warfarin , the process was a reversed one .
The product came out first accidentally , followed up with some research to get a better understanding of the discovery .
Warfarin was put into practice directly after it , because its use was totally known when discovering it .
The whole process was highly effective and by chance .
No one expected it before head .
In conclusion , the mechanized tomtechnologiesm has different start , process and key to suweress from the discovery of Warfarin .

Another major problem that engineers might face in Singapore is that people are less receptive to innovations and ideas as compared to  Western countries .
The older generation is especially resistant to change , and would rather use products that they are used to .
Thus , despite the presence of new innovations that would greatly improve their way of life , they might not be so accepting of these new products .
This would affect the testing and implementation of the solution during the process .
When surveying the feasibility of the solution , results would not be accurate as the target group of an older age would generally be less supportive towards the new idea .
If the customer base for the new innovation is too small , investors will be less willing to provide funds to fund research and development of new innovations and products , therefore affecting the whole design process .
In conclusion , it is inevitable that there will be problems that might affect the various stages of the design process .
However , measures have definitely been taken to tackle these problems .
For example , the education system has now definitely improved in terms of its rigidity .
Since 2005 , the Ministry of Education (MOE) has introduced Project Work (PW) to junior colleges in order to improve communicative skills of students , as well as to encourage building of teamwork among students .
Hopefully in the near future , more effort will be put in to encourage society to be more accepting of new innovations that would greatly change their way of life for the better , and also to encourage in not just aspiring engineers but in students in general , skills that they are able to use and apply in handling problems in the real world .
Rapid industrialization is one of the main economic boosters that characterize today's society .
Singapore is a good example of such a society .
Since the 1960s , there has been a paradigm shift from  low end industrialization to  high end industrialization thus resulting in a rapid depletion of the already scarce resources .
Land scarcity is one of the pressing human needs that may require immediate attention .
Engineering design processes are therefore created to meet the above mentioned human needs .
One  such engineering design processes is gathering pertinent information .
It is essential in minimizing the problems that arise due to land scarcity in Singapore .
According to Khandani , "Efforts spent searching for information about your problem . . .reveal facts about the problem . . .discover mistakes and false starts ."
Researching land scarcity problems can help one to prioritize by deciding on the more important infrastructure to build to strike a balance between social and economic needs .
For example , high rise flats are built to help prevent overcrowding and to sustain the population while mega infrastructures like the Integrated Resort are for economic purposes .
By prioritizing , one can efficiently make use of scarce land material for maximal benefits .
The other process is the generation of multiple solutions .
According to Khandani , "Creative abilities can be developed if one is willing to take risks and is not afraid to tackle problems ."
The lack of land is a challenging problem to the leaders of Singapore thus engineers have to come up with innovative solutions to tackle land scarcity .
In Singapore , a few solutions have been carried out to help solve land scarcity issues .
Some of these solutions are land reclamation , condensed structural landscapes and the construction of sky scrapers .
One of the final processes is to analyse and select a solution .
According to Khandani , Ergonomics is crucial in the designing process because production of final products must not result in disaster .
For example , the construction of Nicole Highway initially resulted in injuries but after detailed analysis made by relevant experts , the final product is on its way to completion without casualty .
Construction of sky scrapers is relatively safe despite their height due to deep analytical insights in the construction of these buildings .
As a result , the final products serve its purpose without imposing damage to the surroundings .

Toshiba's laptop and Microsoft's operating systems are two technologies that were created under different conditions and environments .
Toshiba's laptop is often known as a skunk work innovation whereas Microsoft'sis known  as a conventionally created product .
The key difference in these two products is the support they received during the creation process .
However , both are known to be successful creations .
The first difference is the lack of support for the creation of Toshiba's laptop as compared to Microsoft's operating system .
According to Rogers , due to the fact that Toshiba's laptop creator Tetsuya Mizoguchi failed to convince his superiors in Toshiba to support his laptop project , he was not able to receive any research and development funding .
The funds would have been useful to help him cover the cost of production .
Furthermore , his superiors refused to assign experienced engineers to aid him .
(1)
In comparison , although Bill Gates himself is the boss of Microsoft , he received much external support .
In January 1975 , the president of Micro Instrumentation and Telemetry Systems (MITS) agreed to let Gates and his partner to develop a program for MITS new microcomputer .
It would be useless if there was no hardware for Gates' program to work on .
With this , he went on to create new programs with the support of his entire team at Microsoft .
(2)
The vision of these two innovators also differs .
Bill Gates' way of running the business is largely monopolistic .
According to the article (2) , Gates actually wrote to computer hobbyists demanding that they pay for the usage of his program so as to allow him to continue to write quality programs .
In May 1998 , Microsoft was accused of abusing its monopoly power to keep rivals out of the market .
Its operating system is believed to favour Microsoft's web browser and not other competing browsers like the Netscape Navigator and Opera .
(3)
On the other hand , Mizuguchi's idea was to create a laptop that was compatible with IBM's platform despite the fact that they were competing for the same market share .
He recognised that IBM was dominant at the time and that it would be fair to  consumers to allow them to use an IBM compatible peripheral Toshiba laptop .
If Mizoguchi had done otherwise , people would probably only buy Toshiba's laptop for its convenience .
Despite the difference in both technologies , there is actually one similarity between them .
That is , both are largely successful .
Mizoguchi , with his perseverance and determination , finally sold the highly demanded laptops in Europe .
By 1988 , Toshiba commanded almost half the market share in Japan , despite the fact that there were many competitors . 
Similarly for Microsoft , Gates rode on the success of IBM's personal computer by becoming the full owner of a program that was written especially for IBM's personal computer .
The program was then sold to IBM , without the copyright .
This  allowed them to have a monopoly in the industry .
In conclusion , despite the fact that both skunk work and conventionally created technologies differ in the environment where they are being produced , they will still be successful if their creators have the determination and are full of ideas .
The birth of new technologies and inventions come about in different forms and through different processes .
Although the innovations may be comparably similar , the conditions where they were created may be totally different .
An example would be  the case of conventionally invented electric cars by General Motors and the first laptop that was invented in a skunk works environment by an engineer from Toshiba .
There are certain differences and similarities between these two .
Differences like , risks involved , working environments , marketing strategies and similarities like the visions and goals of both innovations .
The first difference between the two types of innovation is risks involvement and work stress .
For conventionally generated technology , companies would select a team or department and assign tasks to them .
Then , they would set out to complete their tasks , without having to calculate the risks involved because these are what they are supposed to do .
For skunk works  created technology , the person who suggested the innovation has to take very big risks because it is their own project , theyare not supported by companies , only their own team .
As mentioned in Rogers' article on the 'Birth of laptops' , Tetstiya Mizoguchi , a Japanese technologist , disobeyed orders and risked his career for the sake of innovation-development which in the endwas successful .
Therefore , risk taking is unavoidable in skunk works .
Secondly , the processes in which the new technology are designed and carried out  are totally different between the two types of innovations .
The electric car was researched and built by the R&D department from General Motors .
The team had full funding from the company to support their costs in researching and designing electric motor cars .
On the other hand , Tetstiya Mizoguchi who led the invention of the first laptop , had no team initially and was not funded by his company because his proposal of creating a laptop , was rejected by his company .
Therefore , people who are working in a skunk works environment have to gather their own team and a substantial amount of money before they can actually start on their project .
As such , because of limited funds the team or individual have in skunk works , they have more stress because they cannot afford to fail .
Because of disapproval from companies , the working space for skunk works innovation is usually smaller and limited as compared to those who work under companies to create new technology .
As mentioned in Rogers' article  , Tetstiya Mizoguchi and his team went 'underground' and worked at a factory which was far away from Toshiba's headquarters .
Therefore , for skunk works innovations , people have to find their own team , funding , and workspace to carry out their project .
The third difference is the limitations of marketing .
For conventional innovations headed by big companies , they have their own marketing department to advertise and test their products .
They have the ability to make their products appealing to the public and attract them to test their prototypes .
In the case study of the creation of electric motor cars by General Motors written by Rogers , General Motors went to the extent of putting advertisements in newspapers and came out with marketing campaigns to publicise their new product .
On the contrary , products or technology created from a skunk works environment do not have the capabilities to roll out massive campaigns to advertise due to the lack of funds .
They have to depend on their own network to publicise their product and introduce their prototypes to the public .
Comparing the two articles written by Rogers , the target group for skunk works prototypes testing usually started small , and then eventually became bigger as more people accepted the product; whereas in the case of conventionally created products , the target group is very large in the beginning due to large scale marketing campaigns .
The similarity between the innovations created under different environments is that both  wanted to come out with solutions to solve problems that were present .
In the case of Toshiba's first laptop invention , Tetstiya Mizoguchi wanted to solve the problem which most Japanese companies faced ,  crowded offices which prevented the usage of more desktops due to the lack of space; while , electric motor cars were created to lessen pollution .
In conclusion , there are various differences and similarities between conventional or skunk works innovations , but at the end of the day , both have produced products that have helped to solve problems and bring benefits to the people of the world .
In 1943 , Abraham Maslow published a theory on  the hierarchy of needs of people .
In his study , he defined five stages of needs; they are , in descending order of importance , physiological , safety , love and belonging , esteem and finally self-actualization .
In view of the world today ,  engineers should tackle the most important human need  .
This is of course one of our basic physiological needs , water , which is imperative in sustaining life . .
The five stage engineering design process , as proposed by Khandani , will guide engineers in making solutions to solve this problem . 
Potable water , the source of life , has become  in third world countries .
Drinking water that has not been treated  can lead to life threatening diseases .
According to the World Health Organization report in the year 2000 , Africa , home to a population of 784 million people , faces dire shortages of clean and disease free drinking water .
Furthermore , it is the continent with the least supply of potable water .
Nearly 48% of its human population has no immediate access to water supplies .
This is clearly a problem that needs to be addressed as soon as possible .
According to Khandani , the first step is to define the problem of the water shortage in Africa .
It is important that engineers realize the true root of the problem , so as not to waste resources on a solution that does not work .
For instance , one may think of solving the water shortage by building desalination plants throughout the coast of Africa ,  only to realize that he or she did not address the problem  at all .
Because the water shortage may not lie in the quantity of water , but rather in the ease of access to potable water in Africa .
Hence , the first stage of the engineering design process has to be thought out carefully .
The second step is to research  the shortage of potable water .
Engineers have to understand why current technology has failed to solve the water shortage , and the oversights of engineers of the previous technology .
For example , a company has produced "LifeStraw" , a portable device that processes safe drinkable water  by removing microscopic bacteria through its filters .
Something like this may seem like a godsend to the people of Africa , but  its downfall is its cost and the problem of transportation of filtered water .
Therefore , a thorough understanding of the limitations of technology can guide engineers to invent a product that fulfills all the criteria .
The third step is to brainstorm various solutions to water shortage in Africa .
Khandani believes that engineers must be creative in this thought process .
Engineers have to develop solutions that fit the bill , adhering to the requirements of the water shortage .
Subsequently , in the fourth step , they would have to rate and outweigh all of their ideas and determine the best one to implement . 
Lastly , the fifth step is to make and test the developed technology .
This allows engineers to troubleshoot problems in the device and make changes prior to production .
This ensures the product meets expectations  .
In a nutshell ,  the five stages of engineering design introduced by Khandani can help engineers plan and develop solutions to solving the water shortage in Africa , thereby saving countless lives in dire need of safe drinking water .
Back in 1943 , while working on the secret project P-80 Shooting Star jet fighter , one of the team engineers in Lockheed Martin Corporation , Irv Curler answered a call by saying "Skonk Works , inside man Culver speaking ."
The name was soon adopted for usage in engineering , business and technical field to describe a small group of people  working on secret projects (How Skunkworks Got Its Name , par .2) .
Skunkworks have been a huge contributor for  invention for many decades .
Therefore , skunkworks drive  innovation to conventionally generated technology .
In comparison with conventionally generated technology , skunkworks have minimal management constraints .
Therefore they are often used to roll out  product research before it is developed according to usual business processes .
With minimal management constraints , inventors are given freedom to research  the area they want .
While everyone takes Macintosh as a classic example of skunkworks , Facebook was created under the same circumstances .
Facebook was started off as a small networking site for college students , which slowly extended to be the most popular global networking site With the help of a few roommates , Mark created Facebook with limited resources .
However , Mark was given the freedom to develop the program .
With no management pressure , Mark could add on any application on Facebook , which soon turned out to be the main ingredient in fueling  its success .
As mentioned , skunkworks  always lack  resources ,  .
As a start-up , Facebook didn't have the funding which its competitor , Myspace had .
As the history suggests , Myspace had everything  when they first launched , including funding .
The site was designed by the experienced eUniverse engineers(Myspace , History; par .2) .
Unlike Facebook , Myspace used its resources to push its program to the masses .
Thus , they got instant popularity in the beginning .
However , Facebook trounced Myspace recently , setting its user numbers to a record high .
It can clearly be seen that , skunkworks are no loser to conventional technology despite funding problems .
While conventionally generated technology are opened to the public , skunkworks undertake secret projects .
Before Facebook was created , Mark hacked into the Harvard School system to get the information of all the students  .
He posted the information up on a site called Facemash which paired photos of undergraduates with the visitors(Facebook , History; par .
1) .
Soon Harvard yanked Mark's connection .
Nevertheless , Mark didn't stop right there .
Instead , he scarified his sleeping time to program another program to replace Facemash , which is the Facebook we all are using today .
He started off the program alone without opening it to public before it was launced .
Myspace took a different approach to show the public what they were doing .
The underlying reason could be the confidence Myspace had over their program because of the size of their resources which Facebook didn't have .
Although there are many differences between skunkworks and conventional technology , both of them drive innovation in the same way as the other .
Despite the fact that the approaches they take are obviously different , they share the same goal , which is to innovate  future products .
Either Facebook or Myspacecan be used share information without borders .
They are competing with each other by introducing new features .
Thereby , the healthy competition between both parties should improve one another .

Since 2000 , the government has been driving Singapore towards a Knowledge-based Economy .
On one hand , much effort and funding has been put into our education system to prepare our people for the Knowledge-based Economy .
On the other hand , Singapore has always encouraged companies , regardless of their size , to do more in Research and Development (R&D) .
The reason for doing  is thatour government has realised the importance of R&D in Singapore's progress as a nation .
Although much effort and funding has been spent on R&D , some problems still exist to significantly hinder engineering design processes for innovations .
The first problem that hinders engineering design processes for innovations is the  influence of monetary profit .
The technology , which is selected to be commercialised by corporate manufacturers , must offer the greatest profits to the corporate manufacturers .
Therefore , in most cases , the technology that is selected is usually not the technology with the most advantages to the consumers , for example , the commercialisation of the humming electric refrigerator .
Around 1930 , there were two prototype refrigeratorselectric refrigerator and the the gas refrigeratorr .
Gas refrigerators did not produce the humming sound and had overwhelming advantages over the electric refrigerators .
But , the electric refrigerator was selected over the gas refrigerator because General Electric believed that larger profit could be made from the electric refrigerator .
This is understandable because the main purpose of corporate manufacturers in their investment in R&D is for profit .
Because such influence affects the commercial , diffusion and adoption stages of the engineering design process , companies will chose to promote the innovation which will bring the most profit to them and to the public .
Thus , many great innovations have been destroyed prematurely because of their lack of promotion to the public .
The second problem that hinders engineering design processes for innovations is that  Singaporeans , are not as creative as our counterparts , for example the Americans , Japanese and Taiwanese .
It is because , in the past , our education system was more exam-oriented and theoretical . .
Thus , knowledge was only applied in examinations , without applying it in real-life situations .
There was not much need and opportunity to think and act creatively .
However , in recent years , the government has been actively promoting creative thinking  .
For instance , project work in junior college will post real life problems to the students .
Thus , students are supposed to think of creative solutions to solve these problems .
Although the plans that promote creative thinking  were started years ago , it is still in its initial stage .
Thus , it will take time for the plan to take its full effect .
In conclusion , some problems may significantly hinder engineering design processes for innovations , but Singapore is trying its best to solve these problems .
In addition , in this imperfect world , engineers are always solving problems that arise to make a better world .
A problem will not last infinitely , it will be solved eventually .

The common challenges faced by  developed and developing countries are the daily demands for improvement in various areas , be it economy , infrastructure or even society .
Nation building is never easy; hence governments worldwide engage specialists , engineers in particular , for assistance .
Engineers plying their trades in Singapore , however , will face two major problems  which  are potentially critical in the future development of the city-state .
Singapore , besides being famous for its airport and most recently named as the best place for business by the World Bank , is also famous because of its size .
Hence , local engineers encounter their first major test in their quest: limited land space .
With just 647 square kilometres of land area , it has always been an essential as well as historical issue for the country's development .
Land limitation greatly reduces the range of technological advances local engineers can create in our country .
For example , lack of wide drainage areas force us to adapt building waste water reclamation plants instead , which admittedly drew ridicule from our neighbouring countries .
Despite ongoing plans to build a third plant , Singapore is still rather reliant on Malaysia for the sale of water .
Reclamation of land from the ocean was also limited due to sensitivity of border issues , thus hindering any designs that require huge spaces .
Burning of waste materials hence provide our major source of energy instead of bulky power plants .
Past engineering miracles in housing now require an upgrade in innovation and design due to the cultural shift in our society , as the younger generation now demands quality unlike the past , when the more crucial task was providing a roof for every citizen .
There is another common global issue , muchworse in Japan , and that is the ageing population crisis  .
Entry into the 21st century provides the world with a whole new set of problems: pandemic flu , terrorism and the emergence of a group of senior citizens .
Singapore has no chance of avoiding it as it also experienced a post war 'baby boom' period during the 1960s .
A new research report revealed that Singapore is set to be the world's third- fastest ageing nation , as the proportion of those aged 65 and above will double to 20 per cent in 2020 (The Straits Times , June 28 , 2008) .
Adding  to this problem , Singapore , being a small country , has always faced a talent crisis .
Low birth rates coupled with the outflow of local talent forces the government to resort to adopting a foreign talent scheme in order to increase the talent pool in the city .
An ageing population creates a new dilemma to engineers working on their designs , because they have to rebuild or edit all their past creations so as to be 'elderly-friendly' , a phenomenon unheard of during the early days of nation building .
This will be a somewhat testing task as they cannot rely on any past references in Singapore , so any designs will be a risk taken by them .
These two new obstacles in the 21st century will prove to be a huge challenge to the new generation of engineers in Singapore .
However ,  what Singapore's short history has shownis that it has faced countless daunting tasks and has proven to be up to the mark .
Therefore ,there is no doubt our engineers will strive and succeed in their tasks ahead .
Nowadays we are living infast developing world which provides not only abundant goods but also convenient and functional productions .
People's increasing desire for higher living qualities push our engineers to work on designing new things .
While , things does not get on as it seems to be .
Many negative factors exert on the processes for innovations that significantly hamper the design .
Now focus on the things in my home country , China , there are two main factors: the overflow of copying and lack of money .
The overflow of copying is a serious phenomenon especially in China .
When a famous company releases a new product , some smalproduction or just workshops will soon copy the design of the product and sell "their products" at a much lower price .

Usually customers will not discriminate the products and they consider the price as the main point .
After the great effort , the company will not receive the benefit as they wish , which will definitely cool down their desire to innovate .
Thus , the overflow of copying really hamper the processes for innovation .

Similar to the development of technology ,  innovation has become more and more important all over the world .
In order to survive and develop in the competitive world , it is crucial for not only many countries , but also  individuals to fully develop the process for innovations .
According to Rogers (2003) , there are six main stages of this process , namely the needs and problems , research , development , commercialization , diffusion and adoption and the stage of consequences .
However , in some countries there are still many problems which restrict the development of these stages .
Take China as an example , there are two main problems  hampering the development of innovation .
First of all , the education system has a big effect on the process of recognizing the problems or needs which is the fundamental stage of the innovation-development process .
It is true that the Chinese  education system excels  in laying the solid foundations of knowledge and skills which are also very important in doing  research and studies , but the lack of flexibility and creativeness of the Chinese education system is still a big problem .
As a result , many students get used to accepting  information  without thinking and investigating by themselves .
Consequently , it becomes quite difficult for them to discover  potential problems even when they try  to  .
However , Innovation requires students to develop the ability of discovering problems instead of being easily satisfied with the current situation or just following the rules .
In fact , most  famous inventions or significant scientific discoveries are based on the ability of questioning .
If Watt did not realize the shortcomings of the traditional streamer , the age of stream maybe would not have been invented so fast .
If Galileo did not challenge and had simply accepted the statements presented by Aristotle thousands of years ago , people may not have realized the nature of free fall motion for a long time .
Without the awareness of recognizing or discovering  problems , the innovation process cannot proceed smoothly .
In addition to the education problems ,  economic development is also one of the important limitations for China .
General speaking , the success of innovation needs a lot of prerequisites .
Not only  human resources , but also  financial resources have an impact on the development of innovation .
The implementation of many big projects or innovations requires large amounts of economic support .
Indeed , the economy of China is accelerating at high speed  .
However , it is really hard to meet all the needs of the rapid innovation-development  .
Compared with some developed countries , China still cannot provide large amounts of financial aid to encourage and support scientists and engineers in doing the process of research and in putting these innovations into practice .
In a nutshell , for the importance of developing the processes of innovation , it is  necessary to solve these existing problems  .
Only if China tries to minimize these potential limitations , will the innovation-development processes succeed and flourish .
