The government can start policies to make it compulsory for children to provide for their parents with the basic necessities such as housing and allowance .
Although such policies can reduce the people's dependency on the government , it may not be practical for some .
This is because some children may already have problems supporting themselves or even a new family which they started , so they may want to support their parents but are practically unable to do so .
Nevertheless , the government can be flexible with the policy such that if the children have financial difficulties they can then seek aid from them .
In recent years , many developed countries have been facing problems related to aging population , especially pressures on social support systems .
In view of the  dramatic increase in national budget spent on the aged , some people suppose that the government should limit its expenditure on the aged so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
However , from my perspective , I unhesitantly take issue with the above idea and believe that elderly people deserve public support policies , instead of boundaries on healthcare and welfare schemes .
One of the primary reasons why the government  should not set limits on public spending on older people is the aim to create a higher quality of live for almost everyone .
A society is developed  only if its citizens satisfy the minimum requirements of health , happiness , safety , prosperity , and fortunes .
And obviously , those of old age should also be provided services such as healthcare , insurance , housing . . .Thus , there is no reason for the government to eliminate its expenditure on this area while many people's lives can be improved thanks to the support .
Another factor that policy makers should consider before deciding to set boundaries on public spending on the aged is issues related to moral standards whose decline has been witnessed in recent years in many countries .
From this angle , public support policies for elderly people will make young generations change their attitude toward older people .
Improved healthcare services , subsidies . . . not only aid the aged in poor financial situations or make their health better but also are the ways people express their respect to the older , which has positive impact on enhancing younger people's treatment .
Last but not least , most elderly people after all have contributed to the development of the country during their young age through productive services as well as taxes .
Therefore , limiting public spending on them is irrational .
They deserve more support policies .
The government should not consider the rising expenditure related to programs to support a growing elderly population without mentioning their contribution in the past .
When taking into account  all the above factors , I can safely conclude that public spending on the aged should not be  limited  even though the amount of money can be used to invest on some areas like education , infrastructure and development projects .
Policy makers should find another solution to reduce the rising cost of healthcare or welfare schemes to maximize the benefits of both citizens and the nation .
As a man ages , his efficiency in both physical and mental capabilities decreases , causing many difficulties he would not have faced during his younger years .
Through current research and development , some of those problems have been eased significantly , providing a better aging experience .
In this essay , we will discuss how current research and development has helped to ease some of the issues raised by immobility , health conditions and resource management that the aged face .
Falls are one of the biggest issues caused by lowered mobility in the aged .
While individual efforts can be done to prevent falls , many of the aged are not aware of such prevention measures or they are unable to seek help if they fall despite of such efforts  .An article published by the American Academy of Family Physicians in April 2000 reported that falls caused 70 percent of accidental deaths in people aged 75 years and above .
Falls had also caused more than 90 percent of hip fractures in people aged 70 and above .
In order to address this issue , research in the wireless technology had developed a reporting solution to facilitate fall management .
A motion sensor and pager is installed in a watch and data will be sent to the database periodically .
Information which is collected includes location and motion level of the users .
Alerts can then be sent to family members who are not at home if the user is not within a designated area or haveexperienced a falling motion .
Heart diseases are frequently accompanied with old age .
Acute Coronary Syndromes (ACS) or the commonly known "heart attacks" become frequent with advancing age .
A journal published by American Heart Association in year 2003 had cited 85 percent mortality rate by ACS is of patients aged 65 years old and above .
Heart attacks can be prevented if ACS is recognised but it is not the case unless the patient and the physician are both aware of the symptoms that surfaced .
In most situations a heart attack strikes at least expected times and in most occurrences , immediate medical attention is critical to the survivability of the patient .
Arrhythmia , which is the alterations in the heartbeat , has an increased chance to surface in an aged patient who survived a heart attack .
Medical advancements such as cardiac catheterization (the opening of an occluded artery through a balloon technique) , pacemaker (a defibrillator implanted in the patient's heart to allow the heart to beat at normal pace) helps to ease some of the health conditions that are associated with old age .
A growing number of families have faced a common problem in elderly care and that is resource management .
Resource management may comprise  physical monitoring and medical records management .
Due to time constraints , some of the families employ services from nursing home or private nurses as they are unable to take care of their sick elderly .
However , not all services provided are trustworthy and satisfactory .
A news article by Telegram & Gazette (Worcester , MA) in 2007 featured  a lady who had not been properly taken care of , after the engagement of nursing services .
Research and development in Information Technology allowed resource management to be simplified .
A good example is the conversion of current medical records to technological solutions .
The majority of the solutions are designed to send reminders , the medical conditions or medical schedules to its users .
These solutions greatly reduce the need for physical presences of family members because the manual tasks are now automated .
Research and development has created many convenient and simpler methodologies to help ease the aging process .
If research and development ceased  to exist , it would be much harder to take care of the elderly as the world's aging population is expected to increase from now till 2050 .
Most developed countries are now confronted with more rapid aging in their population than the past .
As such , many countries  have started research , new development and policies to help to ease the aging process .
I agree to a great extent that such research , new development and policies will help to ease the aging process and also prepare the country with their aging population .
Countries are able to use new policy of encouraging employment of the elderly , increasing the awareness of filial obligation or creating new development of infrastructures that cater to the elderly in their country .
Firstly , countries can help to ease the aging process by implementing a  new policy  of encouraging employment of the elderly .
The government can help to achieve this by increasing the retirement age , creating more benefits and lowering barriers to employment of the elderly .
This measure will help to ease the burden of the younger generation , allow the healthy elderly to still contribute to the society and at the same time help to generate more wealth for the elderly which they can use for themselves .
Japan is one good example that uses this measure successfully .
Although the retirement age is legislated at 60 , the government of Japan encourages the elderly to continue to work up the age of 65 .
To help support the employers , the government provides grants and subsidies to the employers who employ the older workers .
Although some are prejudiced towards older workers due to their work efficiency and high salary cost , there are more benefits of employing them .
The older workers are more trustworthy , conscientious and dependable .
Other attributes include punctuality , lower absenteeism and less concern about monetary returns .
Therefore , implementing the new policy of encouraging employment of the elderly will help both economically and socially for countries with aging population .
Secondly , countries can increase the awareness of the filial obligation of its people .
It is the duty of the younger generations to display more filial piety towards their aged parents as they are the ones who took care of us during our growing up days .
They provided us with unconditional love and even paid for all our living expenses .
A society in which the children will take care of their parents will help to ease the government spending on the aging and divert the spending on other areas of the country .
In the Asian culture and belief , it is the responsibility of the children to take care of their parents when they are financially stable .
In Asian countries such as Japan and South Korea , most of the elderly still live with their adult children and can even help to cook , do house work and take care of the grandchildren .
However , contrary to the beliefs in Asian society , it is viewed as "not cool" in the western society to be living with your elderly parents when you grow up .
Living with their elderly parents will not just limit their social life , but also causes their freedom to be taken away .
Personally , I feel that this is a very selfish act .
The adult children should take this as a responsibility of their life and do it with pride .
After all , it is their parents who took care of them when they were young .
So , increasing the awareness of filial obligation will result in more children taking care of their elderly parents and help to ease the country's aging process .
Lastly , countries can ease the aging process by building new development of infrastructure in the country .
To prepare for  the growing demands of an aging population , countries can build special infrastructure , such as hospitals or apartments to cater  to the elderly .
This way , specialized and better care can be provided for the elderly .
An example will be Singapore , where the  government is building new infrastructure to prepare for  the growing demands of an aging population .
Singapore is building new community hospitals as well as linking up acute hospitals with community hospitals .
This way , patients can receive treatment at the acute hospital and then recuperate at the community ones .
Also , special apartments called studio apartments are being built for the elderly .
On the other hand , some may argue that the public spending on the aged should be diverted into other areas of the country's development .
Diverting the public spending into other areas of the country's development will cause the aging population problems to increase and hence also increases the burden of the younger generation .
As such , the public spending on building new infrastructure for the aging population should be encouraged so as to prepare countries for their aging population and ease their aging process .
In conclusion , current research , development and policy have helped to ease the aging process and prepare a country in facing the demand of an aging population .
By creating the policy of encouraging employment for the elderly , the elderly in the society will be more independent and able to support themselves .
Increasing the awareness of filial obligation will result in more adult children living with and taking care of their elderly parents .
Finally , building new  infrastructure that caters to the elderly will help a country prepare for the aging population .
In many countries , the proportion of older people is steadily increasing .
It has been shown that the world is facing the aging problem .
The growing number of older people has caused the attention of many people and countries , and it has caused many problems to the society .
So far there are many countries that have  come up with many strategies to deal with the problem .
Although we cannot solve the problem in the short run , we can ease the problem in many ways .
To a large extent , current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process .
However , we should still go on to ease the problem .
The growing number of aged people  has brought with it many problems including greater pension pressure , increasing medical expenses , and the heavy burden of nursing care for the elderly and so on .
It can slow down the productivity of the society .
It also gives more burdens on young people .
It also discourages the young people from working hard because they think they can depend on the society when they are old .
It also has great impact on health-care .
For governments , there are generally two ways to deal with the problem .
One is to reduce the future old-age dependency burden by increasing available resources , which means to increase the size and productivity of tomorrow's working-age population .
One is to rethink the private attitudes and public policies that now equate old age with a loss of health which somehow entitles the elderly to government spending .
We should do  both  to  deal with aging problem by making aging both more secure for older generations and less burdensome for younger generations .
The policy makers have found out many ways to ease the problem .
For example , the the government encourages old people to continue to work , and government encourages people to save for their old-age , and encourages young people to produce more and so on .
These policies have indeed eased the aging problem .
Without these policies , the government may increase spending on the old people or the young people will be more burdened .
For the young people themselves , they should work hard for their old-age and save to prepare for the old-age .
In this way , it can reduce the burden of the next generation and reduce the spending of the government .
Also , it can encourage people to work hard and help to increase productivity .
For example , Singapore encourages people to save for their old-age .
In the past , the old people just depend on their next generations .
This can make the old people not secure if they have no children or their children are poor .
Thus , the people can secure themselves when they are old in this way .
For the society , it can support the old people by building charity .
There are many charity funds in the society to help old people .
It can ease the aging problem without giving burden on the government and poor people .
Furthermore , it can help to distribute the property and decrease the gap between the rich and the poor .
However , some developed countries have high healthcare costs and thus aging may still impose an economic burden .
It is important to set appropriate limits on healthcare .
To do this , we should know what "health" means for an aging population .
Thus the government should decide on what is essential and should therefore be supported by the public sector , and what should be left to individuals .
Besides , different countries have different policies for their own .
Every country has its own features .
Thus one should not copy the so called paradigm of developed countries .
The developing countries may not have enough capacity to deal with the problem because they have not enough money .
The developed countries can also help developing countries to ease aging problem as it is a global problem .
It is a well known fact that the proportion of the elderly in every developed nation's population is on a rapid rise , thanks to increased usage of birth controls and past government policies .
Along with this phenomenon comes a wide range of problems such as social problems and ethical issues .
Inevitably , governments must intervene in order to curb this ageing population problem .
However , governments' intervention often meant huge spending on medical resources and infrastructure for the elderly , which created many other economic problems such as hindrance to the nation's economic progress .
Hence I agree that public spending on the aged should be reduced so that the government can use the available funds on other sectors of the society .
Reducing funding on the elderly means that the government has more capital to spend on improving their economy .
The funds could go to many different types of industries for research and development purposes .
The money could also go into building cost-saving infrastructures , hence attracting more businesses to the country .
When the economy improves , almost everyone , from the individual consumer to large multi-national companies , in the society will be able to benefit , as opposed to spending on just the elderly where only one group of people will really benefit from the funding .
For example , Singapore government spent a lot of resources to build Jurong Industrial Park so as to enhance its competitiveness in the global market , resulting in rapid increase in economic growth .
Hence governments should focus more of their resources into improving their economy , rather than spending so much of their funds on the aged .
On the other hand , critics of this notion have argued that with reduced government spending , less educated old folks and those who did not save enough would be at a severe disadvantage as compared to the rest of the population .
The government funds would not reach them at all .
These less competitive elderly people would be cut off from any benefits of economic growth .
However , this situation might not be necessarily true because if governments focus more of their funds onto the economic sector , the increase in capital as a result of rapid economic growth allows governments to create social programs for these more disadvantaged elderly people .
In the end , the main idea is that with more funds from the economic growth , governments can do so much more to help these elderly people .
Governments can also use their funds on the education sector .
Since a  large amount  of money is needed to support an ageing population , governments have to increase their own existing pool of resources in order to generate such amount of capital .
One such method is increased focus on education .
The governments could spend more on education , resulting in much better education institutions offering higher-quality education to the people .
The aged workers would benefit as well because governments could introduce educational campaigns that help subsidise skills upgrading for the elderly workers .
The population on the whole would become more skilled and hence increase their competitiveness in the global market .
The country would be able to compete more effectively on a global scale .
In contrast , aged workers , due to less governments' funding , might become even more dependent on their children .
In the end , it is still very taxing on the working population , who now not only have to support themselves and their children , but also their parents as well .
However , it can be argued that after all it is the children's responsibility to take care of their parents .
This belief is especially true in Asian countries .
Hence , governments should encourage their normal working population to bear the responsibility for taking care of their elderly parents , through social awareness campaigns .
In this way , economic growth will not be hindered and at the same time , the issue of ageing population is handled in an appropriate and ethical manner .
In conclusion , government spending is important for all sectors of the country's development .
However , there are limits on how much they can spend on each area .
Furthermore , new challenges and problems will arise in the future; hence because of these two reasons , I feel that the government should not be too focused on the ageing population issue as there might be other more urgent issues that require their immediate attention in the future .
Personally , I do agree that spending on the aged should be limited so that more money can be channelled to other areas of the country's development .
Instead of priming the spending on the aged as one of the key focus on our annual budgeting regularly , I strongly feel that the Singapore government should redefine its focus and divert its focus to other key areas such as military , urban development and education spending .
Firstly , military spending is of paramount importance to all sovereign countries like Singapore .
The adequate spending on the military aspect not only conveys a strong deterrence message to our potential aggressors , but will also instill confidence into our business partners .
The confidence that Singapore is well protected militarily ensures their continual long term presence and active involvement in shaping the country's financial establishments .
In addition , many more foreign investors may be attracted to this safe haven with the aim of expanding their dynamic business empire .
Evidently , we can see how well it is to diversify our spending , rather than just allocating a lion's share to cope with the aging problem solely .
Next , a substantial amount of the annual budget should also be set aside for urban development and education - urban development in the sense of creating a better living environment for our fellow country mates .
Throughout the past two years in the national day rallies , Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong had  reiterated the need to create a "work-live-play Singapore" .
Basically , the essence of that is to conceptualize a Singapore in which we can work , live and have fun  .
Since the Prime Minister had already envisaged a need to create a better living environment for Singaporeans ,  why not we reduce the spending on the aged and invest it on realising this wonderful concept ?
Also , Spending on education should be put on the top of the government's priorities list .
This is because unlike our neighbouring countries , which has abundant natural resources , we have only a form of natural resource , that is our people .
The Investments on our people will ensure the creation of competent personnel .
These competent people will not only ensure that we have a competitive edge over our competitors , but will also give our country a considerable leverage over our neighbouring countries .
Now , we can see in a better light how diverse spending can aid our country .
Although spending on the aged should be limited so that more money can be channelled for the county's development , we should also make sure that a reasonable portion of the  annual budget  is set aside for them .
As the saying goes , "One must never forget the hands that feed them ."
It is  indeed this group of people that had fought hard to bring Singapore to its current reputable standing in the world .
Thus , needlessly to say , it is only conscionable to allocate a reasonable sum of money to ensure that their health and well being are well taken care of .
All in all , as long as we have a definitive balance on the spending on the aged , we can achieve both taking care of them and national development .
In conclusion , we can see vividly how important it is to diversify our spending into military , urban development and education purposes , instead of just placing our top most priority on spending on the aged at the centre of the radar .
As long as their health and well being are taken care of , our priorities should be channelled to spending on other more relevant and crucial areas like military , urban development and education purposes .
As a result , this does not only aid in the nation's continual progress , but will also enable us to create a competitive edge over our neighbouring countries and also build a strong presence in the financial sector in this region .
Every country has its own strategies in development depending on its current situation .
Nowadays , as the world population is gradually aging , the governments start to adopt a new policy on  public spending .
Some people believe that "Public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the the country's development ."
To some extent , I agree that we  spend more money on education and environment since investing in country's development is also a way to invest for the elderly .
First of all , education should take a higher priority than life for the elderly as investing in education is the inevitable preparation for the next generation .
For example , many European countries such as Denmark , Sweden and Cyprus allocate nearly 7% of their GDP for public investment in education .
That money goes to modernization of schools and universities , and helps to train students better , to make them talented scientists or skillful workers .
As a result , this public investment enhances the  intellectual standards of its people , and that leads to an increase in economics as people work more efficiently with knowledge .
Consequently , the government will have more money to provide better services of the elderly care .
After all , not only the young but the old people will also benefit from the investment in education .
Second , the government should also divert the money into the environment .
Recently there have been so many symposiums talking about the earth , the climate change , etc .
Just those conferences can show us how important the environment is .
As a matter of fact , spending money for environmental improvement really brings global benefits .
For example , this could help us to preserve many beautiful natural scenes , which attract many people and thus stimulate the country's tourism .
Moreover , living in a clean and fresh environment is better for everyone's health , including the elderly .
According to a recent study done by the U .S National Institutes of Health (NIH) , environmental factors , as well as the genetic factor , contribute to the longevity and ability of avoiding severe diseases that come along with aging , such as cancer , stroke or high - pressure .
Therefore , green funds can actually offer good returns for everybody .
However , although investing for development will bring good things for the country , we should not spend 100% of the money for it .
In other words ,  we need a policy so that money can be disbursed appropriately .
Firstly , investment for the elderly is an issue of morality .
People spend their whole life working and contributing to the future of their country , so after retirement , it is time for them to rest , and elderly care is somehow the requital for what they have done for the society .
Furthermore , as the young see that the government pays good attention to the elderly , which they will become , they will know that their future is well-secured .
Correspondingly , people will work harder , and there is no doubt that the country will thrive by leaps .
In conclusion , caring about the country's future development is good , but we should never forget about the past , the people who are now not capable of supporting their own lives .
It is much better to have a suitable and balanced money distribution of public investment between elderly care and other aspects .
Population aging generally refers to the increase in the percentage of elderly people in a country .
According to the latest statistics reports , the current number of elderly people is increasing constantly at 8 million per year globally .
Due to this situation , many countries have made huge amount of public spending on the aged in order to ease the various problems that came along with it .
However , I believe that instead of focusing so much on the aging issue , it is sometimes wiser for the government to divert the money to other areas of country's development  , which include education and military .
Adherents who starkly believe that public spending should be focused on the aged often claim that the elderly people are not financially protected once they are retired from their workplaces .
However , this would be tantamount to saying that the government is responsible for "feeding" the elderly people in the country once they are unable to get any income .
This could be a huge economic burden for countries like Japan  , which has one of the highest aged populations in the world .
While in Italy , the government actually has spent a staggering 14 .2 percent of the whole nation's GDP on pension system .
However , I believe that the government should put in more resources in the realm of education .
Providing a better learning environment for the younger generation will yield a better workforce in  future  and thus bringing in more revenue for the government to spend on the elderly people .
Besides that , the burden to take care of the graying generation will also be shared by the children of the elderly people  , who may be highly educated and therefore are able to find jobs easily to support their families .
Conversely , if the country were not knowledge- based , it could hardly make any economic progress  , due to the lack of understanding of technology in development  .
Thus , this may lead to shortages in the government's annual budget for the aged .
One typical example is the Singapore government spending 20 percent of the nation's annual budget on the education system  , which is  one of the key factors that help the country to progress swiftly throughout the years .
Another reason why people support the idea of  spending on the elderly people is  that it's a natural process for everyone to age .
Therefore , taking good care of the elderly people also means securing a better future for ourselves .
However , all of them have glossed over the fact that this can only be done when we are assured of the security and safety of the whole nation in the first place .
One can imagine living in a country like Sri Lanka where people live in fear everyday because of  the never ending wars between the local army and the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Elam .
How is it possible to look after the aged when the whole nation's security is at risk ?
It is apparent that we should not compromise on the  military spending  in our pursuit of  a harmonious and stable society  .
This is also the reason why more and more countries are increasing their military spending .
In 2008 , the global military expenditure rose by 4 percent to a record of $1 .4 trillion .
Therefore , it is clear that  military development should be ranked at a higher priority when compared to  spending on the aged .
However , this does not mean that we should forgo any spending on the elderly people  .
Being the ones who have served the community over so many years , the elderly must be provided for .
Many countries like US have set aside a large sum of money to ensure the welfare of elderly people annually .
Different healthcare policies are also implemented in different countries to allow the old people to enjoy free medical services .
All of these are done as a recognition of what they have contributed to the society for the years .
In conclusion , although it is indeed necessary for the government to take care of the elderly people  , there are many other areas of development that should be looked into   , such as education and military .
Without  these developments , there's no way we can ensure that the welfare of the graying generations will be met .
Based on the results of the 2006 Census of Population of Housing on 30 June 2008 , the number of people aged 65 years and over in Australia increased by 67 ,600 people  , which represents a 2 .4% increase .
The proportion of the population aged 65 years and over has increased from 10 .8% to 13 .3% between 30 June 1998 and 30 June 2008[1] .
To take care of this issue , public spending for the aged needs to be increased .
Critics say that the spending on the aged should be limited and used for other areas of development .
I feel that military and education should take priority over the needs of the elderly ; but measures should be put in place so that the elderly can take care of themselves .
One reason that public spending on the aged should be limited is that some of it can be diverted to develop the military .
Nowadays ,  crimes such as bombing or terrorism can be happened at anytime and anywhere .
According to the World Fact Book 2008 , published by the Central Intelligence Agency , military expenditures from all over the world have increased .
Being a small country with a small population  , Singapore has limited manpower .
This is the reason why Singapore has to spend a big amount  in the military sector .
Singapore wants to improve its military defense .
That's why some of the public spending should be diverted to the military sector .
Thus , public spending on the aged should be limited and diverted to military development .
Other than that , some of public spending can be diverted to develop education .
Education  is one thing that should be prioritized .
Education can prepare the younger generation to be more skilful and productive when they're at the working-age .
Without a good  education , one cannot be as good at work  .
[3]Manali Oak (citation year)  says: "education is important as it teaches us the right behavior , the good manners thus making us civilized) .
He also says that "Education is important because it equips us with all that is needed to make our dreams come true .
Education opens doors of brilliant career opportunities" .
Hence , some of the government public spending should be diverted for education purposes to prepare the younger generations for their future lives .
Critics of my position say that public spending on the aged should not be limited because we need to take into account what the aged have done .
However , unlimited public spending on the aged could encourage the elderly to be less self-sufficient or more dependent .
If the government keeps giving the elderly money without any limit , there's a possibility that the elderly would stop to work and  depend on the government for living  .
Thus , public spending on the aged should be maintained  to prevent the elderly from becoming less independent .
To sum up , even though the aging issue is quite difficult to handle ,  public spending for the elderly should have a certain limitation .
Therefore , the elderly will be  encouraged to be independent and self sufficient .
Other than that , some of the public spending should be allocated for education  purposes  and  military  defense .
By the year 2050 , more than 1 in every 5 persons throughout the world is estimated to be aged 60 or over , while nearly 1 in every 6 is estimated to be at least 65 years old .
( The United Nation , year) As a result , aging population has been one of the focuses in recent years .
The magnitude of the issue on aging population is comparable to issues such as global warming .
At the same time , problems related to aging population have arisen and more will start to surface as time passes and this has raised certain concerns for the world .
In order to tackle  the issues that are resulted from aging populations , many researches and studies have been done  .
The developments of current researches , especially in the field of science and technology have benefitted the older population greatly  .
Hence , I agree to a large extent that  research and development has helped to ease the aging process by improving the mobility  of the elderlyand their health conditions  .
Firstly , science and technology have helped to improve the mobility  of the elderly through the inventions of various equipment that aid in their movements .
As people aged , their health conditions will not be as good as before .
For example , their limbs will get weaker , and as  a result , this will impede their mobility as they are not as agile and strong as before .
Thus ,  science and technology has come up with improved version of equipment that aid the movements of the elderly .
For example , in the past , wheelchairs were bulky and heavy .
Most of the time , the elderly need someone to push them around as their arms are not strong enough to push the wheels for their wheelchairs .
However , there are improved versions of wheelchairs now , such as the electric wheelchairs .
The development of electric wheelchairs has brought great convenience to the lives of the elderly .
As electric wheelchairs are operated using electrical , the elderly can move around on their own easily without relying on others .
Furthermore ,  there are many elegant designs of the wheelchairs .
For example , the wheelchairs are made of lighter and durable materials ,  such as aluminum .
Nowadays , the elderly can have their wheelchairs custom-made .
For example , the elderly may choose the  colours and designs of the wheelchairs .
Thus , this would enable the elderly to  accept using the wheelchair when they  need one .
Therefore ,  science and technology has eased the aging process .
In addition ,  science and technology has helped to improve the health condition of the elderly .
As one aged , their immune and functional systems will not be as strong as before .
As a result , the elderly are prone to many illnesses and physical problems , such as deafness , blindness and Alzheimer's disease .
Research has shown that in Singapore , there are 220 ,000 people who have cataract and they are aged 65 years and above .
They make up about 7% of the population .
By 2030 , it will be about 18% and this is the  consequence of a rapidly ageing population .
However , with the help of science and technology , treatments for cataract are  more accessible to the elderly and more manageable in terms of cost and  risk  .
For instance , the use of ultrasound vibration to remove cataracts through a small incision results in  faster visual recovery after surgery .
This would result in less toll on the elderly  as the wound is smaller and thus able to heal faster .
Hence , advancement in technology has increased the efficiency of operations , and thus , easing the aging process .
Among the different age groups , the elderly population is at the highest risk for adverse events , such as falling down at home .
Even a slight fall might result in  dire consequences  if they are not treated immediately .
Thus , modern technology has come up with many innovations to  prevent some possible hazards faced by the elderly .
For example ,  an alarm system at home  will alert the emergency department and their family members when  the  elderly needs help .
This alarm system is useful  for an elderly who has met with any mishap at home and when no one is around to assist him or her .
As the alarm system is directly connected to the relevant contacts ,  a press of button by the elderly would immediately transmit signal for help .
As a result , the elderly would be able to receive immediate help and treatment .
Therefore , advancement in technology has helped to ease the aging process .
However , some may argue that science and technology does not help to ease aging process .
Critics  argue that what the elderly need most is the mental support provided by their families .
Thus , they might feel depressed or lonely .
This is when family's support plays a crucial role .
However , I beg to differ .
I believe that science and technology would be able to ease the aging process to a larger extent .
Firstly , with the help of modern technology , the elderly would still be  independent   , due to the inventions such as electric wheelchair  .
This would reduce the reliance of the elderly on their families , and thus help to relieve the burden on their family members as they do not have to constantly attend to the needs of the elderly .
Although the elderly might be physically weak , they do not have to rely  on others and can still be independentand continue to lead a normal life as before .
This would indirectly lead to a healthy mindset as the elderly do not feel  that they are a burden to their families .
Also , with the help of modern technology , this would ease the workload of  families  taking care of the elderly .
Therefore , they will have more time and energy to care for  the elderly .
In a nutshell , science and technology has eased the aging process to a large extent by improving the mobility  of the elderly , such as providing  better medical treatment  for the elderly  .
With the help of science and technology , the elderly will face fewer difficulties .
They will reduce their reliance on  families  and have a better time in coping with the transitional phase of their lives .
Thus , they will enjoy their golden age .
The global aging issue has aroused public attention around the world .
Research shows that "The number of persons above 60 years or over is likely to triple , increasing from 673 million in 2005 to 2 billion by 2050" (citation) .
Everybody will get old eventually and when we grow older ,  we may suffer from some organ  or mental decline .
Some illnesses , such as vision loss , hearing loss and senile dementia , often make the elderly feel frustrated , isolated and lonely .
However ,  technology   has helped us to slow down these aging processes  in many creative ways .
" Visual disorders and diseases increase dramatically as we age" (citation) .
Research shows that "one in six adults aged 45 reported some type of vision impairment" (citation) .
These vision impairments often cause troubles in people's daily lives .
However ,  technology has implemented various innovative solutions to help people solve these problems and many users find them very useful in their lives .
For example , a device called "Pocket Viewer" is designed to help old people with long-sighted problem .
The device takes videos of the contents , enlarges and displays them on the screen in real time .
It is so light and handy that users can put it into their pockets and take it along with them wherever they go .
Some other smart products that I would like to mention here are the "Tek Partner TV Partner Remote" and "Accenda Voice Activated" .
Both devices are able to work with TVs and VCRs .
The former remote controller has larger buttons and the words on it are printed in bigger fonts than the usual  ones .
The idea is to simplify the design as much as possible so that the elderly who have low vision problems will find it easy to use .
The latter is more straight forward .
It doesn't even require the user to press any button .
To activate it , one simply gives it a voice command .
The commands are customizable and can be stored in the device .
One of the customers , Anita Clevenger in Sacramento , CA United states , bought this device for her mother who was 91-year-old and almost blind .
After using it for a few months , her mum found it very useful and gave a good feedback on it(author , year) .
Technology can help the elderly with their hearing problem as well .
Hearing loss is probably another common disease which can be found among the elderly .
Reasons that led to hearing loss vary; they could be "birth-related" , or because of infections , injuries , and being exposed  frequently to loud noises for a long period of time .
Once an old person catches such diseases , or her life would turn out to be very inconvenient .
However , engineers can create diverse tools using technologies to  help the old in their daily lives .
One significant problem occurs when they need to make a phone call  .
In fact , some research show that many old people with hearing difficulties do not use the phone at all because they are not able to hear  clearly .
Thus , companies such as "Clarity" , implemented the "Ameriphone amplified cordless phone" .
Its most important feature is to make " sounds much louder , clearer and easier to understand" (citation) .
These amplifier attachments in the telephones also allow users to adjust the volume according to their needs .
Other common techniques used to alert the users are vibration and flash-lights .
"Bed Shaker" and "Doorbell Signaler" are probably two of the most useful devices using the technique mentioned above .
A bed shaker can be designed to work with the telephone to provide alert  .
It can be placed not only under the pillow , but also under the cushion; and  it can  be portable .
Elizabeth A .Smith who is 75-year-old and deaf in one ear said that the "Bed Shaker" had provided a lot of  convenience to her as she is  a deep sleeper .
A "Doorbell Signaler" uses sound and light system to alert the user when there is a visitor .
It can be installed at any location in the house ,  so that  old people can see it easily .
Technologies  can also be applied to prevent senile dementia among the elderly .
One of the most innovative ideas is to create special video games  for the old people .
As we all know , our brains need constant stimulations to remain active .
A study done by psychologist and neuroscientist Helena Westerberg(citation) shows that older adults with an average age of 65 are able to "reach the same level of working memory" as younger adults with an average age of 25 , after they have been through a series of memory training on computer for 5 weeks (citation) .
This inspires game-developing companies to design videos games for the elderly .
Computer games such Wii game "BOOM BLOX" are relatively popular among the old people in some countries such as Japan and Britain .
Millions of people aged over 45 years old believe that taking up brain training through video games are the secret to a happy and healthy old age (citation) .
And such training is "said to improve mental agility , slow the onset of dementia and Alzheimer's disease " (citation) .
In  other words , playing games like Wii regularly is likely to help the elderly retain their abilities to do multiple tasks , exercise their brains and boost their thinking .
Global aging has become a worldwide issue that many developing  and developed countries are facing , or probably will face in the future .
However , we should always believe that technology will help  to ease the aging process and , eventually lighten the burden on the state .
Many countries experience population aging .
It seems to be a natural consequence of economic development , which extends lifespan and lowers birth rates .
This  phenomenon is most obvious in Japan , where 22 percent of its population is  aged 65 and older .
Hence , aging has becoming a popular issue that everyone is concerned about today .
Some of the common aging effects include changes in sensory , perceptual , motor  and  cognitive functions .
The current state of science and technology is able to diminish aging effect of the aging population and enhance their living so that they can enjoy  their twilight years .
It is  undeniable that being healthy and looking young  are the common  dreams of many elderly .
With the advancement of science and technology  , this dream can be brought much closer to  reality .
Firstly , common aging effects such as wrinkles , hair loss and weight issues can be countered to a certain level with the current state of technology .
This can be done by either plastic surgery or  manipulation of hormones   .
This is because hormone levels  have influence over metabolism levels , which in turn influence the effects of aging .
For instance , a new wrinkle reducer named Dysport  works  the same way as Botox in relaxing the facial muscles that caused wrinkles .
On top of that , to fight hair loss and thinning , a product called Revivogen , which is a dermatologist-formulated solution , was introduced to the market aiming at people aged 40 and above .
Secondly , advancement in science allows the elderly to enjoy a healthier life .
Scientific research can be made to deliver solution as well as  alternatives to ease the aging process .
For example , studies have shown that just as a child's nutritional requirements differ in quantity and quality from an adult's , the nutritional needs of the elderly also differ from the younger adults .
Therefore , Dr . Robert M . Russell , a professor of medicine and nutrition at Tufts University in Boston and his colleagues at the Department of Agriculture's Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging at Tufts , Dr . Alice Lichtenstein and Helen Rasmussen , have developed a revised food guide pyramid for Americans over 70 .
If the elderly followed the  the new food pyramid , they could get healthier  .
To sum up ,being healthy and looking young are important to the elderly because this is how they can live with confidence and satisfaction  .
Technology can provide a means for the elderly to have a more enjoyable life .
Their free time can be better spent in a  meaningful way .
Firstly , technology introduces a wider variety of entertainment for the elderly to choose from .
Due to the booming of the media and gaming industry , many sophisticated technological inventions are penetrating the market and becoming more affordable and ubiquitous .
This is unlike the 1970s when old people normally led a monotonous life  , such as  listening to the radio or reading the newspapers to kill their  time .
Today , with many technological inventions such as television , gaming consoles , and karaoke becoming widely available , the elderly have a wider range of options for entertainment .
Moreover , they are more willing to spend money on these devices because they  attract their  relatives to visit them  .
In fact , this makes the home livelier and merrier .
Secondly , the elderly can now expand their social networks beyond the neighborhood by means of using the internet , which is a fruit of technology  .
They are no more confined to the  area around their houses  , but are able to venture into the outside world .
In America , statistics (citation) has indicated that 45% of the senior citizens aged 70-75 are now online , meaning that the internet has become a channel for the elderly to connect to the outside world .
In addition , they enjoy mixing with other people  , especially with the youngsters via virtual communities such as facebook , flikr , and Del .icio .us .
Therefore , their lives will not be boring  because they can make friends on the internet .
The advancement of  technology also enables the elderly to be more independent and  perform activities that they like .
This is unlike the past when they are considered a burden to the family because of  the considerable amount of effort  needed to look after them .
Firstly , with the aid of technology , senior citizens can enjoy more mobility  , and they can go wherever they like  .
They are no longer confined in the house by their family  , who may want to ensure their safety .
With a handheld device like a mobile phone with the integrated Global Positioning System(GPS) feature , they are less likely to get lost in the cities  .
There are cars designed for  the wheelchair-bound or those with difficulty walking , like the Toyota Motor Corp .'s Welcab series .
Secondly , the elderly can look after themselves or even take care of the household chores .
This is because they are aided by artificial intelligence or technological innovations .
In Japan , where 22 percent of its population are aged 65 and older ,  a care-technology market has emerged and it is worth $1 .08 billion in 2006(citation) .
One  example is the "muscle suits" developed by the Tokyo University of Science , which keeps the elderly active by providing support for the upper body , arms , and shoulders .
This eliminates the needs for maids or family members to look after the elderly and monitor their every single movement , which in turn spare some dignity for the elderly .
Clearly , the aging process can be eased by current research and development .
Negative effects of aging can be diminished to  a large extent with the help of  science and technology .
It is possible that in  future , aging effects can be diminished to so low a level that the elderly could enjoy healthy and fulfilling lives into their twilight years , without being a heavy burden on their children and grandchildren .
Nowadays , many countries are facing  the problem of a fast aging population .
As a result , public spending on the aged will increase and eat into the spending of other areas of a country's development .
However this does not solve the aging issue in the long runand in fact it will hinder the progress of a country .
Therefore  , for a developed or developing country , public spending on the aged should be limited , and diverted to other areas of development  .
The most important area should be , education , as education helps  people to acquire the necessary skills needed for work .
With an educated workforce , the country will be able to ask for better wages for their citizens and hence increase their standards of living .
For  example ,  Singapore , at the beginning of  nation building , viewed education as one of the priorities  .
This  not only increases the level of skills of the workforce , but also brings women into it .
As a result , it creates a disciplined and cohesive society that benefits everyone .
Furthermore education also helps the aged to acquire new skills which enable them to work even at  old age .
Another important area would be the environment .
Earth's average temperature has increased dramatically over the past few years and this results in an increase in the public's awareness awareness of global warning  .
Building a greener environment to protect our planet becomes the objective of many countires .
In the long run , it will not only benefit the current population but also the future one .
For  example , Iceland has replaced its energy sources from coal and oil to geothermal and hydropower for decades .
This has helped to eliminate the amount of greenhouse gas emission and hence reduced air pollution to the environment .
As a result ,  their citizens are able to enjoy fresher air , which means that they will be healthier at  old age .
The last area that this essay is going to cover is the military development of a country .
With increasing terrorist activities around the globe , the ability to keep a country safe and stable has become an important issue .
Without security there can be no economic development .
Conversely , stability and security will be jeopardised without economic development .
By achieving security and economic stability ,  a country will be able to exist .
For  example , Singapore has always believed that National Service is important in keeping the country safe .
It  protects our country from external threats and  brings foreign investment into our country .
Only then will Singapore be the safe for everyone to live in .
In conclusion , public spending on the aged will only benefit a minor group of people and slows down the country's progression .
Therefore , in order to benefit everyone in the country  , there is a need to divert the money into other areas for the country's development .
A report from the United Nations predicts that there will be an increase in the proportion people over 60 years old from 10 per cent in 2000 to 21 per cent in 2050 .
Accompanied by the decline in the proportion of the young , by 2050 , the number of older persons in the world will exceed the number of young for the first time in history by 2050 (author , year) .
This trend  is largely irreversible and is presenting countries with  opportunities and challenges .
Every country needs  Fortunately , many advanced policies and technologies are now helping the elderly to  ease the aging process and to become a useful workforce for society .
Many economic schemes are being implemented to help the elderly deal with financial problems .
The increasing  population of the elderlyhas a significant impact on economic growth , investment and consumption .
However , many countries are on the right track in dealing with the problem  , by adopting some schemes like pension plans  .
For example , almost all the old people in Canada are receiving income from Canada's public pensions--- the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) and Old Age Security (OAS) .
Together , the CPP and OAS provide a modest base upon which Canadians can build their retirement income (author , year) .
Another example is  Great Britain's new strategy , "Building A Society For All Ages" which  extended the retirement age to beyond 65 .
Minister for Pensions and the Ageing Society Angela Eagle said that this new policy will help  old people to save enough money for their retirement (author , year) .
This policy will give  older people a chance to work longer and contribute to the society .
The healthcare systems are  improving to meet the need of the elderly .
Statistics from The Center for Disease Control (USA) shows that "88% of those over 65 years of age have at least one chronic health condition; nearly 40% of deaths in America can be attributed to smoking , physical inactivity , poor diet , or alcohol misuse; and almost 20% of older Americans suffer from a mental disorder that is NOT part of normal aging"(author , year) .
Long-term healthcare has become a vital need for old people .
Many counties are paying more and more attention to the healthcare system as the proportion of the old population increases .
For example , the United States  spends more money on heath care than any other nation in the world .
It spends approximately 15 .3% of GDP and the spending is expected to reach 19 .5% of GDP by 2017 (author , year) .
About 97% of older American are benefiting from healthcare system through health insurance like Medicare(citation) .
Being covered by healthcare insurance has become critical for old people  , especially those with disabilities and chronic illness associated with aging .
Many People suffer from sensory impairment as they grow older .For instance , 28% of people aged 65 and above have difficulties with their eyesight , 55% of people aged 60and above are deaf or hard of hearing(author , year) .
Nowadays ,  these problems can be solved with just some small devices .
For example ,  devices like hearing aids are a solution for the elderly with hearing loss problem .
It  can be really small to be noticed .
Another useful device for  old people suffering from vision problem is PocketViewer .
The PocketViewer is a portable solution for older people to read , write and see and it uses a miniature video camera to transfer and enlarge the text and images from a page to the screen(author , year) .
Many others devices are now also helping the elderly to lead better lifes .
The unprecedented demographic changes are transforming the world .
The consequences of anaging population present both opportunities and challenges for all nations .
Many nations are achieving successes to help the elderly to become  a useful part of society .
There is an observation made by Morrow Bourne: "Age is a prison from which we cannot escape" .
Indeed , aging is a natural process that everyone will experience  .
Due to the effects of aging , some  people may suffer from  .
As people are a country's most precious resource , the government should help its people when they are suffering from ageing problems .
In recent decades , many countries have invested a certain amount of money in areas such as science and technology , to develop new products such as  iShoe  and big button TV remote control that would help the elderly .
I certainly agree that these developments have greatly helped to ease the aging process .
With the help of technology , scientists have created an intelligent system that helped the elderly to remember everyday tasks (An Intelligent System Helps Elderly Or Memory-impaired To Remember Everyday Tasks , 2009) .
"Research has shown that aging may affect memory ,  changing the way the brain stores information and  making it harder to recall stored information"  (Memory Loss With Aging) .
Consequently , older people will forget things more easily .
For instance , some of the elderly may be unable to recall some  daily activities such as taking medicine , bringinalong with them their cell phones or keys when they are leaving the house .
to solve these problems , a team of researchers have created a system that  ususes  sensors to identify human actions and  mobile devices to remind the elderly to perform daily activities (An Intelligent System Helps Elderly Or Memory-impaired To Remember Everyday Tasks , 2009) .
As a result , they are able to carry out their everyday tasks as usual .
One of the graduate students from Harvard-MIT Division of Health Sciences and Technology has developed an iShoe that prevents the elderly from falling (HO , 2008) .The iShoe contains a device that measures and records human movements .
In addition , it helps to stimulate the feet and alert the elderly when they lose their balance .
Using these data , the elderly can look for a doctor for early diagnosis .
Therefore , their balance can be improved and they are able to lead a better life .
Tek Partner , has invented a big button TV remote control to help elderly who have visual problems (Aging and Technology Research , 2005) .
Research has shown that  older people will experience some common visual problems such as tearing , floaters and glare (Aging and Technology Research , 2005) .
Consequently , they are unable to focus and see objects clearly .
With  large size of buttons , older people are able to see and operate the control without any help  .
To conclude , science and technology have help in developing products  to ease the aging process .
For instance , the intelligent system is invented to help the elderly to remember their daily tasks .
This is because as people get older , they will forget things more frequently .
Therefore , they need a system to remind them to perform certain activities .
iShoe , is another product that is developed using science and technology to prevent the elderly from falling down .
It helps to monitor human movements and provides a warning if any balancing problem is found .
As a result , the elderly can improve their balance by approaching the balancing specialist earlier .
Lastly , a big button TV remote control is created to help seniors who are unable to see certain images clearly .
With the help from the control , they are able to operate the television , VCD and DVD player independently .
In conclusion , the elderly are able to lead a better life with the help of all these products .
For  the past 44 years , Singapore has made drastic changes to the layout of our buildings and many of these commanding buildings symbolize our country's success .
For instance , the unique "durian" appearance of the Esplanade gives our small city a distinct sky-line and becomes one of the main tourist attractions in Singapore .
However , Singapore is facing a rapidly ageing population with a rise in median age from 20 in 1970 to 37 in 2009; there is a need to improvise our buildings' architecture using current technology to ease the aging process .
Government spending on investment in architectures for the aged has increased tremendously over the  , so as  to build a friendly environment for elderly to live .
A good example is the LUP (Lift Upgrading Program) , which ensurensures that all apartment blocks , including the older buildings built before 1990 , will have lift access to all storeys by year 2014 .In the past , this project is not feasible due to the high costs involved  .
Nonetheless , with our present advanced architecture technology and economic status , lifestyle for the elderly can be improved to a  large extent .
It is also  significant to create a barrier-free environment for the increasing ageing population in Singapore .
The elderly  with crutches have difficulties climbing up and the stairs; therefore , it is  impossible for the wheelchair bound the elderly to move out from their houses .
Obstruction-free walkways are built to connect various districts within the the neighborhood .
of Accessibility to all the facilities in neighborhoods is enhanced with the distribution of ramps throughout the vicinity  .The elderly and the  disabled could move around comfortably because the gradient of the ramps is design in such a way that even without the help of a second party , elderly will also be able to move up and down freely  .
At block level ,  lifts are improvised to stop at every storey  and additional features such as the widening of  the lift door for wheelchairs and the lowering of  handrail bars for elderly to grip on for support are included  .
These architecture advancements are frameworks of the 5-years Barrier-Free Accessibility (BFA) Upgrading Program  .
The BCA (full name of BCA) invested $40 million Accessibility Fund into this program in  2007 .
It aimed to transform Singapore into an elderly friendly and barrier-free environment for the elderly  in the near future . 
Improvements in the architecture of the external environment are essential in boosting  the physical and mental development  of  the elderly .
Elderly who are prone to illnesses need sensory stimulation and exercises to maximize their mobility .
A study has shown that outdoor parks and regular exercises have therapeutic effects on the elderly in improving their health and wellness , as well as  increasing their muscle strength and stimulating  their spiritual developments .
Within housing estates , elderly wellness stations and community gardens are built under the MUP (Main Upgrading Program) to promote healthy living among elderly residents .
There is a wide variety of exercise equipment at the elderly wellness station and pebble walks are also available .
Since elderly have brittle bones , more resting areas with lower benches have also been built to cater to their needs .
These  recreational outdoor facilities are being built extensively to create a better living environment  for the ageing population .
"Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternative" , said Maurice Chevalier (citation) .
Indeed ,  we are actively implementing various architectural developments and policies  to meet the special needs of the aged .
To raise awareness of the importance of "shaping a safe , sustainable and friendly environment" (citation) for people of all ages , a BCA Universal Design Award was introduced in  2007 to promote barrier-free accessibility in our environment .
With these improvements , we are one step closer in building a totally barrier-free healthy environment where the elderly can travel around freely and safely in absolute comforts .
According to the U .S . Census Bureau  , the average rate of people turning 65 years old in 2000 was 795 ,000 each month .
In 2008 , the figure increased to an average of 870 ,000 monthly .
This rate has increased by 9% in just a short period of 8 years and is expected to rise at a higher rate as the first group of baby boomers who were born between 1946 to 1966 moved into the category of elderly in two years' time .
As humans age , their five senses deteriorate gradually .
Among the five senses , the  common deterioration  are those of vision  and hearing  .
Hence , recent technological inventions ,  such as assistive technologies for sight or hearing can in fact ease the elderly in their aging process , making their aging symptoms more manageable .
Vision problems such as presbyopia (a condition whereby the ability to focus and see objects that are near is impaired)  , and cataracts (a condition whereby the vision is affected by the clouding of the lens in the eyes)  are common among aging people .
Being unable to see well may be dangerous a the elderly would not know whether there are obstacles in front of them , which could lead to falls .
Firstly , the development of lens optics improved greatly after the first wearable glasses were introduced by Salvino D'Armate in 1284 .
The improvement in lens development has allowed presbyopia , as well as myopia (near-sightedness) and hyperopia (far- sightedness) ,  corrected using spectacles equipped with convex lens  .
This  in turn assists the elderly to see better while reading or doing tasks which required close  focus .
For elderly with both presbyopia and myopia or both presbyopia and hyperopia , recent improvements in lens optics have resulted in the creation of  bifocals lens (convex and concave lens combined into a single lens)  , which  allow the elderly to have both their presbyopia and myopia or both their presbyopia and hyperopia to be corrected .
Secondly , with vision- assisting technology such as PocketViewer , the elderly can capture an image of any item or text they wish to magnify .
Lastly , for elderly who have serious vision problems like near-blindness or blindness , there are softwares like Talking Cellphone Accessibility 2 with voice-activated commands to allow even people who are completely blind to use a mobile phone 8 .
Hence , the  vision sight assistive or replacement technologies helps the elderly  to see better and  do simple tasks  .
Another condition that is common in aging people is presbycusis , which is more commonly known as hearing loss .
Hearing loss related to aging is nerve- related  , and it is caused by damage to the inner ear .
Without being able to hear clearly , the elderly cannot hear emergency horns when they are crossing the road and  they cannot enjoy simple pleasures like watching the television .
Moreover , it would be difficult for them to communicate with their loved ones .
However , hearing loss  can be helped using hearing aids ,  which are readily available in the market .
There are many kinds of hearing aids such as behind-the-ear or  in-the-ear type  , as well as   bigger models such as the walkman look-alike type that are hung around the waist .
As technologies advance , hearing aids  are getting smaller  , to the extent that  it can be hidden in the ear canal .
This allows the  elderly   to use an inside the ear-canal- type if they felt conscious of the hearing aids .
For example , Sonic Listener is a type of wired amplifier that is to be hung around the waist with the ear phone connected directly to the amplifier .
Also , if wireless is preferred , there is also the TV headset which can also be used as a hearing aid .
The wireless type would be less restrictive as there are no wires from the amplifier connected to the ear phones .
Moreover , there are also other devices that do not amplify sounds but rather  make use of other senses such as touch and sight .
One such example is the Bed Shaker , which vibrates when the phone rings or when the alarm sounds , which  can be used under the pillow when sleeping 11 .
Another example is the Doorbell Signaler which flashes light from the device when the doorbell is being pressed 12 .
Thus , even with  hearing problems , the elderly can still make use of the available hearing assistive technology to help them in their daily tasks .
There are also times when technologies create  troubles for the elderly .
As we move into the technological age , where computers and other devices flourish in every home and office , the elderly would have problems trying to use such devices .
For example , in the National Library , books to be borrowed were to be scanned at the checkout counter .
However ,  it would be very difficult for the elderly to learn how to use new devices without the  from others .
In addition , working elderly are also being easily replaced  machines that can do menial jobs like cleaning  .
One such example is the Eurolab Auto Vacuum Intelligent Cleaner which has wall sensors and can be controlled from a distance .
Employers may be tempted to replace the elderly floor cleaner who may be slow in cleaning  .
How would the employer not be tempted to dismiss the elderly floor cleaner when the price of owning the machine for one year is much cheaper than the annual wages of the elderly cleaner ?
Therefore ,  not every product that is being invented would help the elderly  in the aging process .
In sum , with the help of advanced technologies , the elderly can counter their  sight and hearing loss and  live independently  .
This would help the elderly to feel less depressed and frustrated  .
With the advancement of  Information Technology , many devices have been developed to help the aged , especially those with healthcare problems and are home-bound or have difficulties moving about ,  .
These devices make an impact in their lives by providing them an alternative to ease their problems .
Hence , I agree with the statement to a large extent .
Developments in Information Technology help to monitor the health conditions of the aged without having themthem leaving their homes .
For instance , the  the Visiting Nurse Services of the Northwest , a homecare organization in Spain ,  allows patients to monitor their vital symptoms and send these data back to the nursing home over phone line or satellite  .
The  nurse working in the homecare organization would review the information and  call the patient to tell them about their conditions .
Monitoring programs that make use of technology like the one used by Visiting Nurse Services of the Northwest ease the burden of the elderly having to go to the clinic and also save the trouble for the aged to go through the procedure of medical examination .
In addition , there is a computer program in the US  called The  Technology Coach that helps the aged to simplify  the complex procedure on checking their vital symptoms  , such as taking measurement of the glucose level on a step-by-step basis .
The Technology Coach can even identify  errors  during the procedure and notify them on their mistakes .
These computer programs allow the aged to be independent as they do not need to rely on caregivers anymore .
Besides monitoring programs , there are also devices that helped the aged to remember things  as their memory may deteriorate with old age .
One of the devices is the "memory mirror" developed in the US .
This is a computer program that will remind the elderly of the time to take their medicine , and  the type of medicine to take .
It also uses radio frequency identification technology to allow the aged to keep track of the number of times that they have taken their medication and also the type of medicine they have already taken .
If the aged has taken the medication , it will be shown visually of the computer screen  .
The data will be recorded in the history logbook on the computer .
This is a very useful tool for the aged  , whose memory have deteriorated because of old age .
Nearer to home , Information Technology has revolutionized how the aged communicate with other people .
With the computer and the Internet being readily available  , the elderly can communicate with their families at anytime and anywhere in the comfort of their homes .
The aged who have their family members worked overseas can communicate with them  using web camera .
There is also the Internet chatting system like Windows Live Messenger that allowed them to communicate with their families and friends at anytime .
There are also "video chats" , "forums" and "weblogs" to allow them to  make friends with other aging people and  to express and voice their opinions  .
The Internet also allows the aged to  obtain and learn about information  at their preferred pace .
Thus , with Information Technology , the aged no longer would to be lonely even when they are homebound .
According to an interview with Leonid A . Gavrilov , Ph .D for the Journal of Anti-Aging Medicine () , the aging process is defined as "any process , which contributes to age-related decline in performance , productivity and health .'
Over the years , research and development specifically in the field of technology has made significant contributions to address this process of increased inconvenience .
Although critics of this position point out that technology is still short of significantly slowing aging , current research and development has to a large extent eased this process and made life easier through the introduction of technological inventions .
This essay will discuss the impact of some of these technological inventions and how it helps the aging population cope with their decline performance , productivity and health .
Certain objections must , of course , be considered .
One may argue that older people are forgetful and are not able to learn new things .
Also , with the advances of technology , it is impossible for the older people to learn the complex nature of new technology such as using the text messaging function of a mobile phone .
However , this argument is flawed .
Aging does not affect our ability to learn .
Although it might take an older person a longer time to learn , the cognitive function does not decline with age .
While an older person might have " some difficulty with short-term (working) memory" as cited by James Pirkly ,  "long-term memory generally remains sound ."
Also , although technology itself is complex in nature , there are technological inventions tailored for the older people and we will take a look at two of this technology .
Firstly , the current technology of mobile phones and personal device assistance (PDA) has in a lot of aspects contributed in addressing issues arising from health and decrease performance in terms of mobility .
These devices (mobile phones and PDAs) have various functions and applications that assist the user to complete daily essential tasks that are made difficult due to aging .
The quick dial function allows the elderly to seek emergency or medical help promptly with just a press of a button .
This ensures that the elderly are attended to when they are alone at home and suffer a fall or have any other injuries that need attention .
The global positioning system (GPS) function that are found in certain devices allow loved ones to keep track of the elder's movement and if the elderly gets lost , the loved ones are just a call away .
Applications such as the Baycreast's Memory-Link Program that can be installed on a PDA have functions to set time-based alerts and snapped photos to aid the elderly in remembering important details .
These applications and functions amongst many are easily available on the market and are there to ultimately help the elderly age in the comfort of their own home .
Secondly , the technological invention of Med-eMonitor , a device  helps the old to differentiate the various prescription drugs and when exactly to take it .
Managing the different drugs that often look similar in appearance is a challenge for the elderly .
With their ever-worsening eyesight and memory loss , this device seeks to help ease that burden .
This device has different compartments to store different medication and each compartment has its own unique time reminder system with instructions .
When it is time for the elderly to take a particular medicine , a musical chime will be played .
When an elder opens that compartment , text instructions are displayed clearly on an LCD screen .
