If the musical chime is not attended to , the device can place a phone call to family members or care givers .
Current research and development particularly in the field of technology has in a huge way helped the elderly cope with the demands of aging .
The 2 types of  that are mentioned in this essay are amongst many that facilitate the old in handling age-related decline in health , performance and productivity .
As technology continues to advance , more tasks can be done and aging will soon be considered a transition rather than a problem .
I do not agree with the statement that suggests "public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development" .
Aging issue has been a very serious problem that most of the countries , especially developed countries , are now facing .
It is expected that in future , this issue will be more severe .
To minimize the impact of it , a few suggestions have been proposed .
They are increasing money spent on the elderly; cut benefits; or cut other government spending .
From these solutions proposed , it is very obvious that money spent on the elderly currently is predicted to be sufficient to cover their needs anymore .
By limiting the money spent on this group of people , it means that lesser amount of money will be used to share among those who depend on the public spending to live .
This shows that the suggestion is not going to work as it will cause  problems for the elderly who depend on public s .  At the same time it not help to solve aging issues .
Besides , there is other option available other than cutting the spending on the elderly in order to have more money for other developments .
Cutting down spending on the elderly will only increase the seriousness of the aging issues .
Over the years , journalists and scholars have been publishing articles regarding how public spending on the elderly are rising and will be increasing in the future and the consequences of it .
They think that this will become a financial burden for the young generation and working adults , who will be contributing to the public spending .
It is normal that tax-payers are very concerned on how policy makers make decisions on how their hard earned money is pent and whether the policy makers are making full use of the money .
Hence , more and more people are suggesting diverting the money to other areas of development , which they think is beneficial to them as compared to spending on the aged .
But , this is definitely not a good suggestion because I believe that the government should always put their people as the first priority when making decisions .
If they were to ignore the needs of the elderly and focus on the development , it will obviously bring more social problems to the society .
Furthermore , this aging population is very much dependent on the public spending to cover their daily needs , more importantly their medical expenses .
They  usually have low income level or are below poverty level .
Daily expenses and medical needs might become a burden for them .
I believe this is one of the reasons why most of the  refuse to see a doctor and accept medical treatment when they are ill because they think that it is a waste of money .
Without the help from public spending , they might face financial problems in order to maintain their living and health condition .
Illnesses and various diseases  always seems to attack the old people as this group of people are weaker compared to other age groups .
It will be more worrying if they need special or long term medical treatment that might be too costly for them to handle .
Other than cutting the spending on the elderly , there are other ways divert more money for other development plans .
As for the United States government , they divide the spending to five sectors , which are pension , health , education , welfare and defence .
Due to falling birthrates , I believe it is possible to reduce public spending on education .
Low birthrate means that there are lesser students in future , and also , parents to kids' ratio will be higher .
These two factors will be two very good reasons to cut down spending on the education sector .
From the all the reasons mentioned above , it is very clear that cutting down public spending for the old age is not a good choice in order to divert the money for the areas of development .
The group of elderly people is getting bigger which tells us that the current policy is not applicable anymore in the future as there will be more demand from the elderly .
In order to have more money for other areas of development , one of the ways is to reduce other sectors of public spendingsuch as  education , for example .
So , the suggestion to cut down spending for the old age people is not a good solution to use the money for other areas of development .
Global aging is also known as demographic  .
Population aging has become a typical issue  these days .
The economy growth of the country will be affected when there are less people who  contribute to the country .
The National budgets and economies will come under pressure as growing numbers of elderly persons are supported by relatively fewer younger persons .
The simulation effect indicates that the changes will have a major impact on rates of national saving and real wage rate .
To deal with such challenges , the government has created many policies to overcome this issue .
Firstly , the elderly are encouraged to work for longer periods Social policies , practices and attitudes discourage working at an older age because the retirement for the elderly will be costly for firms .
By having less restriction from the company , the elderly will also easily  suit  the job scope .
The "Age-friendly" policy of setting wages and employment practices has  ensured that the employers have strong incentives to hire and retain old workers .
Moreover , the amount of government incentives , for example the Central Providence Fund Board (CPF) in Singapore will be enough for them to live independently after the retirement  .
By having this policy  , older workers have become people who contribute to the society and not a  a burden of country .
For instance , The Singapore government encourages the university educated or professionally qualified mother to have at least 3 or more children by giving tax rebates of $20 ,000 or more .
On the other hand , the government has begun to provide a subsidy of $100 for employed mothers when their 3th preschool children is placed in approved full day child care centers .
There are also unrecorded leave for mothers to take care of the sick children .
The "three , if you can afford it" policy  has increased the total population of Singapore citizens and has allowed the population of the country to younger .
Lastly , filial obligation is also one of the methods to decrease the negative impact of fast-aging population .
Some moral western philosophers believe that adult children do not have any moral obligation to support their aged parents .
The sacrifice that the parent made for them in the past is compulsory for every human being in the West .
This is so because the children do not ask to be brought into this world .
Thus , the traditional filial obligation of taking care of the elderly is left as either the responsibility of the elderly themselves or as a societal burden of the public .
On the other hand , in eastern countries the grown children , who started working in the society have to take care of their parents .
Most of them have a mindset that it is a must to give back the things that their parents sacrificed for them .
These circumstances  cause the long-term care costs provided by the western government increase sharply .
To overcome this situation  western countries such as the United States have to learn from Asian countries like Japan and China where  this 'moral responsibility' as well the fact that the elderly still stay with their grown are still being practised . .
In the long term  , the increase of the aging population will lower  the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the country .
The government has to take this issue seriously before it affects the eeconomic growth of the country .
Before the leaders take effective action ,  .

The  population in Singapore is aging rapidly .
According to a report on aging population by Committee on Ageing  , the number of residents aged 65 years or older will increase from 300 ,000 to 900 ,000 by the year 2030 (Balaji , 1999 .
It is expected for the aging population to continue increasing for the next few years .
Since  the government introduced the  campaign "Stop at 2" to control the high birth rate , it was too successful that the population decreased due to the overwhelming  positive responses by the citizens .
This has led to  more and more elderly living in this society .
Therefore , the government has been promoting active aging to help the elderly to engage in a healthy and happy lifestyle .
Thus , I agree to a large extent that the "policies have helped to ease the aging process ."
Different types of policies have been introduced to improve the welfare of the elderly so that they are able to benefit from it .
One of the policies that has been introduced is the housing policies such as lift upgrading , elderly fitness corner and studio apartments .
Firstly , the government has implemented the lift upgrading program to build new lifts in  housing blocks which have direct access to every floor to cater to the elderly residents who have painful legs and who are wheelchair bound .
According to Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong s the old lifts have been replaced with the new lifts which previously only stopped at every third or fourth floor (Lee , 2009 .
With the newly upgraded lifts ,  more convenience to the elderly is provided
Secondly , elderly fitness corners are built to cater to the elderly to exercise more in order to lead a healthy lifestyle .
They are strongly encouraged to use the facilities at the fitness corners to do a light workout to improve their health conditions .
Having regular exercises helps to prevent any chronic diseases such as high blood pressure and heart disease from attacking the elderly ( , 2009 .
Besides exercising , the elderly are also able to interact with their  , thus widening  their social network .
Through a healthy and active lifestyle  the elderly  are able to live longer and stay free from illness (Balaji , 1999 .
With that , they are able to return  to work and continue to contribute to the society .
Thus , not only do the elderly  benefit from it , the country's economic growth may also benefit since they have valuable experiences in the industry .
Thirdly , studio apartments are being built to meet the elderly residents needs .
Living in the studio apartment enables the elderly to be more independent .
These apartments are customized with safety features such as non-slip titles which prevent them from falling , level flooring which makes the floor even to accommodate elderly who are wheelchair bound and support hand bars for them to hold on to ( , 2007) Therefore , the elderly are able to enjoy the benefits that are given to them .
They do no not have to worry about their physical needs not being well-taken care of .
However , critics of this position argue that the government should not spend time and resources to ease the aging process .
Instead they should implement more policies on the younger generation to boost the economy growth so as to move towards a knowledge based economy and also to introduce more schemes to increase the birth rate so that the government is able to meet their goals .
Moreover , it is the children's responsibility to take care of the parents instead of the government .
If the elderly well- being is not well taken care of , the younger generation may not want to reconsider giving birth since the society is unprepared for the aging population in the future and this will cause more elderly living in this society .
If the society is well-prepared , the younger generation does not have to worry about their own welfare when they turn old .
Besides that , not all children have the ability to support their parents as they might be facing financial problems and hence are unable to take good care of them .
In addition , some elderly do not have any children .
Therefore the elderly need the government's help to meet their physical needs .
In conclusion , it is important for the society to be well-prepared for the aging process so that they are able to tackle the issues of aging population that the country will encounter in the future .
Most importantly , by implementing the different types of policies , it has indeed helped the elderly to meet their  .

In my opinion , public spending on the elders should be limited and the money can be diverted to other sectors of the progress of the country .
Indeed , the aged  were once the main human resource that  contributed greatly to the development of the country and thus deserve the welfare of getting public spending , as a token of gratitude .
Yet that token of gratitude should not be too much till it may drag down the development of the country .
Instead , reformed policies should be implemented to limit the public spending for the aged , and meanwhile , to make sure that their welfare is still taken care of .
To begin with , public spending on the aged population has become a burden to the tax payers .
It is known that the money proposed for the eldercare nowadays has comprised a large portion of the government spending .
For example , according to the Singapore budget report of 2009 , the payout for the Senior Citizen Bonus is at least SD$73400000 .00 for that year .
This figure has not  included the other programmes that are proposed for the senior citizens .
As the source of money for the government is mainly the tax payers , this figure translates as  a burden on these contributing citizens .
Furthermore , in these few years , the amount of money that is allocated for the eldercare has been increasing .
If this trend does not change in the next few years , the average citizens would have to pay more , in order to enable the government to use the money for the aged ones .
In other words , the income that they earned would be constantly reduced .
This may result in the feeling of indignation in the tax-payers towards the ruling government - which is not an advantageous condition for the further growth of the country .
Moreover , the over-emphasis in aiding the elders for their sunset years may cause the insufficiency of financial resource in the other parts of the country .
As all areas in a country are equivalently important , such as  in terms of the development of the  , the happiness index of people , or even for a higher living standard of life .
If the part of the funding for the aged is overstressed , it is more likely that the spending in other sectors by the governments have to be reduced , so as to compensate the budget .
This is because the money resource of the government to invest in these parts is limited .
As a result , the progress of the other sectors may not be so ideal .
If the situation persists for a long term , it will do harm to the nation and may shake the public trust in the government .
A well-developed country may indirectly even lose competency with the other countries .
Especially in  , agriculturewhere small middle enterprises  depend on the government funding  .
For those developing countries , this will affect the effort of the government and the private sectors in the growth of the nation .
Another reason that makes me agree with decreasing the funding for the elders , and diverting it to the other areas instead , is the familial factor .
When the government takes a great share of the duty to care for the elders , most of their adult children tend to shift their own filial piety .
These adults usually see their parents as a burden , feeling no gratitude to  their teachings , their contribution and , last , but not least , their needs and feelings .
As the government introduces programmes for eldercare , they will happily leave the problem to the government .
This has indirectly sparked their decision to just abandon their parents .
The government has proposed bonuses and allowances for the parents  .
Some of the programmes have even distributed the aid monthly !
Hence ,  public funding may indirectly relate with the rising case of abandoned parents at the old folks'  .
F these parents , all the funding seems to have lost its values , if they have lost their connection with their beloved family  .
In fact ,  public funding for the welfare of the aged  is still needed in some ways , but it is  so crucial until it should comprise such a huge section of the government spending .
As an alternative , some of the policies should be reformed to shift a part of the government duty to the family of the elders , and even the elders themselves .
For example , people should be compelled by law to take care of their own parents .
The family should carry out the responsibility to look after the elders .
Besides that , most of the elders do have their own savings or investment that they have accumulated since they were young .
Anyway , in the case of  homeless , childless and jobless ,  they should savour the benefits from the eldercare programme by the government .
Or else , they may have to end up suffering without assistance or even notice of the others .

Recently , the aging population has caused lots of social and economic problems , which has drawn the attention of more and more governments .
However , what most governments do is just to increase public spending on the aged  , which is not enough to tackle the issue and even decreases the country's development .
In fact , it will be more efficient to limit spending on the old and use more money on economic development .
First of all , it cannot be ignored that there will be more choices to care for those who are in need with sufficient economic growth .
For instance , Cambodia possessed a very slow development for a long time .
With a large population living in poverty , its government spent quite a large amount of money on the needy .
The situation is similar for the problem of aging population .
If more efforts and money are spent on the development of economy , there will be much more benefits gained from it in turn .
Therefore , we are provided with more choices to care for the elder people .
Secondly , it is not necessary for governments to spend too much money on the elderly to resolve the problem of aging population .
Alternatively , by requiring people to provide in advance for their own old-age dependency , governments can also solve this problem without slowing down economic growth .
In some countries , like Singapore and Britain , people are encouraged or compelled by law to save and invest a certain portion of their income when they are active in the work force .
This method proves to be very effective .
With enough money saved or invested during the years of work , the elderly  become less dependent on financial aids from governments .
Moreover , there will be more money diverted to other areas to promote the economic development .
Instead of increasing spending on the old , the problem can also be tackled by encouraging the elderly  to lead longer working lives .
That is an effective way to solve some economic and social problems caused by aging population .
A good example is that the UK's government managed to solve pension drain by using this method .
Furthermore , longer working lives can definitely help lessen the pressure of younger generations , which protects them from being overwhelmed by overloaded work .
What is  most important is that longer working lives give the aged opportunities to accumulate wealth for later lives , making them less vulnerable to the changes of outer aids .
This will truly benefit the aged who are completely dependent on pensions from governments .
Some people may have doubts about the productivity of the aged and argue that it is their right to lead a peaceful lives .
However , this is not true .
On the one hand , life today is different from the past , in part because of demographic and economic changes .
The population aged 65 to 75 is healthier and better educated than those in this age group in past generations .
Most people who retire  from work today are still energetic and in quite good health .
So there is no doubt that the aged are able to lead longer working lives .
On the other hand , since the aged are mostly more experienced and patient , there truly exist some  jobs more suitable for them .
In that case , they are even more productive than younger workers .
It is shown that we are able to efficiently solve the problems caused by aging population with limited spending .
Through the methods of requiring people to provide in advance and encouraging longer working lives , more money can be diverted to other areas to promote  economic development .
And with sufficient economic development , there will be more choices for governments to care for the old .
Firstly , it is not worth spending a lot of money on the aged at the cost of the whole society's development .
Money should be transferred to some more important areas .
In fact , if the ecmics of the whole society can ensure a steady growth , then it will be much easier for the country to undertake the pension .
Although the aging problem is worsening , it is not a wise choice to focus too much attention on the issue .
When the limited money is made the most of , the aged can benefit from the various prospering departmeeconomyver the country , even maintain a self-sufficient life without the financial aid from the government .
Secondly , governments can encourage every citizen to save for their old-age dependency .
If everyone starts to save when they begin to work ,  most of them can be independent in finance after retirement .
Nowadays investment companies or insurance companies provide a variety of investment plans which can satisfy the needs for most people .
For example , in Singapore , people begin to save a certain percent of his salary into his bank account , in order to pay the housing loan , car loan or for advanced age .
Many developed countries such as Britand Australian also carry out this policy .
If people are not willing to save in advance , then the government can compel people to save by law .
Thirdly , government can provide some work especially for the old unemployed people .
Since most of the old people have a lot of leisure time , the government can promote some temporary or long-term programs for the old .
For example , some big supermarkets can employ the old to put the good messed up by the shoppers back to theofplace .
Some jobs like this are not very brain-consuming and do not need a lot of physical strength .their additaccountse old people can earn some money and get some exercises by contributing to the work .
This policy can also be applied to some low-salary jobs which are beneath the young's notice .
Spending the governmentoney is not the most effective way to solve the aging problem .
We can also achieve the goal of easing the aging process by encouraging advance savings and providing suitable jobs for the old .
Since the money should be reduced by promoting these two policies , more goodsy can be transferred to other more urgent areas .
In a nutshell , money spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
I agree with the question that "Public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development ."
The greying population are expected to double by the year 2030 , "one in five Singaporeans will be over 65 , up from 1 in 12 today" () .Therefore the amount of public spending required are also expected to rise proportionately .
The Government should limit public spending so as to prevent over reliance of the elderly on them which  in turn causes an even bigger strain on the shrinking work force .
Therefore , the Government should focus on increasing productivity of future workers and making the citizens more independent rather than  expanding the budget .
Some of the ways to do so is to make saving compelled by law , to elderly to come back to the workforce , and in healthcare aspects .
In order to cultivate the sense of self reliance the Government should make a compulsory law for the working adults to save into a special account with their monthly pay .
One  such example is the Central Provident Fund (CPF) scheme used in Singapore over 5 decades .
This policy helps to prepare the citizens for their retirement while they still have the ability to earn an income .
This would ensure that each citizen would have some amount of money to fall back on when they retire and would in turn lessen the needs for subsidies or help from the government .
Education should also pay a part in allowing the future citizens to know the importance of early retirement preparation and planning .
One of the major problems of an ageing population is the lack of workforce to drive the economy .
Since the human's life expectancy has generally increased over the decades , it is essential that elderly  work and earn more income for their retirement while it is possible .
Therefore the retirement age should be pushed back and elderly should be encouraged to upgrade their skills and continue working as they are a country's invaluable resource with a lot of experience .
By tapping on the large number of elderly , the country's workforce will be increased and more people will be available to drive the country's economy to encourage growth .
With sufficient economic growth , there will be lesser needy people as well .
The cost of healthcare is on the rise .
One of the challenges of the Government is to try to make healthcare services more affordable .
Healthcare service is very essential to the elderly as they are more prone to  .
Therefore by lowering the cost of healthcare , elderly can have more money to use in other areas of retirement .
As the saying goes "prevention is better than cure" - free health screening and health campaigns should be implemented .
Getting more elderly to get free health screening can ensure health problems to be treated at an early stage thus reducing the cost of expensive treatments when symptoms turn serious .
The citizens should also be encouraged to have a healthy lifestyle to prevent any possible illnesses to ensure a smooth retirement with more money spent on other areas other than healthcare .
The human's life expectancy has increased over the years with the advanced technology and different living environments; more adults are better educated and well off than before .
This has changed our perception towards what is healthy and what is ageing .
Despite all these improvements , it does not mean that every single one of the elderly in the country would be covered and well taken care of .
There will still be a group of vulnerable elderly like the old single elderly  mentioned by Robert B . Friedland and Laura Summer () .
This means that lower educated people will be more likely to be in need  the public spending funds .
But all in all , the advantage of limiting of the public spending  outweighs the disadvantage as the needy group of people would be minimised .
In conclusion , I agree that public spending should be limited as citizens should not be over reliant on their Government and the focus to solve such problems should be to increase workforce and also make use of more money on lowering healthcare costs  in other areas of the country's development .

Research shows that of people aged 70 years , 8 .6% report problems with both hearing and seeing" .
This vision impairments and hearing loss can be a serious problem to the elderly as they may lead to misunderstanding in communication .
Elderly who suffer from vision and hearing loss will find difficulties in making a phone call , listening to voice mail , and using text messages with cell phones .
However , the development in technology has eventually overcome such problems .
In 2006 , an electronics brand , Samsung , launched its Jitterbug J , an excellent cell phone for the elderly .
This gadget provides the elderly a simple way in making phone calls and using text messages .
Jitterbug cell phone suits the elderly as it has loud and clear sound as well as large and brief on-screen text .
A satisfied customer , MakenzieB , purchased a Jitterbug for her 62-year-old mother .
Her mother absolutely loves it and could easily understand how to use it .
She can easily call her family and check voicemail by herself .
Technology development has also helped the elderly with smell problems .
A statistic from National Institutes of Health shows that "More than 2 million adults have disorders of smell" .
These problems are more common in elderly because the sense of smell changes as people age .
When sense of smell changes , elder people will lose the ability to detect smoke , leaking gas , or airborne pollutants and toxins .
Thus , they will need warning devices to detect smoke and carbon dioxide .
A device called The Shake-Up Alarm is a solution to this problem .
The Shake-Up Alarm contains  two parts: smoke detector and signaller .
When smoke is  detected , the smoke detector will transmit signals to two receivers which are a bed vibrator and a strobe light .
The bed vibrator can be placed under a pillow or mattress .
Thus , the vibrator will alert the owner even when he falls asleep .
The second receiver , which is a strobe light , will flash 60 times per minute .
The other illness that usually attacks elderly is memory loss .
According to a mid-March story from HealthDay , "5 .4 million Americans over 70 have memory loss that affects their daily lives" .
One problem that occurs as an effect of memory loss is a difficulty to manage a strict schedule of numerous prescription drugs .
Many pills look similar and there are different instructions for taking each of them .
Thus , it will be a big problem for the elderly with memory loss to remember the instructions of each pill .
However , there is a device called Med-eMonitor which can help ease such burden .
Med-eMonitor is a pill organizer which functions as medication separator and system reminder .
This device also shows on-screen instructions which will help elderly take the drug with proper dosage and schedule .
Another device that can help elderly with memory loss is Mnemonic .
Mnemonic is a wrist-wrapped device that reminds the owner about important events or meetings .
It has a special feature which is built-in accelerometer which will keep the display on top no matter which direction it is rotated .
In conclusion , every person will face the aging process and as a result , various diseases such as vision and hearing loss , smell problems , and memory loss are likely to attack as they age .
After all , nowadays research and development in technology has eventually provided a variety of gadgets that suit the elderly and help them handle the aging process .
Thus , elderly will feel convenient to do their daily activities and live independently .

A research conducted by The Center for Disease Control and Prevention in the United States showed that " [1]about 80% of the population aged 65 and above has at least one chronic health condition , and 50% has at least two" .
Some of the most common chronic health problems which the elderly suffers from are arthritis , heart disease , and cancer .
These diseases often decrease the quality of life of the elderly because they cause the elderly to lose their ability to live a normal life as they used to live .
However , some recent medical inventions give us promising solutions to these health problems related to aging and hence ease the aging process .
[2]Almost 43 million adults in the United States suffer from arthritis .
One of the most common types of arthritis is rheumatoid arthritis .
Rheumatoid arthritis can affect many tissues and organ but mostly attacks the small joints .
The disease disables the elderly from doing their normal activities because it causes the joints to become swollen and limits their movements .
Moreover , arthritis and related conditions are the leading cause of disability in the United States .
[3]The most frequently affected joints in the hand are finger joints .
This fact is quite worrying since fingers are the most frequently used part of a human hand .
Nevertheless , researchers at Royal Hampshire County Hospital have invented [4] "a particular type of silver ring splints worn on fingers which is effective in controlling hyperextension deformity of finger joints , which is common in individuals with rheumatoid arthritis" .
This new treatment method replaced the old massive plastic rings which were worn to stabilize the joints .
Many patients who have received the new silver ring treatment commented that [5] "the silver rings look better than the old bulky ones .
They are also more durable and stronger ."
[6] Heart disease makes up more than 30% of deaths in American adults aged 65 and above caused by chronic disease , making it the disease which kills most elderly .
The most fatal symptom of heart disease is heart attack .
When heart attack occurs , blood supply to part of the heart is interrupted , causing some heart muscle cells to die .
This often causes severe heart failure because the heart muscle cells cannot regenerate themselves due to the absence of myoblasts , which are the cells forming muscle cells .
In the past , these dead cells caused by a heart attack could not be replaced .
But today , thanks to a new heart  treatment called "Heart Myoblast Cell Injection" , heart attack victims can get their healthy heart muscle cells back .
[7] In this new treatment method , myoblast cells are extracted from the heart  patient's own thigh muscles .
After that , the cells are cultured in the lab then injected to the heart of the patient .
Research show that new tissue formation and improvement in the heart function of the patients were found after this treatment .
The lead researcher of this treatment at the Arizona Heart Institute , Nabil Dib , says , "Through this heart  treatment we can regenerate a scar tissue caused by a heart attack , which is the opposite of what we learnt in medical school ."
[8] While heart disease is still the leading cause of death in the elderly , cancer comes second .
[9] In the United States , Lung cancer kills more people than other cancers .
The traditional method to cure lung cancer in a patient is by surgery or radiotherapy which is given five days a week for six to seven weeks .
Radiotherapy process can be burdensome because of its frequency , especially for those who do not live in cities with equipped hospitals .
However , cancer specialists from Temple University have found a new method called Stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) .
[10] Unlike the ordinary radiotherapy , SBRT can be stopped after three to eight treatments .
Another advantage of SBRT is it can double the survival rates of early stage patients .
The survival rates of SBRT are as high as surgical methods , which some patients cannot have because of their conditions or refuse to have .
[11] Experts are very optimistic that this new treatment can replace the old radiotherapy and surgery .
Curtis Miyamoto , M .D . , chair and professor of the Department of Radiation Oncology at Temple University School of Medicine said that "With the success of this technique , we're now questioning whether we'll even be doing surgeries on these patients in the future ."
[12] Colorectal cancer is the second  cancer-related killer in the United States after lung cancer .
Most  colorectal cancer patients are elderly because the possibility of having colorectal cancer increases with age .
Chemotherapy is often recommended to cure the disease depending on the patient's condition .
The problem is , most elderly patients are not as fit enough as younger patients to stand chemotherapy .
Nevertheless , some scientists from The United Kingdom have found a vaccine called TroVax which is able to cure kidney and bowel cancer .
This includes colorectal cancer .
The research on the vaccine showed that "[13] One patient who was given the vaccine has seen his tumour disappear totally  .
Another two have seen their tumours reduce in size , and in three people the cancer has been stopped in its tracks .
50 patients have had the vaccine and 95 per cent of those that can be evaluated have had an 'anti-tumour response" .
Unlike chemotherapy which can cause depression of the bodies immune system because it kills not only bad cancer cells but also good cells which contribute to the body's immunity , this vaccine works in a totally different way .
The vaccine improves the body's immune system to fight a particular disease which in this case is colorectal cancer
Recent inventions offer medical solutions to the elderly suffering from chronic medical conditions such as arthritis , heart disease , and lung cancer .
These inventions help the elderly to live a healthier life .
By living a healthier life , the elderly people can live their days more normally and hence this will help them in the aging process .

The aging process usually comes with several phenomena such as bad vision , bad hearing , backache , hair loss , etc .
much progress have been made in science , especially medicine , to provide the elderly with convenient tools for their lives .
For example , dealing with bad vision , which is very popular among people above 60 , we now have special lenses and eye drops , together with traditional magnifiers which are being improved more and more to help the elderly with their eyesight , furthermore special hearing-aids can do a very good work in reinforcing the hearing ability .
In terms of medicine , we also have skin cream to prevent wrinkles , anti hair loss drugs , special medicine for osteoporosis , heart disease , etc .
to provide different ways to ease the aging process .
In addition , technology has also brought to the elderly many convenient tools to help them to be independent in their lives .
Nowadays many houses are equipped with intercom doorbell to help "respond to visitors without having to rush or feel panicky" (1) , thus preventing them from falling .
Electric appliances are accompanied with remote controls which are easy to use and remember so that the elderly can flick through television channels or turn on and off lights and fans themselves .
What's more , wheelchairs now do not need physical strength to move , but thanks to the controls with some different-color buttons , the elderly can use an electric wheelchair and skillfully direct them to wherever they want within the house and around the neighbourhood .
For children working at offices who cannot keep their eyes on their old parents , they can install the webcam system around the house to watch over the parents while still doing their job .
Perhaps the most modern tool for the elderly that has been invented is robots , which have been brought from factories to home to do house chores .
They can do various things and multi-task and thus help the elderly a lot in the house .
For example , the robot named Domo is programmed to not only hold cans and tins but also identify other food with different shapes and quickly find an desired object to accompany the elderly whenever they need(2) .
Or in Japan , where nearly a quarter of the population is at age 65 and above , robots are being used very effectively to help lift the elderly or support them in moving .
Some of them can also respond to oral commands such as "forward" , "back" , "right" , "left"(3) , very convenient for the elderly because they often struggle to remember the buttons and the functions to run a machine .
Who says computers are just for teenagers and the youth ?
With significant advances in information and technology , today the elderly can also use the Internet to join some virtual communities especially designed for them to meet their peers and talk about many things with one another instead of staying alone all day in the house waiting for their children to come home after work .
Singapore recently has launched an Internet portal "I Not Old" ({www .inotold .com}) especially for the elderly , "to provide them with social platforms , games and information"(4) .
In America , a survey has been conducted by the Kaiser Family Foundation to find that one third of seniors above 60 and two-thirds of people between 50 and 64 get access to the Internet .
What are they looking for ?
They search healthcare , such as how to consult a doctor online without having to leave home , or drug information , etc .
(4)
In conclusion , the elderly nowadays are being helped a lot with different advances in technology , to become more and more independent and to live on their own .
We now can feel safe to leave home on our business and leave them at home , knowing that they are supported and equipped with all the things they need .
And with the rapid development in technology , we know that in the near future , many more things will be invented for our parents .
People today have to face an extremely serious problem of an reasons for an aging  population .
According to a definition on the Wikipedia website , the aging population ,  are usually migration , longer life expectancy , and decreased birth rate , which increase  the number and proportion of the older people in the society .
Since  , aging population has been dramatically influencing various fields in people lives such as economics , healthcare system , and social policy , many research , development and policies have been proposed to help to ease this process .
Firstly , for a graying population around the world , lots of policies have been applied to control the birth and death rate or to balance the age structure .
One of the most possibly effective ways is the "two child" population policy in Shanghai , a big city in China .
The Shanghai Daily says about 22% of the population is over 60 years old .
additionally , for a long time , the Chinese population was controlled by a "one child" policy .
As a result , an increased aging population has developed  .
Therefore , "a "two child" policy can relax this problem and boost a higher birth rate , with a government campaign that encourages couples to have a second child .
However , due to a lack of financial incentives , there is still no official announcement with regard to this .
Secondly , to cope with the aging process , an increase in healthcare demand can be organized by improving system performance , redesigning service delivery , support informal caregivers , and shift demographic parameters .
Obviously , the older people use more healthcare than young people .
Nevertheless , health costs are independent of the age structure , which defines the distribution of predetermined expenditures .
Particularly , in Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) , aging population does not have any connections to health expenditure as a part of GDP .
For example , the over-65-year-old Swedish made up 17 .3% in 2000 , but Sweden just spent 8 .6% GDP on health .
The former in Australia was 12 .7% , and the latter was 9 .3% , figured in 2001 and 2002 .
Thirdly , as  mentioned in "A graying world" by Peter Peterson , late retirement not only solves the employment problem , but also lightens the financial burden on the young .
In countries with a limited labour force , taking advantage of experienced , stable employers is very important , as it also contributes to the family income and saves  training cost .
Moreover , providing work to the older people helps them from being bored , alone , and maybe  depressed .
Therefore , the younger people who are the breadwinners of the family are more relaxed and under less pressure , so their work will be more efficient but less stressful .
First , technological inventions provide solution to the vision problem that comes with aging , presbyopia .
The aged may choose to wear optical lenses for presbyopia , and current research has raised this lens technology to a new height .
For example Bifocal Contact Lens has been invented recently .
(Pizzo & Segre , 2008) Each piece of this kind of lens is divided into two parts with different focus .
This enable the presbyopputting it ton a , usually the aged , to see both far objects and near objects clearly without changing lens .
Moreover , this kind of contact lens rides on the eyeball but does not roll together with the eyeball .
This means , when the patient look down , he or she can use the lower part of the lens to read and use the upper part of the lenwhich is being currently done to look at distant objects .
Besides , the aged may also choose to carry a portable digital magnifier which takes picture behind the device , magnifies it to desired clearness and show it on the screen such as PocketViewer .
(HumanWare Group , 2009) With these technological inventions , the aged may be able to read and write like young people .
Hence , the pressure of aging process is reduced .

With technological invents like this , it is likely that the aged will enjoy a healthier and longer life which , eased the agithe agingocess .
