Technology has improved our daily life a lot .
It impacts  our work , leisure and home .
when compared with the past , today , everything can be done easily with the aid of technology .
As the speed of  technology grows , people in the society age as well .
Recently , the aging population has been a a cause of concern for governments and society .
By 2050 , many people in the first world countries will reach 51 .
(1) In order to ease the global aging process , people have begun using technology with the hope of helping the aging population .
Internet and automated gadgets are some of the technology that were used  a few years ago to help the elderly .
Today , the internet has become so common in  society it has beingused to help the aging population .
People have started to create a link from the elderly to the their family members .
For example , in the United State some family members actually give their elderly a GPS device which can help to keep track of their location  anywhere and at any time .
As people get older , the chances of them getting lost are much  higher and with the help of a GPS device , their loved ones can easily find out their current location when they get lost .
Another way of helping the aging population are automated gadgets .
With the automated gadgets , it can help to take care or monitor the elderly especially when they are alone .
An example would be the Med-eMonitor , invented by InforMedix , which acts as a medicine reminder for the elderly .
This gadget actually is just about the size of a VCR tape and operates on a rechargeable battery which can last for two weeks .
Inside this gadget , are many compartments that can help to separate the medication and also allows users to set a date and time .
It also comes with a reminder system , on-screen instruction and a line of communication .
When the time has come for medication , the gadget will play a musical chime that will alert the elderly .
When the user press on the button a LCD screen will display the instruction for taking the drugs , for example , some drugs are to be taken before meal or with a empty stomach .
If the musical chime is not responded to by the elderly and the medication is not taken , the gadget will place a phone call to the family members to inform them .
(2)
Besides using internet and automated gadgets individually , people have also combine them as one device .
In the United State there are devices that can also help to connect the elderly to the doctor without having them to go to the hospital everyday .
For example , the elderly with Cardiovascular diseases can be attached  with an intelligent small device which is called a Chronicle system in their body to monitor their "heart rate , physical activity , body temperature and right ventricular (RV) pressure in them ."
(3) the results gathered by the device are transmitted to the doctors through a remote monitoring so that their health can be monitored even if they are at home or in the hospital .
Using internet and automated gadgets have helped to ease the aging process a lot .
Both the elderly and their family members can receive many benefits from technology .
As time passes , our aging population grows and so does our technology .
But as technology grows , it can provide us with more inventions that can help to ease the aging population process .
"We have an ageing population and the demand for elective surgery continues to increase , which provides us with a real challenge" .
(1) This famous quote by Australian politician Michael Wright not only illustrates one of the problems the government has to deal with an the aging population but also points to the pressure the aging population place on the medical system .
It appears that aging population has become the biggest and common concern for countries all over the world , especially those in Europe and Japan .
Many researchers have recently stated:" To a large extent , current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process" .
From my point of view , supported by many reliable online articles , I agree with the claim above .
The diverse obstacles associated with an an aging population creates lots of pressure , ranging not only from medical services but also to the education system too .
For instance: A survey conducted in British Columbia on the impact of aging population on social services shows that as the average age of citizens increases , so does the health care cost per capita .
(2) The government has to reserve a greater portion of the budget for taking care of the aged because they are more likely to suffer from ailments that almost always occur with old age (such as: diabetes , osteomalacia . . .)  .
Or let's take education as an example: when the majority of the population is old people , which means that the average age of a student in the university will increase .
Students tend to stay in the colleges longer and as a result , the cost on education will rise significantly .
It's also predicted that the cost on education in British Columbia will rise 40% between the period 1989/1990 and 2015/2016 .
(3)
On the other hand , the scientists keep giving out new technological inventions to help the elderly feel more comfortable and content with their ordinary life .
They present wireless and mini hearing aids to enhance the listening ability of  elderly as well as artificial limbs for them or walking sticks to aid them standing and walking around .More specifically , designed elevators used for the elderly  in wheelchairs are everywhere , which plays an important role in helping them to access higher levels in tall buildings .
The older they get , the worse their body organs function , which leads to the situation that they really need some help from inventors to retain their original life .
Without these gadgets and assisting tools , now they would suffer numerous and tremendous difficulties in communicating with other people or going around as well .
The next question that needs to be debated is: "How much money should the government spend on  medical care for the elderly ?" .
In my opinion , the government should use much more money towards taking care of the elderly  due to the following : Firstly , the aged are citizens who have contributed a lot of money to the National Treasury through compulsory taxes like land-tax , income tax . . .  therefore they deserve receiving more care from the authorities .
Secondly , as long as you take care of the elderly well , the average longevity of the citizens will rise significantly .
As far as we are concerned , many economists evaluate the wealth and development of a country not only by its wealth , but also on how the average longevity of its citizens is .
In conclusion , it's unassailable that: To some extent , current research have helped ease the aging process .
This mission not only lies on the scientists' hands but also require some support from the society in general , and the government in particular .
If the government reserve more money on the medical care for the elderly , absolutely they'll be more satisfied with their life .
That's the best solution in comparison with other inventions from the scientists .
Disability affects some people .
Aging affects all people .
As we know , people are living longer today than they used to , and this is resulting in a much larger elderly population than before .
Also , as we grow in to adulthood , many things start to change in our life .
Aging is an unavoidable process , beginning at conception and ending with death .
The process does not proceed at a uniform rate all over the body .
As we age , the organ systems of individuals age at different rates .
Our body gradually slows down in early adult life .
So , current research and development or policies in particular fields of science and medicine have helped to ease the aging process .
Technology can help the elderly with their hearing problem and hearing impairment is one of the five most chronic conditions of aging .
According to research , it is estimated that one out of three people over age 64 has some hearing impairment; this increases to almost one out of two persons over the age of .
But , nowadays , there are many assistive devices available for persons with hearing impairment .
That is what technology is !
For example , vibrating alarms allow older people with hearing impairment to wake from vibration than by auditory alarm .
Also , door knock alert allows older people with hearing impairment to see a blinking light rather than hearing an auditory "knock" sound .
As we know ,  chronically ill patients need to check in with a health-care provider every day and answer questions about their current symptoms allow for immediate intervention .
So , numerous telehomecare devices have been developed to allow health-care providers the ability to manage follow-up care of the chronically ill .
This technology allows patients to sit in the comfort of their own homes while health-care providers conduct routine and comprehensive medical monitoring procedures in their offices .
One example of this type of technology is Aerotel's Medical Parameters Monitoring (MPM) devices , which allow data to be stored for immediate consultation and treatment , as well as for future reference .
Other than those technologies used in developing devices to aid old people's hearing and illness , home , as we know is a very "important" to the older people .
They need a comfortable home for their retired life .
So  , there is a new technology in our modern world now  , Well@home Telemanagement System from Patient care Technologies ,Inc .
This Well@home devices has an interactive function similar to a bank ATM .
This technology reminds patients to take their medication; instructs patients through text , illustrations , and the spoken word on what , when  , and how to make their medication; ask patients if they would like to learn more about their medication; provide administrative , side effect , and storage information to the patient  etc . , .
This will help the older people a lot so that they would not to be "thrown"nto the old folks home because of their disability at home .
As the world goes on , Technology has been applied to public transportation in the development of Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) that enhance older persons mobility by providing better information before and during a journey .
[1] Many of the age-related reduction in function that contribute to driving cessation can impede mobility independence when using public transportation systems , The application of technology within an ITS can support deficits in vision  , hearing  , cognition , and sensorinotor function .
Technology in itself is not the only panacea to solve the aging global population .
So , there should be improvement in every field of study and research to ease the aging population and to enhance the quality of life for a global population that will double in size by 2050 .
Since the birth of human beings , our ancestors have gone through the 4 stages of life , namely birth , aging , illness and death .
It is a process that began when we were first born .
It is inevitable that we will eventually become old and vulnerable to problems and diseases that are associatede with old age .
Therefore , there is a need to improve the life of the elderly in order to ease the aging process .
It is not unknown that Scientists have been researching while governments are constantly improving development and policies for the elderly .
The current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Firstly , modern medical research is able to treat and cure deadly diseases that we were incapable of previously .
With the current advances in medical technology , we are able to remedy and prevent diseases more effectively .
Previous generations had no knowledge of illnesses like diabetes , hypertension and high cholesterol which leads to more severe problems like heart attack and stroke .
With modern research , medicine have been produced to assist in treating the problems .
The findings were used for the prevention of these illnesses , thus the elderly who are more prone to these diseases are able to take more precaution with their health .
Secondly , More health care centers have been developed to cater for the elderly In fact we have access to medical , health care center within a kilometers of any housing estate .
For instance , presently mostmarkets or shopping malls will have at least one clinic in service as compared to the past where patients had to travel long distances in order to get basic treatment .
In addition , more hospitals are being built .
examples like Jurong General Hospital and Khoo Teck Puat Hospital will be built to provide medical services in Jurong and Yishun respectively .
These will provide more opportunities for treatment and shorten the traveling time in a time of emergency .
We can cure and treat everything easily and conveniently but it is always costly .
In fact not many people can afford long term medical treatment especially for elderly who have either retired or have savings that are not enough to cover the expenses .
But on the other hand , policies are made to engage the potential financial problems .
For example , Medisave is made compulsory for Singaporeans to contribute part of their income into saving for medical use .
A minimum balance of $15 000 is required in Medicsave to prevent premature depletion which will be needed for future medical needs , more precisely during old age .
Also benefits such as national medical subsidy schemes have been introduced to subsidise the medical cost for the elderly .
The Elderly are given a subsidy of $360 annually for chronic diseases like diabetes , hypertension and high cholesterol .
These policies make medical treatment more affordable and less taxing to the elderly .
To summarize , with the current medical research , development and polices made by  scientists and the government , it has definitely slowed and eased the aging process that everyone will experience .
Although our lifespan have significantly lengthened from 60 to 65 year to 75 to 85 years in developed countries .
However ageing will remain the same for today and will not change at least in our time .
Regardless of country , race , language or generation , staying young , healthy and active is the dream of every person in this world .
From the birth of mankind , we have been searching and trying all means and ways to ease or stop aging .
This process or searching and examining has never ended , ever after decades .
This is even  more obvious  in this century , where the standard of living of the generation X has improved compared to the past .
They have begun to realize that their life expectancy is now much longer than that of previous generations .
Therefore , the demand for anti aging products and treatments to restore health and beauty has grown significantly .
Men and woman past the age of 40 feel more empowered than ever to take control of their bodies and redefine the aging process .
To ease or slow down the aging process is to have the ability to lengthen the lifespan of our youthful healthy days .
As such , life extension is the main concept that most companies are engaging in to target aging issues .
These anti-aging promoters from various nutrition companies are promoting their own brand of nutrition , in the form of diets or supplements , to extend lifespan .
These products use different raw materials and food processing methods , which they claim  is safe and effective for consumption , after rounds of testing .
However , mostly they work and agree on the same common theory , which is the importance of keeping a stable blood sugar level , achieved in part by managing the glycemic indices of food choices .
[1] An example of the 2 diets with different approaches and with some support from scientific research is the Palaeolithic diet and Caloric restriction .
An alternative to the use of nutrition products to ease aging process is the research and development of Cosmetic interventions such as skin treatments and plastic surgery .
They are widely used to mask the effects of aging , although they do not actually affect lifespan .
Some of these surgeries include skin resurfacing , eyelid surgery and Botox treatments , cosmetic dental procedures and many more .
In addition , Anti-aging creams such as "Olay" and "Loreal" is also getting more popular and commonly use by both men and women .
These are mostly moisturiser based cosmetic skin care products marketed with the promise of making the consumer look younger by reducing visible wrinkles , expression lines , blemishes , pigmentation changes , discolouration and other environmentally (especially from the sun) related conditions of the skin .
[2] Despite great demand , many such products and treatments have not proved to give lasting or major positive effects .
However , it is on the rise at many age levels and has been embraced by many age groups including teenagers .
Another issue connected with the aging process is the terror of memory loss .
According to one  research conducted by the Natural Marketing Institute (NMI) [3] , memory loss and losing brain capacity is the biggest fear of the aging baby boomer population .
Their research had shown that 52 percent of females and 36 percent of the males in United States has memory loss and losing brain capacity as their biggest fear .
Hence , research on means to prevent memory loss and increase brain capacity is essential and important in helping to ease the aging setbacks .
Currently in the market , thereare brain supplements such as "Prevagen" and "Essential Youth" [4]; products which claims to have remarkable formulas , which can help old people look younger , feel better , think faster , remember more clearly , thus enjoy their life again  .This is out in display in all corners of the shopping and healthcare centre .
These products were advertised with the support from TV artists and provide documentation testing from scientists .
When it comes to matters related to healthcare , research is never ending .
Scientists have also carried other studies and proposed other strategies of life extension .
Some examples will be the studies of Cloning and body part replacement technology .
They suggest that therapeutic cloning and stem cell research could one day provide a way to generate cells , body parts , or even entire bodies (generally referred to as reproductive cloning) that would be genetically identical to a prospective patient .
Others suggest Cryonics [5] , which is the low-temperature preservation of humans and animals that can no longer be sustained by contemporary medicine until resuscitation may be possible in the future .
However , these 2 researches involve debatable points in ethics and religion which need to be resolved .
Ethical and theological opinions of cloning and cryonics tend to pivot on the issue of whether this method is regarded as interment or medicine .
Aging is a process which cannot be stopped and it is going to be a much more critical  issue for mankind in the next decade , while the ratio of working adult and to the old is further reduced to one-one .
It is a problem that every country is facing , and if it is not properly dealt with , it will hold back the country's development and be an economic hindrance .
As such , in conclusion , the researches in medicines and other field such as technology and social policy is one of the  most importance issues currently .
With education , detail and proper planning now it will help to ease numerous problems that the country and family will face as the population ages .
According to the Singapore Department of Statistics (2008) ,  life expectancy in Singapore continues to increase .
The report shows  that the life expectancy of people is increasing with time  , which implies that the aging process is becoming  than before .
why if this tendency happening now ?
There are various fields contributing to this tendency , including science , technology , economics , government policies , medicine and psychology .
It can be argued that the development of technology plays an important role in this .
There are two kinds of technology that contribute a lot to the increase in the life expectancy of people .
They are information technology and technological tools .
When it comes to  information technology , every young person should be familiar with it .
However , it seems that information technology is not very popular among the old .
Thus , it seems that  information technology does not help the adults a lot .
The main reason is that the tools are quite hard for the old to handle .
For example , the buttons on a mobile and the words on the screen are too smalll so the old cannot read  .
However , the producers are trying to produce  products particularly for the old .
The products are cheap and the word is big enough and  These tools are suitable for the old and they are quite popular among the old .
With these tools , for example mobile phones , the old can get in touch with their sons or daughters easily .
In this way , the old can chat with their children when they miss their children and ask for help when they are in danger .
Thus , these tools will  help them both physically and mentally .
According to the above analysis , there is no doubt that information technology helps a lot to ease the aging process .
How do technological inventions help to ease the aging process ?
According to the 'loss of hearing ability ,' website , there is a decline in the ability to taste salt and bitter foods , whereas sweet and sour are much less affected .
There is also a  reduction of the thymus gland to 5-10% of its original mass by age 50 .
From this , it can bee seen that when people become old , the organs and tissues will not work as well as before .
However , with the help of some technological inventions , the old can overcome these weaknesses .
There are a lot of quite useful inventions for the old .
For example , there is a walking stick that can test the heart rate and blood pressure of the people using it .
If the walking stick finds anything wrong , it will send a message to a healthcare center and the center will get the information of where the person is and send a nurse to take of them .
In this way , , the health of the old  and this will  ease the aging process .
There are also hearing aids to help old people listen clearly and electronic wheelchairs to help old people go out conveniently .
From the above , , it can be concluded that technological inventions help to ease the aging process . 
In conclusion , with the development of technology , the aging process will become slower .
Technology really helps the old a lot in easing the aging process .
Hopefully , the elderly will benefit  from the fast developing  technology .
Technology has vastly improved during the past century  and made life easier for the elderly around the world .
In the case of  developments in terms of Architecture , this has been true thus far .
In our current society , one which faces a graying population , Architecture has played an active role in creating a safe and greatly accessible environment for the elderly .
With better knowledge in Architecture , homes and places outside home are made user-friendly for the elderly
Moving around at a speed and mobility which they had decades ago was not possible , but Architecture has changed our homes in a manner which assured that the elderly can at least move around without facing many  difficulties .
Homes that are user-friendly to the elderly have features that allow the elderly to move around easily .
One such feature is having homes with only one floor built .
Another  such feature will be homes with wider corridors .
Both of the mentioned features allow greater mobility for wheelchair bound elderly or elderly who move around with the help of a walking stick .
The elderly have always been stereotyped as people who are prone to slipping and injuring themselves .
To ease such worries of the younger generation , developments in Architecture have the means to solve such problems .
In areas where the floors tend to be wet , such as the toilet , anti-slip tiles can be installed to induce greater friction even when the floors are wet .
Furthermore , grab bars can be mounted to the walls of the toilet to aid the elderly in sitting down or standing up .
In parts of the home where a staircase must inevitably be built , handrails or barristers can be built for support if the elderly wish to climb the stairs .
As the number of elderly that live alone rises , the government has seen the need to provide special housing for them .
In terms of Singapore , the government has decided to develop blocks of rental 1-room flats which have lifts that stop on every floor , an alert alarm to call for help in the event of emergency  , and support hand bars in the toilets and along common corridors to facilitate mobility of the elderly .
For the elderly who are able to better support themselves , they can choose to stay in rental flats or studio flats .
Besides homes , Architecture has made the community more user-friendly for the elderly .
New shopping centres such as Orchard Centre and Ion Orchard have elderly-friendly facilities such as ramps or ground floor entrances toilets for the disabled which are also user-friendly for the elderly .
At City Link , there are machines installed to maneuver wheelchairs up and down the stairs .
Architecture has raised the standards of living up to a point where even the elderly that have low mobility are able to move around as they wish .
Certainly , developments in the field of Architecture have helped to ease aging process .
Victor Hugo , poet and novelist , once said that "Forty is the old age of youth; fifty the youth of old age"[1] .
Old age is therefore not the end of our life but a start .
There are many physical and mental ailments that often arise from aging , such as brain degeneration , discrimination from the public , social isolation and no sense of direction in life .
To reduce the negative impact of the aging process , it is therefore important to create a role model for the elderly , to eliminate ageism in the society ,  and ito improve detection of depression and encourage lifelong learning .
Creating a positive image of the elderly is necessary to eliminate the adverse stereotypes on elderly .
For example , there is a controversy as to why many people believe that when we were young and forgetful , the reason for forgetfulness is because we had too much stuff on our mind .
However , when we are old and forgetful , we are more likely to accept memory loss as part of aging .
Memory loss is often equated with growing old and deemed inevitable .
However , this is a fallacy and believing in it will likely to lead to a negative self-image of oneself .
Recent research has suggested that "negative stereotypes highlighting the detrimental effect of aging on memory can negatively affect memory performance among older adults" (Andreoletti & Lachman , 2004)[2] .
Fighting ageism is essential to ease the aging process of our society .
One way of fighting ageism is educating the people about the adverse effects of old aged stereotyping  .
In a study done by Levy and her colleague , older individuals with a more positive self-perception of aging  lived 7 .5 years longer than those with less positive self-perception of aging[3] .
Another common problem of aging is depression among the elderly .
As a person ages , the signs of depression are much more varied than at younger ages .
[4] This is turn makes it harder to detect .
Therefore a possible solution is to increase the number of doctoral-level trained geropsychologists (Psychologists for the elderly) and make age-related information more available to researchers , practitioners and students to help improve  detection and treatment .
A Graduate Psychology Education (GPE) Program was setup in 2002 to provide grants to accredited doctoral , internship and postdoctoral programs .
In a survey done in 2008 , the GPE Program has doubled the number of students who are trained to provide mental and behavioral health services 
Critics of this position feel that people should not be pressured to participate in lifelong learning  "for the good of society" .
[6] However , this is  as there are also many benefits that lifelong learning can  .
Engaging in lifelong learning can help build our body , mind and spirit to be ready for future challenges .
In a book "Learning Later , Living Greater" co written by Nancy Merz Nordstrom and Jon F .Merz , the authors highlighted the benefits presented with supporting case studies on lifelong learning .
Having a positive image for the elderly , effectively combating ageism , and promoting a depression-free and lifelong learning society have contributed to ease the aging process .
The idea that old age is not an end should be embraced . . After all , as George Burns , an American comedian once said  , "You can't help getting older , but you don't have to get old" .
[7]
The world's population underwent rapid growth in the 1950s and 60s .
This was the period of the post-war 'baby boom' as there was peace and stability .
Today , these 'baby boomers' form the majority of our population .
It is expected that by 2030 , about nineteen percent of the world's population will be over the age of sixty-five .
Indeed , this illustrates a concern for an ageing population .
However taking a look around us today , current research , development and various policies have evolved to an extent large enough to dismiss  concerns about a greying population .
These measures and policies  have greatly aided the elderly with their ageing process .
This is especially so in the area of social policies , namely government grants and healthcare benefits .
Considering the aspect of government subsidies and grants , firstly , the local government has done much to introduce various measures to help lessen the economical load on the elderly .
SFor example , the Grandparent Caregiver Relief' policy grants married couples an income tax relief of $3000 if a grandparent is helping the couple take care of their child .
The grandparent caregiver relief encourages three generations to live under one roof .
In this manner , the elderly are in turn taken care of by the younger generation , easing their ageing process .
Secondly , there are also public housing schemes .
First-time buyers of government flats can get a housing grant if they purchase a flat in the area where their parents live .
Even if the elderly are not living with their children in this instance , they are still within an accessible vicinity of their children .
This allows the older folks to easily stay connected with their family as visiting is now made convenient .
The aged today also possess another advantage in the form of Tribunal for the Maintenance of Parents .
This scheme allows parents to get the court's help to seek financial support from their children who are capable of supporting them , but are not doing so .
The parents , however , must be incapable of supporting themselves financially and be over sixty years old .
The above mentioned law contributes to the easing of the ageing process by creating a dependency between the younger generation in families with their elders .
Other social policies established to help ease the ageing process include the Central Provident Fund .
This comes across as forced savings where members can withdraw their savings on reaching the age of fifty-five years , leaving a minimum sum in their retirement account .
From the age of sixty-two , members receive a monthly sum from their retirement account , ensuring they still have money left to fund their old age .
This social policy has helped many to remain self-sufficient in their elderly years .
Also , this has achieved the reduction of elder dependency by encouraging later retirement and longer working lives .
Such is an example of raising the eligibility age for public pensions and government incentives .
At the same time , when people work longer , they will be able to accumulate more wealth which they could use to support themselves in their old age .
In the area of healthcare policies , there are a handful of available measures which have essentially helped ease the ageing process .
Firstly , one such example is the Medisave fund , whereby a portion from a member's central provident fund is channelled into their medisave account where the money can be used to pay for hospital bills and certain medical treatments which are expensive .
This measure curbs elderly people's worry of escalating healthcare costs , which they find themselves more liable for in their older years .
Secondly , direct subsidies are given to government hospitals , polyclinics and some nursing homes for the elderly to ensure that basic healthcare services are made available for all Singaporean senior citizens .
The ageing process is made easier as worry about health issues and expenses are greatly reduced .
As illustrated , currently , many social policies exist which have become widely available .
These policies cater to the varying needs of the ageing population be it in financial terms or healthcare .
Today , the concerns involved with the ageing process  and a majority of people's concerns about a greying population have been dismissed .
The elderly are greatly aided with their ageing process through government grants , healthcare benefits and many other social policies made available to them to be easily utilised .
People today are able to  ease the aging process because of current research and development .
One area of focus is on psychology .
In psychology studies , scientists analysed human mental functions and behaviours and came out with solutions to help the elderly ease their process of aging .
[1]
Through research , psychologists found out that elderly people get depressed easily .
This is mainly due to ageism .
For instance , in the work place , some young adults develop prejudice and discrimination against the older people because they feel that the elderly are less efficient and no longer productive .
Therefore , the aging process  can be eased by helping the elderly develop a positive attitude towards life .
The elderly tend to think that they are incompetent and useless as they no longer contribute to society .
Firstly , life long learning  is emphasized to help them .
They can upgrade their skills by taking up enrichment courses like computer classes .
At the end of the course , a certificate will be awarded to them if they have successfully attained the skill .
This can boost their confidence in securing a .
Secondly , "a community work approach can change old people from passive clients into active and empowered individuals with a positive self-image ."
[2] According to one study , 20-25 percent of the elderly in nursing homes are clinically depressed .
[5] They often feel lonely and helpless as they have no one to confide in .
Now many community service clubs like NUS CSC have gathered volunteers to visit these elderly at least once a week .
In this way , the elderly can get involved in community activities which in turn make them look forward to the next session .
Thirdly , for retirees , they can not get used to the amount of free time they have .
Other than joining activities held in the community centres , they can also form groups with other elderly people to do morning exercises .
"People who are physically active in their leisure time aged more slowly than" people who live a sedentary life .
[3] .
Exercise can help them to improve blood circulation , bone strength and immune system functionsand this makes them look and feel younger . 
On the other hand , critics feel that these solutions can only help the elderly to a certain extent .
It only eases aging temporarily .
However , it is not true .
Easing the aging process is just about making them feel better .
As long as the elderly are engaged in their busy lives , they will actually feel not much different from the young ones .
For retired elderly , they may even feel better as there is no stress from work .
The saying goes: "You're only as old as you feel" .
The solutions from current research and development can help elderly people to feel young and create a positive attitude towards life , and to a large extent help to ease aging .

Aging populations are a global phenomenon which affects economic growth , sustainability within families and public spending .
It is caused by declining fertility and rising life expectancy .
It reduces economic growth as the size of the workforce shrinks as more elderly people leave the workforce and less people are recruited into the workforce  .
Another impact is the sustainability of families , because there are far less children supporting far more elderly .
This results in severe financial stress for the working population .
Public spending  is also stressed to provide pensions , building infrastructureand healthcare catered for the elderly .
Therefore , Public spending for the aged should be limited because 
It is impractical for public spending on the aged not to be limited .
If it is not limited , then it will increase indefinitely .
Either other areas of public spending have to receive less funding  , or taxes have to be raised to allow for more funds to be spent on the aged .
These two solutions are both impractical .
Firstly , public funding on other sectors is also limited and cannot be reduced as they are equally important .
Housing and healthcare are basic needs of people .
The military is needed for the defense of the nation .
Public spending on technology cannot be reduced as it is a substitute for the decline in productivity of a shrinking workforce .
This is because , technology provides the automation and machines to increase productivity solving the problem of a shrinking workforce .
Secondly , the main income for public spending is from taxes , especially income taxes from the working population with services tax forming the largest proportion .
If taxes are raised substantially , it would  worsen the severe financial stress for the working population and adversely impact the consumer market .
Therefore , public spending on the aged definitely has to be limited , ensuring enough funding goes to other sectors such as education , military , technology , transport , housing , healthcare , sports , etc which are equally important so as  not to increase taxes for the working population .
The government should limit  public spending on healthcare for the aged , and the limit should satisfy the healthcare needs of all the elderly .
Healthcare has become more of a want rather than a basic need .
The government has to distinguish between needs and wants .
Needs are consultation and medication upon falling ill .
Wants are usually specialist services that perform detailed checkups to determine the underlying cause of the illness , analysis of patients' symptoms to predict illnesses they might contract and certain pharmaceutical medicines which act as supplements .
The wanted healthcare costs are significantly higher as specialist services and pharmaceuticals use high technology equipment and expertise .
Therefore , individuals should pay for what is wanted and only needs should be subsidized by the government  to reduce public spending on healthcare for the aged .
The government should also support healthcare costs for those elderly in families with financial problems as poverty  if basic healthcare is not provided to everyone .
The elderly are extremely susceptible to certain illnesses due to age .
These illnesses or diseases could be non-communicable or chronic which include cardiovascular disease , dementia and Alzheimer's disease , cancer , arthritis and diabetes .
Hence , self reliance such as retirement savings has to be in place first to allow the elderly to be able to pay for illnesses which they might contract later .
Otherwise , it would be a huge drain on government resources to pay for all their medical expenses .
Although ,  public spending on the aged has to be limited , it cannot neglect the social needs of the elderly .
Social needs of the elderly include being able to communicate with the community .
As the elderly are physically weaker and have poorer vision , elderly friendly infrastructures  ,which include enhancements to transport facilities and housing , are necessary to free the elderly from problems of mobility within the community . .
Imagine if there were plenty of staircases and no lifts , signs with small fontsand no resting areas .
no resting areas .
It would be an anti-elderly society where the elderly would most likely stay at home .
These elderly friendly infrastructures are meant to give accessibility for the elderly to physically communicate with friends , families and other people making them part of the community .
After all , it is only morally right to do so as the elderly were once part of the working population that contributed to the nation and they now form a significant portion of the population .
In conclusion , the world should shift towards fostering an elderly friendly society that values their contribution and allows them to be part of the community .
It should also inculcate a strong sense of self reliance among the workforce to prepare them for their old age .
This would reduce their dependence on children or government to support them and not hinder the growth of other areas of the country's development  , as these other areas currently receive fewer funds due to the increasing amount of funds being diverted into helping the growing aged population .

First , elderly depression could be prevented with psychological consultation .
For example , a qualified psychological consultant is able to offer an old person constructive suggestions of preventing depression such as keeping a positive attitude towards aging , developing hobbies and participating in social activities , which can activate the old person's mind .
The consultant might also advise the children of the old person to keep the elderly company regularly and care more about him .
Probably elderly depression would be prevented from happening to the old person with active mind and lots of emotional support .
Second , elderly depression could be treated with psychological treatment .
The means is more or less the same with the prevention means , but is more enhanced .
For instance , psychological doctors can address the importance of sports as appropriate amount of sports can keep the old people's body and mind on .
At the same time , volunteers can play a part in helping to treat as listeners .
Speaking out personal experience and difficulties in life is a good way of letting off negative mood for old people .
Current psychological development has functioned well in the two points and hence helps to ease the aging process .

With the population of aged getting larger in society a big sum of money is involved in helping the aged .
If this huge amount of spending is reduced , but in turn , spent on other areas of the country's development , the wealth of the country can reach a  .
To many people , limiting the amount of money to be spent on the elderly can be perceived as being cruel to them .
However , it is necessary  to be realistic and pragmatic .
A country's development is the key element to bring wealth to the country , so as to improve the living quality of the future generation .
With sufficient funds , the country can spend on manpower , education , investment , construction and other aspects to aid in its development .
Nevertheless , a government can still provide funds for the aged .
This has to be done within a certain limit , depending on the individual's wealth status .
In this survey , the elderly can state down whether they receive any forms of subsidy from their families , where they stay , who they stay with , and whether they are interested in applying for financial assistance .
In this case , those who decide that they are wealthy enough to support themselves should not be part of this financial fund .
This is because they still have sufficient money to spend on things other than their basic needs .
On top of that , it ensures that their contributions to the country's economy still  exist .
By doing so , the country could differentiate them from the rest of the elderly that  do not need any form of financial aid because they already have enough to finance themselves .
On the other hand , for those who are really in need , they can apply for subsidies to receive a certain amount of funding every month .
Under this financial plan , they will benefit from the country's welfare and at the same time be able to satisfy their basic needs .
A well-developed country can bring wealth and boost the economy of the country .
With that , the citizens can get to improve their living standards and quality of life .
For that reason , spending on areas that serve the purpose of helping a country's growth is essential to the country .
If the government continues to splurge a lot in funding the aged , the country's capital would ultimately become unbalanced and would be insufficient to spend on the other areas , for instance , education .
Imagine a country  that has slower development in education .
In the near future , children in the country would have a lower chance to be educated .
With little knowledge and skills , the country would be poor and would not grow .
In a nutshell , a country's funding for both aged and young should be balanced out .
People need to be more practical and far-sighted to  consider the next generation in the country .
This can be done by building up funds for the country's development , while not overdoing funding for the aged .
The main focus should be on the country's development .
Therefore , public spending on the elderly should be restricted .
Public spending on the aged should not be limited because this is part of the country's development and social well being .
It is equally important as the other aspects of the country's development .
Some countries are experiencing an aging population , for example Japan , which is facing rapid change  , had a 5 .1%1 increase in aging population over the last 30 years .
This figure is expected to increase as more elderly  reach 65 years old .
Countries such as Singapore are also facing rapid aging population growth with a decreasing fertility rate  of 0 .31%1 over the past 7 years .
If this trend continues , Singapore will be second after Japan  .
An aging population  affects the country's economy because of the high retirement rate and the increased need for providing healthcare for the elderly .
therefore public spending should not be limited  because it is still part of the country's responsibility to take care of the aged population .
Firstly , Singapore is one of the many countries experiencing an aging population , where the median age has increased from 16 .9 years since 1970 to 19 .51 years now with a decreasing fertility rate [1] .
Large number of retirees are expected in the futureand the government has extended the retirement age from 55 to 65 years .
Other policies the government have implemented is creating more job opportunities for the aged including , providing part time jobs , allowing flexible working hours and giving an option for them to work at home .
Public funding should be spent on the aged for retraining , as it is also a form of investment because the aged , being part of the workforce , are also helping to improve the economy .
Secondly , as the country's aging population increases , health problems become one of the concerns for the elderly .
For most developed and developing countries , healthcare will become an issue .
As the cost of living increases , the cost of healthcare also increases  .
For instance , healthcare is an issue in the United States  .
Any healthcare cost will become a burden to the elderly as well as to their family members .
On the other hand , countries such as Singapore have policies which help the elderly to cover their medical expenses .
ElderShield plan , an insurance scheme , covers medical treatment expenses for severe disabilities especially for the elderly .
This will not be possible if a limitation on public spending on the aged is imposed .
However , a significant amount of the country's funds should be spent on improving the country's economy , which in turn creates more job opportunities .
For instance , during the current economic downturn , public funding should be diverted to developing more facilities , which will in turn improve ththe economy .
One example is the recent government project of the integrated resort , which will create job opportunities and attract people to spend money when it is completed .
If the economy of the country is not growing , it may affect  businesses  within the country , which in turn affects the employment rate .
Therefore , public spending on the aged should not be limited as they are still part of the country's development and social well being .
It is still part of the country's social responsibility to take care of the aged population .
As a Chinese saying goes , the aged population is actually a treasure to the country .
However a significant amount of funding should also be diverted to other  to stimulate the economy and help the country and its people to survive the economic downturn .
It has been argued that "To a large extent , current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process ."
Elders experience  capabilities in body functions , like standing for extended duration , lifting , diminishing eyesight and slower reaction time among others .
Technologies have been deployed to assist elderly people in day to day activities to counter or decrease disadvantages they face due to their less athletic bodies .
Elderly people are eased in the aging process by technologies that retain  Technologies lower the requirement for physically demanding tasks .
Compared to the past where there was less advanced deployment of machineries and technologies , there are four areas that technologies help the elderly in , work , communication , healthcare and transportation .
Firstly , mechanization and automation have taken away the physical component of many jobs This allows the elderly to have less physical capabilities in their work .
The elderlys are as capable of operating and monitoring equipment as the younger , stronger workers are . .
Working at the port or the warehouse would be impossible for elderly people in the past , where cargo is  uploaded by man .
Dockside cranes and forklifts ,  , allow elderly people to handle the job even though they are not as fit as the younger workers .
Thus , due to mechanization and automation , workers have a smaller decrease in productivity due to age , allowing elderly people to work at an older age than could be done in the past .
The elderly can have a longer time to save up for retirement , decreasing potential financial problems .
The elderly can be at ease knowing that they are able to be more financially capable at an older age .
Secondly , elders can access communication networks through specific communication devices  designed for usage by the elderly .
While most products are still at the prototype stage , the demand in the market warrants such products to be available in the near future .
These devices take into account the tendency  of the elderly to fail to recall operation methods , contacts , schedules , locations , etc .
Much emphasis has been placed on shadow learning curves and user- friendliness to non-technically inclined users User interface and controls can be self-descriptive and intuitiveby using extensive use of icons , grouping of related tasks and automatic hiding and showing of controls by intelligently determining the likely intention of users .
A phone by Doro with big buttons and limited functions is a good example .
The simplicity of this device made it more adoptable for elderly people .
Elderly people can now communicate with each other , their children and relatives regardless of geographical distance .
In the past , they would have had to visit physically at another geographical location or employ the help of their children to make a phone call or chat on the Internet . .
For  , technologies can assist in their healthcare  The access to emergency services and families are of high importance .
There are products in the market where the elderly at home can wear a device like a necklace on which there is a big red emergency button .
A modem installed at home will wirelessly detect the pressing of the emergency button and automatically dial for the emergencyservices with the location  , medical information and family members of the elderly person as long as they press it within the detection range of the device .
This greatly increases the chances of help arriving in a timely manner .
Emergency respond units are able to have detailed medical records of the patients before arrival and apply the appropriate pre-treatment before sending the patient to hospital .
In the past , elderly people would need someone else to look after them and respond to emergency situations .
The elderly might also be unaware or cannot remember their own medical records .
Technologies thus make aging much safer for the elderly .
To help elderly people travel around , the public transportation system underwent changes catering towards them .
In Singapore , MRT stations are retrofitted with lifts so that elderly people do not need to climb the staircase or take the the escalator Many bus service providers around the world are acquiring low- floor buses , which has increased accessibility for elderly people .
Combined with a policy that encourages priority seating for senior citizens , taking public transport has become a much more comfortable experience compared to the past .
In conclusion ,  many technologies  have helped to ease the aging process by a large extent .
Aging would become much more difficult and uncomfortable without these technologies . 
One of the most challenging issues in the world now is  the ability to meet  the increase in energy demand .
Current resources like  fossil fuel , which is used to generate electricity , will eventually be depleted in a few centuries' time (Mitenkov , Kodochigov , Vasyaev , Golovko , Ponomarev-Stepnoi , Kukharkin & Stolyarevskii , 2004) .
One of the solutions to this problem is the Generation IV nuclear reactors .
Among all the proposed reactors , the Very-High-Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is the most suitable option in terms of its design (Mitenkov et al . , 2004) .
Although there are public opponents who do not wish for the nuclear reactors to be built due to potential threats , past incidences and cost , the Generation IV VHTR aims to overcome these negative aspects with funding for its research and development  .
Nuclear reactors are known to be a potential terrorist target .
This is one of the reasons why opponents among the public do not wish for nuclear reactors to be built .
However , according to Butler (2004) , the VHTR has the capability to decrease its own temperature should there be any accident , with minimum operators' involvement .
Therefore , the likelihood of reactors melting down because of terrorists shutting off the coolant to the VHTR is minimised .
Furthermore , terrorist attacks could also come in many other forms; one well-known example is  terrorist attack upon the United States on 11 September 2001 which did not involve nuclear reactors .
Therefore , it can be concluded that if terrorists are determined to destroy a country , they could still use different methods even if nuclear reactors are present in the country .
In addition , since terrorists know that there will be extra precautions taken to safeguard the nuclear reactors , it will be more difficult for them to sabotage the country by means of the nuclear reactors .
In order to make the VHTR  much less attractive as a target to the terrorists , funding for research and development is necessary  to develop simpler safety interlock systems and  materials which can withstand very high temperatures to build the reactor .
The public being nuclear-averse is also the result of the past accidents at Three Mile Island and Chernobyl in Pennsylvania and Ukraine respectively .
The former was caused by operators not being able to respond to a sudden shutdown of the reactor .
Moreover , the cooling system of the reactor was not properly set up; hence , overheating caused the reactors' core to melt and become severely damaged (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
The VHTR can reduce the occurrence of this incident by incorporating a simple cooling system which does not need skilled operators (Butler , 2004) .
Thus , with careful , well trained operators and better cooling systems , the probability of accidents happening will be reduced .
As for the other accident which happened in Chernobyl , it was a result of operators , who were not well trained in operation and safety , operating on a reactor which was inadequately designed (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
These factors led to 56 deaths by 2004 as a result of the reactors' explosion and therelease of radioactive materials into the surroundings (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
It was noted that the explosion was due to the coolant used , which was water , turning to steam and thus suddenly increased the power produced and set off a nuclear reaction (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
It was the inappropriate handling of this sudden increase in power which led to the tragedy .
In the case of the VHTR , the coolant will be helium .
Being chemically inert , helium does not influence the nuclear reactions with a temperature change or  .
Hence , power surges of the reactor will be minimized , resulting in a decrease in the probability of reactor explosion .
This goes to show that nuclear reactors have become safer for operation .
There is no doubt that  opponents would not want  history to repeat itself , so they would not want nuclear reactors to be built .
However , there are important lessons to be learnt from this accident which can be used to improve  the design of nuclear reactors .
Research and development of the VHTR can help to ensure safer operation of a nuclear reactor where safety aspects of the reactor will be better than before .
Besides that , adequate operator training will be planned and carried out faithfully to bring accident rates to a minimum .
With safer nuclear reactors , opponents should feel more at ease with them in their country , and hence , more can be built to help in sustaining the energy supply for the future .
Although the cost of hydrogen replacing gasoline is huge , there will surely be more benefits to mankind due to  high efficiency .
According to Butler (2004) , approximately 400 nuclear power plants , each requiring about US$1 billion , need to be built in order to fully be dependent on hydrogen instead of gasoline .
In addition , research and testing work is required to look for materials which are able to resist the high temperature of the VHTR and the rapid impact of high energy neutrons in the reaction (Butler , 2004) .
Opponents may comment that the initial capital cost is very high , but the VHTR is able to produce 50% more energy than the typical reactor using the same quantity of fuel (Butler , 2004) .
This could help to meet  the rising energy demand .
Although there might be future technologies which will be better than the VHTR , this is not definite as yet .
Therefore , rather than wait for a new technology to fully emerge , we should continue to carry out research work on enhancing  feasible technology present now , which is the nuclear reactor .
Opponents may think that nuclear reactors are potential terrorist targets , but precautions have already taken to minimize the impact .
Moreover , nuclear reactors are not the only targets of the terrorist; there are other ways  terrorists can think of to destroy a country .
Certain major accidents in the past which resulted in deaths involved nuclear reactors , so the public are against nuclear reactors .
However , it is because of these past experiences that there can be improvements to the design of the Generation IV VHTR .
Therefore , the VHTR can be said to be much safer than nuclear reactors of the past .
Lastly , the cost to build and experiment on newly designed nuclear reactors may be high , but the advantage that they can produce more energy with the same amount of resources  far surpasses the cost involved as the important issue now is to solve the problem of constantly increasing  energy demand .
It is mentioned in Butler's article (2004) that building the VHTR can involve many obstacles , but if engineers are able to overcome them , then energy production will be "safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and proliferation resistant" .
Hence , I strongly recommend  further funding for  research and development for engineers to overcome the challenges involved in constructing the VHTR .
