The Chernobyl disaster  was a major engineering accident that occurred in the year 1986 .
The causes of the accident were classified to be design flaws of the nuclear reactor system as well as violation of safety regulations by the operators before the accident .
Some people believe that the use of psychology during the design process might have corrected all the flaws of the system , thus preventing the tragedy while others argue that this incident occurred due to severe breaches of safety regulations by the operators .
Therefore psychology plays no role in preventing this accident as the causes were due to human errors .
In my opinion , I trust that the use of psychology during the design process would have prevented the accident .
The use of psychology would rectify the design flaws and safety mechanism implemented to counter human errors .
Opponents  might argue that human errors occur on a random basis; therefore they could not be prevented .
It was this violation of safety rules by the operators prior to the accident that caused the explosion; thus  psychology during the design process would not contribute anything beneficial to the operations .
An experiment was conducted before the nuclear reactor was due for maintenance .
Before the test , the emergency core cooling system was shut down .
The first human error committed was to continue with the test .
The power of the reactor continued to drop below the lower limit for the experiment .
Control rods which act as absorbers were withdrawn from the core to increase the power of the reactor .
This was human error two .
All the circulating pumps were connected to the reactor that had its control rods withdrawn .
This caused an unstable thermo-hydraulic status .
The experiment started in these undesirable conditions .
Power began to rise and the absorbers were sent back to the core to control the reaction; however  they were unable to plunge fully into the lower stop due to mechanical fault .
The decision to cut off current that holds the absorbers to ensure the falling of rods caused the explosions .
It was through this series of human errors committed prior to the moment that caused this incident .
The impact of human errors could be minimized if appropriate safety mechanisms were installed on the system .
Psychologists could brainstorm for possible human errors that could be committed by the operators and recommend counter measures .
One possible counter measure against human errors could be to configure the system in such a way that whenever safety has been compromised , the system will be automatically shut down .
The use of psychology will bridge the gap between designers and operators as the system will not be overly complicated for the operators to work on .
All operation knowledge and training should be properly imparted by the engineers to the operators so as to guarantee system operation efficiency and safety .
All these measures taken will reduce the human errors to an insignificant level; thus those mistakes committed might not cause such a huge impact and Chernobyl accident might not have occurred .
A report published by IAEA Nuclear Safety Advisory Group stated that the actual causes were due to design errors .
The reactor constructed for the Chernobyl Nuclear Plant was the second generation nuclear reactor which was almost identical to the first generation .
Engineers failed to rectify the design errors found in the first generation; thus  all shortcomings were modeled into the second generation reactor .
The reasons that engineers failed to challenge the errors could be their large working group .
Studies have shown that considerable productivity loss is found when people of different background work together .
Factors affecting a group include evaluation apprehension , free riding and blocking .
The result of all the problems faced by the design engineers was a nuclear reactor which carries several design flaws .
The water channels run through the core vertically where a temperature gradient will be built up .
This causes the reaction within the core to increase greatly .
The control rods end tips were made of graphite which is a more potent neutron moderator and greatly increases the rate of fission reaction when the rods are initially inserted into the reactor .
This defeats the purpose of the control rods .
The use of psychology from the start of design process would rectify all the faults found .
Psychologists are able to give a more objective view on the integrity of the project .
Psychologists , being the middleman , will connect all the engineers together to design the new reactor .
Therefore all the features that compromise safety would be eliminated during the design process .
Therefore the use of psychology during design process would reduce design errors in the new reactor created .
Human errors are unavoidable .
Psychologists must be present to give their safety judgments to incorporate additional counter measures against possible human errors .
The use of psychology could also remove all the design flaws and add in a desirable mechanism to the system , thus creating a more efficient reactor for both the engineers and operators .
Therefore the use of psychology during the design process could have possibly prevented the Chernobyl incident .
Almost every day when we read the newspaper , articles about energy saving or increasing oil price will jump into our sight .
Actually , global warming and energy crisis have been  extremely popular topics these years and large proportion of the governments'  revenue has been spent on the research and development of new energy resources , such as solar energy and tidal power .
Among these new energy resources , nuclear power is highly favored by researchers due to its abundant base materials , low quantities of waste and comparatively cheap fuel costs .
CITATION Why06 \l 2052 (Why use Nuclear Power ? , 2006) Such a situation indicates that the new dawn of the nuclear power is at the corner although it means that the public have to struggle to restore their confidence ruined by the past appalling accidents of nuclear power plants .
Safety is always the thing that matters most .
After the Chernobyl disaster in Soviet Union , many people started to reject the proposal of wide usage of nuclear power .
But actually , no energy sources can be said to be free of risk .
Coal and oil have brought us problems like global warming and acidic rain; hydro projects have deteriorated the environment of  flooded and downstream areas and can lead to great economical loss and mortality once dams collapse; the mirrors and panels used for solar energy production can affect the environment too .
CITATION Com09 \l 2052 (Comparisons of various energy sources  , 2009) Hence , what we should concentrate on now is how to make the nuclear power production safer instead of arguing whether to reject it or not .
The good news is that the basic technology for VHTR has been well established and has been tested by many nuclear plants vendors and national laboratories .
Furthermore , the VHTR concept requires "the lowest risk technology development" to "achieve the needed commercial functional requirements" CITATION Ver09 \l 2052 (Very-High-Temperature Reactor (VHTR)) among the six Generation IV reactors .
Therefore , safety is highly guaranteed in the development and application of VHTR .
Besides safety , people are concerned much about the work efficiency .
Nobody wants to spend so much of their resources to develop something operating poorly .
In fact , "the VHTR system is designed to be a high-efficiency system and that can supply process heat to a broad spectrum of high-temperature and energy-intensive , non-electric processes ."
CITATION Ver09 \l 2052 (Very-High-Temperature Reactor (VHTR)) The pebble-bed and prismatic design of VHTR makes no intermediate refueling necessary .
And due to high temperature , the reactor generates electricity and hydrogen simultaneously , superior to the sodium-cooled fast reactors and critical-water-cooled reactors which can only generate electricity .
In addition , the high temperature exchanger and electrical heater of a VHTR system prevent significant efficiency loss .
Therefore , the VTHR system can meet our efficiency requirements undoubtedly .
Last but not  least , every technological innovation should be feasible not only technically but also economically .
As far as we know , the ultra-long life VHTR systems can be developed with minor actinides .
Minor actinides used can incinerate burnable poisons or fuel materials to obtain high levels of burn-up , which could "facilitate development of new fuel cycles and support sustainability of a fuel source for nuclear energy" .
CITATION Pav09 \l 2052 (Tsvetkov) So the cost of maintenance and fuels for VHTR can be highly reduced compared to other Generation IV reactors .
Besides , the earliest delivery time for VHTR is 2020 , earlier than that of other Generation IV reactors except Sodium-cooled fast reactors .
The earlier delivery means the earlier alleviation of these impending problems and more payback .
Hence , the VHTR systems are highly practical economically .
In conclusion , to solve the global warming and energy shortage problems , we need the exploration and better utilization of nuclear energy .
And among the six proposed new generation nuclear reactors , the VHTR systems are the best in consideration of various factors .
The strong technological backup provides adequate safety; the specific innovational design of the system ensures high work efficiency; the ultra long lifetime and early delivery brings comparatively lower cost .
Therefore , VHTR is the one which deserves further research and development funding most .
On the 6th of March 1987 the freight ferry 'Herald of Free Enterprise' capsized just ouside the port of Zeebrugge .
The accident took the lives of 150 passengers and 38 crewmembers  .
(Pijnenburg &Duin ,1990) .
Could this accident have been prevented or to be specific could the use of psychology during the design process prevent this accident from happening ?
Major accidents besides Zeebrugge such as the 'Three Mile Island' incident and the 'Chernobyl 'disaster are said to be caused by human error .
Statistics show that close to 90% of all accidents is caused by human error .
(BI-ME staff ,2009) The major companies have given the excuse of cost and time as the reason why they have not considered implementing psychology during the design process .
Although these major companies have not shown a high enough level of interest to invest in the use of engineering psychology , I believe that engineering psychology can help improve on the safety of operation in their industry and eventually reduce accidents .
I will look into the 'Zeebrugge' incident in detail to prove that it could have been prevented if psychology were used during the design process .
In the case of the 'Zeebrugge' incident , there were many things wrong with the design of the ferry .
For instance the ferry's design is a huge hull for which its purpose is to load and unload cars at a very fast pace .
Although it might seem a good idea at first  having a huge hull means that the boat can easily turn over when there is water on deck (Noyes  & Stanton ,1997) .
This matter has been brought into attention to the Board of Directors but they were not willing to waste money to have the engineers sketch up a new design .
Another design flaw is there were no light indicators to give notice of the status  of the bow doors .
Once again  ,the idea was rejected because of cost issues .
Considering that one of the reasons that the accident happened is because the bow doors were still open when the ferry left the port  ,it makes us wonder whether the accident could really have been prevented if proper precautions were taken .
During the design process , it is important to ensure that the product design is safe and user friendly (Wilpert ,2007) .
When designing a product or even a system , engineers must make sure that there are safety measures or considerations taken in the design .
Another cause of the ferry capsizing is the lack of communication within the organization .
Critics claim that it is important to establish a professional relationship between the workers and make sure the workers do not step over their scope of work .
This way of thinking however is inexcusable as when working in an engineering industry , most departments rely on each other .
When water started to flood in the 'Herald Of Free Enterprise' , one deck hand noticed it but did not report the matter because he thought that others may have noticed and it was not his job .
If there were proper interaction between the workers the 'Zeebrugge' incident could have a different ending .
Apart from that there is also the matter of the management's role into the 'Zeebrugge' incident .
The management is said to be pushing their workers to work double shift just for their own profits .
Critics mentioned that the welfare of the workers is not important .
As long as they are being paid for their extra work , it is fine .
That way of management is very harsh as the workers' safety and their health are very important .
Looking in the 'Zeebrugge' incident , the worker who was supposed to make sure the bow doors were closed , was asleep .
Because the higher-ups forced the workers into exhaustion an engineering accident happened .
The workers' psychological state and physiological state must be good in order for him to perform his job .
When the workers' mind is in the right place , then he will be happy and content when working (Carpentier & Cazamian ,1977) .
This will undoubtedly reduce human error .
It is without question that the 'Herald of Free Enterprise' would not have capsized if psychological approach is taken during the design process .
Not only the incident at 'Zeebrugge' , but many other major  from this approach in design .
The fundamental issues when designing is that it should match its expectations and also be safe to operate (Wilpert ,2007) .
Although it is impossible to totally remove human error from operations , the  next best thing we can do is to reduce it and by using psychology such a goal can be achieved .
In the past few decades , nuclear energy has been considered as a futuristic and exotic technology which requires much research and experimentation in order to develop these farfetched ideas .
Nowadays , reactors in operation around the world are generally considered second or third generation systems , with the first-generation systems out-dated some time ago .
Our next step will be to innovate generation IV reactors which are cheaper , safer and cleaner compared with the current nuclear reactors .
This mission is put under the responsibility of the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) where ten nations will come together to research and plan the nuclear reactors of tomorrow .
Among the six generation IV reactors concepts , the Very High Temperature Reactor concept deserves further research and development funding for it .
As an introduction , the Very High Temperature Reactor concept uses either a prismatic-block or pebble bed reactor design graphite-moderated core with uranium fuel cycle to generate electricity and produce hydrogen through a thermochemical process .
This high temperature reactor uses inert helium to keep the reactor cool and can be considered as passively safe .
Experiments have been carried out by Japan's Atomic Energy Research Institute based in Kashiwa to test its feasibility by operating a similar high-temperature engineering test reactor at Oarai , Tokyo .
Its first test run had a quite satisfactory result by achieving its goal of 9500C without having any sign of partial reactor meltdown .
Hence , this reactor is practical and has a high potential to be the next generation nuclear reactor .
Generally , nuclear power is a sustainable energy source that does not pollute our environment with tremendous amounts of toxic gases such as nitrogen oxides , sulfur oxides and carbon dioxide .
Compared with fuel oil and coal combustion , nuclear power not only meets the increased global energy demands in the future but also avoids global warming issues .
In Taipei , Taiwan , the government would rather  extend its oldest nuclear plant's life and is willing to take the risk of public safety just to cut down the greenhouse effects .
However , we cannot deny the fact that nuclear energy will produce radioactive wastes that raise the concern of the public .
In fact , nuclear power plant will only emit a very small percentage of radioactive wastes to the air during its operation and the possibility of nuclear wastes leakage is very low .
This safety issues arises because of the huge information gap besides the lack of communication and understanding between the experts and the public about the safety measures taken during the operation of nuclear power plant .
In terms of performance , the Very High Temperature Reactor  is able  to generate 50% more electricity compared with other conventional plants such as Pressurized Water Reactor .
This is because this reactor is designed to run at temperature 10000C which is the highest temperature used among the generation IV reactors to generate electricity  using the same amount of fuel .
Basically , high temperature operations are more efficient to convert heat energy to electrical energy and can avoid wasting of energy in other forms .
This reactor does not have a waste recycling process  and instead , the waste goes directly to the repository .
Although reprocessing can decrease the quantity of waste produced , the generation of weapons-grade plutonium is still not a beneficial product to human kind .
We should cut down the amount of plutonium present and not increase its quantity for further development .
There is no doubt that up-front cost of nuclear power plant building is relatively expensive compared to those associated with fossil fuels .
In fact , there are many ways to mitigate these costs .
The Very High Temperature Reactor is considerably cheap compared to other reactors .
It does not run the conventional reprocessing which is rather expensive and it is among the earliest delivery of generation IV reactor .
Hence , this reactor does not need a very long research period and cuts down the unnecessary development funding .
In conclusion , nuclear energy brings many advantages to our society .
It not only decreases the world's dependency on fuel oils to generate electricity , but also acts as an environment protector .
Although there are a few drawbacks of nuclear power , we can reduce these negative effects by using the latest technology in newer reactors and placing emphasis on public safety .
As long as we use it wisely and efficiently , I believe that nuclear power greatly surpasses other type of energies .
The chief issue that the public have against nuclear reactors is of course it's safety .
Past events such as the incident in Chernobyl serve as a grim retheirder of the dangers that comes with a nuclear reactor .
On top of that , VHTR require a relatively high areerating temperature and pressure for optimum function .
To ensure that VHTR does not suffer the same fate as reactor 4 inA nuclear plant ew materials such as nickel super-alloys and chromium steel are being looked at as potential candidates for reaction vessels as these materials are capable of withstanding the extreme conditions of VHTR .
The reaction itself , unlike other generation IV plants , is moderated by uranium oxycarbide coated graphite , a naturally safe choice , capable of retaining radioactive waste .
BesideHowever , helium , the coolant of choice in VHTR is chemically inert .
So , it is not affpromise radiation , unlike other coolants such as water .

In a time where energy sources are depleting rapidly , a call for new alternate energy has been made by several countries and a large amount of effort and money has been poured into this new cause .
Nuclear power energy has been claimed by many as the most desired new energy source for the new age (Butler , 2004) .
However , in my opinion , other alternate energy sources like solar and hydro energy have more potential to be the new dawn for energy as they have far more advantages than nuclear energy and with lesser risk involved .
Firstly , there have been reports that the use of nuclear energy is much safer as there are much fewer accidents happening in nuclear plants compared to the number of accidents that that happened in conventional fuel-burning energy plant .
Indeed , there might be a decrease in the number of accidents in nuclear plants , in contrast to the thousands of death that happened in conventional energy plants .
However , in the event of a nuclear accident there are usually hundreds of thousands who will be affected (Wald , 2000) .
The sheer number of people affected in one nuclear accident is far more than the number of accidental deaths happened in conventional energy plants over the years .
Furthermore , the adverse effect of the radiation that remains behind after a nuclear accident will cause devastating effects on the environment and the human population in the area .
These effects can range from immediate death to nausea , vomiting , and radiation  burns .
Moreover , these are just the immediate effects on human health; some indirect effects include death in ten days , leukemia , cancers , genetic damage to offspring and even premature ageing depending on the amount of radiation received (Amory , 2009) .
A major concern in the use of nuclear energy is the issue of safety .
Many researchers like Butler assert that the energy produced by nuclear power plants is safe and it can generate a large amount of energy which will solve the pressing problem of depleting fuel sources .
One of the generation IV reactor concepts is the 'very high temperature reactor' with operating conditions such as high pressure and temperature Celsius (Butler , 2004) .
These operating conditions can severely injure any worker on-site if there are any leakages .
Another major issue with the nuclear plant will be the security aspect of the use of nuclear power .
It is a well-known fact that the by-product of the nuclear plant , mainly the nuclear waste has been used for developing nuclear weapons (Wald , 2000) .
The development of nuclear weapons has been condemned by several countries and organizations like the U .N (United Nations) .
Although some might claim that  ,  it is almost impossible to guard against such cases (Butler , 2004) .
Moreover , the ever increasing risk of terrorism will result in a much threatening situation if the nuclear weapon is  stolen .
The amount of damage that will occur is unimaginable  if the terrorists are able to get their hand on a nuclear power plant .
Lastly , the impending cost factor of researching and building a generation IV reactor is regarded as insignificant compared to the amount of money that can be generated when nuclear energy replaces current energy sources (Butler , 2009) .
In fact , this is not true at all .
The amount of money that is required to build these is usually an astronomical amount (James , 2002) , not to mention  there are many underlying costs such as the nuclear plant maintenance cost , the land required to build a reactor and the waste management system .
The maintenance cost that is required for each nuclear reactor is much higher than for a conventional energy plant as the safety measures for these plants are much more detailed since it is handling highly reactive substances .
After a certain amount of usage or a period of time , a nuclear reactor will have to be decommissioned and the cost incurred is not  just large sum of money , but  land spaces are needed as well .
All these costs incurred by the nuclear reactor are much more hurting to the economy rather than easing the financial pressure for countries .
In conclusion , all the following aspects such as the security , safety and costs component for a nuclear reactor indicate far more disadvantages and risks compared to the advantages that the nuclear reactor  brings about .
Thus , in my view , there are much better technology and sources than nuclear power around , so there should be more emphasis and support for other technologies .
It is beyond doubt that the Earth has been recently getting warmer .
The most devastating effects of global warming was the South-Eastern Australian heat wave which brought temperatures soaring above 43 degrees Celsius according to the  (2009) .
One of the main contributors of global warming is the burning of coal and gas to produce energy .
In the year 2007 , it was proven that the coal-generated power plants were the largest source of global warming (Environment News Service , 2008) .
However , we can reduce global warming by using the Generation IV (Gen IV) reactor concept nuclear plants .
One such reactor is the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) which can produce large volumes of energy cleanly , reliably , safely and affordably .
This would therefore provide future price stability and have environmental attributes .
These characteristics demonstrate why the VHTR is such an imperative in the United States (Wallace , 2005) , but due to public opposition , nuclear reactors are perceived as dangerous and unreliable .
However , we should clear the misunderstandings of nuclear energy and learn to accept it and use it to save the Earth .
Furthermore , there is widespread information that nuclear energy is the most expensive and unreliable source of energy .
On the contrary , a team of energy experts from various governments , academic and private sector research units noted that wind and solar powers are not very reliable as they are only generated when the wind is right or when the sun is shining (Science Compass , 2002) .
Furthermore , they are also very difficult to store hence making it a very unreliable source of energy .
In addition to this , solar and wind technologies are four to ten times more expensive than nuclear energy sources like the VHTR .
For example , a VHTR costs 2 billion dollars and is able to supply electricity to billions of homes whereas one wind energy system for one home costs 25 ,000 dollars .
In comparison , VHTR supplying electricity is much cheaper (Martin , 2009) .
In short , Wind and solar power are intermittent and unpredictable and they simply cannot replace coal generating power plants .
Therefore , building a Gen IV nuclear reactor like the VHTR is not as unreliable and expensive as perceived by most .
Another issue widely discussed by the public is the issue of nuclear waste .
It is true that the generation of electricity in a nuclear power plant produces nuclear waste which is difficult to dispose of and harmful to the public as the effects are devastating .
However , according to the {International Atomic Energy Agency}[HYPERLINK: http://www .iaea .org/Publications/Factsheets/English/manradwa .html] (2005) , there is research being conducted to develop a technology where the VHTR will be powered by using fuels originating from reprocessed nuclear-waste .
This technology would not only destroy most of the nuclear waste , but it would also make the existing waste a very valuable source of energy .
Furthermore , it can also be used to deliver ten times the energy of an original fuel .
Hence , with more research and time given to develop the technology , nuclear waste would not become a  anymore .
In conclusion , the VHTR can be seen as a safe , reliable and  affordable way to produce electricity since electricity has become a necessity in our everyday lives .
To confront global warming , Gen IV nuclear reactors like the VHTR should be seen as a solution .
According to a study by MIT in 2003 , it was concluded that the use of nuclear energy may be needed to meet future energy demands and to reduce carbon emissions as energy demands continue to rise annually .
Yetsubstantialfixed; thus a nuclear plantprovidingIn conclusion , the different factors of costs , mainly construction costs , operating costs and decommissioning costs contribute to almost the whole cost of building nuclear plant .
The total cost is a very huge figure as compared to other types of power plants .
As such , I do not support the further R&D ftong for it .
This is backed up by the fact that no new nuclear power plants have been ordered in the US since 1978 as the high costs have caused many problems such as bawouldptcies (Clayton , 2009) .

In a world where technology has fitted seamlessly  , the threat of global warming and rising energy needs which affect the future of our planet has never been greater .
Given the gloomy forecast on global warming due to the environmental impacts caused by greenhouse gases , it is not surprising that countries are turning towards nuclear energy as an alternative .
The only issue that stands in the way of the government turning towards this alternative is the memories of past incidents such as the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , and the partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania (Butler , 2004 , para .4) .
However , over the recent years , research is starting to show that such issues can be overcome , and together with the launch of generation IV reactor concepts , we may be on hand to witness the revival of nuclear reactors which are safer , more valuable and more energy-efficient .
According to a statistical review of world energy consumption done by the EIA (Energy Information Administration , 2009) , the total world consumption of marketed energy is projected to increase by 44 percent from 2006 to 2030 .
Given the fact that the current rate of fuel consumption is already causing damage to our planet , such statistics is indeed alarming .
This leads to an increased urgency to turn to the usage of alternative energy such as nuclear energy , as the waste produced does not contain any greenhouse gases , thus it will help reduce global warming , as well as climate change .
As stated in Butler's article (Butler , 2004 , para .9) , the production of nuclear power plants may cost up to a hefty US$1 billion , yet it may end up as the cheaper alternative  compared to the rising cost of oil and fuels , since fossil fuels are getting scarcer , and hence more expensive .
Generation II's reactors are known to be less efficient  compared to the energy generated by fossil fuels , which has led to the decrease in the production of such plants , to the point that countries have resorted to using more fossil fuels instead of relying on the nuclear plants .
However , one of the generation IV reactor concepts such as the Gas-Cooled-Fast-Reactor (GCFR) has new functions which are turning the heads of investors and the government .
The GCFR has a 50% increase in efficiency as compared to Generation II's reactors .
Studies have shown that nuclear fission , the splitting of a heavy atom's nucleus , releases great amounts of energy .
(N .D . Alternate Energy Sources) For example , the energy it releases is 10 million times greater than is released by the burning of an atom of fossil fuel .
Besides , it would take many hectares of land covered with solar collectors , wind farms or hydro-electric dams to equal this power .
The fact that it is also able to produce both electricity and hydrogen makes it all the more practical .
Hydrogen can then be converted to produce electricity; without this conversion , demand from US transport alone will cause the nation's oil imports to soar by 78% (Butler , 2004 , para .15)
The damages caused by global warming may be causing the birth of nuclear technology , and given the benefits that it brings , it comes as no surprise that extensive research is constantly being done to ensure the smooth delivery for this renewable source of energy .
Being equipped with this self sufficient form of energy , mankind can then continue to come up with cutting edge technology without the fear of harming our planet .
Public unease over the safety of nuclear technology has historically been the principal opposition against its utilisation .
Indeed , a burnt child dreads fire .
The nineteen-eighty-six Chernobyl accident killed thirty- one people and resulted in significant damage to environment and population health in large parts of Europe .
However , as pointed out in a 2008 report by the World Nuclear Association , "to this day , the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl accidents remain the only major accidents to have occurred in more than 12 ,700 cumulative reactor-years of commercial operation in 32 countries" .
Furthermore , statistics from the same report placed coal as the type of energy generation which caused the most related immediate fatalities from 1970 to 1992 with a total death count of six thousand and four hundred .
In contrast , nuclear power industry only resulted in thirty-one for the same period .
Moreover , the safety of nuclear technology was demonstrated during Hurricane Katrina in 2005 .
The survival of all three directly affected nuclear plants illustrates the high preparedness of the nuclear industry for operation under harsh conditions .
Crucially , when extrapolated to the event of a hypothesised terrorist strike , it showcased the capability of current technology to work during emergency .
Further research into VHT reactors would improve safety standards and ease public concern .
Next , opponents are concerned about the cost of nuclear energy .
They argue that investing resource into constructing the related facilities is not economical .
Studies from the Nuclear Energy Institute showed otherwise .
In the United States in 2008 , the cost of electricity from nuclear production was 1 .87 cents per kilowatt-hour , lower than that produced with coal or gas  which was 2 .75 and 8 .09 respectively .
Furthermore , the indirect economic cost from global warming would be catastrophic as recently seen in world-wide increase in frequency of natural disasters and their ruthless damage to property and human life .
Moreover , a reason why such facilities are budget taxing is due to lack of construction expertise .
As one of the aims of VHT reactor research is cost reduction , the proposed research and development in this field will draw in resources and bring about a decrease in construction and production cost .
Another reason for opposition is the disputed performance of VHT reactors .
Opponents regard Generation IV reactor as mere concepts which work only in computer simulations .
However , research into enhancing reactors in the last two decades has led to improvement in production efficiency in current plants .
The average capacity factor for plants in the United States was fifty-six percent in 1980  compared to ninety-one percent in 2008 .
Nuclear power has always been a very controversial topic over the past  few decades .
The proponents emphasized  its high energy potential while the opponents were so much concerned about its radioactive nature that might cause harm .
As energy resources have become more and more precious and our technologies keep advancing , the supporting side of nuclear power seems winning in recent years as nuclear power plants are increasing in numbers in America , China , Japan and other countries .
Butler (2004)says that the Supercritical-water-cooled reactors (SCWR) should be used .
Hence , it is necessary to have further research and more development funding for nuclear power due to its cost-efficiency , security and safety issues .
Firstly , nuclear power is superior to other energy resources due to its cost-efficiency .
Global warming has drawn people's attention nowadays .
Al Gore's documentary film "An Inconvenient Truth" and the Kyoto Protocol ratified by nations have shown that it is urgent to find a future energy alternative .
Nuclear energy will be the one as nuclear power can produce 50% more electricity compared to coal and it emits less  dangerous oxides such as  carbon dioxide , sulphur dioxide and so on .
For instance , 790 to 1182 grams of greenhouse gases are released by a coal plant if 1 kilowatt- hour electricity is generated while only 2 to 59 grams of it is emitted by a nuclear power plant .
(Nuclear vs . Coal , 2007) The cost for coal and nuclear energies are generally comparative , $300/Mw-hr for nuclear energy and $29 .1/Mw-hr for coal respectively .
SCWRs are also cheap and efficient to run and build .
Thus , nuclear energy is more cost-efficient compared to existing energy resources and it is more environment-friendly .
Moreover , the nuclear power system  is much more secure than other energy resource systems .
The establishment of a nuclear plant is  .
Once the plants are built up , safety precautions will be installed and working staff will be carefully selected .
Hence , it is indeed not easy for terrorists to attack the plants as they will be spotted and stopped by the high-tech security systems before they do so .
Abuse of nuclear energy is also less likely to happen among countries as international organizations such as United Nations will hinder the proliferation of nuclear weapons .
For instance , North Korea has announced plans to be  a "powerful nation" by 2012 in terms of nuclear weapons .
(Klingner , 2009) America , China and other big countries and organizations have stood up and criticized this action .
Many nuclear power projects are not implemented under pressure such as the one initiated by Korea Peninsula Energy Development Organization (KEDO) .
From the hindered growth of nuclear energy in North Korea , we can see that the abuse of nuclear power such as SCWRs is less likely to happen nowadays .
The atomic bombing in Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945 will definitely not happen nowadays as they will be strongly opposed due to its inherent immorality and military unnecessariness .
On the other hand , nuclear energy is much safer than other energy resources .
Governments have spent large amounts of money in maintaining the safety of nuclear power plants .
Technologies are kept upgraded to ensure the smooth running of the systems .
The following statistics can illustrate that nuclear power is much safer than others .
The number of immediate fatalities from 1970 to 1992 for nuclear power facilities is 31 and those for coal and gas are 6400 and 1200 respectively .
(Ball , 2001) We cannot deny the fact that nuclear disasters have happened in the past such as Chernobyl disaster in 1986 .
(Jaworowski , 2004) However , as compared to coal plant accidents , SCWR is still a superior choice due to its sophisticated safety systems and that is why the governments should have development funding for it to achieve zero nuclear disaster someday in the future .
To sum-up , the nuclear energy is much more environment-friendly and it is a better choice compared to coals and gases as more electricity can be generated by the same amount of nuclear energy with comparative costs .
Nuclear energy is also under protection of high-tech security systems .
Hence , we should support further research in this area and increase the development funding for nuclear power .
Since the nuclear reactor accident at Three Mile Island and Chernobyl , it has been two decades before the issues regarding conventional nuclear power were brought up once again due to increasing cost of power generation .
Generation IV nuclear energy systems offer advantages in the areas of economics , safety and reliability , sustainability and could be deployed commercially by 2030 (Cogeneration Technologies , 2002) .
The Generation IV International Forum (GIF) has selected six nuclear systems which have the potential to be used for commercial electricity generation and in my opinion , the supercritical-water-cooled reactor (SCWR) and the very high temperature reactor (VHTR) are the better ones compared to the rest of the reactors .
Further , I think that the VHTR deserves further research and development funding compared to the SCWR .
On safety features , the SCWR operates at a lower temperature (510C - 550C) than the VHTR (1000C) which gives the impression that VHTR is more dangerous than the SCWR .
But the fact is that the VHTR uses a graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations (Sterbentz , 2007) .
Thus , the core has large thermal inertia which means it is not easily corroded even in high temperatures .
It also has high heat capacity and structural stability .
VHTR uses helium gas as coolant which does not react with other substances even at high temperatures (Chang , 2007) .
Further , the VHTR will be built on hard rock surface and this will minimize the effect of natural disaster such as earthquake .
Besides , it will also be built in a confined building that will protect the reactor from terrorists' attacks .
With these safety and security features , the VHTR is safer and more secure than SCWR .
The reason for using nuclear power is because power generated from fossil fuel is getting more and more expensive due to scarcity of fossil fuel .
Therefore , we must be able to produce nuclear power  at a cost lower than conventional power plants .
The capital cost of a SCWR is approximately USD 1 billion and VHTR is from USD 1 .8 billion to USD 2 .4 billion which means building a SCWR is much cheaper than building a VHTR (US Department of Energy , 2004) .
The reason for the higher cost in building a VHTR is because of its safety features .
In addition , VHTR uses high-strength alloys with protective coatings that could significantly improve the service life of high temperature reactor components .
Furthermore , the capital cost of VHTR will be lower for the second and subsequent reactors than the first one (DOE , 2004) .
In addition , VHTR has a low input cost which will lead to low processing cost that will produce cheaper electricity .
This feature alone already fulfills one of the main objectives of GIF which is to produce low cost electricity .
The reactor's performance is also one of the main concerns of GIF .
SWCR has a higher efficiency compared to the current water-cooled reactor by having a burn-up of 45% but VHTR has an even higher burn-up which is 65% .
Another advantage of VHTR over SWCR is the ability to produce hydrogen without consuming fossil fuels or emitting greenhouse gasses (Forsberg , Peterson & Ott , 2004) .
Hydrogen production needs a high temperature of 700C , so heat from VHTR can be transferred to hydrogen production plant but SWCR does not produce high enough temperature .
Experts see hydrogen as the future fuel and large amounts of hydrogen are needed to convert heavy oils and tar sands to liquid fuel .
Hydrogen is also needed in fertilizer production .
Hydrogen is getting increasingly important because of its potential to be used in fuel cells .
Therefore , the ability of producing hydrogen is a great advantage to VHTR .

This point of view is not true since design processes are human activities and human activities are always accomplished by human errors .
Psychology , by studying human behaviours and activities , is able to detect these human errors and help avoid and eliminate accidents (Stanton , 1996) .

The practice of psychology would help spottininvolvementgligence and the accident would probably be avoided .

Another opposing view expressed by some managers is that the enrollment of psychologists in design processes will increase the cost and time spent .
This is a valid concern; however it cannot deny the significance of practice of psychology in design processes .

This problem can be perfectly solved if engineers are educated in psychology .

The first nuclear reactor was built as part of the Manhattan project back in the 1940's to build an atomic bomb (Gilman , Newton , N .D) .
After World War II , nuclear reactors became power generators , providing electrical energy .
However , people opposed the usage of nuclear power .
The opposition can be categorized into three main groups; the public , the government , and the industry .
The public are concerned about health and safety , governments are concerned about security , the environment , and space constraints , and the industries are concerned about profits , the environment , and operation stability .
To address these concerns , experts proposed several designs for the next generation of reactors .
These designs are flawed , failing to resolve some of the concerns people have .
However , with fossil fuel depleting fast (Howden , 2007) , alternative sources of energy need to be explored; hence research on nuclear power as an energy source should be carried out .
In addition , the Lead-cooled fast reactor (LCFR) design is the best solution to the people's concerns , so research should be concentrated on this design .
First , the LCFR operates in a moderate temperature , low pressure condition (Butler , 2004) .
This characteristic is advantageous as operating a reactor under such conditions is simpler compared to the extreme conditions such as high temperature required for the other designs .
Also , according to Butler (2004) , at such temperatures the conversion of heat to electricity is efficient , thus producing more energy than present nuclear plants .
Thus the expenses to develop and operate the LCFR are cheaper than the other designs , increasing profit .
This addresses the considerations industries have for profits and operation stability .
Furthermore , with stability , accidents are unlikely to occur , and therefore it resolves  the concerns people have for safety .
Next , the LCFR enables waste recycling .
The advantage is the maximized use of uranium , the fuel for nuclear power .
As uranium is a non-renewable resource , wasting should be discouraged , as uranium reserves will deplete as rapidly as fossil fuel .
This is critical as one motive of looking for alternative energy sources is to have a long lasting source; thus this property should be prioritized .
In addition , with waste recycling , the amount of radioactive waste to be disposed is reduced .
This dispels the environmental concerns that governments and industries have .
However , waste recycling is dangerous , as plutonium is separated .
Plutonium is a key ingredient of nuclear weaponry , thus causing the government's security concerns .
Nevertheless , this can be resolved by implementing restrictions on nations , preventing nuclear weaponry development .
Hence this property should be present in the future nuclear plant .
Another property of the new nuclear plant is the production of hydrogen fuel together with electricity .
As hydrogen is capable of replacing fossil fuel as an energy source (Bose ,  Malbrunot , 2006) , having nuclear plants that produce hydrogen will relieve us of our dependence on the fast depleting fossil fuel for energy .
This will benefit the world , as carbon emissions will then decrease , slowing down global warming .
However , considering the large amount of space taken up by a plant and its hydrogen output , governments will debate over whether it is worthwhile to use so much land to produce enough fuel for the nation .
In addition , for small countries such as Singapore , there is no room to even construct a plant to power the country .
Nonetheless , land constraints may be resolved by situating the nuclear plant offshore , which is  listed as  one of the considerations by the government of Singapore (Li , 2008) .
With alterations to the operating temperature , pressure , waste recycling ability and power output of present nuclear reactors , the LCFR design is able to address many concerns the world has regarding the utilization of nuclear power .
In addition , with the advantages of the LCFR design heavily outweighing the possible problems it may bring , the LCFR design is arguably the most suited solution amongst the six designs to the concerns the world has towards nuclear power .
Therefore , more funding should be provided for research and development to be carried out on the LCFR design .
Nuclear power has always been a dilemma to humans .
As it is a very promising energy source , it is not a wonder that nuclear power is extremely enticing to mankind .
This advantage , however , comes with a price .
The danger , which nuclear power holds , is a big concern and it has held the development of nuclear technology back for decades .
The radioactive waste produced in a nuclear process is also dangerous and lasts for a very long time .
After years of development , the scientists published six generation IV reactor concepts which should solve most of today's problems in nuclear plants .
The most promising would be the sodium-cooled fast reactors (SFR) because ,  safety wise , SFR needs low pressure and temperature to operate and it does not produce hydrogen which is volatile .
For the product , only electricity is produced , making it one of the most efficient reactors .
In terms of safety , SFR is safer because of its necessary condition , like temperature and pressure , to operate and the waste it produces .
SFR operates at a temperature around 5500C which for a nuclear plant is considered a low temperature for a nuclear plant to operate .
The low temperature indicates that we do not need to manufacture a new kind of material to withstand the temperature .
; most of the concepts are operated at almost twice the temperature SFR is operating at .
SFR is also operating at a pressure around atmospheric level so it is safer because the high pressure will increase not only the stress on the walls of the plant but also the damage if an explosion happens .
Using radioactive material such as Uranium238 , plutonium and lanthanum , the SFR runs a full cycle which nearly consumes all the material to produce electricity .
This means that no radioactive waste is released  to the public and also no hydrogen is produced as a byproduct .
As no radioactive waste is thrown out , there is no danger of radioactive poisoning .
The risk of explosion is lowered because no hydrogen is produced but we still need to be cautious as we are using sodium as a coolant and sodium not only explodes if it is in contact with water but also burns if it touches air .
Operating at low temperature and pressure also means that this model is efficient as less heat is being transferred out of the system and the energy is turned to electricity .
The fact that radioactive source are being processed repeatedly until it changes into non-radioactive compounds and no byproduct produced also indicates that this model has high efficiency .
SFR has  a high capital cost due to the necessity to use magnesium oxide as the container of sodium to prevent it leaking .
This problem deters many countries from pursuing the SFR model further but if they manage to build an SFR plant , the profit that comes from building one will cover the capital cost in just several years .
Right now , there is research to reduce the cost by improving the design of SFR and the most prominent is probably by improving the design of the core of SFR .
Other concepts may have lower capital cost but they also have a lower efficiency .
From all the advantages like the low pressure and temperature condition , almost no radioactive waste and no other byproduct like Hydrogen , it can be seen that SFR is the most promising and advantageous model compared to other reactor concepts and it is worth every dollar spent to pursue deeper research and development .
This model's weaknesses like the high capital cost and the danger of using sodium are actually solvable by producing a new metal that is incapable of reacting to sodium .
Nuclear energy has been a topic of discussion among the society given the memories of the partial nuclear meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , during which the reactor core exploded (Butler , 2004) .
The radioactive effects of the aftermath can still be felt even years after the accident with common side effects that include deformities in newborn babies .
The issue of safety is of utmost concern in the debate of whether nuclear reactors should even be in operation .
The world's natural resources are depleting rapidly  and there is a need to search for alternatives to meet the ever increasing energy demands of the world .
Generation IV reactors may just be the solution to meet these demands .
In addition , their new designs will address safety issues .
Two of such Generation IV reactors include the very high temperature reactor (VHTR) and the gas cooled fast reactor (GCFR) .
Both of these designs incorporate helium as a coolant and produce electricity as well as hydrogen as their energy output (Butler , 2004) .
However , the favourable VHTR has advantages in performance , safety and cost that outweigh those of the GCFR and thus should be given support for further research and development .
Firstly , the VHTR has better performance than the GCFR .
The GCFR produces less waste than the VHTR (Khalil , n .d) .
However , with less waste produced it means that the same fuel is reused several times .
As a result , the fuel loses its properties to generate energy over time .
In contrast , the VHTR uses fresh fuel each time and therefore , output efficiency remains high .
Furthermore , the VHTR has a higher operating temperature , which is essential in achieving better efficiency , as energy output is dependent on temperature (A Technology Roadmap for Generation IV Nuclear Energy Systems , 2002) .
This will result in the VHTR producing more energy with the same amount of fuel .
Secondly , the VHTR incorporates a safety feature that is not present in the GCFR .
The GCFR operates at a much safer lower operating temperature compared to the VHTR .
In contrast , the VHTR operates at a higher operating temperature .
However , the VHTR has a temperature monitoring system that constantly monitors the temperature of the core to prevent any meltdowns from occurring , and it has a proper back up system that continues producing energy during a malfunction .
This is particularly important for a country like France where 80% of its energy depends on nuclear source (Butler , 2004) .
Moreover , with such a system , human intervention can be avoided during emergencies .
Also , we have to understand that every system is bound to fail .
Relying on visual inspection of the core will not be adequate for the GCFR to meet safety standards .
In addition , the issue of waste recycling in GCFR will pose a huge problem .
Waste recycling will produce plutonium and uranium in its pure form , which is an active ingredient used in the making of nuclear weapons (Butler , 2004) .
This problem is not present in the VHTR that stores waste instead of recycling it (Very High Temperature Reactor , n .d) .
In conclusion , the VHTR should receive further funding for research and development given the advantages it holds over the GCFR .
The VHTR has a better performance in terms of higher energy output , a safer design that meets safety standards and ultimately a more cost effective solution .
On July 17 , 1981 , the interconnected second level and fourth level hanging walkways in the Hyatt Regency in Kansas City collapsed , killing 114 and injuring an additional 200 more (Hotel Horror) .
The reason for this disaster boiled down to gross negligence by the project engineer for not checking with the calculations before agreeing to design changes as a result of material constraints .
In the case of the accident at the Hyatt Regency , the introduction of a psychologist to the errant architecture design firm could have brought to light the negligent behavior of the engineer in question .
However , the identification of this particular problem through behavioral observation by a psychologist may not be a good method given that the multitudes of other problems that might occur , thus leaving much the fault-finding process to chance .
Indeed , the application of psychology in the design process should not only be in the form of adding personnel well-versed in psychology .
The implementation of safety orientated intervention practices as discussed by Geller(2001) can  help cast a wide net of control over the domains of possible human errors .
Geller's article , albeit written in the context of occupational safety , advocates the use of behavior-based safety (BBS) techniques as tools to help members of a working unit to take better control of their safety performance .
One particular way of implementation , the "Actively Caring Model" , shows promise of cultivating a work attitude of actively caring for the associated benefits of others through promoting the effects of various psychological states of mind like self-pride in ones' field of work , the effects which could have prevented this accident .
Additionally , there is a need for the application of psychology to create a standardized design process where measures for the purpose of ensuring safety can be explicitly listed and made compulsory .
An effective measure can be mandating a 'design check' by a competent and independent third party before construction , which could have prevented the accident .
This is where  it is necessary for a psychologist to compliment the design process , by looking out in the directions where the design process is unable to cover .
The operation hierarchy of the engineering firm is highlighted as there is only one person who is responsible for approving the designs .
Given the importance of this task and the possible stresses of the job , it can be very risky to have only have one person in charge .
The utilization of elementary psychology would have prevented this accident as these types of windows of opportunities for risk could have been easily identified and rectified if the firm employed introspective reviewing of its operation .
First of all , if psychology approaches were introduced in the design process , product safety could be better guaranteed .
It is very often that managers of large projects tend to believe that engineers would never make mistakes .
However , the fact is human errors widely exist in engineering designs process , which may result in the failure of product functions (Wilbert , 2007) .

In addition , human scientist will focus on factors that are closely related to the design , such as the environment in which the product will be implemented .
Companies hire engineers to design certain product and they expect them to consider every detail related commonly design .
But in reality , engineers often focus on the product itself while ignoring the environment .
In the case of high-speed train , the track is important to analyze .

It has been argued for a long time whether the use of  nuclear power should be encouraged or opposed .
In recent years , scientists have developed a new concept of nuclear energyGeneration IV reactors .
Generation IV reactors have features such as high operation temperature , simplified safety measures , and proliferation-resistance (Butler , 2004) .
One type of Generation IV reactors would be the very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) .
Many people think that there should not be any more funding for the research and development of VHTR because of its high cost , low reliability , as well as its potential threats .
However , by considering the tremendous benefits it will bring , funding for further research and development of this reactor should still be encouraged .
One reason that causes the public to disapprove of the idea of providing funds for the research and development of VHTR is the high expenses on it which most believe that many countries cannot afford .
In fact , even a prototype of VHTR will cost US$1 billion to build (Butler , 2004) .
However , despite the actual construction cost in building the reactors , VHTR would be economically beneficial because of its high efficiency in electricity and hydrogen production .
It has been proven that the amount of electricity produced by VHTR will be 50% more than that produced by the older nuclear reactors (Butler , 2004) .
In fact , many of the developed countries such as the US and Europe have already started the research and development of VHTR and plan to finish it by 2021 (Kirk , 2006) .
Therefore , if we consider the future benefits that VHTR will bring , the funding would be trivial .
Lastly , despite all the safety measures implemented , it is still believed that the nuclear reactors are potentially dangerous .
It is doubtless to say that there is a possibility that radioactive leak will occur .
However , the VHTR has been developed into such a stage that in an event of accident , the reactor  is able to shutdown itself without human intervention (Miyamoto , 2005) .
This will greatly reduce the possibility of a radioactive leak and make the nuclear reactors safer than ever .
Another problem may be dumping the nuclear waste which , if not carefully considered , may cause serious consequences (Madan , 2008) .
However , VHTR has its unique design which makes the disposal of nuclear wastes convenient and safe .
It has a corrosion-resistant repository which collects all the nuclear wastes before they start decay (Butler , 2004) .
On the whole , the VHTR has shown great potential in becoming the future source of energy .
It is not only more efficient in generating energy , but also more environmentally friendly than those conventional sources of energy .
Therefore , despite the current challenges for this new energy source , the society should provide funding for the research and development of VHTR .

While the demand of energy is constantly increasing , earth is running low in coal , oil , and gas supply .
Based on 2003 rates of production of fossil fuels , the global oil , gas , and coal reserves were predicted to be exhausted in the next 41 , 67 .1 , and 192 years respectively (Lincoln , 2005 , p . 622) .
Due to the scarcity of fossil fuels , nuclear power made its way back onto the table .
The concept of Generation IV reactors was introduced and  several countries in the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) were in favor of the Very High Temperature Reactors (VHTR) .
However , safety , cost , and performance are the three main reasons for opposition to the VHTR .
Even with these three reasons , there is still a need to do further research and development funding for it .
Another reason for opposition is the danger of the operation of nuclear reactors .
Haunted by the memories of the catastrophe at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and Chernobyl in Ukraine , the public requires some convincing (Butler , 2004 , p . 238) .
One of the main safety principles for Generation IV reactors is the concept of defence in depth .
This concept involves several "overlapping layers of safety and multiple barriers , such that if one safety provision should fail , another will be available to prevent unacceptable damage from occurring" (The Risk and Safety Working Group Of the Generation IV international Forum , 2008) .
Hence , with multiple layers of safety measures , operation of VHTR would not pose any threat to the public .
The final argument  by opponents is availability of the coolant of VHTR .
VHTR uses helium as a coolant which is extracted from natural gas reserves .
Given the fact that natural gas reserves are depleting , the same applies to helium as well .
Hence , VHTR will not be able to function in the absence of helium .
The characteristic of helium as an inert gas had made helium recyclable (Bowe , 2004) .
Furthermore , having helium exposed to radiation in the nuclear reactor does not turn helium into a radioactive compound .
VHTR could recycle their coolants and requires minimal addition of helium from time to time .
In a nutshell , the opponent's reasons are debatable .
Energy generated by VHTR is abundant , inexpensive , safe and reliable .
Nuclear energy will do more good than harm to  mankind .
Therefore , further research and development funding for the very-high-temperature reactors should be supported not only by GIF but also other countries as well .
The first nuclear power plant provided electricity to the power grid in the 1950s .
What separates the first nuclear plant from the recent one is the reactor , which has undergone a series of advancements .
The reactor has evolved from Generation I to Generation III over the past five decades with Generation IV being the next prototype .
However , the one reason why few nuclear reactors have been built over the years is public opposition .
(Butler , 2004 , pp .
238-240) Despite the public claiming that nuclear energy is dangerous , an expensive form of energy or of poor performance , the use of molten salt reactor can address their concerns with new designs of the reactor and a cheaper , cleaner and sustainable form of energy .
Thesis statement
The major reactor meltdown happened in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and in 1986 at Chernobyl , Ukraine .
Close to a hundred people died and a few thousand people developed cancer over the decades due to exposure to radiation from the reactor meltdown  .
(Bock , Hofmann , Hoffmann , & Logan , 2005) In the new reactor the radioactive materials are contained within the chamber and if there is a reactor meltdown , the release of large amount of radiation can be prevented .
Most of the public has the misconception that nuclear energy is expensive , therefore  opposing it .
However , it is easy to conclude without substantiating with a proper cost analysis .
The cost of building a nuclear plant is admittedly more that for than other kinds of power plants but the consideration should be based on performance and cost per unit energy .
According to statistics from the Nuclear Energy Institute , nuclear power plants have achieved increasingly higher capacity factors with the same or greater levels of safety over the past two decades .
In the United States , for example , the average capacity factor for nuclear plants in operation in 1980 was 56 .3 percent .
By 1990 , it had risen to 66 percent , and in 2007 to 91 .8 percent .
(Eerkens , 2006 , pp .
19-29)
Some opponents of nuclear energy argue that coal reserves can last another 120 years and funds should be spent on researching technology for coal .
However , this is based on the assumption that coal is used solely for producing electricity .
In fact , coal is an alternative raw material to manufacture plastics in place of oil which will be depleted in 40 years , meaning that coal will last much less than the alleged 120 years .
Unlike coal , nuclear energy uses the fission of atoms to generate electricity .
There are many types of elements and their isotopes available for fission like Thorium , Uranium-235 and Uranium-238 , and reprocessing is possible , resulting in at least a thousand more years for nuclear energy .
The burning of coal also produces carbon dioxide and other air pollutants , contributing to the global warming .
(Eerkens , 2006 , pp .
19-29) Thus , nuclear energy could be a long term solution and it does not contribute to global warming .
It is evident that the claims from the oppositions of nuclear energy are flawed .
In spite of them claiming that nuclear energy is unsafe , costly and of low output , there is research and data to show otherwise with Generation IV reactors .
In conclusion , it could be a wise decision for the public to evaluate nuclear energy as a form of energy and eventually , support further research and development funding for it .
Nuclear reactors are often believed to be accompanied with the danger of leak and explosion .
However , few people know that the Generation IV Reactors , which will be put into use in about 10 to 20 years' time , will produce energy that can be "safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and proliferation resistant ,"  just like what Spencer Abraham , one of the US energy secretaries , said at the 2002 gathering of GIF (Generation IV International Forum) representatives .
The VHTR (very-high-temperature reactor) is one of these reactors .
It can produce heat and hydrogen simultaneously with an outlet temperature as high as 1000 C . Although there are still many peopleconcernedg about the safety andeconomicy factors , the VHTR is indeed one of the most advanced and valuabledesignsn in the world and deserves further research and development funding for it .
Even among all the Generation IV Reactors , the VHTR has the highest operating temperature .
The higher the temperature is the higher heat resisting level the materials must achieve .
So some people worry that the existing materials can not meet the needs  .
And in case of accident , the very severe reaction may be difficult to control .
In fact , the VHTR uses Helium as the coolant and graphite as the material of the core .
Helium is a kind of inert gas and will seldom react even in the very high temperature .
Numerous tests and calculations have shown that it is nearly impossible to burn high-purity , nuclear-grade graphite , since graphite could be heated to more than 1650  C without incurring ignition or self-sustained combustion .
Therefore ,underge normalcircumstancese , there will be no problem for the materials to stand therequiredg high temperature .
Moreover , the reactor adapts the self-regulating system .
If there is some trouble , the reaction will automatically stop and the temperature will gradually cool down to avoid dangers .
The earliest VHTR will not appear on the earth until 2020 while the research has been ongoing since 1990s  with a total research funding of more than 1 .6 billion dollars .
Opponents may argue that it will cost too much to put the design into use .
It is true that the early investment of VHTR is much higher than the existing normal nuclear reactor or others; however , the VHTR could produce 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared with other conventional plants , and its deign life is as long as 60 years compared with 40 years of the normal nuclear reactors .
Besides , the VHTR can gain hydrogen through regular running , which could be converted into electricity for cars and homes .
In other words , the by products are worth a great deal of money .
So , it is easy to find that after a long period  of running , the total cost of VHTR will not exceed that of other existing reactors any more .
In conclusion , the VHTR has its own safety features , such as very high system temperature , enhanced reliability , low system pressure and so on .
The early research and development cost might be high but in the long run there seems no obvious difference .
So it is worth developing and investing .
The two general IV nuclear reactors that we will be discussing are very high temperature reactor (VHTR) and gas cooled fast reactor (GCFR) .
I personally feel that VHTR deserves more funding and research than GCFR in terms of performance , safety and cost .
The similarities between these two reactors are that both  use helium as a coolant , do not need working at high pressure and produce the same output of hydrogen and electricity .
(Butler 2004) .

So a higher operating temperature of VHTR would allow for more electricity to be produced  compared to gas cooled reactors .
Besides that , the waste material being produced by gas cooled fast reactors is pure plutonium and this material is mainly used for weapon production .
This is dangerous if it goes out of hand .

It monitors the reactors to avoid any meltdown .
Such system does not exist in gas cooled reactors that operate at lower temperature .
(http://www .cogeneration .net/very_high_temperature_Reactor .htm) .

In the event of sudden shutdown due to malfunction , VHTR can still produce energy .

as hasof causingFirstly , opponents may doubt the safety and reliability of SCWR .
This doubt arises from the lack of knowledgewhich occurreddesign of this reactor .
The nuclear accident happened at Chernobyl was mainly because the nuclear plant utilized positive void coefficient of reactivity , causing it impossible to stop forrking process when things went wrong .
(Bodansky , 2004) On the contrary , SCWR uses negative void coefficient instead , which could effectively reduce the possibility of this kind ofS DOE Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee & the Generation IV International Forum , 2002) .
Moreover , opponents may also argue that the notion of SCWR is rather a pure theory with no prototype , so that this reactor may not be as effective as stated .
This-argument is sensible but not totally true for SCWR .
Actually , the notion of SCWR is an add on of two current techonologies .
One is light water reactor (LWR) , which is currently under use all over the globe .
The other is supercritical fossil fuel fired boilers , which is also under use now (Idaho National Laboratory , 2007)accidentre , it wouee of these practical experiences .
Thus , although SCWR has no prototype yet , it actually has some reliability for implementation .
Finally , SCWR has a higher thermal efficiency of 44% compared to LWR of 33-35% (Baindur , 2008) .
However , opponents may point out that this high thermal efficiency is achieved at the expense of operating under very high temperature and pressure , which could increase its potential danger .
This concern is necessary but SCWR has overcome this issue .
The coolant in the SCWR system is supercritical water , which has very high specific heat , so that in very effective acting as a coolant .
Besides , this system is simple to construct and control since only one phase of coolant is present throughout the process (Generation IV International Forum , n .d .) .
Therefore , the safety issue concerning high temperature and pressure is overcome to some extent .
To sum up , although there exists disagreement of the use of SCWR due to its issue of reliability and safety , SCWR is worthy for further research because it bases on two current technologies , which increases its reliability , and its design principle improves its thermal efficiency compared to LWR and reduce the possibility of causing nuclear accidents .
Hopefully , SCWR could be better improved on current problems in the future development .
