Given the memories of the two accidents which happened in 1979 at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania and in 1986 at Chernobyl of Ukraine , some people may still have not recovered from the great horror when they hear nuclear power .
However , instead of nuclear power , the fossil fuels people have been using are bringing various challenges to human beings .
On the one hand , people are facing the challenge of energy shortage because fossil fuels are nonrenewable .
On the other hand , burning fossil fuels produces the "green gases" such as carbon dioxide that have resulted in serious problems like global warming .
Therefore , some high-efficient , sufficient and environment-friendly energy is urged .
And because of high-efficiency and cleanliness , nuclear power is coming back into human consideration .
Recently , the generation IV International Forum (GIF) came up with six generation IV reactor concepts .
Among the six reactors , the Very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) stands out and may probably be the first choice as future fuel although some people may worry about its safety and cost .
Opponents may claim that the safety of VHTR cannot be controlled , which allows potential accidents .
However , VHTR is much safer compared to the past nuclear reactors .
First of all , instead of using water as coolant , VHTR uses helium gas .
Hence there is no need to be concerned about the safety of the reactor coolant .
The advantage of using helium as the nuclear reactor coolant is that helium is an inert gas which is single phase , and it will not chemically react with any material (International Atomic Energy Agency , 1997) .
In addition , exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive , which is quite different from most of the other possible coolants (Youchison et al . , 1987) .
Secondly , for the material of VHTR , the ongoing 30-MWth HTTR project in Japan is intended to demonstrate the feasibility of reaching outlet the temperature up to 950 C coupled to a heat utilization process .
Thirdly , there are two unique designs of VHTR , which enhances the safety .
One is that the reactor and the gas turbine system are separated fromthe hydrogenn production plant , which is aimedatoisolatinge the hydrogen plant fromthe reactorr system during the abnormal events ofthe hydrogenn production plant .
The other design is that there are three control valves to mitigate the thermal variation of helium gas , which can automatically control the power generation rate when some abnormal events occur in the IS process such as process pump trip (Japan Atomic Energy Agency , 2007) .
In this case , the number of the accidents caused by human factors would be decreased .
To conclude , it should be evident that the arguments against the safety and cost of VHTR are invalid .
Since VHTR uses helium as a coolant , the research of the materials for VHTR is also ongoing , and also there are unique designs for VHTR , the safety of VHTR would be enhanced a lot .
Besides , compared with other generation IV reactors , VHTR costs less .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen as future fuel , which is environmentally-friendly and can effectively solve the energy shortage as well .
Therefore , VHTR is a promising and practical form of power .
Secondly , the reactor has been designed with a lot of safety concerns in mind .
After seeing the incidents at the 3 Mile Island athe reactornobyl , people are worried about having a nuclear reactor in their country and have questioned the safety of the Generation IV reactors .
The VHTR is designed to operate on a pebble bed core in which the fuel is coated with silicon carbide which ensures that the radioEwing Jack ,September 2009pheres or pebbles (Andrew C .Kadak , MIT study on the future of nuclear energy) .
The reactor is helium cooled and uses graphite moderated core , which takes advantage of the fact that the helium coolant is inert and has no reactivity effects and that graphite has a high thermal inertia and is stable at high temperatures (VHTR , Idaho National Laboratory) .Also , any waste produced goes directly to the repository and this means an additional waste recycling process can be avoided(Butler , NuclCorwin Bill ,2003 .
)f any failure the damage does not spread to the surrounding regions but is contained within the plant itself .
Lastly , most of the technology involved in the VHTR is already in its development phase and the reactor can be shelled out as early as 2020 Butler , Nuclear Power's New Dawn , 2004) .
This is a deciding factor as the current reserves of fossil fuels won't last long and the sooner we make nuclear power the mainstream source of energy , the better it would be for us and Mother Nature .
Although people might suggest the use of Carbon Capture and Storage in the existiKadak .C .Andrew)missions to a great extent , it should be pointed out that this is merely a solution to delay the problem that we would eventually face .
In summary , it can be concluded that nuclear power is the answer to the current energy crisis and the VHTR is an ideal candidate because it (Butlerlyectric energy efficiently but also provides hydrogen which can help decrease CO2 emissions .
It is also much safer than the current generation reactors and has been well designed to counter any possible error that might occur due to human or technological factors .
Clearly , the reactor is the future of nuclear power generation .
There was a train disaster which occurred on the 3rd of June 1998 near a small town in Lower Saxony , Germany .
No one would have thought it would happen .
Such a super fast , state-of-the-art Inter Express trains of German Railways rolled out of the tracks and split in two , due to a bridge falling onto the train .
It resulted in 101 dying and 88 being injured .
Although there were many causes to be pointed out for this train accident , I think the biggest cause is that no one was aware of the importance of the use of psychology during the design process .
It was reported that the direct cause was a wheel with a composite construction which is relatively common on light railway transit vehicles , but are unique to ICE 884 in high speed trains which replaced the original wheel .
Furthermore , those replaced wheels just were inspected regularly .
However , it has still carried out some of discussion about the difficulties of such inspections and the frequency with which they take place to be used to debate with the method .
It cannot be denied that this is a human mistake which can be avoided by applying  psychology .
Psychology can make engineers aware that they are not only  normal persons , but are also professionals .
Their professional specialty can change other people's life , even save a life .
If they understand that , I believe that the engineers would not have used those composite construction wheels and used wheels which had not been checked properly and approved  .
Observing the pictures which recorded the scene of accident , there was at least one  car was detached from its underframe .
It showed another construction problem of the train - the car's ability to contain its occupants was severely compromised .
It was reported that the construction of ICE did not follow traditional practice .
The floor forms parts of the underframe were welded onto the body .
In order to pursue the high-speed , the bodies were made from aluminum extrusions instead of steel to achieve light weight .
However , the heat-treated method for achieving light weight affected and reduced the tensile strength at the site of the weld .
If designers considered more about that for the high-speed trains must take into account the forces to be absorbed in the event of the vehicle being in a collision , there would not be so many people who were thrown through the air 
Considering only the construction of trains is not enough , the environmental element can affect the result as well .
The designers never anticipated that a bridge which was expected for lightly use , demanded a less substantial structure than if it were to carry a major truck load .
They completely ignored environmental elements which was the speed and weight of the train passing under the bridge which resulted in such a horrible disaster .
To sum up , any design process  can minimize a probability of danger , even can be avoided by applying psychology .
Because all design processes are to fulfill needs of human; and all products are produced by humans .
Therefore , anything as long as it is people-oriented will get the biggest benefits .
Of course ,  avoiding an accident  is the biggest benefit to people .

The six nuclear reabuild are not only sustainable and economically viable solutions; they are also safe and reliable source of energy .

Nowadays , since  fossil fuel is running out at a very high rate , people are seeking another alternative energy resource to replace the traditional fossil fuel resources , which have been used by humans for hundreds of years .
One of the alternatives is nuclear power .
However , the public is very concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Actually , with the improvement of technology , the generation IV reactors are safe enough .
Moreover , these generation IV reactors are also very economic and promising .
Amongst these generation IV reactor concepts , I think the lead-cooled fast reactor is very competent and should get further research and development funding .
With regard to safety , people are usually afraid of the accident caused by the nuclear reactors .
This is because  once a nuclear reactor accident happens , it would be a huge disaster to both the creatures and the environment within that area .
A very famous accident , which is also used by the public to oppose building nuclear reactors , is the accident at Chernobyl which happened on 26 April 1986 .
As a result of this accident , 28 people were killed either immediately or within a few years , and 17 more died during the next ten years .
Moreover , according to the estimation , there would be thousands of people dying from cancer in the next forty years .
Another famous example is the accident which happened at the nuclear power station at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania on 28 March 1979 .
Although at Three Mile Island the discharge of radioactive material was too small to cause any harm , it still caused a great public reaction (Kletz , 2001) .
But for Lead-cooled fast reactors , people do not need to worry much about safety .
The temperature needed to operate lead-cooled fast reactors is about five hundred and fifty to eight hundred , which is relatively higher than today's light-water reactors and can avoid the risk of coolant boiling , and the pressure is rather low (Butler , 2004) .
More importantly , unlike some other materials like sodium , lead does not react with either water or air .
These features give lead-cooled fast reactors a significant safety advantage .
Furthermore , as the technology has improved so much , even if an accident happens , the damage is probably not that big .
For example , in the Three Mile Island accident , nobody was killed  or injured .
All radioactivity was contained as designed .
Therefore , lead-cooled fast reactors are very competent in this aspect of safety .
Besides safety , the economy is also a very important aspect which people should take into consideration .
At present , to build a nuclear reactor is still costly .
According to a study conducted by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) , even reducing completion time to just four or five years , and lowering construction costs by a quarter , would still not put the nuclear plants in contention with coal , and would just barely match the price performance of a combined-cycled natural gas-powered plant (Nivola , 2004)  .
However , since we can eliminate the need for an intermediate heat transport circuit in lead-cooled fast reactors , and lead is relatively cheap when compared with other materials used in other fast reactors , a large part of cost would be saved through this .
In addition , the high temperature of the lead-cooled fast reactors can also be used for thermochemical hydrogen production , which would contribute to reducing the cost as well .

No matter what the designers are to work on , complex systems or everyday products , psychology is helpful to gain insights of problems that may be encountered or prevent undesirable aapproaches .
For everyday products design , it is quite understandable that if the technical configurations are similar for all , psychology could help designers make a difference by humanly consider making improvements that are more user-friendly in design .
More impactful consequences of not applying psychology in design are that serious failures can happen in complex projects and systems hence cause loss of life .
For instance , the collapse of Nicall Highway , two stretches of highway road linked by Merdeka Bridge , located in the Central Region of Singapore (Vernon , 2000) , could have been prevented if psychological approach were adopted in the design and construction process .
For the Nicoll Highway incident , some argue that it is merely constrained by technology and only causes are engineering problems .
While it is true that the restrictions set by technology limitations are direct cause for the engineering failure , the application of psychology could help to overcome the negative effects of technology difficulties .
In compto preventtems like the Nicoll Highway case , management and balance amongst understanding of technical level , small parts of operations , and control of the whole working process is crucial (Wilpert , 200consideringrnals written by engineers and professionals analyzing this disaster were all very absorbed by civil engineering details and theories after Nicoll Highway collapsed , but the disaster was concluded to causingexpected as technology should have been suffiNicollfor this construction project (Thansnanipan & Aung , 2005) .

It is known that global warming and rising energy consumption are the major challenges for people to solve in the near future .
In order to resolve such problems , a few nuclear reactors have been built in the past decades .
As it is not sufficient to provide energy power and not environmentally friendly , a new set of theoretical nuclear reactor designs are currently being researched to satisfy the requirement of energy .
Research into these reactor types was officially started based on several initial goals .
The primary goals being to improve nuclear safety , efficient thermal performanceand reduce cost .
Many reactor designs are being considered to  meet the generation IV goals of today .
Two of the generation IV reactors called Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor and Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor are highly appreciated and accepted in modern nuclear power plant systems .
In terms of performance , securityand cost cost , both  reactors are well designed .
However , to compare the two fast reactors specifically , it is better to choose Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor as the new reactor to meet the generation IV nuclear plan instead of Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor .
To begin with , truly speaking , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor has high thermal efficiency which converts the raw material to the power energy with range from 39% to 47% .
(M .J . Lineberry & T .R .
Allen , 2002) compared to the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor has the thermal efficiency about 48% , which is generally higher than sodium-cooled fast reactor .
(W .F .G .
van Rooijen , 2009) In addition , under the high performance , both  reactors need to work under high temperature .
Specifically , for Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor , the temperature is about 550 while the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor is about 850 .
(Butler .D , 2004) Hence , from general chemical knowledge , it is more convenient and efficient to convert energy under higher temperature .
In thermal performance , both  reactors have good  features especially for energy conversionhowever , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor may have additional advantages .
Secondly , it is appreciated that the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor has some safety features .
It includes a long thermal response time which is a large margin to cool boiling .
Then , it is a primary system that operates near atmospheric pressure .
Meanwhile , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor is based on safety countermeasures for self-controlled shutdown function and controlling function .
(M .J . Lineberry & T .R .
Allen , 2002) The Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor ,  not only includes a basic self safety control functions but also has many safety approaches  applied to the system to make it work safely under high temperature with additional safety devices being added to the equipment .
Recent research and development with in depth studies for safety shows that , , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor system has through experiment demonstrated its security aspect .
(T .D .
Newton & P .J .
Smith , 2007) Hence , it is safer when it works properly .
Furthermore , in terms of cost , the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor was economical  with the use of high burn-up fuels .
It uses advanced materials and innovative design options to reduce  power plant capital cost and lower operating cost .
However , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor is also well designed especially for waste recycling; GFR tries to minimize the release of gaseous and liquid effluents to the environment .
It takes into account that the management of waste from equipment is also important .
GFR systems are designed to allow for self-treatment by applying fuel manufacturing operations .
In addition , GFR can direct energy conversion .
Hence , it makes best use of energy and reduces the entire cost .
(T .D .
Newton & P .J .
Smith , 2007)
In conclusion , both the The The Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor and the the the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor achieve generation IV primary goal to satisfy the requirement of energy .
Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor works with  good thermal efficiency under a lower temperature when compared to Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor .
Moreover , it is designed well in terms of safety and cost .
Similarly , the GFR system offers significant potential to advance generation IV sustainability goals through its thermal efficiency , direct energy conversion , safety arrangement and proper cost .
Over all , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor has advantages over Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor with respect to thermal efficiency , security  and cost .

The drastic industrial development and advancement in science and technology has led to the rising energy demand  .
Searching for alternative energy sources becomes the main effort of the whole world , especially those industry-developed countries due to the dwindling energy supplies from coal and fuel .
The past few years have seen repeated calls from some of the world leaders to introduce nuclear energy as an alternative energy source to replace fuel and coal in the near future .
Generally , nuclear energy is generated through the process of nuclear fission and nuclear fusion of radioactive elements .
The energy loss in this process is dissipated in the form of heat , where it can be used to generate power and electricity .
The invention of Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) is one of the latest Generation VI nuclear reactors that have high potential to replace  coal and fuel as an energy source .
Nonetheless , debate on the using of this nuclear reactor has become a hot issue today due to the negative effects that would be brought to humans as well as other living organisms on the earth .
On the whole , further research and development funding for SWCR should be provided as all these weaknesses of nuclear reactors can be overcome via evidences and discoveries from the research done .
First and foremost , The Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) has a good security system and is safe to be used .
Much has been said about the danger of using nuclear reactors as power generators such as emission and leakage of radioactive waste and explosion of nuclear reactor , where Chernobyl and Three Mile Island emerge to be famous for that reason .
(Nuclear power's new dawn (2004)) However , research and current technology have improved the safety of using SWCR .
According to Nation Master (2007) , the coolant of this reactor is supercritical water , which has high specific heat capacity .
This helps to minimize the heating effect of the reactor .
Furthermore , this reactor's pressure vessel is incorporated a core arrangement with three passes to avoid the overheating effect and thus , minimizing the probability of the explosion of SWCR .
Emerging plasma surface modification and grain boundary technologies are also applied to modify the near surface chemistry , microstructure and stress state of alloys used , which reduce the corrosion of the body of SWCR .
(Nation Master (2007)) Obviously , all these improvements have overcome the weaknesses of nuclear reactor's security system , thus making SWCR into a safe power generator .
Moreover , the cost of construction of The Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) and cost of its power output are cheap and reasonable .
It is undeniable that uranium oxide , the main input for SWCR , and the construction materials used are expensive .
However , due to the plant simplification , its design is far simpler , that is , without the circulation pumps , pressurizers , steam generators and dryers .
This will help to reduce its cost of construction as compared to other power generators .
Also , its coolant is water which is cheap and can be obtained easily .
Although uranium oxide is expensive , it has a very long  life , about 24000 years .
(Generation VI technology (2007)) Therefore , it promises a continuous energy supply in the long run .
This also helps to reduce the cost to search for alternative input material for SWCR .
Last but not least , The The Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) has high efficiency in term of electricity and power generation .
According to Nuclear Engineering and Design (2007) , Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) promises to have high thermal efficiencies of approximately 45% , which can generate about 1 ,700 MW of thermal energy per hour .
Besides , the simplified once- thru direct cycle of coolant also helps to increase its efficiency in power generation .
As a result , less energy is being dissipated as heat and energy wastage can then be prevented .
This will also help to produce low-cost electricity as its cost of generating power is lower .
In conclusion , despite the evident harm nuclear power can cause , we should not immediately rule it out as a possible source of power in the future .
Further researches have shown that The Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) can achieve great safety by its design modification , lower and reasonable cost of its construction and power generation and has high efficiency in terms of electricity and power generation .
Therefore , further research and development funding for the Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) should be provided as it stands in  good stead to become the future's power generator in the near future .
Most scientists have agreed that we have to reduce the emission of green house gases as the impact of global warming becomes more serious .
Simultaneously , the demands of energy are increasing rapidly .
Hence , it is a matter of great urgency to seek an alternative power source .
Nuclear power will not produce the green house gases and it will provide vast amounts of energy .
However , The U .S gave up building reactors since 1979 because of the defects of nuclear power and as the cost of a reactor was high , since there was no appropriate coolant for reactors  and as the waste recycling system was not perfect it sparked a significant controversy of whether the nuclear power should be reconsidered .
Firstly , SCWR is still facing a financial problem .
To build a nuclear reactor and its prototype will cost over US$1 billion .
If the government uses this money to build more fossil reactors , the increasing fossil reactor plants will help the situation of lack of energy .
However , in a long term , nuclear reactor plants will reduce the cost compared with fossil reactor plants .
It is true that the initial cost of building a fossil plant is low , but the long-term costs which keeping it working are high says PBMR Company international marketing manager Gert Claassen .
Furthermore , the SCWR reactor's efficiency and relatively simple design ,  would be cheaper to build and run than normal reactors .
Therefore , the cost is not a problem for SCWR .
Secondly , it is too difficult to find an appropriate coolant for nuclear reactor .
However , the coolant of SCWR is supercritical water .
Normally , the critical point of water is the point at which the water exists as a combination of the liquid phase and vapour phase .
The condition of this point is at temperature of 374centidegrees and a pressure of 22 .1Mpa .
However , for the supercritical water , the critical point is much higher than the normal water .
It is about 510centidegrees at 25Mpa .
Therefore , the coolant can sustain under the high temperature and do not have any phase change .
Thus , it can produce a great amount of energy .
For that reason , to find a suitable coolant will not be a problem because there is no difficulty to find water in earth .
Thirdly , people are worrying about the waste of nuclear power , because the waste of reactor is normally radioactive .
If we are not able to handle the wastes well , the nuclear pollution will trigger the catastrophe .
Nevertheless , SCWR could work out this problem .
The coolant for SCWR is supercritical water and the waste of water is still water as well .
Therefore , this waste are not radioactive and it is much safer compared with the wastes of previous of reactors .
Moreover , SCWR has built a system for water purification through supercritical oxidation .
This system is to convert the waste water into potable water .
Then the reactor can reuse this water as coolant again .
To sum up , the supercritical-water-cooled reactors solve general problems which the normal nuclear power reactors have .
Therefore , the SCWR is feasible and reliable .
The SCWR 's revival would benefit the whole population .
For the public , the problem of global warming and other environmental problems caused by emissions of fossil fuel will be eliminated .
Politically , the nuclear power will maintain their energy source independence and reduce the conflicts of energy possessing .
To engineers and scientists , the applications of nuclear reactors would encourage them to find more efficient way to generate energy from reactors and the improve the safety of reactors in case of any accidents  .
Generally speaking , the nuclear power will be the fuel for the future .
People will obtain safer cleaner and cheaper energy generated by nuclear power reactor .
We are now marching into a new era of nuclear age .
Generation IV of nuclear power is now undergoing development and research .
Very-high-temperature Reactor (VHTR) which is operated by open fuel cycle is one of the six concepts of Generation IV reactors .
It has an operating temperature of 1000 C and uses high pressure during reaction stages .
VHTR is one of the best substitutions for coal plants from a science perspective as it does not pollute the earth and it does not need to use as much fuel as other forms of energy .
The question of whether we should have nuclear powerplantst as an energy resource is controversial .
People stand against it as they havelittle knowledgea about the nuclear power plant .
Cost , safety and performance are three major aspectsofr opposition to this technology; nevertheless , there is still an unyielding need to support further research and development funding for VHTR .
People believe that it would be costly to start up a new nuclear industry .
It is true though .
According to Mansilla (2008) maximizing the system efficiency does not guarantee a minimum cost .
Still , in point of fact , nuclear power plants can reduce the expenditure in producing more energy in the long run .
compared to conventional plants , VHTR can bring out 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel .
Since that VHTR uses a lower amount of fuel to produce higher amounts of energy , it is much more economic than other power plants regardless of the start up cost , as the start-up cost can be compensated in the long run .
Needs for energy are neither going to decrease nor are sources of energy going to increase .
Therefore , when sources of conventional plants are severely depleted , its cost will soar up  and become uneconomical; on the other hand , VHTR uses half the amount of fuel to produce an equal amount of energy , hence it can last longer .
Safety of a nuclear plant is the issue that concerns the public the most .
The reactor core explosion at Chernobyl in Ukraine was a catastrophic failure .
It raised public's uncertainty about the safety of developing new nuclear power plants .
However , VHTR is being designed to avoid such circumstances .
VHTR is coated with a layer of graphite which can be used to slow down neutrons in order to control the nuclear chain reaction and it is covered with an ultra hard ceramic layer .
Furthermore , it uses helium , an inert gas as a coolant .
Therefore it can avoid any radioactive material from escaping if an accident happens .
Moreover , a back-up emergency core cooling system (ECCS) has been designed .
ECCS can remove excess heat and avoid damage to power plants in emergency situations , such as terrorism .
In addition , VHTR would be able to function without the need to reprocess plutonium waste .
This would be able to prevent the creation of nuclear power weapons as plutonium is an ingredient to produce advanced nuclear weapons .
People assume that VHTR has lower performance when compared to other kinds of Generation IV power sources .
According to research , VHTR is a thermal reactor which relies on moderators to slow down neutrons while Gas-cooled Fast Reactor , Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor and Lead-cooled Fast Reactor are relying on fast spectra .
This gives people a wrong assumption that VHTR  .
However , the performance of reactors also depends on operating pressure and temperature .
Researchers anticipate that VHTR's cycle efficiency could reach above 50% while comparing to Molten Salt Reactor , for instance , which could only reach around 44% to 50% .
Furthermore , VHTR is designed to efficiently produce both electricity and hydrogen at the same time .
In conclusion , the opposing reasons for not supporting further research and development for VHTR are arguable .
The initial cost for VHTR is high but it can be covered in the long run by its quantitative energy output .
Likewise , VHTR is being designed with adequate safety precautions to prevent a tragedy from happening .
It has better performance as well since it has high efficiency and both electricity and hydrogen as its reactive product .
Concepts of nuclear power plant in generation IV have shown substantial improvements in cost , safety and efficiency especially VHTR .
Consequently , more research and development funding should be given to VHTR .

There has been a debate between two Generation Four reactors , the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) and the Supercritical Water Reactor (SCWR) , as to which  reactor has superior performance .
On the one hand , engineers use the most advanced technology and concept to design the VHTR .
On the other hand , the technology applied on the SCWR is developed from conventional technology of an older type of nuclear reactor , Light Water Reactor (LWR) .
The supporters of VHTR attack SCWR for its "obsolete" technology and its incapability of generating Hydrogen as a co-product of electrcity .
Nevertheless , I believe the most practical thing ends up being the most useful thing .
In my opinion , the SCWR outmatches the VHTR at both performace and cost .
When people compare the two types of reactors , they tend to focus on the temperature at which reactors operates .
Then , they discover that the VHTR is operating at a temperature level which is almost twice as that of the SCWR .
As a result , a misleading conception arises , which is that the VHTR works much more efficiently than the SCWR  .
Indeed , temperature is an indicator of how efficient the reactor is .
However , it is by no means the only indicator .
According to Prof Mirko Ascic's scientific journal (ASCIC , 2005) , the energy of neutrons in the reactor is the dominant factor that affects the process of converting heat to electricity .
The fact is the SCWR has about four times as many neutrons in the energy range above 6 .2 MeV and about 16 times as many neutrons below 0 .1 eV .
These two energy states of neutrons are closely related the fusion of two fuels , U235 and Np237 .
As a result , The SCWR has a higher performace up to 4 percent compared to the VHTR .
For people who are obssesed with the VHTR , one main reason would be it allows an easy way to generate a clean natural energy , Hydrogen .
It is unnecessary to describe how huge the amount of fossil fuel the world consumes everyday and the influence of burning the fuel on the whole environment .
Scientists have been searching the most suitable and the most economical surrogate for fossil fuel for decades .
And reactors with super-high operating temperature seems to be the ultimate answer .
However , in my opinion , reactors that can generate Hydrogen are just "gimmicks" .
After all , electricity is also a perfect energy which has no side-effect on the environment .
Furthermore ,  using Hydrogen , which has just begun developing and is far from matured , electricity has been with human beings for over a hundred years .
The technology of electricity can be found everywhere  and big automobile manufacturers have started to discuss the possibility of replacing fossil-fuel-powered cars with electricity-powered ones .
Thus , the critical question arises .
How to produce electricity economically ?
In my opinion , the SCWR is the answer .
The SCWR is built  of low-cost electricity .
In addition , the two technologies needed to build the SCWR are already at hand , which are widely-employed  by current Generatioon Three LWRs .
Unlike the VHTR which uses rare gas Helium as a coolant , the SCWR simply uses water to cool down the system .
As a result , the SCWR costs much less to build and greatly simplifies the nuclear plant .
In conclusion , the most advanced technologies may not be suitable in a certain condition .
The SCWR has proven itself to be more capable at both high performance and low cost .
In this sense , the SCWR is a better nuclear reactor compared to the VHTR for our future .
Competitive costs and financial risks of nuclear energy systems are constantly being compared .
In the case of the Very-high-temperature reactors , the cost of running the plant is lower when compared to Molten salt reactors .
The efficiency of the VHTR is also >50% as compared to conventional reactors .
VHTR produces hydrogen as a byproduct , thus increasing the chances of utilizing the reactors for other energy sources .
There is no doubt that the world is moving towards nuclear energy development in the future 20 years from now .
The current race to develop the best reactor for use is still questionable as all the reactors have their own strengths and weaknesses .
However , with the current VHTR's achievable research goals , it will probably be the generation IV reactor to lead the pack in years to come .
Using nuclear processes to produce energy is not a new concept .
Since the first poweractor was built in the Sovietfornion in 1954 , there are consumedear power plants in operation at present .
(IAEA) Meanwhile , nuclear power has not risen to be a top choice because of worries about leakages of radioactive substances from the plants .
For example , the explosion of reactor 4 in the Chernobyl power plant resulted in 237 deaths due to radiation .
In another accident in the Three Mile Island in the US , 140 thoand people living within a five mile radius of the plant evacuated after the meltdown of a cooling system .
Moreover , in this post 911 era , many worry about nuclear power plants becoming the terrorists' targets .
Acknowl(Pachauri , 2007) nuclear power to meet the world's energy appetite , several countries have formed the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) to research on the possible nuclear technologies and to mitigate the risks posed by them .
Two of the six short listed systems are the Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor (SFR) and Super Critical Water Reactor (SCWR) .
Both of these systems , especially the Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor , promises higher efficiency , lower operational cost and enhanced safety measures over current generation of reactors .
In the SCWR , liquid water , which is used as coolant for the 650oC reactor core , is pressurized to 2500 times the atmospheric pressure , to the supercritical state .
Firstly , at this high pressure , water has a larger range of operating temperature .
Thus , the reactor can function safely within a greater range of temperature .
Secondly , supercritical water also has the highest heat capacity .
This means that water can absorb a higher amount of energy for the same volume of water , thus having a better rate of heat transfer compared to the current generation of reactors such as Boiling Water Reactors (BWR) and Pressurised Water Reactor (PWR) .
Better heat transfer also allows the coolant to have a slower flow rate of the coolant , thus saving cost by using of smaller pumps and piping .
Thirdly , water does not change phase within the coolant cycle due to its increased boiling point .
This would allow the coolant to have a laminar flow , increasing the efficiency of the coolant .
Hence , the plant would have 45% thermal cycle efficiency .
On the other hand , SFR uses molten sodium as a coolant for the 510oC reactor core .
As compared with the SCWR , the sodium can be kept at normal atmospheric pressure .
This eliminates thepresent (IAEA , date ?
) .ng from having to maintain a pressurized coolant .
Also , the reactor core is at a lower temperature , thus relatively easier to manage .
Hence , these results in a comparable 45% thermal efficiency , in spite being a newer technology compared to water .
Finally , they are highly sustainable due to their closed loop cycle , having an added advantage of actinide management and fuel consumption of 99% .
Moving on to the cost , SCWR do offer much savings .
As it is developed based on current reactors , such as Boiling Water Reactors (BWR) , a lot of research could be done on existing facilities .
For example , research focusing on accident management could be done at some of the out of commissiofacilities , without building up a prototype from ground .
Also , research on water chemistry that was done for BWR could be capitalised for SCWR .
Consequently , the research could be focus towards developing irradiation resistant materials to be used for the reactor .
Conversely , SFR also utilises expertises from existing reactors such as BOR-60 , JOYO , Phenix , and BN-600 in the US and Japan .
Like the SCWR , SFR would require several areas of research to make it suitable for development .
Researches into fuel cycle and physically stronger and more radiation resistant structural materials would minimise the operating costs with improved operations and performance .
Also , with support of countries such as Japan , France , and Russia , the cost of research is shared .
In fact , the SFR system is the most technology developed system of the 6 Generation IV systems .
(SFR) Furthermore , it is estimated to be deployable by 2020 .
the supportResearchRegarding the safety aspects of the nuclear reactors , the GIF has set high targets Comparedcto .
For the SCWR , the use of water at the supercritical state allows the coolant to be functional and effective at a right range of temperature .
The absence of a change in phase would also make the reacand thus safer to operate .
All this is possible with the highly pressurized water .
Meanwhile , SFR does not have the problems regarding maintaining the coolant at high pressure .
Instead , the challenge lies in keeping the sodium coolant from direct contact with air .
As sodium is highly reactive , it reacts violently with the airdoesrom the environment .
This difficulty is overcome by using a two-step cooling solution , whereby sodium is used to cool the core , and a secondary coolant , such as water , is used to cool the sodium .
Also , SFR has the added advantage of closed fuel cycle , which helps in the management of highly radioactive actinides .
This wfocusedprevent the proliferation of the nuclear waste .
Finally , nuclear-enriched materials being kept at high temperature would prevent them from being stolen and use as weapons by terrorists .
usedkeeping nuclear-enriched materials at a In conclusion , SFR stands as a more viable option to be the solution to the world's energy crisis .
Though the deployment cost is high at present , the burden will be shared by the many countries support the technology .
Also , the performance of SFR is ensured based on the findings of the various researches conducted .
Finally , well-planned safety measures and actinides management would ensure the SFR would function safely within its use .

Nuclear accidents like the Three Mile incident and the Chernobyl disaster left a bad aftertaste in the eyes of the public .
Furthermore , the constant threat of nuclear terrorists and the issue of radiation leakage made nuclear energy even more unpopular .
However , as mankind evolves , nuclear energy could possibly be making a comeback .
Facing the issues of rising oil prices and the long term availability of fossil fuels , governments are now rethinking their national energy strategies .
One of these strategies is harnessing nuclear energy .
Going nuclear would provide the growing economies with a constant and steady supply of energy to sustain their economic development .
Furthermore , it also addresses the issue on global warming as it does not produce greenhouse emissions which could further aggravate the situation .
Though the public may be concerned about the safety of operating a nuclear plant , we should continue to develop nuclear energy as its economic and environmental benefits outweighs its risks .
Ever grumbled every morning about the exhaust fumes , produced by fuel vehicles ?
The harmful fumes are part of the cause of the hole in the ozone layerlayer ( Jacob , n .d) mentioned that 20% of greenhouse gas is caused by automobiles , in U .S .
In order to resolve this situation , researchers and developers are trying to come up with cleaner and greener ideas .
Hence the birth of the electric car , which Marshall (n .d .) explained that its automobile fully powered by electricity only , which reduces the harmful emissions by no emissions , which results in a cleaner and greener environment .
Oppositions agree that the design the electric car is safe enough for driving .
However many commuters are concerned about design nature of the electric car , which includes mainly on safety concerns , and also others like cost and performance .
In recent years , despite the contentious debate of using nuclear power to meet our ever-increasing energy needs , the world has started to consider nuclear energy as a future fuel source which is believed to  more environmentally friendly  compared to fossil fuels .
Hence , late in 2002 , Generation IV International Forum (GIF)  announced the selection of six reactor technologies which they believe represented the future shape of nuclear energy .
These were selected on the basis of being a clean , safe and cost-effective means of meeting increased energy demands on a sustainable basis , while being resistant to usage of materials for weapons proliferation and secure from terrorist attacks (US Department of Energy , 2009) .
In this essay , I would present my argument to support further research and development funding for the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) as opposed to the Supercritical Water Reactor (SCWR) , from the perspectives of security , performance and costs .
Firstly , proponents of SCWR claimed that the very high-temperature concept of VHTR reactor can be detrimental to safety if a loss-of-coolant accident (LOCA) occurs .
This means that if there is a break in the pipe , coolant will be lost and cause the reactor to heat up very quickly , resulting in the release of toxic gases and fission products into the environment .
However , this may be an unfounded concern in years to come when we consider the fact that the Korean and the US governments have worked for the past three years on developing and validating advanced computational methods for simulating LOCA in a VHTR , in an attempt to prevent such an accident from happening (Chang , 2006) .
Proponents of SCWR also claimed that VHTR produced high volume of nuclear waste which can be a potential source of nuclear weapons for the terrorists .
However , this claim may not be entirely valid because the waste produced , though in high volume , is considered low-level (low in radioactive content) .
The fuel pebbles used in VHTR are also very 'durable' in the sense that it is very difficult to extract the trapped fission products inside which render it a less favorable choice as a nuclear weapon .
In addition , it is important to note that VHTR is a much safer reactor also because the radioactive content of the fuel is contained even if the reactor reaches temperatures in excess of 500 C more than the normal operating temperature (Norman , 2007) .
VHTR also adopts a passive safety feature in which in the event of an emergency ,t does not require operator's action to shutdown the plant safely .
Furthermore , the fuel pebbles are coated with an impermeable layer of silicon carbide which would not rupture easily , and the plant is also equipped with a reaction vessel that is free of oxygen .
Both features prevent the occurrence of a fire .The concernn of graphite being an easily-combustible material is also addressed by experimental results that have shown that graphite can be heated to 'white-hot' temperatures (~1650 C) without incurring ignition or self-sustained combustion (Lee , 2009) .
Next , VHTR has better performance than SCWR in three main aspects .
Firstly , in terms of burn-up rate of the fuel , for VHTR , it is possible to burn up to 65% (US Department of Energy , 2008)of its initial fuel as compared to SCWR which is capable of only burning up to 45% of the initial fuel (Buongiorno , 2003) .
Secondly , due to the high operating temperature of VHTR , the large amount of heat produced can be used for many purposes , ranging from providing domestic energy supplies and refining crude oil , to providing energy for hydrogen production .
This is unlike SCWR , which can only produce electricity .
Hydrogen production ,  an energy--intensive process , is important as hydrogen holds enormous promise as a power source for the future generation .
This is also one point that makes VHTR a more economical plant than SCWR .
Lastly , VHTR uses graphite as the moderator , which according to nuclear experts , is an excellent moderator as compared to water which is used in SCWR (Cogeneration Technologies , 2002) .
VHTR also uses helium gas as the coolant which is an inert gas .
Hence , the plant can be operated at high temperatures without having to worry about corrosion of the plant pipes .
This is different from SCWR , which uses water as the coolant and hence there is a possibility of the pipe's corrosion by water .
Lastly , proponents of SCWR claim that the construction cost of VHTR plant is much higher than SCWR due to its high operating temperature .
This would not be a valid claim if we consider the fact that VHTR is built to operate at a long life span of 60 years (Lee , 2005) which is much longer than that of VHTR .
Hence , this makes it justifiable to spend more money to build VHTR plant .
Some people claim that Gen II and Gen III reactors are safe enough for operation .
Despite the accident in Chernobly , Ukraine , which was mainly caused by man-made operating errors (Chernobly accident , 2009) , no major accident occurred in the past two decades .
Compared with funding the Gen IV reactors , they think that governments should rather use the money to reinforce the safety of currently operating reactors .
However , malwastions that had the risk of being disastrous happened from time to time .
For instance , in 2006 , part of the Forsmark-1 reactor in Sweden failed to startlbecameesulting in a catastrophic meltdown .
A Belgian reactor experienced a similar problem in the preceding year (Nuclear reactor safety , 2007) .
Such incidents imply that the potential risks of the Gen II and Gen III reactors cannot be ignored .
The Gen IV reactors can significantly change this risky situation .
Take the VHTR reactor as an example .
In this new design , the fuel pellets used in nuclear reaction are fused in graphite pebbles and coated with ceramic layers which effectively prevent the radioactive materials from leaking .
In other words , no radioactive damage will occur even if there is a meltdown (Butler , 2004) .
Therefore , the Gen IV reactors are more reliable than the previous generations .
In order to achieve safer operating environment , government should fund the development of the Gen IV .
Opponents also argue that the Gen II and Gen III reactors have already achieved excellent performance , so it is not necessary to develop the new generation .
As a successful example , France obtains over 75% of its electricity has occurredlear power .
The low cost aRather than fund r energy has made France the largest electricity exportergh the result appears favorable , this performance is only based on the short term effects .
Other factors should be included for a more objective estimation .
Gen II and III reactors produce high level radioactive wastes at a rate of 12000 tons per year around the globe .
These wastes take thousands of years to lose their activity , thus they are not environmentally friendly in the long term (Radioactive wastes , 2001) .
Moreover , the storage of the wastes is both money and labor consuming .
A repository built to store the wastes could cost up to $90 billion , like that in Yucca Mountain , US (Tetreault , 2008) .
However , these problems can be solved using the Gen IV technology .
In one of its designs , VHTR , the used fuel pebbles can be automatically selected , and those with some life left are recycled (Butler , 2004) .
This process reduces the amount as well as the radioactive level of the final wastes .
Therefore , it will lead to more sustainable performance in the long term .
This advantage proves that it is worthwhile to fund the Gen IV technology .
Opponents also suggest that Gen IV reactors have no commercial benefits .
For example , building and testing a Gen IV nuclear plant costs about US$1 billion , which is a considerable investment (Butler , 2004) .
On the other hand , the cost of generating electricity from current nuclear reactors is already quite low (2 .3 pence per kilowatt) , which is competitive with other major sources (The cost of generating electricity , 2004) .
As a result , it is not worth spending additional money funding the new designs .
However , a typical Gen II reactor can only operate at an efficiency of around 30% , meaning that a large proportion of the energy is wasted .
But with the tecactivity .
Thus IV reactors , the efficiency can be improved to 45% to 50% due to extremely high operating temperature (1000 degrees Celsius) (Daniels , 2007) .
Numerically , this increase in efficiency can be reflected by a cut in costs of approximately 30% for the same amount of electricity generated .
Moreover , the heat produced by the Gen IV reactors can be used to produce hydrogen from water or supplied to petrochemical industry (The very-high-temperature reactor , n .d .) .
The cogeneration and applications make the total efficiency even higher , thus further reduce the operating costs .
From these statistics , it is obvious that Gen IV reactors are more profitable in the long run compared to the old generations .
Thus , Gen IV reactors should be funded by the government .
reducingthe petrochemicalThough the Generation II and III reactors have been maturely adopted in electricity generation , the drawbacks in their designs largely confine the potential power of nuclear energy .
In order to optimize its power to meet the increasing demand of electricity as well as to maintain long term sustainability , governments should fund the Generation Icomparableinstead of the old generations .

The most awaited Tata's Nana car was finally unveiled at the Auto Expo 2008 .
It was a very proud moment for Tata as it was the cheapest car compared to all other cars found around the world (Massey , 2008) .
The target of Tata was to make a car which most of the citizens in India can afford but it came out to be a big talk among car dealers too .
They were very much surprised by the unique design and  amazed by the stunning price .
It just costs about one lakh (Rs 100 ,000) which is US2500 dollars (Darukhanawala , 2009) .
Although it was a surprising package , both positive and negative arguments about the car were presented at the Auto Expo 2008 .
The main issue discussed was  safety .
There were mixed reviews concerning the safety of TaTa's Nano among car dealers .
The big question raised was whether Tata's Nano was safe to drive on normal roads  .
So , my stand as a reviewer is that Tata's Nano lacks safety .
There are three important reasons for my stand .
Firstly , the most important point is that it is not able to withstand high loads .
Tata claims that despite its low price and compactness , the Nano car is able to meet all Indian safety regulations .
They prove that it is able to withstand a crash on a solid steel bar at a speed of 48 km/h .
Besides that , Hichman , designer of Nano , explains that their target was to construct a modular body where structure was added to the base of the vehicle so that Nano will be able to meet the European safety regulations (Schedel , 2009) .
Moreover , a test was even done at Motor Industry Research Association (MIRA) in the UK to prove their claim .
Although much supporting evidence was given by Tata , it is said that Tata made critical modifications specifically to meet the European and Indian test norms .
So , the vehicle which is being sold in the market may not be the same as the one which went through the tests .
Besides that , Americans feel that the test was not sufficient as it was only done at a speed of 48km/h .
Many vehicles travel at much higher speeds especially on highways (Jenks , 2009) .
Another thing to be considered is the warranty for the car .
Tata  provides warranty for a period of only 18 months , which is much less compared to the other cars .
This implies that cheap material could be used not only in the interior but also in the exterior structure .
So , it is very clear that Tata's Nano has poor crash resistance .
Secondly , the car lacks safety features .
It is a big surprise that Tata has just neglected some of the most important features like the airbag , parking sensors , fog lamps and traction controls in its design .
Many who bought the car are complaining especially about the safety aspects of the car .
For example , a citizen of India  stated that there are not enough safety features and that the Nano is a very bad design (Gangadharan , 2008) .
The designer of Nano claims that even designs such as a car without lights and doors were considered during the design process .
This really makes everyone feel that Tata's main intention was to make a cheap car and the safety issue was not a big concern for them .
But their argument was that these features were not a necessity on Indian roads (Massey , 2008) .
However , Tata should realise that the car is not only going to be sold in India but  marketed in other countries .
So , if other countries are not willing to purchase the car because  it lacks safety features , then it will be a big loss for Tata .
Thirdly , there are some flaws in the design .
Only one side mirror is found in the design (Daily Mail , 2008) .
Tata should understand that it is not safe with only one side mirror .
Drivers will definitely have difficulties spotting the vehicles which are coming from behind and this may even lead to accidents .
Besides that , the wheels look small .
It seems that it lacks stability .
So , while travelling on slopes or heavy traffic , it could be dangerous .
There are also complains that the car is not comfortable .
The most important thing to be considered when designing a car is comfort .
The more comfortable the driver feels , the more easy he will find it to drive the car .
Thus the journey will be smooth and accidents could be prevented .
So , clearly it seems that there are some features that need to be changed .
To conclude , Tata's Nano needs modification .
It would be better if tougher materials could be used , more safety features  added and some required changes  done to the current design .
These will really improve the safety aspect of the car .
Tata may argue that these will increase the price of the car .
But I strongly feel that those who want to purchase the car will not mind paying a little more if it is going to provide a safer ride on the roads .
A nuclear reactor is an apparatus that produces nuclear energy by performing nuclear reactions ("Nuclear reactor ," 2009) .
The reactor was invented because of the increasing demand for an alternative source of energy that could substitute crude oil .
Nuclear reactors can produce cleaner and higher energy than  crude oil .
However , there is always an intention for the public to reject the idea of using nuclear reactors .
The public is concerned about safety in the operation of nuclear reactors .
The disaster that happened at Chernobyl , Ukraine , in 1986 is one reason of the public's anxiety .
In the disaster , the nuclear reactor exploded and spread the radioactive debris across Europe .
As a result , thirty one people were killed in  disaster (Butler , 2004) .
Nonetheless , a VHTR (Very-High- Temperature Reactor) , which is one of the generation IV reactor concepts , has the technology to prevent the disaster by using helium as its coolant and by producing waste with low radioactivity .
The VHTR can also produce both electricity and hydrogen through a very efficient process , so the cost of running a VHTR will not be as high as other reactors in the long run .
Therefore , the development of the VHTR should be supported .
First of all , opponents argue that helium , which is used as a coolant in the VHTR , could explode because of the high operating temperature and pressure of the reactor .
This argument may arise because of the lack of knowledge about  helium .
Helium is , in fact , an inert gas .
Therefore , helium will not react with any material due to its stability (Youchison , 1987) .
This is also why helium is widely used to fill blimps .
In addition , helium will not become radioactive as other coolants do when they are exposed to radioactive radiation .
Thus , helium is safe to use as a coolant in VHTR .
Secondly , opponents claim that an explosion may occur because the materials used for constructing the reactor are not strong enough to overcome both high operating temperature and pressure .
They argue that currently there is no existing material that can maintain the high operating temperature and pressure of the VHTR .
This is indeed true .
However , the ongoing HTTR (High-Temperature Engineering Test Reactor) project in Japan gives us a clue that it is not impossible to develop a new strong material in the future .
Currently the HTTR has successfully overcome up to 950oC (The U .S . DOE , 2002) .
In other words , we already have materials that can stand 950oC .
The VHTR operating temperature is more or less 1000oC .
Thus , it is not impossible to find a new material that can stand 50oC more .
Thirdly , critics argue that the nuclear reactors are producing radioactive waste and this waste can harm the environment around the reactors .
It is true that the waste that contains high radioactive material , such as , plutonium , can affect the environment severely .
However , the waste of the VHTR is less radioactive than the other reactors .
The VHTR has high thermal efficiency and high fuel burn up .
This is why the concentration of the heavy metal radioactive matter in the VHTR waste is relatively low .
The waste of the VHTR will then go to a repository after being reprocessed and meeting the certain acceptance criteria (Shropshire , 2004) .
In addition , the operation of the VHTR does not depend on  plutonium reprocessing , which is a controversial issue (Butler , 2004) .
Thus , the VHTR waste is much safer than that of the existing nuclear reactors .
Lastly , opponents claim that the cost of building a nuclear reactor is very high .
They say that the money that the government spends on building the reactor can be used for other purchases .
This is indeed true .
However , , the cost of building a VHTR is in fact not as high as the other generation IV reactors .
The total cost of building a VHTR is about US$670 M . It is much lower than the cost of building a Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor , the next more expensive reactor , which is about US$ 870 M . Moreover , due to its high operating temperature (1000oC) , the VHTR can operate with a high efficiency to produce electricity .
Data show that the percent efficiency of the VHTR is more than 50 percent while other generation IV reactors range from 30 to 50 percent (The U .S . DOE , 2002) .
This means that the government will spend less money on fuel in the VHTR compared to the other generation IV reactors .
In addition , the hydrogen that is produced by the VHTR can be used in fuel cells .
Thus , by using this hydrogen , the government can reduce the cost of importing oil .
Therefore , in the long run , it is profitable to build the VHTR because it can produce both electricity and hydrogen through a very efficient process .
To conclude , in spite of claims that nuclear reactors are dangerous and costly , the VHTR with its improved design , can overcome these issues .
The VHTR can produce electricity and hydrogen efficiently in a much safer way without producing hazardous waste .
Hence , the development of the VHTR should be supported .
Mention nuclear power and the general consensus are fear and rejection , and Chernobyl comes to  mind .
Dirty power , they will say , and it is not worth the risk , despite ironically being much cleaner and powerful than the current fossil fuel-guzzling power plants .
However with the formation of the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) and its six new reactor designs , it is hoped that nuclear power can be tapped upon with full consent of the public .
These reactors , still in the designing and testing phase , excel in areas of sustainability , safety , economics and proliferation resistance (Bouchard and Bennett ,2008) , all which are specially intended to address all issues and challenges that nuclear power faces in a world combating the production of greenhouse gases , but in the safest possible way .
Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) emerges from the six as one of the most promising and is currently being heavily researched on .
But is it worth the funds and efforts when safety concerns are still present and worse , unaddressed ?
Or is the Lead-cooled Fast Reactor (LFR) design a better option ?
For its performance level , the operating core temperatures of the reactor is capable of reaching  an almighty peak of  1000 (Chapin , et al 2004) , figures that will not only raise questions about its viability as well as the safety measures in place for such a high amount of energy , since temperature is directly proportional to the energy level of a closed system .
And because of the heights in the Celsius scale , the materials used in the reactor cannot be of regular quality , much less inferior .
The use of high temperature creates an extremely volatile and sensitive situation which , on the one hand raises output efficiency (OECD Nuclear Energy Agency , 2000) , but also requires a precise state-of-the-art monitoring system that further increases the production prices .
Much effort will be needed to reassure the public about the operation of the nuclear plant if it is to be commissioned .
The six new reactors  mainly differ only in their choice of coolant used in the system .
VHTR , being a descendant of the Generation II gas-cooled reactor , uses helium gas .
While a tried-and-tested choice , it is puzzling as there are better coolants proposed among the new designs and yet not favoured .
Helium gas is abundant on the Sun's atmosphere but only at trace levels on the Earth's surface (AIR LIQUIDE , 2009) .
Furthermore its common extraction is from fossil fuels , so one can imagine our source of helium when the oil wells eventually run dry .
In addition , helium is not the only coolant that is chemically inert with the fuel; molten lead is another viable option and is plentiful on the Earth's crust .
Last  but not least , gaseous coolants have low thermal transfer properties , hence requiring an intermediate heat exchange with a larger surface area (Chapin , et al 2004) .
From the performance requirements , it becomes apparent that VHTR will eventually be a massive power plant , an outcome that is not favourable for developing countries which are in need of enhanced energy output for economic growth .
LFR on the other hand , is more suitable .
The relatively smaller scale of operation and hence energy output , may be inferior compared to VHTR , but it is not feasible and unsafe for a large nuclear plant in a developing country where security and social unrest are issues .
LFR is a more portable option , thus more resistant against terrorism and weapon conversion since it is too stable to become a destructive tool  .
Maintenance costs for VHTR will also be a tight spot for a growing nation , an area of concern which can be resolved by the use of LFR , which requires refueling once every 20 years .
Even the cost of coolant is different; every 100g of helium (Elert , 2007) can fetch around the same price as 500g of lead (MetalPrices .com , 2009) .
The system core temperatures of LFR can reach up to 500 (Idaho National Laboratory , 2005) , almost 50% lower than that of VHTR and present significant differences in the operations of the plants .
Even though thermal efficiency of LFR is lower , 43% compared to up to 50% for VHTR (OECD Nuclear Energy Agency , 2000) , it is offset by offering a higher likelihood of reassurance to the public .
The use of low temperature means LFR can actually be built using the current technology , though some improvements may be needed .
Molten lead , compared to helium , is a superior and cheaper heat transfer medium , hence increasing the portability of the power plant by reducing the need for a large intermediate heat exchanger .
In conclusion , LFR may not be as proficient in energy production when compared to VHTR , but it addresses critical issues that VHTR fails to  Therefore LFR is a more suitable Gen-IV reactor .
As the population's reliance on technology advances and grows , a greater need for electricity energy to power these computer gadgets has since sparked an inevitable concern as many worry that fossil fuels ,  being used over the years to generate electricity , are not sufficient enough to accommodate all the needs .
Moreover , global warming  has been growing at an alarming rate , thanks partly to the excessive air pollution generated  by fossil fuels .
Therefore , a search for higher efficient and safe energy supply is desperately needed and it is already on the agenda of all countries .
Nuclear power has since expanded to replace conventional fuels because of the higher efficiency it can provide to the world .
Many concepts are reviewed to improve the already competent nuclear reactors and so far , generation IV reactor concepts are among those which have stood up among the crowd that are worth developing Personally , in my opinion , Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is by far the best nuclear reactor concept to be chosen for funding of research and development .
One of the reasons why Very High Temperature Reactor is better for funding is because of its safety factor .
Safety factor is heavily considered because if an accident occurs at nuclear reactor sites , it can result in massive releases of radioactivity .
Therefore in this context , safety design in VHTR has been introduced to take care of all the uncertainties and accidents which might occur with the ultimate goal of protecting the environment and people from being exposed to radiological hazards of potential release from the nuclear power plants .
And it includes the development of passive heat removal systems , low power density and easily cool-able geometry .
Helium is used in the heat removal system as a coolant because it is an inert gas and it will not react chemically with any other material .
VHTR will also be equipped with graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations .
The graphite has tiny pellets of uranium fuel encased in it and they will absorb heat without failing and releasing radioactivity .
As VHTR would be expected to operate at a very high temperature , all these are essential to prevent the reactor from being over-heated .
However some have argued that VHTR is unsafe as it is operating at a higher temperature and it would easily be the target of terrorist attacks Since the terrorist attack on the World Trade Centre in New York on September 11 , 2001 , the risk of threats of terrorist attacks on nuclear facilities cannot be regarded as negligible .
And some have also put doubts on the ability of a passive heat removal system because if it fails to remove heat in the reactor , leakage of radioactive components will occur .
Certainly ,  disasters which happened in Three Mile Island , Tokaimura and Chernobyl should never be repeated .
But , according to Forrest J . Remick , professor emeritus of nuclear engineering and a former associate vice president for research at Penn State ,  VHTR is safe and this concept has been demonstrated in several test reactors in the United States , Germany , China and South Africa .
Therefore as all the tests have shown , the potential of leaking and being unstable during operation can be rendered as zero .
However , some experts have pointed out that if such high temperature is stimulated within a reactor , a new hardy alloy may be necessary to protect the inside layer of the reactor .
To get those alloys  would already cost millions .
How about the construction cost of the entire power plant which is still unknown  ?
Furthermore , it is easier and cheaper to build other generation four nuclear reactors compared to VHTR .
For instance , for supercritical water-cooled reactor , it is relatively cheaper to build because it uses water as coolant instead of helium in VHTR .
So , the process of handling the phase change of helium to another state is not needed and this kind of simplification can largely reduce the cost .
When the cost is reduced , cheaper electricity can be provided to the public .
But in terms of performance , VHTR is a more efficient concept compared to others in generation four nuclear reactor concepts .
Even though it might prove costly at the beginning  it pays off well as it produces both electricity and hydrogen fuel instead of electricity only .
High temperature processed in the reactor can be used as a condition to yield hydrogen from sulphur-iodine cycle , which is a series of thermo-chemical processes that will fail without a sufficient source of heat .
Hydrogen fuel produced can be used in vehicles as its onboard fuel .
Also , as it is operating at higher temperature , it produces more electricity compared to the rest .
In conclusion , VHTR is a very promising energy system to provide us electricity and hydrogen cogeneration .
Currently , VHTR development is in the early stages .
There are enormous items left to do in order for this concept to succeed in future .
Therefore , more research and development should be carried out so that in future this concept can become the energy supply for everyone on this earth .
The Chernobyl nuclear accident , which occurred on 26 April 1986 , had resulted in massive radioactive fallout into the atmosphere that affected millions of people .
Because of the catastrophic effects of a nuclear accident , no nuclear reactor has been built since then .
However , as global warming is becoming a more pressing issue , we have now turned to nuclear reactors to provide us clean energy .
Which generation IV nuclear reactor we should choose ?
Although some have chosen lead-cooled fast reactor (LFR) over very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) because of the various benefits LFR has over VHTR , there is some evidence that VHTR is much better than LFR .
Supporters of LFR claim that LFR is much safer than VHTR .
One of the main reasons for LFR being safer is LFR , which operates at around 550 degree Celsius , has a lower outlet temperature than VHTR , which operates at around 1000 degree Celsius (Butler .
2004) .
It is believed that the higher the temperature , the greater the risk of a nuclear meltdown .
However , VHTR is designed to work at such a high temperatures .
In VHTR , its graphitic core structure , helium coolant , and coated fuel particles allow VHTR to withstand high temperatures (Chapin al te .
2004) .
Thus , it is able to attain thermal stability .
In short , operating at 1000 degree Celsius is not much of a safety issue since VHTR is safe and reliable at high temperature .
In  terms of the coolant used by the two reactors , VHTR is safer than LFR .
LFR uses lead as its coolant .
Lead is corrosive and may form polonium , which is a radioactive substance , when exposed to radioactivity (Loewen al te .2003) .
Given the presence of the radioactive polonium and the corrosiveness of lead , it is not safe to use lead as a coolant .
On the other hand , VHTR uses helium , which is a chemically inert .
Thus , it reduces the safety hazards which can arise due to the corrosion and the irradiation of the coolant .
Supporters of LFR also maintain that LFR is much cheaper than VHTR .
In terms of cost to build the reactor , LFR costs around US$700 million (Neil W . Brown .
2006) while VHTR costs around US$1 .1 billion (Butler .
2004) .
In addition , in terms of the cost of coolant , lead costs around US$0 .24 per 100 grams (MetalPrice .com) while helium costs around US$5 .20 per 100 grams .
In terms of these two factors , LFR is much cheaper than VHTR .
However , there are other factors that will also affect the cost of operating the reactor , such as maintenance costs .
For instance , since VHTR is specially designed to operate under a very high temperature , it will produce hydrogen , which is a source of clean fuel .
The economic production of hydrogen (H2) by thermochemical cycles ,  can reduce the maintenance cost for operating the VHTR .
The final argument advanced by the supporters of LFR is LFR performs much better than VHTR .
Unlike VHTR , LFR will reprocess its nuclear waste .
Thus , LFR can use the nuclear reactant to its maximum before disposing it .
However , recycling of nuclear waste will result in the production of plutonium , which can be used for nuclear weapons (Butler .
2004) .
In fact , United State has refrained from reprocessing of nuclear waste .
Hence , recycling of nuclear waste is not safe in terms of security .
In addition , VHTR is more efficient than LFR .
It is because the higher the outlet temperature , the greater  the efficiency of electrical generation .
As VHTR is operating at a higher temperature , there is an efficient conversion of energy from heat to electricity .
From data , for the same amount of fuel , VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity compared to conventional plants (Chapin al te .
2004) .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen fuel that can be used to produce electrical energy .
VHTR generates electrical energy in two ways , from the nuclear reactant directly and from hydrogen fuel .
In conclusion , VHTR is safe because it is designed to attain thermal stability and it uses an inert coolant , which is helium .
In addition , it is cost effective because of its economic production of hydrogen .
Furthermore , it is also efficient because it is operating at a very high temperature .
Hence , it should be evident that VHTR works better than LFR in terms of security , cost and performance .
Since VHTR is one of the better options among the generation IV nuclear reactors and it is feasible , we should invest in and support  further research and development on VHTR .
