After more than 20 years of evolution , medical robots have becomee one of the great inventions in this  technology driven world .
In the past , medical robots helped the surgeons to diagnose the patients' internal organs and perform minor surgerys .
But in recent years , due to the technology advancement on the medical robots , prototypes of these robots surgery systems are now able to perform more precise , accurate and complicated surgery , such as reaching for untouchable tissue on the patients with the surgeons controlling them remotely .
Moreover , the surgeons are able to reduce their stress levels while performing surgery and the robotic surgery systems are able to maintain the stability of their arms for long hours of surgery .
However , there are many issues revolving around the use of the robotics surgery system compared to traditional human operated surgery 
The first issue is that the public is concerned that robotic surgery will be expensive . .
This is the first thought that appears in their mind when they heard of such surgery for the first time .
However , this is true for medical fees , especially surgery , and it is even more expensive when compared with traditional methods .
This may be the only disadvantage that the patients are going to have but there are lots of advantages for them if they are willing to use medical robots to perform surgery .
"Patients experience less trauma , blood loss , risk of infection , scarring and pain .
Hospital stays are also generally shorter ."
This is quoted from one article by Debra S . from Reuters .
Another article from Newsweek , reported by Jennifer B . mentioned , "Forbes was walking within hours of his surgery and was discharged the next day .
By midweek he was walking three miles daily .
In 10 days he was back at work .
After three weeks he was playing golf again ."
From these , we can see that patients are definitely benefiting in many ways especially when the they are able to go back to their normal daily life within a  shorter recovery time .
The public is also concerned about the safety and reliability of the robotic surgery system , for example , the system breaking down in the process of surgery .
They are worried if this would have happen to them during surgery .
However , the public can rest assured on this matter because the hospitals have always been doing maintenance of the robotic systems .
As a matter of fact , this is the biggest downside for having a robotic system in the hospitals .
An article in The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists mentioned "The system costs hospitals about $1 .6 million and requires an annual $100 ,000 maintenance contract , according to Dr .
Advincula ."
"Da Vinci system costs $ 1 .4 million and annual maintenance costs of $ 100 ,000 with a lifespan of five years ."
Another article added .
This shows that the hospitals always have engineers around to maintain the robotic systems regularly to prevent any failure from happening .
The last issue of public concern is  that the surgeons are not well trained in controlling the robotic surgery systems .
This is a valid concern as the patients are placing their lives in the surgeons' hands .
However , the public , especially the patients , do not need to worry about this issue , as there is a robotic surgery training center  in Singapore to train the surgeons .
The surgeons are responsible for proper training and follow training standards for using the equipment .
The surgeons are encouraged to have more practices before operating on the patients .
"The more you do , the better you're going to get , said Dr Kevin Zorn" 
In brief , with the advancement of medical technologies , the robotic surgery systems  definitely benefit both the patients and the surgeons .
While the patients are able to recover quickly and return to their normal lifestyle , the surgeons are able to perform more surgery as they spend less time on each patient and requireless manpower in the operating theater .
In my opinion ,  robotic surgery systems help to extend the lifespan of one human being .
Therefore , the public should not fear  the robotic surgery and should have confidencet and trust  the surgeons and the technologies they are using .

The first generation of nuclear reactors was built in 1950 .
Since then , continuous researches has been done to produce a better generation of nuclear reactors .
There are 436 active nuclear power plants in the world and 53 nuclear power plants are under construction .
Nuclear power plants represent more than 70 percent of our non-carbon generated electricity and consist of 17% of our world total energies consumption .
The benefits and usages of nuclear power plants are undeniable .
Nuclear power plants have been widely deployed in many leading countries in the world such as United States , Japan , and China which use the nuclear power plants as one of their main power sources to propel the energy industry .
The usage of the nuclear power plants is widely recognized and they are being integrated as part of those countries' promising energy sources .
Nuclear energy is the most concentrated source in terms of energy generation .
One kilogram of uranium can release the same amount of energy as that released by 2400 tons of standard coal .
It is a good alternative energy source which not only reduces the greenhouse effect ,but also helps solve the problems of limited fossil fuels .
For countries with limited natural resources , nuclear power plants serve as a dependable energy source .
According to the report from GIF (Generation IV International Forum) , tripling the number of nuclear power plants worldwide to 1000 plants could avoid the production of 1 billion tons of carbon emission per year by 2055 .
Nuclear power  is deemed to be a promising energy source for the future .
However , the nuclear leak incidents which  happened in the past few decades in countries such as Three Miles Island , Pennsylvania , Chernobyl in Ukraine , and Bhopal in India have posed doubts on the reliability of the nuclear reactors .
"It is unlikely that we can meet our aggressive climate goals if we eliminate nuclear power as an option .
However , before an expansion of nuclear power can be considered , key issues must be addressed including: security of nuclear fuel and waste , waste storage , and proliferation ."
Obama said in his energy plan that addressing certain key issues are needed before deciding to build more nuclear plants .
In response to this , the creation of the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) came into being .
It is an organization formed by 9 leading countries in the world: Canada , China , Euratom  , France , Japan , Republic of Korea , South Africa , Switzerland , and United States .
The organization tries to resolve security issues posed by the current nuclear reactors .
100 international experts from GIF and other world leading nuclear power plant research centers have gathered together to find the most promising nuclear systems .
This led to the proposals of the six Generation IV Systems which offer the most promising performance , in terms of sustainability , proliferation resistance and physical protection , safety and reliability , and cost .
The six Generation IV Systems are being designed to counter the problems faced by the current nuclear reactors .
These state-of-the-art nuclear reactors will be able to minimize nuclear wastes and reduce the long-term stewardship burden posed by traditional nuclear reactors .
They have integrated safety design and back-up systems to prevent accidents due to human errors and carelessness , therefore reducing the likelihood and degree of vector core damage .
Besides that , the new designs will have a much better life-cycle cost advantage over other energy sources .
The most important thing is that , they will not be an attractive route for diversion or theft of weapon-usable materials .
The physical protection of the new nuclear reactors will also prevent  acts of terrorism .
The six Generation IV Reactor are revolutionary designs of nuclear reactors .
Out of the six proposals  in the Generation IV Reactor , Very- High-Temperature Reactors (VHTR) stands out for its potential capability to achieve an excellent thermal performance .
This is the only reactor that is researched by all the partner countries in GIF .
It is technically realizable and technologically well established by vendors and national laboratories .
The great breakthrough in the research also suggests that the VHTR does not require intermediate refueling , therefore eliminating the likelihood of accidents .
The reactor operates by using a high temperature exchanger and electrical heater to avoid efficiency penalty and  enable the generation of electricity and hydrogen at the same time .
It iss also known that the ultra-long life VHTR systems can be developed with the use of minor actinides (MA) .
The Generation IV Reactor will be established after 2030 .
With today's high demand of energy sources , one can say that nuclear energy is an inevitable energy source of the future  .
Many people mistakenly equate nuclear power to nuclear weapons although , in fact , they are in basically different categories .
Nuclear power , for a long time , has been one of the most useful inventions that served the people .
The Generation IV International Forum , which was attended by  the ten nations specialising in nuclear power ,  introduced the six new reactor concepts ("Nuclear power's new dawn ," 2004) .
One of them , the Molten Salt Reactor , has a prospective application though there are several objections with respect to safety , cost and performance .
The first opinion that opposes the building of nuclear plants is the people's fear of danger .
Some think that nuclear plants emit radioactive waste into the environment , which may cause both pollution and genetic mutation; others are afraid of the safety system , meaning the plants might explode easily .
These thoughts are due to the history of some nuclear accidents , for example , the meltdown of a nuclear plant at Three Miles Island in Pennsylvania .
However , nuclear power as well as the new Molten Salt Reactor system , in fact , is safer and useful .
According to Declan Butler (2004) , the Molten Salt Reactor system mainly uses fluoride salts , which also belong to heat-and corrosion-resistant materials , as coolant , which can operate for a very long time and is also  safe and reliable .
The salts can keep the reactor's temperature at around 700 oC , which is acceptable in comparison with the others .
One advanced benefit from this system is its low pressure so that the reactor wall can handle good protection .
Another advantage of nuclear power is its green emission .
Current nuclear plants (known as Generation III) and also future ones emit only hot steam while other electricity producers like coal plants pollute the environment with CO2 and SO2 .
In short , the Molten Salt Reactor system is safe to operate and friendly to the environment .
Some people relate nuclear plants to buildings for research rather than for producing electricity , and the cost for producing is high .
In fact , among other Generation IV Reactors as well as electricity generators , the Molten Salt Reactor seems to be the cheapest way to produce electricity  .
This is because the coolant (molten salts) is cheap and recyclable .
Molten salts can be easily found in nature , and the purification technology used for them is simple and less costly than , for instance , lead-bismuth , sodium and helium .
Osman Kemal Kadiroglu (2006) noted that the cost for the same amount of power produced by nuclear plants is cheaper than any other power generation technologies .
He compared them in terms of the availability to build , cost to produce power and area of land occupied .
For example , the cost (in US dollars for fuel used per Megawatt-hour energy is $5 for nuclear and $11 for coal plants ("The Virtual Nuclear Tourist ," 2005) .
A nuclear plant can be built anywhere , which does not require natural resources .
Other sources of energy need natural resources to operate: swift water flow for dams , strong blast for wind turbines , sun beam for solar panels .
Hence , their availability to build up is limited .
Besides , land used for a nuclear plant is less than other alternatives .
Solar or wind power need a lot of land to produce the same amount of energy .
Performance is one of the most concerned factors that people  But nuclear power , especially the Molten Salt Reactor system , should be ranked as the first ("Ranking Power: Scorecards Electricity Companies ," 2004) .
The power , an amount of energy generated in a unit of time , of a nuclear plant is highest among the others' .
As Roger (2007) stated in his statistical data , the average amount of energy generated per hour  varies among kinds of plant: average 4000 MW for nuclear , 1000 MW for coal or oil-fired and 700 MW for hydroelectric generating stations .
From these numbers , it is obvious that the performance of nuclear plants is sufficient  to support the consumption of a large population , which helps the nations lacking in natural resources be independent of coal or oil import .
Particularly , the power output of the Molten Salt Reactor system includes both electricity and hydrogen , which can also be used for other purposes .
In short ,  cheap material , additional product (hydrogen) and high performance (property of nuclear power) make the Molten Salt Reactor system as well as nuclear power most efficient .
In conclusion , nuclear power is safe , clean and effective , which most  people seem to forget .
With the cheap , safe , recyclable , low pressure , having-additional-produce and high performance properties of the Molten Salt Reactor system , it is one of the most potential electricity generators for the future .

The LFR's smaller core and lesser required cooling systems , such as the omission of an intermediate cooling link , saves significant building costs as compared to SFR .

(Hejzlar , 2009) Furthermore , it costs less per kWh of electricity compared to SFR .

atis thereforeAll in all , the overwhelming advantages of LFR as a future implementation of the new generation IV nuclear plant , proves that it is better than the SFR in all of the above aspects .
Therefore , we should push for development of LFR nuclear power plants .
According to statistics provided by the World Coal Institute , the remaining coal and natural gases reserves will only be able to last us for around 122 years and 42 years respectively .
Due to vast development and urbanization in both developed and developing nations , these resources are rapidly depleted to generate electricity in power plants .
Hence , to meet the world's energy needs , scientists are re-addressing the potential benefits of harnessing power through nuclear reaction , in which uranium is split to release energy .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) based its operations on the concept of generating electricity through such a process .
As a result of operating at a very high temperature , 900 degree Celsius , the VHTR functions at 50% higher thermal efficiency which allows it to generate more electricity .
Moreover , the processed heat that the nuclear reactor produces can also be used in other industrial areas such as hydrogen production , water desalination and the treatment of crude oil (Jacques , 2008) .
Despite the apparent benefits from harnessing energy through VHTR , the public continues to harbor doubts over the reliability and effectiveness of this technology .
Environmentalists claim that green energy such as solar , wind and hydro energy are the trusted technologies which we should focus our research and funds on in meeting the increasing energy needs .
While it is understandable that such technologies are everlasting , cheap and clean to adopt as resources used are free and renewable and the processes do not emit any harmful materials into the environment , we notice that these technologies cannot be readily implemented throughout the world .
This is because they rely heavily on weather conditions which vary drastically according to location and time or may be even unpredictable at times .
On the other hand , with its simple design and high efficiency , it is fairly cheap to build and operate the VHTR .
The VHTR can be built anywhere on an empty plot of land .
The fact that uranium is also widely available in ample supply is in contrast to the trend of the rapidly depleting coal and natural gases reserves .
Henceforth , nuclear power has limitless potentials for us to look into and the cost of its usage is fairly cheap .
Anti-nuclear activists believe that as the waste from nuclear processes are being recycled to retrieve unused uranium , plutonium , a key ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons is also being separated and recovered .
In addition , the leftover waste is radioactive in nature and if not handled properly ,  creates pollution and poses great threat to the ecosystem of the world .
Their concerns are valid but with the advancement in nuclear technology , the VHTR is able to counteract these effects .
Firstly , the VHTR does not recycle its leftover from the nuclear reaction .
Instead the waste is  discarded at the end of the nuclear process .
As a result , plutonium is not recovered .
Secondly , new forms of reprocessing radioactive waste are being researched and developed to shorten their half-lives (Butler , 2004) .
This means their hazardous effects will only be short-lived .
Lastly , despite conventional beliefs that nuclear power causes pollution , the truth is that the VHTR actually produces less carbon emission as compared to power plants fueled by coal or natural gases .
Its effects on global warming are less prominent .
It can be seen that the usage of the VHTR is in fact environmentally friendly and responsible to the society .
In response to the mounting threat of terrorism , country leaders are concerned with the security and safety aspects of nuclear plants .
They are afraid that if terrorists were to sabotage these nuclear plants , their act will lead to a catastrophic disaster which will affect the nation's economic and social health  According to Thinkquest , their worries are not unfounded as the lapse in safety of nuclear reactors led to two devastating nuclear accidents which happened on Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , in 1979 and at Chernobyl in Ukraine in 1986 .
To prevent the repeat of past events , the VHTR has enhanced safety features and components1 that do not rely on sophisticated backup systems or experienced operators to function .
In the event of an accidental power trip or a planned sabotage , the VHTR is able to cool itself with minimal or even zero human intervention .
Therefore , the VHTR is 'meltdown proof' and it provides maximum safety and reassurance .
To conclude , nuclear energy is relatively cheap , environmentally and socially responsible , and safe to use .
Most of the participating nations and organizations of the Generation IV International Forum are supportive of this new technology and they have pooled US$500 million over the next 5 years to fund its further research and development (Jacques , 2009) .
It is imperative for us to accept and embrace this new form of technology in order to meet the world's increasing energy demand .
An accident is often an unintended action which results in vast effects .
One example will be the Chernobyl disaster which occurred in 1986 during a non-routine operation .
There was a sequence of events that caused the explosion of reactor number 4 that led to the release of radioactive fission products to the atmosphere .
This resulted in many deaths , including those who died from the accident , those firefighters and majority who were exposed to radiation .
(Chernobyl .info) There were a number of reports published that summarized this accident , concluding that the sequence of events was due to human error and design faults .
There are arguments that the lack of knowledge of the operators and the technical failure of equipment could not be solved with the application of psychology .
However , it seems otherwise since psychology is a study of the human mind or behavior .
This incident occurred during a non-routine operation to test the ability of the turbine , in times of power failure , to produce sufficient power .
For that , all backup systems were switched off to avoid disturbance .
One main factor that resulted in the explosion was the activating of the emergency button by operators .
The operators were inadequately trained .
They did not know that with the activation of the button , there will be a sudden surge of power before dropping reactivity .
It is thus argued that psychology may not be helpful in this case as the behavior of the operators is beyond the control of the design engineers .
However , considering the mentality of the operators , it was logical for them to do so since it was meant as an emergency action .
This shifted the responsibility to the design engineers .
A successful designed process is one that is foolproof .
The behavior of operators should be anticipated and thus engineers could have reduced the complexity of the task by providing short and efficient procedure guidelines .
The failure to do so showed that the engineers had overestimated the operators' knowledge of the process (Wilpert , 2007)  .
In other words , it is unfair to blame the operators  when accidents happen Furthermore , the testing of limits of the reactor was not a routine operations , thus the lack of knowledge to react is considerable and should be anticipated and counteracted .
Even so , many still think that psychology may not come in handy in preventing accidents  , especially when it is due to technical faults .
In the Chernobyl case , the positive coefficient of the reactor is one major technical fault .
This characteristic will cause reactors to be unstable at low power levels .
It was due to the instability of the reactor that there was this rapid power increment resulting in explosions .
(Engineering .com) Despite this dangerous feature , engineers still chose this type of reactor as they deemed it as the best choice .
Another fatal technical fault was the chosen design of the control rods .
These control rods will cause a sudden surge in power before reducing reactivity .
It was thus argued that psychology is not useful as engineers were aware of the consequences but there was no better solution .
While it may be true that there was no better choice with the level of technology then , the engineers could have improved the designs .
According to Wolfgang Botsch , a similar error with the positive coefficient of the reactor had already occurred in Lithuania in 1983 .
However , sadly , this experience was not passed down to the design crew of Chernobyl .
Therefore , it is not right to say that the reactor was the best choice to be used in the plant .
If they had adopted the use of psychology , they might have reviewed safety records of that type of reactor in the industry before deciding on it .
Furthermore , the typical approach by the engineers to find solutions often starts with a fixed plan with the application of their knowledge .
However , in this process , there may be partial failures in the system which the engineers failed to identify and were thus unable to improve safety of the system .
Therefore , a systematic thinking is recommended , where engineers constantly analyze their own approach and decisions so as to take corrective action to improve the safety of the whole system .
By doing so , we are adopting the path of feedforward control of safety .
This is preferred to making corrections only after an accident has occurred .
It will be too late .
This evaluation is also part of psychology application , where the mistakes from the engineers are reduced as much as possible to safeguard the complex high hazard system .
(Wilpert .B , 2007)

The rapid development of countries and expansion of population have created a world that is increasingly unable to meet the demand of energy .Additionally , fossil fuel is criticized as the main contributing factor for green house gas effect .
As such , there is a pressing need to search for alternative renewable forms and energy which is comparatively more eco-friendly and highly effective .
In such a context , nuclear energy created by using the Generation IV (Gen IV) reactor is able to replace  fossil fuel , which is believed to be the main cause of global warming .
One such reactor is the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) which can "supply electricity and process heat to a broad spectrum of high-temperature and energy-intensive processes"  .
Some may argue , with skepticism , that the safety issues of this reactor are still imminent and hence , nuclear power should not be supported .
However , in my opinion , on the whole , the benefits gained from VHTR will far exceed the problems created .
Some opponents have raised  doubts of the performance of VHTR .
However , VHTR has proven itself as a high-efficiency system .
First , VHTR performs under very high temperature , thereby allowing for more efficient conversion of heat to electricity .
For example , Butler (2004 , p . 238) reported that it "could squeeze 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared with other conventional plants" .
Besides , VHTR can also be used to split hydrogen from water thermo-chemically .
Nowadays , there is an increasing demand for energy due to fast economic development .
Thus we need a power generation method that would be sustainable in the long term .
Actually , fossil fuel is also possible but with the spike  in energy consumption in the past few decades , fossil fuel is predicted to be depleted by 2040 .
Moreover , the fossil fuel's emission of carbon dioxide , which contributes to soaring green house gas levels would not happen with nuclear power .
In short , I believe that with further research , the efficiency of the nuclear power can be increased , making it a potential  energy resource in the future .
Some skeptics feel that the building of VHTR is a risky investment , complaining that VHTR is an expensive source of energy , hence unfeasible .
Yet , although the fixed cost of building is high , it is myopic to merely look at the short run cost while neglecting the long run benefit .
Due to low maintenance , the fixed cost would be lower in the near future  .
Zheng L . reported that China is planning to install nuclear power capacity of 86 gigawatts by 2020 , up nearly 10 fold from the capactity it had by the end of 2008 .
The fact that China , one the world largest consumers of energy , is willing to spend high proportion of money for this project shows the  long run benefit that nuclear power can bring about , especially since the Chinese government has been always very pragmatic .
The final argument advanced by the opponent is that while high temperature makes electricity and hydrogen production easier , it also poses a threat of explosion .
For example , two incidents-an accident in 1979 in which the reactor core lost coolant and partially melted , and the 1986 catastrophe in which a reactor exploded and released radioactivity into the atmosphere(Sandra M) greatly increased concerns about the safety of nuclear power .
Yet , VHTR is actually still safe and reliable to operate , with improved accident management and mitigation and reduced off-side response with little human intervention .
Last but not least , some will question why helium with low thermal conductivity is chosen as its coolant given that some other coolant , for instance molten salt , allows better electric conversion efficiency than a helium-cooled VHTR operating at similar conditions .
However , the selection of coolant is based on many factors .
First , "helium gas provides a nonreacting cooling medium with a low nuclear cross section that can either directly drive a turbine for power production , or can be directed to process" (Gen IV) .
Second , VHTR uses helium as a coolant for safety purposes .
Helium is an inert gas , so it will not chemically react with any material , and exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive , unlike most other possible coolants .
Balancing all these factors , Helium is still the overall best coolant .
Hence , this selection proves the safeness of VHTR .
Thomas Malthus , a famous demographer , published a theory that population growth will eventually outstrip resources .
Hence , the research for alternative energy is necessary .
Although there is certain undenied limitation of VHTR , I am strongly convinced that with the current technology advances , the limitation will be solved .
With more funds channeled into research into  this  area , the potential of VHTR could be maximized .
The world is concerned with the safety of nuclear power plants andsibility of nuclear arms proliferation .TS Past incidents at Chernobyl and Three Mile Island (Bodansky , 2005) had left many in doubt of the technology .
In recent news , both North Korea and Iran have been told to step back on their plans of a nuclear power plant in fear power , whichme radioactive materials used for energy generation will be used in nuclear weapons .
The VHTR design does not include the controversial method of waste recycling , whereby plutonium is extracted in a pure form (Butler , 2004) .
Hence , this design reduces the probability of nuclear arms proliferation .
Within the VHTR reactor , the nuclear fuel is enclosed within pebbles of silicon carbide and pyro-carbon (Olander , 2009) which are able to contain the radiation .
The coolant used is helium gas instead of water .uperior because it will not get irradiated and does not undergo volume expansion phase change .
Even if the reactor body is breached , there will be no explosive dispersion of radioactive materials .
Therefore , the VHTR design is safer than current nuclear reactors and less susceptible to nuclear arms proliferation (Hylko , 2008) .
Moreover , detractors have argued that the high temperature generated in nuclear reactors is not fully utilized anconventional non-nuclear energy generation methods have better perfohavence in terms of theraboutl efficiency .TS ERecently ,r plants have thermal efficiency of approximately 33% (Olander , 2009) compared to 70% and above forr non-nuclear power plants .
Firstly , the VHTR operates at close to 1000 C compared tproducing nuclear00  C in current nuclear reactors .
This higher temperature translates to the extraction of 50% more energy from the same amount of fuel (Butler , 2004) .
Improved engineering and design will further increase the thermal efficiency of the power plant in the future .
Secondly , although the thermal efficiency of nuclear plants is lower , the actual amount of power generated per unit mass of fuel is actually much higher than that of fossil fuels .
Hence the method of using thermal efficiency for comparison is not practical .
Lastly , because of the higher temperature , it is possible to produce hydrogen gas from water thermochemically (Elder and Allen , 2009) .
There is a demand for hydrogen gas which may become a fuel for cars in the future .
Therefore , the VHTR design is superior as it produces more energy and hydrogen gas

It is said that the world's population will expand from the current 6 billion to around 10 billion by the year 2050 (GIF , 2002) , which will push us into an even more serious energy shortage position unless we successfully find new kinds of energy as soon as possible .
In fact , human beings have been seeking for the solution to energy issues for a long time .
So far we have already developed solar energy , wind energy , nuclear energy and many others .
However , none of these can be the ideal energy to us now due to the technological problems , economic concerns , or potential dangers .
Among all these new kinds of energy , nuclear energy is regarded as the most controversial one which has been the hotspot since its appearance .
Whether to develop and promote the use of nuclear energy has triggered firm discussion among both experts and common people .
In my opinion , we should give more support to nuclear development because of its high efficiency , none-greenhouse-gas emission and its valuable by-products during the reaction .
Some opponents may argue that other kinds of energy can also be environmentally friendly , such as solar energy and wind force .
There is no need to spend so much on nuclear energy development .
However , in terms of efficiency and economic value , nuclear energy has great advantages over both solar energy and wind force .
The Generation reactors are expected to increase the efficiency of electricity production to as high as 50% while the efficiency of solar energy is no more than 40% in the lab (U .S . Department of Energy , 2006) which means its actual efficiency of industrial application will be even lower .
Besides this , in the process of nuclear reaction , a large amount of hydrogen can be generated for the use in petroleum refinement and also as new advanced fuel in transportation (Vilim , 2007) .
It is said that for America , the energy demand of transport alone will cause increase of oil imports by 78% by the end of 2025 if it does not switch its dependence on oil to hydrogen (Butler , 2004) .
So the Very-High-Temperature-Reactor (VHTR) is believed to play an important role in America's energy crisis , because it can help to reduce the dependence on oil for its over 2 million normal cubic meters hydrogen production per day .
Though solar energy and wind force can also contribute to environment protection , nuclear energy indeed has its unique advantages which they cannot rival  .
Apart from this , opponents may be worried that the nuclear reactors would become the target of terrorists because of disastrous consequences after its ruin .
However , the new advanced feature of VHTR can effectively protect itself from the damage of terrorists .
Normally , the terrorists attempt to make an accident by shutting off the coolant or power supply of the system .
But they will not expect that the meltdown proof in VHTR can cool itself down when accidents happen and minimize the interaction with human beings (Butler , 2004) .
So , nuclear reactor would not be a desirable target for terrorists any more .
To sum up , the Generation reactors have made great improvements compared to the older generation ones in terms of both technology and safety features .
On one hand , nuclear energy has the advantage of high efficiency , non--greenhouse-gas emission and the by-product hydrogen , which is supposed to be another ideal energy .
On the other hand , the fact that nuclear power plants contribute about 16% electricity to the world , which is the largest share among all the new developed energy sources (NEA , 2006) , indicates that nuclear power has become more and more essential to human beings .
Given both the advantages of nuclear energy and the current situation , it is practical and urgent for us to put concerted efforts to the development of nuclear energy .
The electric vehicle (EV) is not new on the road .
In fact it has been on the road for more than a century  .
EV became unpopular since the birth of the gasoline powered vehicle which offers high performance and low cost .
However , the idea of EV is revived mainly due to peak oil and climate change .
EV is powered by huge rechargeable battery packs and propelled by only an electric motor .
For that reason , EV is also labelled as the zero-emission vehicle .
However , there are safety issues on the newly developed technologies that the electric vehicle carries such as the volatile Lithium ion battery , massive battery weight problem , and the silent electric motor that might cause unnoticeable hazard to the pedestrians .
Despite all the safety issues , steps have been taken to enhance the safety of the EV .
In my opinion EV is safer than a conventional gasoline vehicle .
Although numerous articles claiming that EV is unsafe , there isevidence of improvements  made to make EV safe to drive .
There are claims and myths that the Lithium ion rechargeable batteries that power the EV will explode and cause massive damage to the vehicle and the driver .
To ensure safety , carmakers are rigorously testing their batteries .
Nissan and Mitsubishi , for instance , expose the batteries to extreme temperatures , continuously charge and discharge the batteries , and smash them to experiment real road accidents (Rowley and Hall , 2009) .
Besides that , carmakers also improve the materials of the battery to minimize the risk of overheating .
An anti-impact cage is added to shield the battery from being crushed .
In order to prevent over charging and discharging , advanced microchips will be used to monitor the batteries' capacity .
With these improvements , Osamu Masuko , president of  Mithubishi Motors says that gasoline is relatively far more dangerous than batteries .
The electric vehicle carries large and heavy battery packs to increase the mileage per charge .
These heavy batteries result in an EV being much heavier compared to an identical gasoline vehicle .
However , if the weight of the batteries in the vehicles is arranged correctly , the EV should be able to achieve higher stability .
Other than that , in a crash test , the occupants of a lighter vehicle  suffered from higher damage compared to a heavy vehicle (insurance Institute for highway safety , 2009) .
In comparison , an accident involving a 1400 Kg vehicle will cause about 50 percent fewer injuries than a 900 Kg vehicle .
Therefore , the weight from the batteries brings safety benefits .
Recently , there have been debates on electric vehicles posinga hazard to pedestrians , especially to the blind or visually-impaired road users (Nuckols , 2007) .
EV is propelled by an electric motor in which torque is produced by electromagnetic forces .
Vibration and noise is minimal compared to an internal combustion engine .
Therefore , EV travel on the road inaudibly , hence the EV could surprise or cause an unexpected danger to the road users .
Tests have shown that the noise level that the EV produces while operating below 30 km/h is not noticeable for all types of road users .
Beyond that speed , more audible noise is formed by the air displaced by the body of the vehicle and friction on the  .
Thus , the European Commission and the US Congress are taking the initiative to set up a minimum level of sound for the EV , and the Japanese may add noise to the quiet vehicle (AFP , 2009) , so that the pedestrians and blind people are able to detect oncoming EV .
This shows that initiatives have been taken to make the electric car safe for the drivers and the pedestrians .
From all the weaknesses of the EV mentioned above , we can actually see that they are no longer a threat to the EV drivers or pedestrians .
EV batteries have been improved to prevent over-heating , controlled charging and discharging .
The casing has been fortified to ensure the batteries are not seriously damaged after a car crash .
The weight problems were countered easily by properly aligning the batteries such that the weight will give more stability to the EV .
Innovative idea such as adding artificial noise to the EV has effectively eliminated the hazard posed by the silent electric motor .
In conclusion , we can see that manufacturers have greatly improved the EV to a standard that EV is safer than the conventional gasoline vehicle .
Heartmate II is a battery operated electronic pump attached internally onto a patient's heart inside his or her chest cavity .
It is connected to an external power source , running on batteries or a power console , carried by the patient .
Heartmate II is the successor ofwork ,rtmate , which was a previous prototA hearthat needed to be improved .
However , even as Heartmate II solved issues of incompatibility and durability , there is still much to improve in terms of safety , performThis proves to be very difficult , and tmate II is operating at a 70 .6% success rate with the remainder resulting with reoperation or mortality .
The causes of mortality were primarily due to sepsis , bleeding issues and device related complications2 .
I feel that there is much room for improvement for the design to enhance Heartmate II's safety and performance and efforts should not stop till a much higher percentage success rate is achieved .
Battery life is one of the main concerns that need to be addressed for toHeartmate II .
Currently , the external battery pack of two AA sized batteries supports the Heartmate II for a good five hours3 .
Though extra batteries can be brought to sustain the appliance , this may be insufficient and can be an area where human error occurs to cause fatalities due to power shortages .
As such , I propose an improvement in battery life by having a better power source , one that would last for more than half a day so as to keep the changing of the battery as minimal as possible .
This would lessen the possibilities for power shortage accidents to occur .
However , an improved battery life could lead to a compromise in the size of Heartmate II .
The bulkiness of the device could reduce the mobility of a patient and in turn increase the possibility for bleeding issues internally .
Essentially , what needs to be achieved is a compact and less bulky battery with longer life span .
Another factor to increase the safety of Heartneeds II would be the alteration of the materials used to manufacture the appliance .
Firstly , it has been reflected that users are facing problems with regard to issues surrounding water resistivity externally3 .
Being caught in a rain would prove to be fatal to a Heartmate II user .
Upgrading the material's water resistivity would make Heartmate II safer .
Furthermore , users could even enable the user to take a proper bath , instead of being restricted to just wiping themselves clean with a wet cloth .
In addition , the materials of the wall of the internal artificial ventricles and pump have to be made to have none or negligible resistance so as to ensure smoother blood flow rate .
Lastly , a lighter material should be preferable for the Heartmate II to reduce any strain whilst being attached to its users internally and externally .
All these elements are crucial to the performance and safety of the Heaa longere II .
There exist many more avenues that can be explored to improveusers Heartmate II and the invention of an artificial heart is still in early stages of its development .
Amidst this discussion , I feel that the cost should not be a determining factor in the construction and application for such health devices that could determines ones life and death .
Issues of security and performance hold the highest priority for mechanges could be made todesigns like the Heartmate II .
I strongly feel that the strife for more development and research should be done for the sake of creating a more durable and lightweight Heartmate III .
Over the decades , the quality of life has improved tremendously in terms of technologies .
People are now living in a world filled with technologywith every edge of the world powered by electricity .
This shows the significance of electricity as compared to the past .
However , the day when people use more electricity than they produce is approaching .
According to Butler , the global demand for energy is expected to double by 2050 (Nature ,2004) .
This forces people to resort to producing energy through nuclear reactors which have higher outputs .
One of the nuclear reactors of Generation-IV nuclear reactor concepts which are highly discussed is the molten salt reactor(MSR) .
Fundings should be allocated for further research of MSR as MSR is able to address the issues of safety ,cost and performance which are the main public's concerns .
Firstly , the public has always held the view that nuclear reactors are unsafe to use as they emit substances which are hazardous to people's health and the environment .
An example of nuclear explosion as quoted by Arlington National Cemetary Records: ''3 January 1961: A reactor explosion (attributed by a Nuclear Regulatory Commission source to sabotage) at the National Reactor Testing Station in Idaho Falls , Idaho , killed one navy technician and two army technicians , and released radioactivity "largely confined" (words of John A . McCone , Director of the Atomic Energy Commission) to the reactor building .
However , this tragedy is very unlikely to happen for MSR .
As MSR has a liquid fuel , the reactor has the unique safety advantage that in the event of an accident , the fuel salt is dumped to critically safe , passively cooled storage tanks .
Moreover , molten salts are effectively incompressible .
Consequently , a failure of a heat exchanger in the chemical plant will not pressurize the plant .
In contrast , if helium or other gases are used in the heat transport systems , a heat-exchanger failure can pressurize the chemical plant , with the potential for large releases of toxic materials .
Also , the public is afraid that the nuclear reactor will be misused for development of nuclear weapons .
This does not concern MSR , as it is able to operate with non-weapon grade fissile fuel which gives  no chance for people to misuse the research to develop nuclear weapons .
These features make MSR exceptionally safe compared to other reactors .
Secondly , it has always been a general perception of the public that the cost incurred to build a nuclear reactor is always huge .
This results in not much effort being taken to initiate a nuclear reactor project as they believe the project is not feasible .
Another related concern is the amount of cost incurred for the maintainence of the reactor .
However , MSR is known to be among the cheapest nuclear reactors .
From the table shown by R .W .Moir(Nucl .
Tech .
139 (2002)) the cost incurred by MSR is 31 .3$ for every megawatt of energy generated per hour which is the least compared to the current technologies used .
Also , MSR will be using thorium as fuel as thorium is so abundant in the world as compared to current technologies which mostly use coal as fuel where coalis expected to last just for another 146years according to Energy Information Administration (EIA) .
These show that MSR is economical and should have cleared any doubts regarding further research on MSR as it is a feasible project in the long run as it makes use of resources which are abundant .
Lastly , the public has doubts about the performance of MSR .
Among the issues highlighted were whether it has higher output than other reactors and the technologies required to fully utilize MSR .
As the power required to overcome heat-exchanger pressure drops in a molten-salt system is typically about one-twentieth of a helium system , MSR has higher efficiency than most reactors .
Also , the size of a molten-salt heat-transport loop is only a small fraction of those using helium and is small relative to those for other coolant which leads to usage of a smaller area .
If funding is provided for research on MSR , there is no doubt that MSR can be fully utilised .
Although MSR generally generates less energy as compared to other nuclear reactors , the less space it requires can make up for it .
Thus , the efficiency rate is still very comparable to other reactors of high efficiency rate .
In conclusion , it is evident that MSR is worth the funding for the research given the attributes it possess .
If further research is  done , there is no doubt that MSR will be able to improve its weakness in having higher output as well as further refine  its strong points which are economyl and safety  .

The very high temperature reactor , belonging to the new generation , has a high efficiency of energy conversion and the applications can be extend to hydrogen generation .
Firstly , it uses graphite as a moderator , a substance which neutrons collide with , so that the efficiency is demandd .
During the process , the moderator is one owayshe important ingredients .
A good moderator is the one that should not absorb too much energy when the neutrons bounce off nor absorb the neutrons before they split .
Graphite is nucleare comparExpertsdinary moderator which is water nuclearphite is hwhich  are resistant .
So using graphite increases the efficiency of the usage of uranium and reduce the lost of energy .
Secondly , operating at very high temperatures , a much higher proportion of the energy from the core can be turned into electricity and a much higher proportion of the U235 can be split .
Besides , due to the high temperature , hydrogen , which can be used in transportation and other industry is also produced from water splitting (Elder , 2009) .

After the Chernobyl disaster involving the radioactive substances escaping the nuclear reactors and killing several people , the world has realised it wants an effective  , clean and safe way to tap this dangerous energy source .
The VHTR can not only supply heat to a broad range of high temperature and energy intensive processes but also produce electricity to meet the modern demands .Also in the end , hydrogen is produced , which clearly is a huge benefit as the energy required to produce pure hydrogen is really tremendous .
The coolant used in this type of reactor is not water but helium .
Helium is an inert gas .
Hence exposing it to radiation does not make it radioactive , thus averting a major health hazard .Because of helium being used as the coolant very high temperatures such as 1000C are possible , thus increasing its efficiency manifold .
The fuel which is used in VHTR is uranium carbide pellets which are extremely heat resistant .
One of the major reasons for accidents in a nuclear power plant is the meltdown within a nuclear reactor .
With the fuel being so thermally inactive that it doesn't break down even in the event of a meltdown clearly poses as a major safety advantage .Another advantage is that the VHTR does not require frequent refuelling which extracts a heavy toll on the human labour  .

(U .S Department of Energy)
A hundred percent safe and efficient design for a nuclear power plant is theoretically impossible .
However with the present level of research we shall be safe to set our hopes on the Generation 4 reactors  , with their advanced design and coolants  .
The use of nuclear fuel has always been received with some scepticism  , which is actually beneficial as it isn't yet a safe energy resource .

Nuclear power promises a viable source of energy which is far cleaner and more cost effective than conventional thermal power stations .
However , there have been strongly differing views .
This is primarily due to safety , security and cost issues which can affect the public adversely .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is one of the new Generation IV reactors that is currently under research .
This new generation nuclear plant has been designed to deal with imminent concerns so as to prepare us for the nuclear power era .
Hence , there are plausible reasons to fund research and development projects pertaining to this area .
Critics of nuclear power maintain that the production of nuclear power is dangerous as there is a dangerous possibility of a radioactive leakage .
However , due to technological advancements in the VHTR , this is no longer an area of concern .
The coolant used in VHTR is helium , an inert gas that does not react chemically with any material .
Exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive .
As such , a leakage would not be radioactive .
The VHTR is a safe reactor which has a 'pebble bed core' .
Spherical fuel elements are termed as 'pebbles' .
Each pebble , containing thousands of micro fuel particles , is essentially a mini nuclear reactor made of graphite .
These pebbles are coated with multiple layers of hard ceramic  which results in the pebbles being extremely heat resistant .
If a meltdown were to occur , the pebbles will not crack easily or release harmful radiation or fission products .
As such , a leakage is unlikely to be radioactive in nature .
Another argument from the opponents of nuclear power is that nuclear waste is non-biodegradable and that radiation from the waste is deadly for those who are constantly exposed to it .
However , the amount of nuclear waste and its negative effects will be greatly reduced with the use of VHTR .
The VHTR has the ability of using existing nuclear waste to produce electricity .
This will considerably reduce the amount of nuclear waste produced .
The half-lives of these nuclear wastes will be shortened to just a few decades instead of the few millennia with the existing technology .
With future technological breakthroughs  , nuclear waste disposal  will no longer be a concern .
Lastly , the public is concerned about the high price related to the production of nuclear energy .
The energy produced by the VHTR can be kept low due to the substantial amount of nuclear energy being produced compared to other energy sources such as coal , oil and wind .
According to statistics , the cost of producing per kilowatt-hour of nuclear power is only slightly above 2 cents in recent years , the lowest as compared to gas , coal and oil which are the three main energy sources in the world .
The implicit cost of pollution that we have to pay is also essentially zero .
This is because the only emission to the environment is steam , which does not pollute the environment in any manner .
Thus , cost should not be an area of concern for the general public .
The most defining issue regarding robots is  safety  .
It is not uncommon for people to experience a machine breakdown halfway through an important process , which can be frustrating and may sometimes lead to significant losses .
The breakdown may be a result of a mechanical part failure or a lack of power supply .
In the case of robotic surgery , a breakdown in the middle of an  operation can be disastrous .
The sudden discontinuation of the robot may hamper the proceedings of the operation , increasing the chances of infection and possibility of death .
To counter these problems , robotic systems like the Da Vinci System have in place a self-check mechanism that allows proper shutting down of the system in the event of a failure in either the self-check or the power source (Safety , 2008) .
This allows the surgeon in charge to be able to continue  with the surgery conventionally .
In this way , there would not be a huge time period where the patient is left with an open incision , thereby keeping any possible chances of infection to a minimum .
Although there may be many doubts on robotic surgery , the benefits of it should not be overlooked .
As robotic surgery is also known as minimally invasive surgery , it does exactly what its name suggests .
The incision required for this operation is much smaller than traditional methods .
This signifies a massive improvement in recovery time and less pain endured by patients (Young , 2007) .
Also , as machines can be sterilized more effectively than humans , there is a lower chance of them being contaminated by external factors , which means less chance of the patient being infected .
robots for surgery is still in a developing stage .
It is vital that the safety aspects of the system be ameliorated before they can be implemented on a wider scale .
With the constant upgrading of the robots and surgeons , the time is nigh for humans to embrace robots as the new generation of surgeons .

Looking into every single opportunity to decrease the greenhouse gases emittedg into the atmosphere , we realise energy sources may be one of the emphatic points to be revised .
Many of the energy producing sources produce inadmissible air pollutants and greenhouse gases which are very harmful to the environment .
Nuclear power is one of the alternative energy sources that is being considered to arbitrate these problems due to its efficiencies and environmental friendly processes .
With the new generation IV reactor concepts , Lead-cooled fast reactor is the paramount choice for producing nuclear power as it surpasses the other reactors in terms of different aspects (Butler , 2004) .
With further research and development , Lead cooled fast reactors will be the future energy source which make security , cost and performance problems precedent .
Nuclear reactors haven been mistaken for a time bomb waiting to explode anytime because of the tremendous pressure contained inside .
It is also believed to cause a catastrophic accident that is very disastrous with any slight technical or human error .
Rebutting , it is actually not true as a power plant is too big to convert a part of its U-235 or plutonium into fission fragments and generate enough heat to fly apart .
On the contrary , a bomb is a compact object so the neutrons need not travel far to hit another fissionable atom which is what makes it so powerful .
This is a fact based on the fundamentals of physics on how fast fission neutrons travel (John , 1995) .
Lead-cooled fast reactors are also built with superior materials to resist strong knockings and vibrations to prevent any leakages of radioactive substances into the atmosphere .
It has been a strain to convince the public to allow nuclear reactors as they involve large amounts of radioactivity .
Accidents that have happened and serve as evidence of the dangers involving nuclear reactors .
However , accidents involving nuclear reactors have been relatively small , compared to cave-ins in coal mines which often kill hundreds .
Nothing is perfectly safe but nuclear energy is definitely safe enough to be relied upon as an energy source .

It also operates at lower pressure compared to other contenders .

First , opponents claim that the VHTR requires materials to reach high standard and currently there is no suitable candidate .
It is true that the requirement for the materials is tough to meet .
Materials used in the internal core structure are required to withstand at least 1000 degrees centigrade which is much higher than the melting points of most materials .
In fact , there is still a small number of ceramic and metallic materials with high melting temperatures and they are the potential materials for VHTR , such as carborundum with a melting temperature of 2730 degrees centigrade and tungsten with a melting temperature of 3410 degrees centigrade (Callister , 2007) .
Besides , aerospace materials are a source of reference for scientists .
The surface temperature of a space shuttle can reach more than 2000 degrees centigrade and certain materials have b successfully used .
Currently scientists are doing research to find new high-temperature-resistant materials .
In general , we are confident to develop suitable materials for VHTR .
Secondly , skeptics argue that there is potential safety hazard .
Ia high reasonable that people concern a lot about the safety since the Chernobyl accident and Three Mile Island accident happened .
Nuclear accidents are deadly disasters , causing economic losses as well as huge damage to the environment and people's health .
According to McCarthy (2009) , the VHTR is quite safe due to its special design which is different from reactors of the Chernobyl type .
Having a negative temperature coefficient , the VHTR can automatically slow down the nuclear reaction inside the core when the temperature rises .
This feature ensures that the temperature in a VHTR core can never be high enough to trigger a meltdown .
With this special design , the VHTR can shut down itself once anything abnormal happens .
Therefore , safety can be ensured for the VHTR .
Accidents like the Chernobyl accident will never happen to the VHTR .
Thirdly , critics argue that the construa potentialthe VHTR is too expensto assumese of the neware concernedlogies applien the reactor design and high standard for materials , new materials and vessels , which may cost millions of dollars , are used in the construction .
However , the benefit attained from the VHTR can cover the high cost .
Scientists pointed out that the VHTR is a highly efficient system .
It will produce electricity about 40 percent more efficiently than most reactors in America do now and its hydrogen production is about 50 percent higher than the existing methods .
Besides , the heat it generates is also useful for refineries , perochemistry and metallurgy (The Generation IV and Nuclear Hydrogen Initiative Programs , para .3) .
Thus , although initially the construction expense is high , later more profit can be achieved .
more profit can be achieved laterinitialalthough theIn conclusion , obstacles like lack of materials , safety problems and high construction cost all can be overcome .
The VHTR is a safe and profitable nuclear reactor with excellent prospect .
Thus , the VHTR is worth further research .
Hopefully , it will be widely used within a decade .

The Chernobylgineering Design Process , Ertas and Jones (1996) notes that engineering design is the process of devising causeda total of system or process to meet desired needs , and it is a decision making process .
Design is a human activity , and human may make mistakes .
Therefore , designers may make mistakes in the design process .
Psychology is the scientific investigation of humans' mental process and behavior .
(Kowalski & Westen , 2005) Using psychology to analyze how the designers think can point out the flaws in their thinking process .
In this way , psychology could help designers to minimize their mistakes in the design process (Wilpert , 2007) .
Thus , possible accidents may be prevented .
In The Truth about Chernobyl , the author , Medvedev (1991) , notes that one of the reasons which cause Chernobyl accident is the inadequate operators with insufficient knowledge operated the reactor inappropriately .
It is true that the operhumans not happened in the design process .
However , the use of psychology in the design process could prevent inappropriate operations from happening .
In the design process , designers should consider the user of devices , components or systems under development , which includes people who maintain and repair the product as well as who operate it (Ertas & Jones , 1996) .
However , the high technical knowledge of the designers may make them overestimate competence of the users .
Therefore , they give insufficient instructions to the users to equip them with equivalent competence (Wilpert , 2007) .
Obviously , in the case of Chernobyl accident , the operator did not have a well-designed instruction manual and was not adequately trained .
If psychology was used in the design process , it would point out this flaw and advise designers to provide an adequate instruction manual including the operations in emergencies so that operators would know how to operate the reactor when facing emergencies .
In this way , Chernobyl accident may be prevented .
Medvedev (1991) mentions in his book that the RBMK reactor in Chernobyl had a dangerously largecausedtive void coefficient and a defect in the design of the reactor protection aoperatingol system .
The designers was aware of the defects of the reactors , however , they did not make efforts to correct them .
Some people argue that these defects caused the Chernobyl accident , psychology cannot solve them .
Technically , psychology could not solve the technical problem for engineers .
But , psychology could point out the potential danger and consequence of the problem so that enoperates would search for better options .
If the designers know the severe consequence of the accident , they would try their best to prevent it .
Psychologists could also indicate the flaws in the design process and advise designers to lower the positive void coefficient and enhance the protection and control system in this case .
Thus , the disaster may be prevented .
would have triedknewIn conclusion , Chernobyl is a result of flawed design of reactor and inappropriate operation by inadequate operators .
However , the use o f psychology in the design process would be helpful to preventdesigners werel disaster .
The errors in the design process and the operation process may be prevented with the help of psychology .
Nowadays , developed countries and developing countries have invested huge funds to develop nuclear power as nuclear energy is regarded  to be the potential energy source for the future (Butler , 2004) .
However , the large amount of R&D funding needed for Generation IV nuclear reactors has made the development of nuclear power a controversial issue .
From a long term perspective , there should be R&D funding for the development of Generation IV reactors since Generation IV reactors are safer , cheaper and cleaner .
First of all , nuclear power is a sustainable energy source in the long term when developed properly .
Generation IV reactors are much cleaner than previous generations .
They will help reduce carbon dioxide and subsequently reduce the effect of global warming (Jacques & Ralph , 2008) .
Jacques and Ralph claimed in Generation IV Advanced Nuclear Energy Systems: "According to Princeton University's Carbon Mitigation Initiative , increasing the number of nuclear power plants to 1000 worldwide-more than double what it is today could avoid one billion tons of carbon emissions per year by 2055 ."
The statistics have shown that the success of development of Generation IV reactors will bring a great improvement to the living environment for human beings in the future .
In the long term , funds should be given to support the development of Generation IV reactors at current stage .
Some may argue that until now , the scientists and researchers are still researching new materials to reduce radioactive leak and wastage (Butler , 2004) .
The success seems to be too far away for the public to feel .
However , this is the reason why more funds must be given to support further research for Generation IV reactors .
Scientists and researchers should be given financial support to overcome difficulties they face during research rather than give up half way .
Therefore , the development of Generation IV reactors deserves R&D funding .
Thirdly , Generation IV nuclear energy systems operations will make further improvement in safety and reliability (Michael , 2005) .
Safety  is one of the most priorities of Generation IV International Forum (GIF) .
The revolution in fuel utilization in Generation IV reactors will reduce the radio toxicity by a large extent (Jacques & Ralph , 2008) .
The public may not trust the ability of scientists and researchers to ensure their safety since they still remember the nuclear power accidents at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania and at Chernobyl in Ukraine which caused many people to die (Butler , 2004) .
However , Generation IV reactors are designed to be safer than the previous generations .
Safety issues will be handled with extreme care by all GIF member counties .
Researchers from different countries are doing collaborative research to achieve this common goal (Jacques & Ralph , 2008) .
Thus , the public should look forward to Generation IV reactors' performance rather than oppose it .
Given the advantages mentioned above , I believe that R&D funding should be given to Generation IV reactors .
Even though the fund is limited and by allocating funds for Generation IV reactors , we have to forgo other possible benefits such as spending the same amount of money to solve poverty or terrorism .
I support to explore new and advanced technology , Generation IV reactors , to solve environmental and energy problems .
{Generation IV reactors}[HYPERLINK: http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Generation_IV_reactors]are a set of nuclear reactor designs being researched currently .
Current reactors in use around the world are considered 2nd or 3rd generation systems , with the 1st generation systems having been retired a long time ago .
TheSupercritical water reactor(SCWR)is one of the generation IV reactors .
The concept is that uses{supercritical water}[HYPERLINK: http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Supercritical_fluid]as the working fluid .
Supercritical water-cooled reactors (SCWRS) are the most advanced nuclear systems .They can generate high thermal efficiency .
The main mission of the SCWR is producing of {electricity}[HYPERLINK: http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Electricity] .
(Nuclear power plants , 2009) .The proliferation of the new nuclear technology is causing considerable controversy and concern .

People have always been concerned about the development of nuclear energy .
Today , 104 reactors produce about 20 percent of the United States 'electricity (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
However , it is still a big question whether Generation IV Reactor projects should be funded .
In this case , I'm confident that Generation IV reactors in general and the VHTR concept in particular deserve to be funded around the world .
For a very long time , many people have been worried about the safety of nuclear energy .
Accidents such as Chernobyl have destroyed the Chernobyl-4 reactor and killed 30 people , including 28 from radiation exposure .
However , if we look on the whole , there has not been a serious accident in the nearly 30 years since the Three Mile Island reactor in Pennsylvania experienced a partial core meltdown .
VHTR is the safest concept among other nuclear reactors , due to low decay heat and non-combustible nuclear-grade graphite , which is virtually impossible to be burnt .
Therefore , the use of VHTR is safe and we can believe in the further development of such GenIV nuclear reactor concepts .
Secondly , global warming is what we are concerned about .
It demands a profound transformation in the ways we generate and consume energy .
Our current sources of power like coal and gas are producing Carbon Dioxide , which make the global warming problem worse .
In addition , these sources of power are being used up and we should find  alternative sources of power .
Scientific research concludes that the world must reduce global warming emissions by at least 80 percent by 2050 to avoid the most dangerous effects of global warming (UCSUSA , 2009) .
Nuclear power could play a huge role in reducing global warming emissions because nuclear reactors emit almost no carbon while they operate and have low life-cycle emissions .
New generation of reactors such as VHTR will produce relatively cheap electricity while solving the threat posed by global climate change .
U .S power producers have proposed building more than 30 new nuclear reactors and some proponents have called for building as many as 300 plants by mid- century (UCSUSA , 2009) .
Therefore , using GenIV nuclear reactors is a very efficient way to reduce the effects of global warming .
The third concern is whether nuclear power concepts such as VHTR can be widely applied to the whole world .
There are some barriers that may prevent nuclear energy from developing: it is expensive to build a plant , there may be human errors and it still produces radio-active wastes .
However , there are lots of positive features that we can count  .
VHTR produces a high-efficiency electricity production with a broad range of process heat applications , while retaining the safety characteristics in both normal and off-normal events .
VHTR is performed under very high temperature (from 500 to 1000 degrees Celsius) , therefore allowing for more efficient conversion of heat to electricity .
A single power plant can produce a large amount of energy compared to the amount produced by wind so in total , the nuclear energy is a cheap kind of energy .
Finally , the energy power concept like VHTR helps prevent the effects of global warming .
It is safe and efficient , so therefore it can produce a lot of energy and is able to replace traditional sources of energy .
It is clear governments should fund the VHTR nuclear projects to develop it further , and nuclear energy will definitely be the energy of the future .

The plutonium produced from reprocessing of waste stays at a high temperature , making it too hot to be stolen .
In addition , as the fuel waste is recycled , there is no need to replace the fuel for a few years .
For comparison , VHTR can not reprocess their fuel waste , and because of that , the amount of fuel waste that it produces is getting bigger and bigger as the electricity's demand increasing (Rohrer , 2007) .
These prove that GFR is safer and more environmentally-friendly than the VHTR .
