Nuclear power can be defined as any nuclear technology that is designed to extract usable energy from atomic nuclei via controlled nuclear reactions .
In 1951 , the world's first experimental nuclear reactor station that produced usable amount of electricity from nuclear energy , Experimental Breeder Reactor I (EBR-1) , was built (Nuclear Technologies , n .d) .
Since then , Nuclear power was often seen as the best alternative energy source as it has no carbon emission and can theoretically produce an unlimited amount of energy since nuclear fuel is inexpensive and abundant on earth .
Currently , 15% of the world's electricity supply comes from nuclear power reactors (World Nuclear Power , 2009) .
With the advancement in nuclear technology , the upcoming generation IV reactors , such as the Sodium-cooled fast reactors , will be even safer and more efficient , making nuclear power the best option in providing mankind with enough electricity for now and the future .
However , after major nuclear incidents such as the Chernobyl disaster , the general public have became skeptical about the safety of nuclear power .
Furthermore , nuclear power is often associated with terms like radiations , weapons of mass destruction , high maintenance cost , and targets for terrorism .
This stigma against nuclear power has led  people such as the general public and environmentalists to favor other alternative energies namely wind energy and solar energy , as they are deemed as better choices .
As such , even though mankind are in need of much more energy , the rate of further development and research on the generation IV nuclear reactor , such as the Sodium-cooled fast reactor , still depends heavily on factors such as cost efficiency , safety issues , and environmental friendliness .
The cost efficiency of a power plant is one of the major considerations in deciding whether a power plant should be built .
It is a common fact that nuclear reactors have high set up and maintenance cost .
The decommissioning cost of a nuclear reactor can sometimes be higher .
For example , the Chernobyl reactor requires lots of maintenance even though it is unable to produce any electricity as there are still lots of nuclear fuel left in the reactors .
Lots of money is also required for the clean up process during the decommissioning of a nuclear reactor (More cash for Chernobyl , 2008) .
Many people would thus argue that this money would be better spent on other alternative energy sources such as wind farms and solar panels as these power plants would incur less economical cost .
However , many of these arguments are based on  short run expenditure that one would face when building a nuclear power plant .
In the long run , after considering the higher capital cost , financing costs and operating costs of a nuclear reactor , a nuclear reactor would still produce much cheaper electricity when compared with other alternative energy sources such as wind energy .
This is because a typical nuclear power plant would produce around 3 to 10 billion kWh per year (World Nuclear Power , 2009) .
This amount of electricity produced is more than the total quantity of electricity produced by a collective of few thousands of wind turbines , since a typical wind turbine produces 0 .5 to 3 million kWh per year (Annual energy output , 2003) .
Furthermore , with the new generation IV nuclear power plants , more energy will be produced , increasing the cost efficiency of nuclear power .
In addition , nuclear power plants do not require specific areas for construction , unlike other alternative energies such as wind farms , which will require areas that have sufficient wind speeds , or hydroelectric plants , which will require a large river for the dam .
Having little restrictions on the construction site , the cost of building a nuclear plant is lowered , making it more competitive economically .
It is thus inevitable that nuclear power is much more cost efficient as we look towards the future .
Besides the cost of electricity , it is important for us to excogitate the safety issues regarding the nuclear power plant .
After the Chernobyl accident , one would commonly assume that nuclear reactors are extremely hazardous .
This is because the Chernobyl accident caused many direct fatalities in the explosion and future fatalities due to the effects of nuclear radiation .
The nuclear radiation caused genetic defects , leading to cancer , leukaemia and other body defects for current and future generations (Pflugbeil & Claussen , 2006) .
Besides reactor accidents , nuclear reactors may also be easy targets for terrorism as many nuclear reactors appear to be vulnerable to any form of terrorist attacks .
In addition , nuclear wastes are dangerous as well as they contain high levels of radiation and can be used for weapons of mass destruction as tons of plutonium nuclear waste are produced by nuclear reactors each year and are often recycled to make nuclear weapons .
Furthermore , lots of secrets about nuclear power plants are often kept away from the public due to economic interest of government bodies and private companies , leading to people choosing other alternative energy as they are seemingly much safer .
On the other hand , since the Chernobyl accident  23 years ago , there has not been any other major nuclear power plant accident .
In fact , the numbers of deaths caused by nuclear power plants accidents are much less compared to coal , hydro or natural gas power plants each year (Safety of nuclear , 2008) .
Moreover , Generation IV nuclear reactions , such as the sodium-cooled fast reactors , excel in many safety aspects such as having the ability to withstand up to a magnitude of 8 .2 on the Richter scale and to shut down safely if any accidents were to happen (Nuclear Power Plants , 2009) .
These new reactors are also more reliable and resistant against proliferation , and are able to use their fuel more efficiently , thus producing less plutonium waste (Generation IV , 2009) .
With the technological advancement in nuclear power in mind , nuclear accidents and disasters would be a thing in the past as nuclear power plants will become safer in their operations .
As our earth suffers from the adverse effects of global warming , everyone would probably want to have clean and green electricity .
It is thus important for us to consider whether nuclear power plants are environmental friendly .
Environmentalists would often suggest the use of alternative energy such as wind , hydroelectric , thermal and solar energies as these energies are known to have little emissions of any kind of pollutants .
Nuclear energy is often seen as a bad alternative as it produces lots of radioactive wastes .
These radioactive wastes require special storage areas , which can either take up land or sea space .
Areas used for containment will thus be subjected to contamination after some years if there is any leakage of radioactive waste , which could destroy ecosystems in the areas .
These environmentalists would thus believe that nuclear power's benefits to the environment are insignificant (Nuclear power undermining , 2008) . . On the contrary , these beliefs are often biased against nuclear power .
Nuclear energy , like all other alternative energies , produces no air pollutants or greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide , sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxides during its daily operations .
Although nuclear wastes will be produced , these are solid wastes that can be stored away safely with current technology .
Nuclear wastes are also under high surveillance that ensures safe transportation and storage (Nuclear Power and the Environment , n .d) .
Furthermore , the nuclear power plants require less land area when compared with other energy sources .
This allows more land areas to be conserved for wildlife and other purposes that benefit the environment .
As such , it is clear that nuclear power is environmentally friendly and should be used so that we can reduce our carbon emissions .
In conclusion , more research and development of Generation IV nuclear power plant should be done as the many benefits of nuclear power  clearly outweigh the disadvantages in many important factors such as cost efficiency , safety issues and environmental friendliness .
The Generation IV sodium-cooled fast reactor will most likely be able to provide mankind with abundant and affordable clean and green energy with minimum risks , and thus removing the stigma on nuclear power .
Generation IV nuclear reactor will allow mankind to fully realize the potential of nuclear power , thus encouraging further development on nuclear technology .
With the sharp increase demand for fuel by emerging economies in the world , it was predicted by some analysts that the world will reach peak oil , the point where half of the world's supply of oil is left , by 2012-2016 (Peak Oil Netherlands Foundation , April 2009) .
As a result of fewer fossil fuel supplies left to be extracted , oil companies will either search for smaller oil fields that will inevitably increase the cost of production of oil or look for unconventional sources of oil such as tar sands that will increase the level of carbon dioxide emission and pollution (World Oil , National Geographic , June 2008) .The increasing demand for oil and the rising level of carbon dioxide emission , which contributes to global warming , have prompted the energy market to search for alternative energy sources .
Nuclear power seems to be one of the promising solutions to the above problems .
The use of nuclear power also faces opposition from the public .
The public is very concerned about the safety of nuclear power plants , the storage of radioactive waste and the cost it has to pay for nuclear power .
In contrast to  public opinion on the adverse effect of building a nuclear power plant , the latest generation IV reactor , Very-High-temperature reactor (VHTR) , is designed to overcome these problems faced by the public .
The public is very concerned about the safety of nuclear power plants and fears that any factors that trigger the explosion of a nuclear reactor will have devastating impact on the people living in the region .
Ever since the partial reactor meltdown at Three Mile Island in 1979 and the Chernobyl nuclear accident in 1986 , the public feared that any similar incidents would have grave consequences to the people living around  nuclear power plants .
Pertaining to these concerns , the 'Defense-in-Depth' approach adopted by VHTR consists of prevention and control of abnormal operation and failures , detection of failures , protection against accident progression and mitigation of the effects of severe accidents and substantial amount of released radioactive materials .
Through the implementation of 'Defense-in-Depth' approach , not just safety barriers are protected , but also predicted types of accidents are prevented and mitigated (Source: CEA) .
In addition , the production of hydrogen during the process does pose hazards to the nuclear plants .
This is because the explosion of hydrogen could damage the nuclear reactor .
Consequently , safety measures such as implementing a maximum of 100kg storage of hydrogen near the nuclear reactor and transporting hydrogen gas in double-walled pipes away from the reactor to storage plant at a safe distance (Satyen-Baindur , 2008) .
All these measures are implemented to meet the safety expectation of the operation of nuclear power plant .
Furthermore after 9/11 , nuclear power plants have become the target of terrorists .
Any successful terror attacks on these nuclear plants will have disastrous health and psychological impact on  surviving victims .
Regarding the threat of terrorism on nuclear power plants , the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) has stepped up measures to tighten security around nuclear power plants .
These measures comprise regular 'force-on-force' exercises to test the plant's ability to react to attacks made on it , vehicle inspection at greater safety distance away from the plant , improved communication among different government organizations and stricter  access to restricted sites (Source: NRC , February 2005) .
Other measures include bullet-proof barriers in important areas , intruding detecting devices , detection zones that are illuminated , well equipped and trained security personnel on daily duty and protection against intrusion of network by outsiders (Nuclear Energy Institute (NEI) , July 2009) .
The purpose of these stepped up security measures is to deter any potential terrorist attacks on  nuclear power plants and to have a contingency plan in the event of any attacks .
Another reason why the public and environmentalists oppose  the building of nuclear power plants is that  radioactive waste produced by nuclear power plants will remain radioactive for hundred over years .
When the radioactive waste is not properly stored in location that is of safe distance away from people , the people may be exposed to harmful radiation resulting in serious health effects .
Without proper storage facilities , there are chances of leakage of radiation that will pollute the land and damage the ecosystem .
The public does not need to worry about the large amount of radioactive waste produced by  VHTR because  VTHR spent fuel is contained in a repository that is very resistant to leaching of radioactive materials .
Also the recycling of used fuel also minimizes the production of radioactive waste .
Thus , the process in VHTR produced only electricity and hydrogen and radioactive waste is not disposed and buried underground (A Technology Roadmap for Generation IV Nuclear Energy Systems by US DOE Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee and the Generation IV International Forum , December 2002 , page51-53) .
The public is worried that nuclear power tends to have higher operating and maintenance costs which will result in them paying a higher price than that of coal and a gas power plants .
Such worry is unfounded .
According to the World Nuclear Association , the price of nuclear power is actually competitive with other types of power plants .
For instance in 2007 , the cost of electricity generated by a nuclear plant is about 2 .87cents per kilo-watt hour in comparison with 17 .8 cents per kilo-watt hour in the case of oil power plant in the United States .
The cost of nuclear fuel is as low as 0 .5 cents per kilo-watt hour which is one quarter of that of gas power plant .
As compared to conventional nuclear power plants , there is greater efficiency in generating electricity because VHTR can produce fifty percent more electricity output using the same amount of fuel (The Economics of Nuclear Power by World Nuclear Association , July 2009) .
The process heat can be provided by VHTR to support other industrial activities such as refiningand manufacturing of fertilizers and plastics .
Therefore , the high operation cost of VTHR can be offset by extra revenue earned from these services (Idaho National Laboratory , 2009) .
Moreover , VTHR does not require the disposal of radioactive waste and the cost required for radioactive waste disposal can be minimized .
As the future of oil prices continues to rise due to the scarcity of supply and increase in demand by emerging economies , this will inevitably lead to a more competitive price of nuclear power .
Indeed , there are many concerns from the public regarding the safety of nuclear power plants , the disposal of radioactive waste and the cost of electricity consumers will have to pay .
However , with the designing of generation IV reactors such as VHTR , the problems of radioactive waste disposal and the high cost of electricity generated by nuclear power plant will be solved .
Moreover , there are many safety measures implemented to minimize potential dangers of operating VHTR .
The prospect of nuclear power will remain optimistic and in the future more countries may consider substituting gas and coal power plants for nuclear power plants to generate electricity .
With the increase in global population , the demand for energy is increasing .
According to the International Energy Agency (January 2009) , worldwide energy consumption on average will increase 2% per annum and will double by the next 35 years .
With the fuel prices soaring up , fossil fuel reserves dwindling and increased pressure to tackle climate change and global warming , nuclear energy is back in the agenda of many countries .
In 2001 , amidst increasing debates about nuclear energy , the ten founding nations of Generation IV International Forum also known as GIF decided to work together , collaborating on research activities in the field of nuclear energy (Butler D , 2004) .
These collaborative efforts resulted in building up six possible nuclear reactor concepts known as the generation IV reactors .
However these concepts at that time were still untested and would require years of further extensive research before they could be used in the industry .
Although six possible concepts were developed I personally believe that the molten salt fast reactor concept is the best solution amongst the six .
Nuclear energy is produced by splitting the nuclei of uranium atoms which in turn produce a large amount of energy that is used to drive turbines which produce electricity .
This procedure is extremely efficient so much so that one pound of uranium produces 20 ,000 times more energy compared to  one pound coal .
However , according the World Energy Council there are only 442 nuclear reactors to date and currently they provide only 11% to 18% (March , 2008) of the world electricity requirements .
This is mainly due to the fear and anticipation of possible accidents in nuclear power plants .
After the Chernobyl accident in 1986 and Three Miles accident in 1979 (Think quest , May 2007) many people fear the word "nuclear energy" , but if we consider the number of accidents since the commencement of operations of the world's first nuclear power plant in the year 1954 (Think quest , May 2007) , it is only a handful .
Also , the technology used in the production of nuclear energy has significantly improved in the past few decades and safety factors are analyzed thoroughly when a nuclear plant is designed following the Three Miles Island and Chernobyl accidents .
We should also not forget that accidents do happen in other energy related industries .
For example , statistics show that there is one accident taking place in a coal mine somewhere around the world every week (Mining Industry Today , August 2008) .
In contrast to other  accidents ,   nuclear accidents are given more media coverage sparking public disapproval .
The primary cause of many nuclear accidents is  overheating of water which is used as the coolant in nuclear fission reactions .
As a result of such overheating under high pressure an immense amount of steam is produced if uncontrolled .
This causes the system to explode .
However , in molten salt reactors also known as MSRs fluoride salts are used instead of water as the coolant .
Fluoride salts has boiling temperatures over 1300o Celsius which is about 13 times higher than the boiling temperature of water and they are not flammable (Forsberg CW , 2007) .
Furthermore , most of the current reactors and generation IV concepts require high pressure and high temperature to optimize the energy output .
This further increases the probability of possible accidents .
However , MSRs operate at much lower pressure levels and with Min a relatively low temperature range of 750 o C to 800 o C .(World nuclear Association , August 2009) .
Thus these enhanced features of MSRs further reduce any possibility of any nuclear reactor-based accidents .
However , scientists argue that the current reprocessing method can be altered such that Plutonium produced cannot be used for manufacturing of nuclear weapons .
One such example is the mixed oxide fuel process (commonly known as MOX) used in France where Plutonium is converted to a form stored under very high temperature so that it cannot be used to produce nuclear weaponry .
Moreover , more than 90% of the energy in spent fuel can be reprocessed and reused leaving only about 3 to 4 percent as net waste (Ling K , The New York Times , May 2009) .
Furthermore , MSRs being closed fuel cycle nuclear reactors (World nuclear Association , August 2009) reprocessing takes place minimizing nuclear waste .
In addition nuclear waste produced by MSRs is not soluble in water thus reducing chances of possible contamination .
Thus , through advanced research the cost of nuclear waste management can be reduced and the MSR technology can be enhanced to further minimize the harmful effects and to avoid nuclear waste proliferation .
Another challenge faced by the nuclear energy industry against other alternatives of energy is that building of nuclear power plants is very costly and time consuming .
Most nuclear reactors involve the use of the fast breeder technique but the MSRs use a technology known as slow breeder or thorium fuel cycle breeder which has been proven to be less expensive (Forsberg CW , 2007) .
Besides , the operation costs involved in maintaining high temperature and pressure within nuclear reactors during nuclear fission is notably low in MSRs since they operate at a much lower temperature and pressure .
Also the concepts behind the MSRs are not completely New .
Several have been already constructed with simple validated designs , thus this will reduce the time required in designing larger nuclear reactors (Forsberg CW , 2007) .
Another important advantage of MSRs is that they can be built in a small scale first and can then be expanded gradually , so the plants could be easily built with several small reactors and from the income they can carry out expansions (Forsberg CW , 2007) .
This further reduces cost and additional financial burden arising from interest expenses .
Therefore , MSRs are highly cost effective and efficient .
Uranium prices are currently much more stable than fuel prices and of all the uranium available less than 1% is used up to date .
Compared to hydro or solar power , nuclear energy .
does not change the ecology of a certain environment .
Unlike wind turbines , nuclear energy does not require specific environmental conditions and compared to fossil fuels , they do not produce green house gases , However , the future of nuclear energy depends on further research where these generation IV reactors have to be tested , constructed and operated in such a way that they can provide competitive prices while maximizing the usage of natural resources and enhancing nuclear safety .
They also need to address the fears of the public so that people are more aware of the advantages of nuclear energy
In conclusion , all earlier mentioned objectives cannot be achieved without necessary funding .
In an era where global warming is a burning issue , when the effects of extreme climate change are already evident , nuclear energy may be the ultimate solution to greener energy alternative , thus it is indeed time for us to move forward by challenging our fears and supporting funding for research based on nuclear reactors .
Nuclear power -- an evolutionary discovery that is capable of replacing conventional thermal power stations for decades or even centuries .
Nuclear power makes use of a common element on Earth , which is uranium .
Uranium has an extremely long half-life of 4 .5 billion years .
The atoms of uranium are shot against each other ,  processing an incredible amount of gamma radiation and heat .
This is extremely efficient as compared to the conventional thermal power station methods .
Nuclear power plants have been around for decades and according to Brain and Lamb (2007) , 430 operating nuclear plants have been providing power to the world as of July 2008 .
Nuclear plants have come a long way since the early days and the world has witnessed two major accidents , the Chernobyl and Three Mile Island Incident .
According to Butler (2004) , Generation IV nuclear reactors comprise of six different types of reactors , Gas-cooled fast reactors , Lead-cooled fast reactors , Sodium-cool fast reactors , Supercritical-water-cooled reactors , Very-high-temperature reactors and lastly Molten salt reactors which will be discussed in this article .
Generation IV nuclear reactors including the Molten salt reactors is designed to be safer and preven similar incidents such as the Chernobyl and Three Mile Island from happening again .
Molten-Salt-Reactor technology as one of the six Generation IV nuclear reactors are designed with these factors in mind -- safe , environmentally friendly and cheap in their use of electricity .
However , with all the different concerns involved , this might not be the case .
Firstly , Molten-Salt-Reactors (MSRs) are used to produce electricity .
In addition , MSRs use liquid fuel as compared to the other reactors that use solid fuel .
MSRs are high temperature reactors , depending on the choice of salt; it could range from 320 to 500 degrees Celsius .
As the temperature rises , the heat transfer properties of the reactor rapidly improve .
In addition , the close helium or nitrogen Brayton power cycles are adopted thus allowing the high temperature generated by the MSRs to be efficiently used .
As a result , there is an improvement of 15 percent in electrical power output without increasing the temperature of the fuel salt .
Secondly , with nuclear power being a dangerous source when explosions happen , safety has always been a concern throughout the world .
MSRs handle the situation by having excellent safety measures to handle emergencies .
When the situation calls for it , there is a drainage system to cool the critical safe dump tanks using the liquid fuel .
On top of that , the system can be initiated upon overheating of the coolant with the use of freeze valves and other techniques .
Workers are protected as well , thanks to the intelligent fuel system .
The refueling can be done online , therefore minimizing the danger of the workers .
However , if nuclear plants are to replace conventional thermal stations and be the world's source of power , there are much more to be taken into consideration .
Firstly , despite the safety of  MSRs , one can never forget the devastating Chernobyl incident in April 1986 .
According to World-Nuclear (2009) , the explosion happened during a test on how long the turbines would spin and supply power with the main power supply cut off .
Approximately 200 ,000 people were involved in the clean up from the accident and these people were exposed to  high radiation .
More people were then evacuated from their homes as the radiation spread widely and rapidly .
The effects of a nuclear plant accident are devastating .
Currently there are people around the world who are still suffering from the after effects of such an accident , living in pain where some develop cancer from the exposure to radiation .
Even with the new safety precautions which promise excellent safety measures and technology , no one can guarantee that such accidents would not cause more people to suffer .
For example , the Titanic ,  the largest ship built then , and was equipped with the most advanced technology and safety measures at the time .
A collision with an iceberg during her maiden voyage still sent the enormous ship deep down onto the sea bed .
Secondly , nuclear plants are said to be environmentally friendly due to the fact that they do not produce Carbon Dioxide .
As a result , it helps reduce the greenhouse effect .
On the other hand , the wastes produced by  nuclear plants are highly radioactive and cannot be easily disposed .
These wastes have to be transported to a storage pond filled with boric acid to absorb the radiation , or to a disposal site , for example the Yucca Mountains , where the wastes are buried underground .
During transportation , there might be leakage from  containers , and the effects of burying the waste underground are yet to be confirmed till years to come .
In addition , these waste disposal process might become an open target to terrorists who are constantly keen on destruction .
Lastly , nuclear power might be more cost effective as compared to the conventional thermal power stations .
However the cost of constructing the plant is significantly higher , as well as the operational and waste disposal costs .
The construction cost involves  research on the material so as to contain  radiation in the event of a nuclear meltdown .
Operational and maintenance costs are made up of labor and overheads , for example , pension benefits and medical .
Labor costs include  labor from various departments in the nuclear plant .
These include maintenance , health , engineering and headquarters .
Firstly , maintenance consists of mechanics , instrument personnel , electricians and control personnel .
Secondly , health consists of doctors , nurses and physicians .
Thirdly , engineering consists of electrical , chemical , computer , radiological , nuclear and mechanical aspects .
Lastly , headquarters consist of mainly administrative personnel .
In addition , there are expendable license charges , emergency planning fees as well as other expendable costs .
The waste disposal cost of a nuclear power plant is higher than a conventional thermal station .
The cost involves transportation of the waste to  various storage ponds and dumping grounds , and the running costs of these sites .
This cost increases over the years , as more nuclear wastes are produced .
In conclusion , Generation IV MSR does provide  energy hungry cities with the amount of electricity needed and it reduces greenhouse effect due to the zero carbon dioxide emission , and lastly it is much safer than the previous Generation plants with  enhanced meltdown technology .
On the other hand , the danger of nuclear radiation , fear of terrorism and the high initial and running cost of a Generation IV nuclear plant , make us consider if there are any other alternatives .
has goneforThe serious global warming and the gy demand give nuclear power a chance back to the stage .
The new generation reactors , namely generation IV reactors , have tremendous innovations in improving reactors' efficiency and safety .
Among different kinds of new designs of generation IV reactors , the Very-High-Temperature Reactors(VHTR) are the moweaponsmising ones .
Although VHTR withill has a few technical problems to be solved , its inspiring advantages have indicated the revtheval of the nuclear power .
The design of VHTR has an abundance of advantages .
First of all , VHTR is designed to operate at 1000 which results in the more efficient conversion of heat to electricity .
From thepotentialt of uranium fuels , VHTR can squeeze 50% more electricity than conventional plants .
The same reason of high operating temperature gives birth to  (VHTR) second advantage which is the produce of hydrogen .
At temperatures of about 700-900 , hydrogen can be split from water thermochemically(Nature , 2004) .
This by-product of nuclear power is also a kind of clean energy in place of oil the third advantage VHTR has is the practical experience .
A similar test reactor of VHTR has already been operated in Japan and proven to be a success since it reached its operating goal of 950 .
Last but not least , VHTR does not have the problem of reprocessing of plutonium waste .
Many politicians are afraid that the reprocessing of plutonium waste , which is used in other generation IV reactors , may cause plutonium wars since plutonium is a key ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons .
VHTR will not cause such concern .
In spite of so many advantages VHTR has got , it still faces some technical challenges .
One of most essential ones is the high cost of a reactor , which will deeply affect the development of the whole nuclear industry .
Based on a report from U .S . Department of Energy , even a prototype , which is just a sample run of the practical reactor , will require $1 .25 billion to build(Korman , 2008) .
Meanwhile , the price of uranium is fast increasing , a 30% increase in a thermochemically (Nature ,$50 per pound to 2008's $65 per pound(DOE , 2009) .
These two factoenergy;ult in a high cost of nuclear-generated electriciwhich disables nuclear power from competing with other clean energy technologies like solar energy and wind energy .
A second major challenge is to find suitable building materials .
Since VHTR is operated at a very high temperature and pressure condition , the materials must be able to resist continued high temperature , pressure , corrosive reagents and intense bombardment by neutrons .
Scientists still cannot give a proper solution to this problem .
The last challenge is what the public concerns most-the safety issues .
The high temperature and pressure , which gives birth to the advantage of producing hydrogen , on the other hand , means a high risk of accident .
Also VHTR has no waste recycling systems so that radioactive waste goes nowhere but directly to repository .
This potential danger of waste leak will affect generations .
Nevertheless , in spite challenges are just challenges , not impossibilities .
With the efforts of countless scthe mostists and engineers , these challenges are expected to be solved in a few years .
In terms of high cost of a reactor , significant cost deduction the U .S be achieved by design improvement , standardisation , better construction methods , reduced construction time and improving probuild (Kormanent in building a reactor(OECD , 2005) .
Meanwhile the high efficiency of fuel utilization in VHTR makes reactors use less fuels which in turn lower the cost of fuels(OECD , 2005) .
For finding suitable materials , although the perfect solution has not been found yet , engineers do have some suggested materials that have promising potential to develop , such as silicon carbide , specific grades of graphite and high chromium steels(Murty & Charit , 2008) .
Lastly , the design of VHTR enhances safety features and excludes sophisticated backup systems or experienced operators so as to minimise the human intervention .
In addition , VHTR's ability of burning up 65% of uranium fuel will vastly reduce the amount of nuclear waste to a tolerable level(USDOE , 2005) .
level (USDOEsteels (Murtyfuels (OECD)To sum up , VHTR has many advantages that other generation IV reactors do not have .
It can do very well in converting nuclear power to electricity efficiently .
And it is relatively easier to build and it will not cause political concern on reprocessing of plutonium waste .
Also it produces useful hydrogen as a by-product .
After solving challenges in reactor cost , building materials and safety issues , VHr (OECD)l become a best choice for cheaper , cleaner and safer energy .
This promising design reveals the revival of nuclear power .
The rising sea level , the increase in natural disasters , the proliferation of pandemics , which are the by-products of industrial development , along with the depletion of fossil fuel , demand a new source of energy .
In the endeavor to meet this demand , the GIF (Generation IV International Forum) introduced new types of nuclear reactor in 2002 .
However , nuclear power always conjures up images of catastrophes , tremendous capital investment and wars .
To me , these thoughts on safety - daily danger , accidents and waste , cost and security , can be completely expunged from our minds with the new reactor technology , specifically the lead-cooled fast reactor .
First , there are myriad benefits of nuclear power that the critics often overlook .
In terms of environment , nuclear plant operation by no means entails greenhouse gas emission .
Economically , the price of electricity generated from radioactive fuel would be much lower than that generated from fossil fuel due to the enormous energy churned out from fission reaction .
In addition , as the new nuclear reactor works at high temperature , scientists can utilize it to produce hydrogen from thermochemical reaction of water , which is  material for other industries .
About the negative effects , the first argument  concerns the impact of radiation on humans due to the routine operation of a nuclear plant .
However , according to the Journal of the American Medical Association published by the National Cancer Institute , a major survey showed that there was no rise in cancer rates in 107 US counties near 62 nuclear plants .
In fact , the amount of radiation that people living in the neighborhood of a nuclear plant are exposed to is really miniscule in comparison with that from natural sources .
Furthermore , burning coal in industries also emits radioactive elements .
According to the Atomic Energy Commission ,  power plants using coal produce ash that contains 5 .2 tons of uranium and 12 .8 tons of thorium per year .
Regarding  nuclear accidents , it is the modern reactor generation that is invulnerable to the meltdown incident .
Granted , we cannot deny their impact  , such as the Chernobyl and Three Mile Island accidents , but the new technology can eliminate the possibility of these accidents .
In Three Mile Island , indeed , there were still two defense lines along with the thick steel vessel containing radioactive fuel .
These safety criteria are improving in the lead-cooled fast reactor .
It has double-walled container and a lot of core-cooling emergency systems .
Moreover , since  accidents are mainly brought about by the leaking of the cooling tube , lead is chosen to reduce this possibility .
Lead vapor has low pressure .
Lead is a good heat conductor .
Lead is an inert substance preventing  corrosion .
What is more , lead has high shielding capability for gamma ray (the most damaging radiation) .
Besides , the effects of accidents in coal and oil industries are noticeable , such as oil spills , mining accidents , let alone the environmental effects of the toxic fumes they produce .
As far as  radioactive waste is concerned , a lead-cooled fast reactor is designed best to cut back on the amount of high level waste .
It has a closed cycle and high operating temperature in order to increase the efficiency and lower the radioactive waste .
Furthermore , the high level waste is turned into a rock-like form before it is embedded into a deep rock layer whose lifetime is about one billion years .
On the other hand , the emissions of coal and oil industries are still lingering in our atmosphere , which impact on the number of respiratory disease .
Therefore , in terms of safety , the new lead-cooled fast reactor can really outweigh  coal and oil plants .
Another rationale behind  protests against nuclear plants is that it takes a huge capital investment to build up a nuclear plant (from $3 to $5 billion dollars) (Nuclear Energy Information Service , 2004) , to research the new reactors (approximate 1 billion US dollars for each prototype of generation IV reactors) (Nature publishing group , 2004) .
From the viewpoint of those against , to gain such a sum , the government has to cut off its expenditure on  on education , health  , etc , and raise taxes .
In my opinion , it is essential to invest in a new nuclear power plant .
First , if the government fosters  research and development in the nuclear industry , the cost for building and maintaining the new nuclear power plant will be  affordable  .
Second , the expenditure can be compensated for by  profit since a nuclear plant is competitive in comparison with coal and oil industries in terms of productivity and environment .
Third ,  fossil resources are shrinking rapidly , so the cost for coal and oil would increase sharply in the future .
Last , if the country continues producing energy without reducing the burning of oil and coal ,  health and social service expenses will rise  .
At any rate , the government has to increase its expenditure .
For the lead-cooled fast reactor , it has new features to increase the longevity of core life , and  scientists have come up with the idea of creating a medium size reactor to reduce the cost .
Last but not least , the skeptics are worried about security .
They believe that the development of nuclear states might create opportunities to produce nuclear weapons from  plutonium reprocessing and uranium enriching .
Terrorists may also have the chance to magnify the destruction by attacking  nuclear plants and  freighters that carry radioactive substances .
However , the new lead-cooled fast reactor , as I have mentioned , has many emergency systems that make the reactor "meltdown proof" even in cases of human interference .
The closed cycle will reduce the waste as well as the necessity of plutonium reprocessing .
The efficiency of the nuclear reactor also means the reduction of refueling , so it minimizes the frequency of radioactive substance transfer .
In addition , the development of nuclear power also improves the energy security of a country .
In other words , it reduces the amount of foreign energy import , so it can help solve disputes over energy , especially oil .
In conclusion , the new generation IV nuclear reactor , in particular the lead-cooled fast reactor , is an optimal choice for future energy in three fronts -  safety , cost and security - though there are still many challenges  ahead .
Thus , the government should invest more in  nuclear power development to make construction of these reactors a feasible feat .
For the past few decades ,  engineering field has developed drastically to a new  level .
At the same time , the peril and hazard of the engineering installations and systems rise in response to complexity .
However , these designs seem to be too complex and complicated for engineers to work with .
The result was a series of engineering accidents: Three Mile Island , Chernobyl , the Challenger  and more .
Interestingly , the analysis reports of these accidents invariably described human factors as the major cause of the accidents .
Thus , people start to argue the importance of psychology in engineering design process .
Supporters claim that psychology can help to reduce the probability of accidents and  emphasize  the value of human lives .
Opponents , mainly composed of engineers and operators , consider costs more and somehow ignore  safety measure as it is reasonable for suppliers to produce at a minimum cost .
Although engineers and operators tend to oppose the use of psychology in engineering design process , research results have shown the importance of psychology in preventing accidents by using their professional knowledge .
One of the most famous accidents -- the Chernobyl accident that occurred on 26 April 1986 in the Soviet Ukraine -- is a typical type of engineering accident .
Frot's (2000) studies gave two main causes of the explosion of the Chernobyl reactors: design errors and faults of management and errors committed by the operating staff .
While psychology is described as a necessity in improving the safety measures during a design process , opponents are still sceptical about the validity and reliability in psychology research .
Karanian (1988)  showed how  engineers think: "The content is considered repetitive and filled with slanted views and reflective of self-interest and personal bias" .
They claim that psychology tends to talk a lot but there are too few really good theories .
However , their disbelief is mainly due to their lack of knowledge about  studies of psychology .
According to the International Ergonomics Association (2000) , engineering psychology is defined as "the scientific discipline concerned with the understanding of interactions among humans and other elements of a system , and the profession that applies theory , principles , data and methods to design in order to optimize human well-being and overall system performance" .
It does not only reflect on how human thinking solve human errors but it also uses sophisticated theory and principles  .
For example , one famous psychology law -- Hick's Law -- describes the amount of time that a person takes to make a decision , given several possible choices he or she has .
It can be seen that psychology is a professional field that has been accepted by  society and the theories and principles are useful in analysing  latent designing errors .
Still , opponents argue that accidents are unpredictable as there are too many possible causes .
However , research has shown that causes are basically formed by human errors .
In the Chernobyl accident , six human errors were identified (Frot , 2000) .
The reactors were not well-designed and operators were not sufficiently trained .
Wickens , Gordon and Liu (1997) defined human errors as "mistakes made by human operating a system , humans who designed the equipment , who supervise the worker , and who trained or advised the worker" and those human errors can be categorized as psychological factors .
Psychology which deals with human behaviours is therefore the best preventive way to avoid engineering accidents .
During a design process , designers do not focus on human response to the design and there is frequent mismatch between  operators and  designed machines (Wilpert , 2007) .
However , psychology takes human behaviours into consideration while using the machines and they look into questions like "Are the machines too complex for the operators to deal with ?
Or will the operators feel fatigued easily while using the machines ?"
Accidents are hard to predict , but psychology will definitely help to reduce the probability of occurrence of accidents .
A single error will usually not produce an accident but it arises from a number of failures (Noyes , 1997) .
Those latent errors mostly arise during the design process .
For the Chernobyl accident , there were five major design errors (Frot , 2000) .
These five design errors then led to the start of the accident .
Eventually , latent and active failures had come together to create this tragedy .
Why are there so many errors ?
Actually human errors are inevitable but can only be minimized to a tolerable extent (Noyes , 1997) .
Psychology is useful in foreseeing latent errors and thus it is easier to come out with a solution that will reduce the probability of an accident .
It can be done by designing a less complex device , giving more useful information and practice for operators in charge , designing better backup systems and so on .
With the aid of psychology which focuses on safety measures , accidents are more likely to be avoided .
In brief , while engineering has become a much sophisticated field , safety measures have become more and more important at the same time .
People have incurred much loss in terms of money and lives in various engineering accidents and they will not want to experience any disaster anymore .
While research has shown that most of the causes are due to human error , people are able to solve this problem by using psychology .
Human errors are unavoidable , but psychology is meant to reduce the effect caused by these errors  .
Although some engineers and operators still oppose the use of psychology , for human safety , it is worthwhile to include psychology in an engineering design process .
In the current world , nuclear technology has evolved significantly and researchers have come out with many prototypes and systems which can benefit the world .
The latest systems are the Generation IV nuclear systems which were introduced in 2002 .
Now , the 6 nuclear energy systems are technologies which include advantages like reduced capital cost , enhanced nuclear safety , minimal generation of nuclear waste , and further reduction of the risk of weapon material proliferation .
Gen IV systems are designed to be highly sustainable because the energy they produce meets the desire for clean air and in the long term , benefits the environment(Bouchard ,J) . , Each system has its own advantages in terms of performance , cost and security (Generation IV International Forum GIF and U .S . Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee NERAC)
The Lead-Cooled Fast Reactor (LFR) system is a system which uses lead as the coolant and the radioactive fuel used is the uranium .
It operates at 400~500 during its operation .
We measure performance by  the output of the system  and the amount of power it can generate .
Since the lead-cooled fast reactor is not a large scale reactor , its output is not as much if we compare it to reactors like Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) .
The VHTR is a helium-cooled , graphite-moderated , thermal neutron spectrum reactor with a coolant outlet temperature of 1000  C or above .
VHTR outperformse other reactors because of its potential to produce hydrogen .
It is possible to produce over 2 million cubic meters of hydrogen per day and this is the energy which is equal to over 16 ,000 gallons of gasoline per day (Chapin et al ,2004) .
From this , we can see that VHTR greatly outperfomsm LFR .
Safety is one of the biggest concerns when it comes to nuclear powered reactors , because the result is grievous and devastating if a nuclear reactor accident were to happen .
On 26 April 1986 at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine , there was a nuclear reactor accident which resulted in the deaths of many due to radiation poisoning .
To prevent such accidents from happening again , much emphasis has been put into the safety aspect of nuclear reactors  being designed .
The graphitic core structure , helium coolant , and coated fuel particles allow the VHTR to withstand accident temperatures without structural damage or fission product release .
The publication by MPR further added that these features of VHTR replace the current safety systems in current reactors .
This feature is the enhanced version of the safety system .
Because of the very high temperature used in the reactions , hotspots are prevented from forming within the core because the graphite core of VHTRs has very high thermal conductivity .
Another promising safety feature of VHTRs is the helium coolant .
Helium is chemically inert , which means it is not very reactive .
This removes any possible corrosion or irradiation which could occur with the component materials .
In addition , helium does not go through any phase change at or over reactor operating temperature; this will improve  safety because the design and operation are being simplified .
VHTRs are also designed to be proliferation resistant .
Due to the extremely hard reprocessing of its fuel , it deters any means to misuse them  since the process is very complicated .
Although this feature does not really decrease the chance of reprocessing to zero , it does complicate the means to try to reprocess them (Chapin et al ,2004) .
On the other hand , lead-cooled fast reactors (LFRs) have various safety issues which are of concern when it comes to building a safe reactor .
There are chances of corrosion of lead with its reactors' component materials when temperature is increased .
(Generation IV International Forum GIF and U .S . Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee NERAC) .
This will pose as a threat for  workers at the reactors due to the corrosion of the materials .
Because the Gen IV's VHTR systems are built on the older generation of high temperature reactors , therefore many of the safety systems which already existed in the old reactors are further being enhanced .
In this way , the safety systems in VHTR do exceed the ones in LFRs .
For the generation IV nuclear reactor systems , the cost of the individual reactors varies and some are far more costly than others .
The estimated cost of building a 100MWE prototype of lead-cooled fast reactor in the U .S . is between $400-$700 million (Brown ,N .W .) .
Compared with this , the cost of building a VHTR reactor is much higher; it has an estimated cost of about $1 .1 billion (Butler , D .2004 , May 20) .
This is partially due to the reason that VHTR's coolant , helium gas ,  is much more costly than LFRs' coolant , and because of the strong structure that VHTR consists , it costs more to build .
However , most importantly , the extra cost of the system must be valid and used in an effective way .
In the case of VHTR , though more costly than LFRs , its performance and safety systems exceed those of LFRs , which justifies the extra cost incurred in building VHTRs .
In conclusion , both Very high temperature and lead-cooled fast reactors have good performance and excellent safety systems , but VHTRs are on a higher end as compared to LFRs due to the greater system performance and system safety it provides .
Hence , VHTRs are , to some extent , better than LFRs .
However , there is no doubt that the energy demand will continue increasing , since human beings cannot slow down the pace of technology development .
In this case , we have to consider more about energy-producingrecent research and development of generation IV nuclear reactor makes the large scaled use of nuclear energy more reliable and feasible , because of its sustainability , reliability , economics and proliferation resistance .
Some may say that nuclear plant is dangerous , after seeing those nuclear accidents in the last few decades .
However , the generation IV reactors are quite different from the previous ones .
Here , we are going to discuss two of the generation IV reactors , Gas-cooled Fast Reactor (GFR) , which features a fast-neutron-spectrum , helium-cooled reactor and closed fuel cycle , and Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor (SWCR) , which is a high-temperature , high-pressure water-cooled reactor that operates above the thermodynamic critical point of water .
I think that GFR does a better job than SWCR , respectively in the aspect of efficiency , cost and security .
When talking about an energy generating method , efficiency will to increasegnored .

Chernobyl , Ukraine is the location of the most fatal nuclear accident that happened on April 26 , 1986 .
The accident caused many deaths and resulted in severe health impacts due to  the population's exposure to radiation (Cleveland , 2009) .
There is a debate on whether the use of psychology during the design process would have prevented the Chernobyl tragedy .
The critics argue that the calamity took place due to human factors which were beyond the control of the engineers .
The use of psychology would be irrelevant .
On the other hand , the supporters claim that through the use of psychology , the engineers might have has anticipated different scenarios that could happen and designed a safer and more stable plant .
In other words , the Chernobyl accident could have been prevented and if better safety measures were in place , the effects of the accident would have been minimized .
According to Wilpert (2007) , human actions usually play a significant role in provoking accidents .
In the Chernobyl accident , the operators lacked the expertise of operating the nuclear power plant and were inadequately trained .
They also violated several operating and safety regulations (Serrill , 1986) .
These led to the explosion of the power plant .
The engineers did not factor in the possibility of the operators switching off the security systems as its probability was close to zero (Gorbachev , n .d .) .
The use of psychology would be ineffective as the carelessness of the operators was beyond the control of the engineers .
However , psychology has a vital role in all human ventures (Wilpert , 2007) .
The problem of psychopathology of design refers to a mismatch of the engineers' and the operators' theoretical models which happened in this case .
The use of  occupational psychology could have aided the engineers in understanding that the operators might not have been equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge to operate the plant .
They could  have exercised precaution such that unauthorized personnel could not shut down the emergency safety systems (World Nuclear Association , 2007) .
Therefore , there is a possibility that the use of psychology would have prevented the accident .
At the very least , it would have had weakened the severity of the consequences .
Human actions alone could not trigger the explosion .
The Chernobyl reactor was unstable due to the positive void coefficient which made  power exacerbation uncontrollable .
It did not have a containment structure to reduce the amount of the radioactivity released (World Nuclear Association , 2007) .
The poorly designed reactor contributed to the Chernobyl accident as well .
It may seem that the use of psychology would be irrelevant as the flawed reactor design was a technological fault .
However , this instead posed a challenge to psychology to help modify the plant design through the method of feed-forward safety controls which could be applied in the  (Wilpert , 2007) .
The engineers should be aware of the limitations of the reactor and the use of psychology could have led them to use a better reactor or install other measures to counter the weaknesses of the reactor . 
In addition to the operators' actions and the flawed reactor design , there are external factors that made the explosion possible .
The operators were working under pressure overnight (Stang , 1996) .
A study shows that irregular hours of work can decrease work performance and may result in errors or accidents (Costa , 1999) .
Furthermore , when some reactor components fail to work correctly , the operators face more stress (Stang , 1996) .
They might not be able to think properly and make the right decisions .
Such external conditions are not part of  design process and hence the use of psychology would not be helpful .
However , occupational threats and individual workplace misfortunes are the focus of psychology as they are influenced by the individual's motivation , attitude and decision-making (Wilpert , 2007) .
The use of work and organisational psychology might aid the engineers in understanding how the environment could affect the operators' performance .
The engineers might have implemented more safety measures to counter the failure of each component or the effects of the blunders made by the operators .
Therefore , there is a possibility that the use of psychology would have prevented the accident . 
In conclusion , the main factors that resulted in the Chernobyl disaster are the negligence of the operators , the flawed reactor designed and other external factors such as the pressure faced by the operators .
On the surface , psychology appears to be irrelevant during the design process of the nuclear plant .
On the contrary , psychology could have helped the engineers foresee possible problems during the operation and more safety precaution could have been incorporated .
The use of psychology might have prevented the Chernobyl accident and the effects of the accident would have been minimized .

Generation four nuclear reactor plants went into development with the hope of creating a new nuclear reactor plant that can replace the current old generation three reactor plants .
The new nuclear reactor may be high in cost for research but it has better performance , safety and security measures than the old generator plants .
In this new development , experts have looked into 6 new nuclear reactor plant concepts like molten salt reactor (MSR) and Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) .
MSR researchers did intensify research to ensure that it has superior safety standards and fuel cycle qualities than VHTR .
Therefore ,  research in MSR costs about $1000 million as compared to VHTR's research which  costs about $670 million as quoted from the report on "a technology roadmap for generation IV Nuclear Energy system" .
The latter costs only 20% less than the former and the difference in money spent is used to build  generation 4 reactor's standards .
From the report , researchers for MSR distributed a lot of funds in areas like safety , reactor system and fuel cycle as compared to fund distribution in these areas of research in VHTR .
The areas of safety and reactor systems will be covered later in this essay .
Fuel cycle in MSR needs to have more attention as compared to VHTR  because there is a need to ensure that molten salt which is mixed with  nuclear material will still be functional after many rounds of usage in the system .
The idea of MSR is that it will produce less waste and be able to recycle it .
Therefore , the effort put into this area of research is to make MSR a cleaner nuclear reactor plant that  reduces , reuses and recycles its waste .
MSR works better than VHTR in various ways .
It has a 24/7 circulating molten salt fuel mixture in the whole system to generate energy for the masses .
The molten fluoride salt used in the system helps to lower  vapor pressure , thus , reduces stresses on vessel and piping .
As compared to VHTR , it uses helium cooling to transfer heat to electric energy .
This system generates high temperature of up to 1000 degree Celsius .
Therefore , when there is high temperature the pressure in the system will also increase .
A highly pressurized system is dangerous and needs to be consistently monitored to ensure a safe operation as stresses acting on the pipes and vessel can cause the system to explode .
When MSR is operating at high temperature of  eight hundred degrees and above , it can produce another good energy source .
This energy source is hydrogen .
Hydrogen can be used to generate power for machines like hydrogen-powered cars which are clean for the environment .
In VHTR , in order to produce hydrogen for similar usage , it requires another indirect cycle that consists of a heat exchanger .
This will further complicate the VHTR system and additional cost is incurred .
The fuel used in MSR can be recycled as mentioned earlier .
However , in the case of VHTR , the fuel used is  one through fuel cycle and therefore , it requires proper disposal .
Researchers have been looking into this area , to recycle VHTR fuel waste , so that it will be a clean nuclear reactor plant .
The Molten  Salt reactor  is a lot safer in performance and operation than the Very High Temperature Reactor MSR works based on 3 independent sub stations and is a closed loop that interlink with each other to transfer heat energy to electric energy by turning on the turbine generator .
In  case of an industrial accident in one of the systems , operators can easily isolate that particular system and rectify the problem as quickly as possible without worrying that the problem might spread to  parts of the other two systems .
MSR's design works on fail-safe drainage , passive cooling , and low inventory of volatile fission products in fuel .
As for VHTR , it has only one open loop system to produce  electricity from heat .
Overall , MSR also operates at lower pressure than VHTR as low temperature results in lower pressure .
One of the reasons for development in Generation 4 nuclear reactor plants is  security reason .
The waste products produced by the current old nuclear plants cannot be recycled and need to be disposed at wasteland .
These wastes are highly radioactive and suitable for making weapons of mass destruction .
If these wastes landed on the wrong hands like terrorists , the world would be in chaos as we live in fear of nuclear attacks by unknown enemies .
Wastes generated by these nuclear plants also bring problems to  future generations .
As these wastes take very long to degrade , the land that holds them will become a wasteland which is not suitable for agricultural , residential and commercial usages .
Therefore ,  Generation 4 nuclear reactor plants like MSR recycle their waste products and do not need to dispose them .
However , in VHTR , as mentioned earlier , it produces wastes and researchers are trying to find solutions to it .
In conclusion , even though MSR costs more due to research than VHTR , its benefits outshine VHTR .
Its performance in low pressure quality can help to reduce stresses on equipment and less chances of industrial accidents than a high pressure system which induces high stress to the equipment .
It is safer than VHTR as it has better safety standards .
Lastly , in the area of security , MSR will not create chances of producing waste that will land on the wrong hands like the terrorists as compared to VHTR which has to deal with secured and proper waste disposal .
In recent years , we have seen that nuclear power is one of the main sources for generating electrical energy .
As of September 2009 , there have been 436 nuclear reactors worldwide and another 53 nuclear reactors under construction .
An undeniable fact is that a total of 14 percent of the world's energy was produced by nuclear reactors in 2008 (Nuclear Energy Institute , 2009) .
Another shocking fact is that 76 .2 percent of electrical energy is generated by nuclear reactors in France (Nuclear Energy Institute , 2009) .
There are always concerns about the safe operations of nuclear reactors  , opponents of the supporters of nuclear reactors note that the public's irrational fears towards radiation .
I have chosen the Supercritical water-cooled reactor to support the argument for further research and development funding for  generation IV reactors .
One of the most important factors to support further research development funding is security .
The public often have doubts when it comes to security and safety issues concerning nuclear reactors .
However , the Supercritical water-cooled reactor is one of the safest reactors compared to current generation II and III reactors .
The SCWR has safety measures such as physical resistance against terrorist attacks .
For example , possibilities of an air attack by terrorist do occur .
However , the penetration of the containment for nuclear elements is not possible .
events that lead to the occurrence of such possibilities would probably not reach the nuclear vessel (Carl & Mark , 2005) .
Ever since the Three Miles Island incident , many new safety regulations have been implemented ; also in SCWR , emergency plans have been set up to prevent such things from happening again .
For instance , the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) has set up a 10-mile Emergency Planning Zone (EPZ) to maintain warning zones and also set up sirens and conducted emergency evacuation exercises (Carl & Mark , 2005) .
Such plans are to assist in protecting people within the 10-mile radius .
In addition , cost is a major factor for all sectors including the private sector , the government and the community .
The economics for overall nuclear reactors are hard to estimate .
Normally , the economics of nuclear reactors are basic construction costs , operating costs , the life-time of the plant and the rate of return on capital (Solar Energy Systems) .
Critics often said that the overall cost for using nuclear energy has increased over the years and was relatively high (Jack & Nicolas , 2008) .
In contrast , with the new SCWR , it is possible to decrease its cost since it is cheaper to build than existing nuclear reactors in the United States which consist of the Pressurized Water Reactors and Boiled Water Reactors .
For example , the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission concluded that the operating costs are lower for Light Water Reactors (LWR) compared to coal-fired operating plants and also considerably below the operating costs for gas-fired plants (Solar Energy Systems) .
Thirdly , the performance of the nuclear reactors also contributes to further support and development funding of nuclear reactors .
Performance is measured through the efficient production of electricity , the production and recycle of waste disposal , and the method and characteristics of the nuclear reactor .
Critics often said that nuclear reactors are unsafe , impractical and low in performance .
However , this argument is not true .
The Generation-IV International Forum (GIF) has been formed in order to improve the current generation reactors , thus also improving the performance of the Generation IV reactors .
Since SCWR is under the category of Generation IV reactors , it is also true that in terms of performance , it would be better than current Generation III reactors .
As for the characteristics of the SCWR , it operates above the thermodynamic critical point of water with high temperature and high pressure .
Statistics showed that the thermal efficiency has been increased by 45 percent compared to previous generation reactors (Solar Energy Systems) .
It should be evident that the arguments against supporting further research and development funding for Generation IV reactors are not valid .
On the contrary , recent research also found that 74 percent of the U .S population favors nuclear energy (Ann , 2009) .
Safety measures such as physical resistance and emergency plans have been implemented to improve the security of the SCWR .
Furthermore , the cost of the SCWR which is lower compared to existing LWR reactors also plays an important role in further research on Generation IV reactors .
Nonetheless , the formation of the GIF and the increase in performance  SCWR are also another reason for further research and development of the nuclear reactor .
Therefore , the development of the Generation IV reactors will surely benefit mankind and help  with energy demands of the future .
In today's operating theatre , it is not an uncommon sight to find 3 or more surgeons and nurses needed for a simple operation .
Most surgeries will require even more .
The need for surgical robots will eventually eliminate the number of surgeons and nurses in one operation theatre .
Surgical robots are machines performing operations by having surgeons control them using a computer .
Research shows that patients who undergo robotic surgeries will recover in a shorter time .
According to statistics from Morristown Memorial Hospital (2009) , prostate cancer patients can be discharged from the hospital after one day and return to their normal activities after one week .
Comparing this with  open human surgeries , patients can only return to their daily activities after 4 to 6 weeks .
Surgical robots definitely play an important role in operation theatres in terms of their advantages .
However , as surgical robots are still not widely used , there are some constraints  which patients are concerned about  .
These constraints include the patients' safety in using the system , benefits of the system , as well as the cost of the surgery and the system .
When it comes to  patients' safety , some questions such as the reliability of surgical robots are raised by the public .
Patients feel uneasy having robots operating on them without the presence of humans .
They feel that robots are not able to feel their 'pain' and thus unable to detect any error during the operation .
According to New York Health Times (2009) , surgical robots have successfully helped a patient with a kidney transplant .
This is one of the many successful operations using surgical robots that are happening around the world .
A patient's safety is the responsibility of a surgeon .
The surgeon will ensure that the robots are in good working conditions before having them in operation theatres .
Besides having the robot in the operating room , there will be at least one surgeon in the room to control the robot remotely .
Every movement of the robot's arms is controlled by the surgeon (Morristown Memorial Hospital , 2009) .
There are official training centres available to train surgeons such as the H pitaux Universitaires de Gen ve .
One issue often raised by the public is the need for surgical robots when compared to  traditional method .
The procedures for both robots and traditional surgeries are the same with the only difference of having robots doing the job and surgeons controlling them .
According to University of Geneva (N .D .) , patients who undergo robotic surgeries suffer significantly less pain and less scarring and have a shorter hospital stay .
Some patients chose robotic surgery  solely because of the shorter recovery time (U .S . news , 2009) .
A research  carried out by Detroit's Henry Ford Hospital (2003) states that 100 patients who undergo robotic surgery lost less blood than 100 who had traditional open surgery .
Robotic surgery is useful in some ways such as microscopic precision; it saves manpower and ergonomics .
The surgical robot has keyhole techniques to reach previously untouchable tissues during surgery as unlike in  traditional open surgery (Bonsor , 2008) .
This precise cut will enable less blood loss and therefore , less scarring .
There will be a camera attached to each robot to provide three dimensional images and visual magnification (Morristown Memorial Hospital , 2009) .
This provides safe operation for the surgeons and better control of the system .
Traditional surgeons used to spend long hours operating without changing their hand postures .
With the robot , surgeons can now sit comfortably controlling the robots , hands positioned in a natural forward position , relieving stress as compared to the traditional open surgery (Morristown Memorial Hospital , 2009) .
The final issue is the cost of the surgery and system .
According to an article (The Journal of Urology , 2004) , the cost of each surgery ranges from a few hundreds to a few thousands depending on what surgery is performed .
The cost of the system is estimated at $120 000 with a yearly maintenance of $100 000 (The Journal of Urology , 2004) .
Although the cost is high , it is definitely worth the money given the quality that the system can provide .
The extra cost from the elimination of surgeons can also be used for the maintenance fee of the robots .
The government will also subsidize for the cost of the system and also for people who are in need of financial help .
In conclusion , surgical robots play a very important role in hospitals .
The number of surgeons in each operating theatre is reduced .
Actual precision such as keyhole techniques  produces less scarring and less blood loss .
Robots can also help to reduce hand stress of the surgeons from long hours of surgery .
Surgeons are well-trained before they can operate the robots .
This will enhance safety of patients .
Although the cost of the surgery is high , given the high quality provided from the robots such as shorter hospital stays , faster recovery and safe operation , surgical robots should therefore be encouraged worldwide .
