Nuclear energy is a new kind of energy generated from nuclear power plants .
A hugeuge amount of nuclear energy will come out during atomic reactions .
Because of its high efficiency and enormous quantity , nuclear power energy has developed rapidly in recent years .
However , many negative aspects of nuclear energy , such as radiation pollution , waste heat , greenhouse gas emission etc , also cause people to question its reliability .
Nowadays people argue about the safety  and economic cost of nuclear power generation and they doubt  its ability to help ease climate change as well asserted specifically by some scientists .
According to  scientific observations of nuclear power generation and the positive effect of nuclear energy , there is no doubt that nuclear power is one of the best ways for energy generation , although there are some negative influences .
One of the most controversial issues is the safety  of nuclear power plants .
Everyone knows that nuclear reaction produces a lot of radiation waste which will harm human health .
In the past years , accidents did  happen .
One catastrophic example was the Chernobyl accident  in 1986 in Russia which caused 28 deaths within 4 months and up to 56 fatalities by 2004 just because of  steam explosion and a slight waste release of the radiation of the reactor's core (Chernobyl Accident , April 2009) .
Nevertheless , scientists found that nuclear power risks are actually tiny and they can also be further reduced through using the updated technological reactors .
Facts also indicated that the record of the operational safety of nuclear plants is much better than any other types of power plants (debate on nuclear power , n .d) .
Hence , compared with other energy , nuclear energy actually is much safer !
The second controversial topic about nuclear power is its high cost .
Millions and billions of dollars will have to be spent to build a nuclear power plant .
For example , in May 2008 the congressional budget office reported that the actual cost for the construction of 75 nuclear power plants in the USA is 45 .2 billion dollars; furthermore , they eventually cost  144 .6 billion dollars after taking the facilities into account ({ Benjamin K . S .}[HYPERLINK: http://scitizen .com/screens/usersPage/userSummary/sw_userDisplay .php ?idUserDisplayed=899&sign=08b456d033fcee27acbc8caf208135e8] Nov 2008) .
The astronomical cost is the reason why many people are against nuclear energy development .
But the  argument only considersshort-term effects while it does not pay attention to  long-term impact .
In fact , compared to other forms of electricity generation , nuclear power is ascendant with lower cost .
The MIT has published a 2-year study on the prospects of nuclear energy in USA .
The results showed that the generation cost is 4 .2 c/kWh , which is just the same as coal , eliminating all carbon cost .
An industry study for European electricity has made a comparison of the electricity costs among gas , coal and nuclear in 2005 .
The final data suggested that with its 5% discount rate , nuclear is much cheaper than all the others  (The Economics of Nuclear Power , July 2009) .
In the long run , the cost of nuclear power is much lower than others .
Another reason why people argue against nuclear power is that people doubt  its ability to help ease climate change .
People argue that nuclear is not emission-free at all .
They argue that if we take into account emission in relation to plant construction , uranium mining , transportation radiation and the contamination storage  , in the UK for example , its 23 nuclear reactors can only cut less than 8% emissions .
However , the European Union stated that more achievement with 20% reduction can be reached at zero net costs by 2020 (Velloor R , 2009) .
But the truth is nuclear power can do more than what has been mentioned .
Take France as example .
Its emission of nitrogen oxide and sulphur dioxide has been reduced by 70% over 20 years .
In India , the government also stated that it will sharply reduce  global warming gas to combat climate change (Velloor R , 2009) .
There is no doubt that nuclear power can efficiently help ease climate change with low cost .
Generally speaking , nuclear power is becoming more and more acceptable .
Some countries which did not support nuclear power before , like Australia , have started developing their nuclear power generation .
In an earlier survey , more than half of the Australians support nuclear power now; even 92% of them think it is quite an important approach help ease climate change (Australian attitudes to uranium , 2007) .
Although some technological problems still exist , nuclear power energy , as one of the energies of the future , will surely become more and more popular . 
The notion of addressing the world's power needs has never been more pressing as developing countries become more developed , population increases tremendously and demands for power supply escalate exponentially .
It is in time like this that mankind is driven to innovate and churn out alternate solutions , hoping that coupled with existing ones , he can solve or at the very least tackle the problem effectively; and in this case , an experimented , practical solution would be the further development of nuclear energy .
Due to the numerous advantages that nuclear energy brings about , it is very likely to be one of the most feasible solutions to the world's energy crisis .
While there are public concerns about  cost , security and safety issues involved , the new generation IV reactors are proposed to address these areas of concern .
One particularly advanced concept is the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) , which makes use of helium coolant , which is inert and not reactive , and produces electricity and hydrogen , which is in turn used for the formation of hydrogen cell (GEN IV International Forum , 2003) .
These advantages , along with other safety precaution in place , will definitely serve to tackle the energy problem of the world .
Nuclear energy has never been a foreign subject to energy scientists .
A vastast amount of resources , manpower and time has been invested in research involving it .
Nuclear energy is most commonly produced by the fission of uranium , which produces 10 million times the energy produced by the combustion of an atom of carbon from coal (McCarthy , 2008) .
In light of this , nuclear scientists all over the world are hoping to harness this rich pool of energy .
With the exponential increase in energy consumption , nuclear energy will prove to be a good alternative , or even a primary source of energy .
Detractors argue that it is not cost effective to carry out such research .
The critique is that such costs may not even bear fruit .
However , this is a rather myopic view , as research generally entails foreseeable results in the long run .
The amount of money required for research is initially estimated at 6 billion over the next 15 years for the 6 Generation IV reactors , but one must realize that subsequently the cost of maintaining the nuclear plant as well as the raw materials are far cheaper than coal (World Nuclear Association , 2008) .
The inexpensive fuel cost and the sheer volume of energy produced by a nuclear reactor far outweighs the cost of research and development .
The next key agenda on the minds of the public is nonetheless the safety considerations and implications that these nuclear reactors can have .
While we can gladly say that nuclear leakages are not rampant over the past few years , we can never forget the reactor meltdown back in 1979 at Three Mile Island , where lives were taken away (Butler D , 2004) .
This not only serves as a reminder for generations but also for scientists to reflect upon and further enhance their research .
In fact , it is because of these very reasons that the Generation IV reactors were proposed --  to further improve on the safety aspect of existing reactors .
Most thoughts were put into the proposal to ensure the  level of safety and security in producing such a powerful reactor .
We have realized how much a nuclear power plant is capable of , and a reactor of such magnitude should it land in the hands of the undesired will have grave consequences .
Security issues tied with nuclear power plants have been a very sensitive topic as political leaders have to account for the internal and international security of their country .
However , the concept of a VHTR , one of the safest reactors proposed , encompassed this consideration and will prove hard to be a security breach due to the high temperature in which the nuclear byproducts are embedded in (EU and Energy research , 2007) .
Indeed , nuclear power development carries with them a social stigma; being dangerous and harmful to the society even in the modern world as mankind is skeptical about its use and benefits , and instead are more wary of the few incidents whereby lives were lost .
However , this societal stigma can be eradicated with the help of time , together with education on nuclear energy .
Nuclear energy does not produce greenhouse gases or acid rain , and thus governments abiding by the Kyoto Protocol will definitely be looking at this to cut down on  greenhouse emission .
I definitely believe that it is too early to simply brush aside the whole concept of nuclear energy and classify it as being unsafe .
While we might have our reservations , given the test of time , nuclear energy will be able to prove its worth in our society .
The devastating damage and long-term , "chronic" consequences of the two nuclear disasters at Hiroshima and Nagasaki  still remind us about how dangerous this type of weapons is .
Greenpeace and a lot of volunteer groups and organizations around the world are trying their best to ensure that those calamities will never occur again .
Nevertheless , the scenario of no fuel resources left and increasing extreme weather caused by global warming nowadays have pushed us to reconsider nuclear power .
Governments and scientists support the wide use and development of nuclear power .
Obviously , to lessen the world's thirst for energy in the long term , and to reduce the growing number of disasters , I am in favor of using nuclear power as a main resource of energy in the future .
First of all , we have to ease  public worry .
Consequences of nuclear disasters are still among the most fearful images of the human race .
With approval to widely use nuclear power , authorities have to be responsible for the safety of the entire process .
Mistakes are impermissible because they would kill several people and totally destroy a huge area .
There are also a lot of nerve-wracking problems , particularly chronic diseases many years after a disaster .
Security is the second issue when operating nuclear power plants .
Discrimination is widespread around the world due to terrorism , racism and religion .
Some nations even publicize their support for these idealisms .
Because of this , any source of  .
Otherwise , the degree of destruction would be more fatal than those mistakes in operating nuclear power plants .
However , the shift from fossil fuels to nuclear power is inevitable .
Global warming and worldwide shortage of energy are main problems .
Typhoon Ketsana , Hurricane Katrina , and tsunamis striking the South- and South-East Asia are some apparent consequences of global warming .
In addition , more difficult problems soon arise if we keep using fossil fuels .
Acidification , famine , and disappearance of permafrost , coastal areas and agricultural lands will threaten our future  .
The reserves for fossil fuels are running out .
Thus , nuclear energy is a prominent alternative .
Further research brought us the promising generation IV concept , the very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) .
It not only generates 50% more electricity  than conventional plants from the same amount of fuel , but can also split hydrogen from water , which is another fuel for the future .
Then , we can use energy that is safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and yet proliferation resistant (Butler , 2004) .
First of all , it is possible to generate a large amount of electricity with just a plant .
The VHTR has the highest potential among the six generation IV reactor designs .
Many plants operating at the same time will give us more than enough electricity for industrial and city needs .
It is a remarkable benefit of nuclear energy compared to other developing kinds of energy like solar energy and wind power .
Those types just meet the requirements of residential , office and house needs .
Using nuclear power is a long-term solution to human need for energy .
That is why nuclear energy is said to be abundant .
Secondly , this technology has had a long process of development while solar energy and wind power have just been developed recently .
Humans do not need to invest too much on it compared to other kinds of energy .
Thus , a large amount of money can be saved .
Thirdly , nuclear energy frees us from fossil fuel dependence .
That means no monopoly of some oil-rich nations like in the present .
It will prevent some countries from abusing fuel as a way of achieving political and economic power to form a new world order .
In contrast with fossil fuel , uranium is evenly deposited around the world .
Thus , there will be enough fuel for all nationsand regions .
With this fuel , nuclear power plants are no longer vulnerable to some unexpected scenarios , such as wars , natural disasters or economic disorders .
This is the reliability of nuclear energy .
Lastly , more procedures will help decrease the potential danger of nuclear energy .
Nuclear waste can also be recycled and reprocessed .
Thanks to the rapid pace of technology development nowadays , new materials for reactor construction , ways of observing and controlling process , we can be assured that past accidents like Chernobyl will never happen again .
Without nuclear disasters , no people die due to working inside nuclear power plants .
However , each year , many people all over the world die from respiratory diseases because of the burning of coal , gas , oil , etc .
In conclusion , the advantages of nuclear energy outweigh the disadvantages .
Regulatory systems will create more strict safety measures .
As global energy demands are predicted to soar  relentlessly , nuclear energy is a prominent resource .
It will not only mitigate the consequences of global warming , but also help lessen the world's thirst for fuel for a long period .
We , human beings , have to adapt to a new age of nuclear powerand  fully exploit it rather than be uneasy and doubtful about this controversial type of energy .
With increasing concerns over the impact of global warming and oil prices , fossil fuels alone will not be able to meet the world's increasing energy demand in the future  .
While oil will remain indispensible for transport for a long time , nuclear energy , with its large and cheap output of energy , has the potential to play a big role in supplying the rest of the world's energy demands .
Nuclear energy is currently supplying 17% of the world's energy demand ;  however this number is projected to drop as old plants close more frequently than new ones open .
Unless a new source of sustainable energy is discovered , continuous research and development of nuclear energy should be conducted in order to sustain the economies of the world .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is one of the nuclear generation IV reactor concepts that should be given priority in  research and development .
It uses helium , an unreactive gas , as a coolant and operates at high temperature to achieve high efficiency .
It has  one of the earliest delivery dates among the other generation IV reactors .
Many projects incurred high costs due to extended periods of research and development , thus it is economically more sensible to give priority to a project that has an earlier delivery date .
Moreover , the VHTR does not require the reprocessing of nuclear waste , thus avoiding the separation of plutonium , a key ingredient in making advanced nuclear weapons .
The difference between the cost of nuclear and conventional power plants is perhaps the most important factor in the research and development of the former .
The costs mainly comprise of two components: the investment and generation cost .
Typically , the investment cost of a nuclear power plant is much higher due to its design .
However , based on generation cost , nuclear power plants have a significant economic advantage over conventional power plants .
The high investment cost is offset by the generation cost , making nuclear energy a much cheaper form of energy .
According to Jones and Woite (1990) , in countries where raw materials for generation of energy is not readily available , nuclear electricity is significantly cheaper .
On the other hand , for example in the coal-rich regions of China , coal-based electricity is much cheaper .
Many countries depend on the import of oil , gases and coal for generation of electricity , which means that cheaper electricity is only limited to countries with control over fossil fuel .
Since 1990 , oil prices have risen steadily as sources of fossil fuel decrease and demands for fossil fuel increase .
It is apparent that eventually nuclear energy will be significantly cheaper even in regions that are rich in fossil fuel .
The main reason for public opposition to nuclear energy could be the lack of confidence in the safe operation of nuclear power plants  .
The Chernobyl (1986) and Three Mile Island (1979) accidents are frightening examples of how devastating a nuclear accident can be .
Even until today , people are  dying from the effects of radiation caused by the accidents .
During World War II , the world also witnessed the large scale effects of radiation on both environment and humans when an atomic bomb was dropped over Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
The nuclear power industry is still a relatively new one and  confidence in the safe running of  nuclear reactors comes only with experience over time .
Despite this , the nuclear industry has already an established safety system and stringent checks , and over time , the industry would be able to prove its safety records .
There has been a concern over how the growth of nuclear power will contribute to nuclear proliferation .
The world now already has enough nuclear weapons to blow up the whole planet .
In addition , majority of the nations with nuclear plants own nuclear weapons as well and the nations with the most number of nuclear plants own most of the nuclear weapons worldwide .
Nuclear was first developed under a project codenamed "The Manhattan Project" and it was fueled by  competition with the Nazis to develop the world's first atomic bomb during  War World II .
The technology was later used to generate energy , thus it is inevitable that most countries own both nuclear weapons and plants .
With the introduction of the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT) , majority of the nations have adhered to it and has since concluded that it is also in their security interest to remain without nuclear weapons .
In summary , nuclear energy will continue to play an important role in meeting the world's energy demands .
However , with increasing public opposition to nuclear technology due to the harmful effects of the radiation produced , in recent years more plants have shut down than new ones opening .
The cause is due to concerns over the cost of nuclear plants and most importantly , the safe operation of nuclear plants and the issue of nuclear proliferation .
The concerns are uncalled for as continuous research and development will bring about cheaper and safer operation of nuclear plants .
Measures are also in place to keep nuclear proliferation in check .
As new reactor concepts develop  , it is no surprise that nuclear energy is the "next big thing" .

Many major engineering accidents have occurred around the world such as the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl accidents .
Some feel that  incorporating psychology into the design process can help to avoid such accidents from happening .
This could be one of the reasons why Psychology is now being taught in the design graduate programs of many institutes , such as Chicago's Institute of Design ; it is also used in some design firms (Psychology by design , n .d) .
Psychology is , in short , the scientific study of human mind and its functions , especially those affecting behaviour .
By understanding psychology one would be able to enhance his or her thinking style and creativity , therefore would be able to come up with  better solutions during the design process .
Therefore , the use of psychology in the design process would help to prevent major engineering accidents from happening again .
As stated by Wilpert(2007) , the train accident in Eschede (Germany) , in the year 1998 , was one of the major engineering accidents that had occurred .
It has been documented that the crack in the wheel of the train caused it to derail  (Eschede train disaster , n .d) .
As every design process involves more than one engineer , some people might argue that this accident occurred due to poor team work and effort .
They suggest that if there had been a better team of engineers involved in the design process , they would have worked in an effective and productive manner and would have been able to come up with a better piece of design for the wheel  , thus preventing the accident .
However , these people are not aware that the use of psychology helps one to understand the people around him as well as know their strengths and weaknesses .
This way , during the design process they would have been able to split themselves up into smaller groups and work on the part of the design process they are strong at .
This would help them to specialize in the area they are strong at and hence the entire process would be conducted more effectively , resulting in a better solution or design for the wheel .
Therefore , if psychology had been used in the design process , the accident would not have happened .
Opponents of the use of psychology would argue that if a prototype of the wheel had been built and tested at a high speed it would have prevented the accident .
Khandani (2004)) also states  that building of a prototype , which is the last step , is very important as it helps us to know if the design is reliable to  use .
However , it was noted that Germany did not have sufficient facilities to facilitate the prototype then (German ICE Accident , n .d) .
Therefore , even if a prototype had been built it would not have been possible to test it out with  real conditions .
The use of psychology , on the other hand , would have helped to prevent the accident .
The design process places a very high demand on the creativity of  engineers involved , which is closely related to  thinking ability .
Therefore , the use of cognitive psychology would have helped to prevent the accident .
According to Wanger (n .d .) ,  cognitive psychology focuses on the essence of human thinking .
The use of cognitive psychology would enhance  style of thinking and creativity in the design process , encouraging the engineers to come up with an effective and safe design .
There are a group of people who might strongly feel that if proper research has been done , the engineers at Eschede would have come up with a better design such that any fault in the wheels would have been detected and hence prevented the train from moving .
High technology research on this aspect of design would have been possible and hence would have prevented the accident .
However , the study of psychology focusing on  Human Computer Interaction (HCI) helps one to use the rapidly advancing telecommunication and research facilities to their advantage .
As mentioned , "modern information and communication technologies drastically change the nature of the design process" (Wilpert , 2007 p .297) .
Therefore , the study of HCI would better enable the engineers to analyse  information they gather and would hence  to be able to come up with innovative designs which look into the safety of the design .
Therefore , the use of  psychology would have helped  prevent the accident .
In conclusion , incorporating psychology into the design process would help to enhance the creativity and style of thinking of the engineers and it would also help the engineers to better interact with  advanced technologies and modern information .
Psychology also helps teamwork to be effective  .
Therefore , the use of psychology would have prevented the accident .

In recent years , oil has become very important to many people by providing fuel for cars and most importantly , generating electricity .
We are using more tools that require electricity with technological advancement .
This means that we need more oil to meet our rising energy demands , causing the oil price to increase due to depleting oil reserves .
At the same time , burning oil to generate electricity also releases a large amount of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere .
This has caused many environmental problems like global warming .
Thus , there is a need for us to find other ways of generating electricity .
One alternative we have is nuclear power .
However , there are many who oppose  this idea because they feel that this choice is expensive , unsafe and cannot perform as well as others like renewable energy .
Thus , scientists have come out with the idea of Generation IV Reactors , which will be safer , cheaper and better in terms of performance .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is one of these reactors .
Since  the Generation IV Reactor that is expected to have one of the earliest deliveries with the highest power output (Butler , 2004) ,  research on it should be supported and continued .
Firstly , many people oppose the use of nuclear power as a form of energy because it is expensive to research and build  .
However , they do not realise that nuclear power is expensive only at the early stage .
In the long run , nuclear power is still a cheaper alternative fuel as VHTR can generate fifty percent more electricity from the same amount of fuel in the current coal-powered power plants (Butler , 2004) .
Besides this , the rising price of oil will eventually become much more expensive than the radioactive materials used .
In the long run , the cost of setting up the plant and researching can be offset .
Thus , nuclear power is not expensive compared to other sources .
Secondly , people may argue that nuclear power is not safe  because of the radiation that radioactive materials give out .
The Three Mile Island accident and Chernobyl accident are evidence of their claims .
In the Chernobyl accident alone , there were fifty-six deaths (World Nuclear Association , 2004) .
Hence , they feel that nuclear power is dangerous .
Yet , according to the World Nuclear Association (2008) , the most serious case of nuclear reactor accident was the Chernobyl accident with fifty-six deaths while a recent coal mine methane explosion in China has caused seventy-eight deaths .
Thus , nuclear power is not as dangerous as we thought .
Furthermore , in the new concept of VHTR , it will be "meltdown proof" so it will  still be safe if accidents happen (Butler , 2004) .
Thus , nuclear power is not as dangerous compared to other sources of energy and  VHTR can be made safer with modern technology .
Lastly , people claimed that it cannot perform as well as other sources of energy since it is not sustainable (Langwith , 2009) .
The radioactive materials will run out one day like oil and coal , giving us the problems that coal and oil are giving us today .
Thus , they feel that we should use renewable resources like solar and wind for power .
However , nuclear power is actually a better choice over other sources of energy because it has the best output for its cost and land area occupied .
Many renewable resources like solar and wind require a lot more land mass to generate sufficient energy (Mckenna , 2007) .
Thus , the amount of electricity generated per land area is not as much as nuclear power .
So , if we use renewable resources , we will have to clear more land , which is harmful to the environment .
Furthermore , nuclear power is one of the cheapest powers to generate now (The Royal Academy of Engineering , 2004) .
Thus , even though nuclear power cannot perform for a long time like other renewable powers ,  it is the best performing power that we can rely on now for its efficiency per land area and cost .
In conclusion , coal and oil are no longer sources of energy that we should rely on because of their rising costs and environmental impact .
Thus , there is a need for other sources of power .
Currently , generating power using the nuclear reactor , VHTR , will be our best choice since it has zero emission , cheap , safe and efficient .
Thus ,  research on VHTR should be continued and funded to get ourselves ready before the demand for energy increases much more in 2050 as predicted (Butler , 2004) .
As noted in "Nuclear power's new dawn" , Butler said that the public is concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Public opposition was one reason why few nuclear reactors have been built in the past few decades in many countries .
However , nuclear energy is more efficient and gives a new future for  energy consumption , especially after the use of generation  IV nuclear reactors (Hill , 2008) .
In my perspective , it is a good choice to support and fund the development of generation  IV nuclear reactors for future energy consumption .
The first reason  why it is good to fund and support the development of Nuclear energy for future energy consumption is  the limitation of energy resources .
The main energy resources human beings consume today are coal , oil , natural gas and some other non-renewable resources .
People may argue that we still have enough resources in the following centuries; however , according to a survey done by  world geographers ,  oil will be used up 40 years later if human beings continue using it like they do now .
Natural gas will last 60 years and  coal can last a little longer time , 160 years .
nuclear energy now is hot and it will show its great use in the next few centuries (Gerstner , 2009) .
Scientists in Taiwan plan to build a nuclear reactor and here are some data they made public .
If they build a power plant that can produce 17 .8 billion kilowatt-hour of electricity , they need 81 ton uranium , or 4 .34 million ton oil , or 6 .51 million ton coal  From this it can be seen that the uranium can produce more energy per kilogram and it can partly solve the issue concerning limitation of energy resources .
In this case it will be a good decision to fund the development of nuclear energy , especially the generation  IV nuclear reactors .
Besides the advantages mentioned earlier ,  nuclear energy also does not produce any greenhouse gases , like carbon dioxide .
Many people think green house gases have nothing to do with nuclear energy .
Nevertheless , from a news report in 2008 , "Nuclear power gets green light from UK government" , the UK government decided to use nuclear energy to reduce the production of carbon dioxide .
The generation  IV reactors can really reduce the production of green house gases (Butler , 2004) .
People may argue that  many accidents have happened related to nuclear reactors .
We cannot deny it ; for example , on 26th of April , 1986 , the nuclear reactor in Chernobyl , Ukraine leaked and exploded  .
Although the possibility of accidents exists , under strict management and better technology , the number of accidents will be reduced and nuclear energy will be a kind of energy that is environmental friendly  .
The public should fund its development .
A country can also benefit a lot from nuclear energynot because it is a kind of future energy but also because it can enhance the speed of economic development (Hill , 2008) .
People always say that economic development will depend on  comprehensive national strength or  national power , not  nuclear energy .
However , they may not see the importance of nuclear energy in improving  .
According to a report made by OPEC , in 2009 , China consumed 8 .27 million barrels of oil a day , which is 0 .29 million barrels more per day than 2008 .
And China will rely almost 50% of its whole energy consumption on oil .
The money for oil import is a huge number and that money can do many other infrastructure constructions .
As mentioned before , the material for nuclear energy can produce much more energy per kilogram .
Hence , China will reduce a lot of its oil import if nuclear energy is widely used and accepted by the public .
The generation  IV reactors will perform very well in this aspect .
If we can support and fund the nuclear energy for future development , it will enhance the speed of economic development .
In conclusion , it will be a good decision to fund the development of generation  IV nuclear reactors for future energy consumption .
Nuclear energy has three main advantages --  its high rate of energy production , its being environmental friendly , and its ability to  enhance a country's economic development . 
As we advance into the age of technology , we witness many breakthroughs .
It is significant that nuclear power has marked a new era of science and technology .
However , some people have lost their confidence in nuclear power development after the occurrence of nuclear disasters in Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
But the generation IV reactors that are currently under research and development have been greatly improved and hence they are much safer than conventional plants .
Of the six generation IV reactors ,  the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) has the most potential to be selected for further R&D funding .
Specifically , compared with the Molten Salt Reactor (MSR) , the VHTR is saferand incurs low operation and maintenance costs and modular construction costs .
The MSR operates at the temperature of 700-800  C and low pressurs .
On the other hand , the VHTR requires a very high pressure since inert helium is used to keep the reactor cool .
Thus , the VHTR would incura higherr cost of installing since it needs thicker pipes to sustain the high pressure .
However , the VHTR which operates at a higher temperature is highly efficientin then conversion of heat to electricity compared to the MSR .
For instance , the VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared to conventional plants (Butler , 2004) .
Therefore , with economy of scale , the cost of installing and maintaining the VHTR increaese less than proportionately with the plants' generating capacity due to its high efficiency .
Moreover , additionalR & D technologiesD for the VHTR includings high temperature alloy , fiber reinforced ceramics and composite materials can further improve the efficiency and cut down the costs (U .S . Department of Energy Nuclear , 2002) .
For instance , an optimized approachtor dealing with graphite is currently under research .
Thus , the VHTR is much cheaper than the MSR in overallcosts .
Some people might have a wrong assumption that the MSR has higher performance than the VHTR since it is a fast reactor that relies on fast neutrons while the latter is a thermal reactor that relies on moderators to slow neutrons first .
However , this is not true because the reactors' performances  also depend on  temperature and pressure .
In fact , the overall plant efficiency of the VHTR is more than 50%  compared to MSR's  44-50% .
This is because the VHTR is operating at a higher temperature , thus its thermal power output is up to 600 MW .
In addition , the VHTR is operating in a midsized plant as compared to the MSR which is  large in size .
Thus , it is true that the VHTR has higher performance .
Research shows that the MSR is safe to operate and maintain as the molten fluoride salts used are mechanically and chemically stable at sea-level pressures (DestinationScience .com) .
However , the MSR is operating with closed fuel cycle while the VHTR is operating with an open fuel cycle system .
Thus , the VHTR is neutral in sustainability which means that VHTR spent fuel that could be disposed of in a geological repository or conditioned for optimum waste disposal .
Therefore , the VHTR is definitely safe to be used because the encapsulation for the spent fuel fission products has been further improved so it is extremely resistant to leaching in a final repository (U .S . Department of Energy Nuclear , 2002) .
Furthermore , the MSR discards a larger amount of waste compared to the VHTR .
Even though  waste from the MSR undergoes recycling ,  this process is unsecure as this bypasses the stage where plutonium , an active ingredient for nuclear weapons , is produced .
Hence ,  plants might become  targets of terrorist .
In addition , the cost of recycling is very expensive and a lot of fuel still ends up as waste .
On the other hand , the VHTR enhances minimization through fuel recycling .
From the analysis , the VHTR will spend fuel in a symbiotic fuel cycle that can achieve significant reductions in waste quantity and radio toxicity because of its ability to accommodate a wide variety of mixtures of fissile and fertile materials without significantly modifying the core design (U .S . Department of Energy Nuclear , 2002) .
Thus , in terms of safety and security , the VHTR is actually much safer than the MSR .
In conclusion , the VHTR provides an economically competitive nuclear heat source and hydrogen production capability (Idaho National Laboratory Idaho Falls , 2006) .
Therefore , unremitting efforts and funding should be put into its research and development so that it would give a fresh impetus to enhance the development of nuclear power .
Should funding be given to  Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor over the other Generation IV reactors ?
There has been much debate on whether to develop Generation IV reactors , or to continue using Generation III reactors , which are much safer (Butler , 2004) .
However , with the rising need for energy , going ahead to develop the Generation IV concepts is a logical choice .
Among the six chosen concepts for Generation IV reactors , the Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor (SCWR) is one of the more popular choices (Butler , 2004) .
The SCWR has a much simpler design compared to the other chosen reactors , and would be cheaper to build and operate (Cogeneration Technologies , 2002) .
This will fulfill the nuclear reactors' main purpose of generating affordable and reliable electricity (Buongiorno , 2003) .
In addition , the SCWR is developed from existing technologies that work , which will result in a reduction in the cost of building it and also an increase in its reliability (Buongiorno , 2002) .
Therefore , the SCWR is the most feasible choice among all the other generation IV reactors .
The main reason for choosing the SCWR over the other reactors is the low cost of development (Buongiorno , 2003) .
The SCWR requires the least to develop , compared with the other reactors .
This is due to the SCWR being developed from existing technologies , and some of its core components can be recycled .
In addition , the coolant , water , used by the SCWR is the cheapest among the chosen Generation IV reactors .
The SCWR also creates hydrogen , which can be sold to the hydrogen economy , resulting in the reduction of operating costs (Buongiorno , 2003) .
Opponents of the SCWR would argue that water is a precious resource , and the amount of clean water available is decreasing .
This problem can be solved by using other methods to generate the water needed for the coolant .
One of the methods available to date is the distillation of sea water .
As the Earth is mostly made up of  water , there will be enough water to be used for the coolant of the SCWR .
Therefore , with the low cost needed to develop and run the SCWR , it will be an apt choice for more funding and development .
The rapid decrease in the amount of fossil fuels is leading to development of alternative energy sources .
Nuclear power is one of the frontier alternative power technologies that people have huge interest in .
However , converting nuclear power into usable energy is not a simple process .
Unfortunately , the development is not aided by nuclear disasters , such as the Chernobyl disaster in 1986 and  the Three Mile Island disaster in 1979 , which are two of the most serious accidents which happened in nuclear power plants .
The current nuclear power plants use generation II reactors , for example , Pressurized Water Reactors and boiling water reactors .
However , the efficiency , security , economics and sustainability of generation II nuclear reactors are not up to the mark .
New nuclear technology is definitely needed to be developed to achieve a broader application in the power industry .
As a result , generation IV international forum (GIF) , initiated in 2000 , is currently developing six new nuclear technologies for deployment between 2020 and 2030 .
We will discuss two out of the six new nuclear technologies---Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) and Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor (SFR) .
Then we will decide which one will better meet the energy deman of the future .
VHPR is a good reactor for utilization in the future .
It offers the potential for the cogeneration of electricity and hydrogen , alongside process heat .
Moreover , VHPR is expected to achieve an even higher efficiency than SFR due to its higher operating temperature .
However , after considering sustainability and practicality factors , SFR is better .
It is proven scientifically that hydrogen could be generated in the VHPR system .
However , it is not important , as no research has proven that the method of generating hydrogen can achieve a higher efficiency compared with generating electricity .
Besides , from a practical point of view , electricity is more widely used than hydrogen .
Most of the devices and appliances we are using today use electricity as a source of energy .
There is a rather mature and secure electricity transit and selling system in the world , while hydrogen transit is still a problem waiting to be solved .
It is not wrong to assume that under a higher temperature VHPR can achieve a higher efficiency than SFR .
However , VHTR's aim of operating above 1000 C presents significant challenges in terms of current scientific technology .
There is still a lot of research to be done before putting VHPR into service , which may bring many uncertainties in development and unpredictable cost .
In contrast , SFR has already benefited from considerable technological advancement .
As a result , it is easier for SFR to achieve its intended goal of providing energy to the world .
Similarly ,ditm has the potential too achieeg a higher efficiency rate .
According to an article in Nature Magazine , the earliest delivery of VHTR is estimated to be in 2020 , while SFR can be delivered by 2015 , five years earlier (Nuclear Power's New Down .
Nature  .
20 May 2004) .
Additionally , "SFR offers the potential to operate with a high conversion fast spectrum core , with the resulting benefit of increasing the utilization of fuel resources" .
("The Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor (SFR)" .
Generation iv technology forum .)
Lastly , SFR has an obvious advantage over VHTR .
SFR is supposed to be safer and more environmentally friendly than VHTR .
"SFR have the capability to efficiently and nearly completely consume trans-uranium as fuel , which would reduce the actinide loadings in the high-level radioactive waste it produces .
Such reductions would bring benefits in the radioactive waste disposal requirements associated with the system and enhance its non-proliferation attributes " ("The Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor (SFR)" .
Generation iv technology forum .)
Such feature increases sustainability of SFR and makes it easier to ease public anxiety over the security of new nuclear power technology .
Thus , it will be much easier to put nuclear power plants to work .
Nuclear power is a good substitution for fossil fuel .
The utilization of nuclear power is going to change the world and people's way of living  in the future .
At present , it is necessary for people to decide which one of the six new nuclear technologies is most valuable to our power needs .
It is reasonable to choose Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor instead of Very High Temperature Reactor since SFR has a narrower technology gap , safer and more environmentally friendly , can achieve a high efficiency rate and has the potential to be developed to reach a higher efficiency level beyond the hypothesis .
The first nuclear reactor was invented by Dr Fermi in 1934  .It produced plutonium for the world's first atomic bomb ("World first nuclear reactor , " 2008) .
The bomb , dropped in Japan during the World War II , killed more than 200 ,000 people .
In 1986 , the worst nuclear accident in history broke out in Chernobyl .
The meltdown of the nuclear plant caused 30 immediate deaths along with 100 ,000 cases of fatal cancers in the years that followed (Greenpeace UK , 2006) .
Seventy years into the nuclear age , we are being constantly reminded of its power and danger .
However , the world today has come to a crossroad where we might have to reconsider the role of nuclear power .
In many instances , nuclear power could be a solution to problems we are facing now .
For example , fossil fuel combustion which emits greenhouse gases can be substituted with nuclear power to produce electricity .
Nevertheless , with the high cost and the inadequately safe nuclear technology that we have now , convincing people to embrace nuclear power will not be possible without safer and cheaper technology .
Out of the various fourth generation nuclear reactors currently being researched , the Very High Temperature Reactor , also known as the VHTR , is one of the most promising ones .
Conventional nuclear reactors utilize heat produced from nuclear fission to boil water .
This water becomes steam and drives a turbine which produces electricity .
The VHTR , on the other hand , utilizes the heat to boil helium , an inert gas , which drives the turbine directly .
This brings up the efficiency of the reactor by as much as 50 percent (Hecht , 2008) .
Besides efficiency , VHTR also shows its potential in two other aspects .
The first aspect is in its inherent safety design .
In conventional nuclear reactors , the radioactive fission products remain in the reactor's core .
In the event of an explosion , these products will dissipate into the surrounding .
The VHTR , however , is designed such that the fission products are trapped inside the fuel particles .
These fuel particles , coated with layers of uranium oxycarbide , have the ability to absorb the radioactivity and withstand a temperature of 2000c , way above the working temperature of 1600c (Hecht , 2008) .
People may be concerned that the high temperature of VHTR can trigger an explosion .
However , the worry is unnecessary because the VHTR is able to shut down itself in a situation of abnormal high temperature .
When above normal working temperature is reached , the VHTR reactor is able to catch the highly accelerated neutrons and stop the chain fission reactions completely , thereby shutting down the whole system .
This is evidenced by the test carried out on one of the VHTR prototypes , HTR-10 in 2004 .
The helium coolant was cut off from the system and the reactor was able to shut down automatically without leakage of any radioactive particles (Hecht , 2008) .
The second aspect lies in its economics .
Most people are aware that building a nuclear plant is expensive .
According to a report by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2009) on the cost of nuclear power , the overnight cost (cost without interest incurred) of building a nuclear plant is US$4000 / kwh (kilowatt hour of electricity produced) .
A coal-fuelled plant of the same scale only cost US$1300/ kwh .
While its initial cost is high , VHTR makes up for its efficiency and versatility .
Besides electricity , VHTR also produces heat and hydrogen which can be harnessed for other industrial applications .
For example , heat can be used for petrochemical reprocessing while hydrogen can be used as fuel in fuel cell plants to produce even more electricity .
Hence , VHTR is actually more profitable to operate as electricity , heat and hydrogen can be obtained altogether .
Besides , non-monetary economics should be considered at the same time .
Traditional coal-fuelled power plants produce 20% of the world's emissions of greenhouse gases ("Coal and climate change fact" , n .d .) while VHTR does not produce any of such gases .
The environmental damage done , though not measurable in dollars and cents , should also be taken into account as  cost .
In this context , VHTR is much cheaper than coal-fuelled plants .
Nobody expected it .
In less than a minute , a six-storey building was reduced to a pile of rubble .
This was one of the deadliest civil accidents in Singapore , known as the Hotel New World collapse which happened on 15 March 1986  .
According to the Singapore Civil Defence Force (2009) , this misfortune took away 33 lives .
In an article on the collapse , Tan (1999) claimed that investigations showed the collapse was due to under design made by the engineers , shoddy workmanship and cost cutting made by the contractors (Tan , 1999) .
In this example of Hotel New World collapse , National Geographic (n .d .) also showed that warning signs of structure integrity failure surfaced 16 hours well before the collapse (National Geographic , n .d .) .
There are some special scenarios where no amount of logical preventive measures could prevent accidents from happening , but as far as this study is concerned , the devastating loss of human life and the collapse of Hotel New World could have all been avoided with the use of psychology during the design process , eliminating the errors committed by humans in the design and maintenance phase .
All modern buildings are designed to support what the experts call the dead load and the life load .
The dead load is the weight of the building itself and the life load consists of people and objects like furniture which the building has to support .
Calculations made by the draughtsman of Hotel New World in the designing phase was so badly wrong that he only considered  the life load and had forgotten about the dead load .
It was destined to collapse from the moment they designed the drawings .
Separating the submission of dead and life load calculations could ensure that both loading types were being considered in the designing phase .
To take an even further precautionary measure , safety factors could have been introduced to the design calculations to make way for any unprecedented human calculation errors .
In summary , this accident could have been prevented right from the beginning , taking human errors into consideration in the design phase .
No doubt engineers and contractors had to play a role in erecting the building and also ensuring the safe operation of the civil structure .
More importantly , the users or patrons must not assume ignorance .
Upon completing the construction of the building , the building went into the maintenance phase , making the building operational .
The building showed signs of failure in the structural integrity 16 hours well before the collapse , yet people who witnessed the failure did not react appropriately .
Staff of the building were alerted but did not know what to expect , whereas the management overlooked and had repair workers to fix the cracks in concrete by bracing it with timber .
This event would have turned out differently if the management teams of the building were psychologically prepared .
In other words , educated or briefed on such issues , the building would have been evacuated almost immediately , even having a buffer time of 16 hours on hand to do it , saving the lives of 33  .
In short , this accident could have been prevented with the aid of psychology during the design process in the maintenance phase .
As an additional pointer , the maintenance phase could act as a second safety net to catch  any remaining human errors left unsolved in the previous designing phase .
Risks are an integral part of our life .
Every day we are making risky decisions unknowingly .
It is just a matter of  degree in the risk taken: walking on the open street itself would also mean being exposed to  aircrafts crashing down on you . 
Freak accidents referr to unanticipated natural disasters , such as unforeseen or illogical scenarios like the tsunami that swept across Sri Lanka in year 2004 .
No amount of logical preventive measures taken could hav prevented the disaster from happening .
There are no absolute measures to an accident-free world .
What can be done is to minimize the risk as much as possible , preventing the occurrence of accidents close to nil  , learning from past mistakes and improving if an accident has occurred .
In an article on Keeping Building Engineers Well Grounded , Lee (2008) claimed that Hotel New World is iconic of the construction challenges in the 1970s (Lee , 2008) .
To conclude , it is evident that the arguments involving psychology during the design process in the design and maintenance phase would have prevented the accident in this particular study .
The author of Hotel New World Collapse , Hon (1987) , concluded that the design was bad , the construction was bad and the maintenance was bad .
Human errors  caused the failure of Hotel New World .
Nuclear reactors produce harmful or even deadly radiation while radioactive nuclear wastes are extremely difficult to handle and may even explode with no warning .
Nuclear reactors also produce plutonium as a by-product which can be used in the nuThe Clear weapons .
It raises a global concern that terrorists or aggressive countrnuclear have easier access to the nuclear weapons and may threaten the world peace .
Also , nuclear hseactors are opthe rrational only for around fifty years , requiria mg regular costly replacements
s .However , with increasing demands for energy due to industrialization and the rising price of oil and fossil fuels , nuclear energy remains as an important source of energy despite all the controversies .
Currently , there are mainly six differ types of reactors .
Among them , very-high- temperature reactor (VHTR) and sodium-cooled fast reactor (SFR) are sidered the two most advanced and iable systems .
The VHTR has an open fuel cycle and can supply electricity , hydrogen and heat at a highly efficient level .
Tfuelre reactor is connected to an intermediate heat exchanger to process heat and is able to output the temperature up to 1000 degree Celsius with more than 50% efficiency ("Very- High-Temperature Reactor" , 2003) .
On the other hand , the SFR has a closed loop fuel cycle and is designed to reduce wastes .
It demands less space of repositories as it recovers and recycles 99 .9% of the actinides and has the thermal efficiency of about 40% ("GEN-4: Technology: Systems") .
With regards to safety , the VHTR has certain desirable safety measures under both normal and extreme conditions .
However , the need to operate the VHTR above 1000 degree Celsius puts the limitations on the effectiveness of the safety measurement .
For the SFR system , safety measures consist of a long thermal response time , a huge margin to coolant boiling and a main mechanism that works near atmospheric pressre .
However , sodium reacts chemically with air or water and is a major safety drawback .
Nevertheless , with some innovations , a buffer can be introduced to prevent water vapor from reaching the radioactive sodium in the primary system .
Also , the SFR offers other safety measures such as automatic shutdown function and cooling function in case of accidents ("Jordi , Todd , Lineberry" , 2002) .
The cost ofa reactor varies with various factors .
For the VHTR , the cost is mainly associated with the heat exchanger size and the installation expenses which usually total to about US$781 .5 millions .
For the SFR , the cost can be reduced considerably by using some innovative methods to make a modular design or to remove a primary loop or to integrate the pump and the heat exchanger .
Although the cost of building a nuclear reactor is great and there are concerns about safety , there are several advantages of using nuclear energy as an energy source .
The small size of the nuclear pwer plants allows them to be integrated in the already developed regions and makes the long- distance power transfer unnecessary .
Also , the nuclear energy does not produce pollution directly into the atmosphere in the form of greenhouse gases .
Moreover , a large amount of energy can be produced in the nuclear power plants within a relatively short period of time .
The use of nuclear energy is also advantageous in a sense that it will never run out while oils reserves and fossil fuels are likely to be used up at some time .
With more research and investments in the nuclear technology , the SFR can become a viable energy source in the future .
The infety measures can be improved and the hazardous by-products can be reduced with the advancement of technology .
With the rising demand for energy and the increasinlong-distancermful effects of the use of oil andssil fuels to the environment , the nuclear energy offers an alternative and is regaining some of its popularity and early successes of 1970s .

On 20 April 2004 ,  contractors and workers were having their usual tea break when they heard a loud thud from the structure that they were working on for the past few months .
The retaining wall of the tunnel for the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) Circle Line at Nicoll Highway had collapsed (MOM , 2005) .
Four men were immediately killed (MOM , 2005) .The Nicoll Highway that links Kallang to the Central Business District had collapsed .(Ahmad ,A . ,2004) .
Now , it was damaged as a result of the collapse of the tunnel construction for the circle line .
The collapse of  Nicoll Highway was a controversial issue where everyone had his or her own views .
Could the use of psychology have prevented the accident ?
There were views from engineers as well as the parties involved , saying that the collapse was not due to a mistake in design as they followed the code of practice in their design and the safest bottom-up construction method was used .
There were no occupational hazards influenced by the decisiveness and attitude of the project managers .
The parties involved took pride in their work .
In my opinion , I felt that the collapse was due to a mistake in the design , the lack of integrity as portrayed by the parties involved and the management team's indecisiveness about the situation .
Indecisiveness and negligence of the management team , design mistake and lack of integrity are three factors of psychology which I felt were lacking in the design process which had resulted in the engineering accident .
The reason for the collapse of Nicoll Highway was not solely due to a mistake in the design .
Safety factors were taken into consideration in the design of the loads according to the Code of Practice (LTA , Sep1 , 2004) .
Furthermore , the common and safest bottom-up method was used , said a civil engineer working in LTA .
It was definitely a mistake in design as the investigation revealed that there was an error in the design of the strut support system and that it was under-designed(MOM , 2009) .
Also , it was under-designed by a safety factor of 2 (SCOSS , SC/06/102) .
There were omission and misintepretation of the code of practice (SCOSS , SC/06/102) .Therefore , the use of phsychology could have prevented the accident if the parties involved had not made any errors in the design .
The Land Transport Authority was decisive throughout the whole project as it shored up the surrounding ground to prevent further collapse of the repair work .
If they were indecisive , they would not have been able to decide what  steps to be taken to prevent further collapse .
However , there was evidence showing that the management teams had neglected their roles .
The management teams failed to provide adequate instrumentation and monitoring works , lacked  competent personnel to carry out specified works , and failed to identify adverse trends and implement corrective work (Ministry of Manpower , 2005) .
The management team did not make the right decision about the situation .
There were signs of structure failing but they were ignored (17 May 2005 , Ministry of National Development) .
The above evidence showed that there were human errors such as the negligence of the management team which had resulted in the collapse  .
The parties involved in the construction of  Nicoll Highway were carefully selected and one of them was the Land Transport Authority (LTA) .
Since it is under severe guidance by the government , there should have been  no problems with integrity or dishonesty .
However , there was evidence showing that there was dishonesty and lack of integrity among the parties involved .
From the book on Nicoll Highway Collapse , extracted from New Civil Engineer (2005) , Nishimatsu-Lum Chang (NLC) , being a party involved in the project , was negligent , reckless and dishonest during the design and construction of the retaining wall .
He cut costs by using scrap material as a replacement of stiffener plates as stated by Shanmugan (New Civil Engineer , 2005) .
If the parties involved had integrity and knew that  cutting costs would result in many casualties , the engineering accident would have been prevented .
It was due to the parties' lack of integrity , which was one of the psychological factors that they failed to demonstrate , that resulted in the collapse .
In conclusion , the use of psychology could have prevented the accident if the parties involved were careful about the design and made sure that it was not under-designed as in the case of  Nicoll Highway .
The carelessness and negligence of the management team  caused the accident .
If there were no cutting of costs in this case , the structure wouldn't have collapsed .
In many cases , structures failed due to the dishonesty of the parties involved in the construction process , not just Nicoll Highway but also the collapse of the Hotel New World .
Therefore , I felt that the use of psychology could have prevented the accident .
Nuclear energy generally refers to electrical power from controlled nuclear reactions .
Some people think nuclear energy is good but there are still people whothink we should not develop nuclear energy .
Two sides support their  views on pro and cons to nuclear energy .
In my opinion , we should further develop nuclear energy .
In Butler's (2004) article , there are 6 types of generation IV reactor .
If we look at Supercritical-water-cooled reactors , it is cheap and requires low temperature to generate electricity .
This means it is safer to use this kind of reactor .
This reactor can generate a large amount of energy and can undergo waste recycling .
We can see that the future reactor is much cheaper , safer and more environmental-friendly .
We should further develop nuclear power energy since the cons of nuclear energy can be minimized by developing it .
Some people feel that radioactive waste is the main problem of nuclear energy source because it causes cancer .
Although radioactive waste lasts for a few thousand  years  , fossil fuel will cause more serious damage to the earth because of emission of natural gas that leads to global warming .
Global warming affects the whole world but nuclear waste only affects a certain area .
If we maximize the effect of global warming , all  life forms on earth will become extinct eventually .
will finally disappear after a long period .
(Kowner and Rotem , 2002) .
From the example of Hiroshima , we can see how fast a city is able to rebuild itself after a nuclear warfare .
In addition , the probabilities of it happening again can be further reduced if we put more effort in research and develop the technology of nuclear energy .
Furthermore , nuclear waste is not a problem for future generation IV reactors like the Supercritical-water-cooled reactor because it recycles waste .
Many people think that we should not waste money on nuclear energy because the cost of handling or building a nuclear power plant is very high; we can use the money to contribute to research on finding alternative energy or  the development of alternative energy sources like solar and wind energy .
Energy demand each year is rapidly increasing  so I do not think alternative energy sources like solar and wind energy can meet that need .
Nuclear energy contributes to almost 15% of the world's electricity (Leipoldt , E , 2006) .
If we don't use nuclear energy , what are we going to use to replace  15% of the world's electricity ?
Since there is already a solution to meet the energy demands of  the future , why don't we just use it ?
In addition ,  future generation IV reactors like the Supercritical-water-cooled reactor can produce much more electrical energy than older generation reactors , so we should develop it .
Helium-3 produces much less waste and has a half-life that is 12 years only .
If we use helium-3 we don't really need to spend a lot of money in handling nuclear energy waste .
A lot of countries are racing to go to the Moon for helium-3 that is why they keep improving their space technology .
Lasker (2006) states that NASA is planning to go and harvest it in 2024  so they are developing high technology to achieve it .
We should improve our nuclear technology first while waiting for  nuclear sources from the moon .
Using nuclear energy can decrease the emission of natural gas , generate a large amount of energy to meet future needs  .
The disadvantages of nuclear power energy can be further reduced by research and development in nuclear technology .
In addition , we should prepare for helium-3 isotopes by developing better nuclear technology .
Since developing higher technology can reduce its disadvantages and increase its benefit , we should develop nuclear energy; hence we should support further research and development in nuclear energy .
The Britain's Road to 2010 strategy states that nuclear power , which generates low carbon electricity , is affordable , dependable and safe (Nuclear Power In The United Kingdom , 2009) .
Like Britain , many countries have considered nuclear power to be the best solution to foster electricity as well as the energy industry .
However , after two significant accidents , Three Mile Island and Chernobyl , most people are worried about the safety factor of nuclear reactor plans .
Therefore , Generation IV reactors are researched based on technological goals , especially nuclear safety .
Among these reactor designs , Supercritical-water-cooled reactor (SCWR) is the most suitable concept for funding and development due to its usage of advanced material , safety and economical design and high security .
People who oppose nuclear power plants think that SCWR is not safe enough because it has potentially hazardous requirements .
The SCWR operates at high temperature (510-550 Celsius degree) and very high pressure .
As a result , it needs technological characteristics to prevent physical phenomena such as corrosion and stress (Butler , 2004 , p . 239) .
However , recent studies about materials show a lot of success in finding out a lot of materials that satisfy these requirements .
For example , INCOLOY alloy MA956 that "combines excellent strength fabric ability with outstanding resistance to prolonged exposure up to 1300 Celsius degree" (INCOLOY alloy MA956 , 2004 , para .
1) is one of the candidate materials .
Other promising material , 9Cr-1Mo-1V , can be used under corresponding maximum service temperature at 650 Celsius degree and has several characteristics for resistance to radiation .
Since the materials are subjected to rigorous safety standards , SCWR should be supported further through research and development funding .
One point in favour of SCWR is that scientists plan to manufacture it with simple and economical design .
Some people still doubt the safety of SCWR's design; in their opinion , a simple design may lack specifications that cause unexpected accidents .
On the contrary , the balance of SCWR plant design utilizes a relatively simple direct cycle power conversion system , which also allows for the incorporation of passive safety features .
Moreover , compared to the Light-water reactor (LWRs) , it provides a simplified , reduced volume system with higher thermal efficiency .
SCWR's efficiency is  about 45% while this one in advanced LWRs is 33% (Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SCWR) , 2007) .
Another advantage of SCWR that it is very cost-effective because it involves only one cycle .
In addition , because of similarities in primary system design between the SCWR and LWRs , it is expected that some of the current LWRs technology will be applied in this area .
So the overall simple design of the SCWR will also cut down  construction cost .
Finally , while it's true to say that reprocessing nuclear waste is still controversial , the general characteristics of the SCWR make it an attractive candidate for addressing Generation IV safety goals against terrorism .
The attack on September 11 in 2001 has provided a wake-up call to the threat of nuclear terrorism .
Freely circulating plutonium in the global market is really a huge threat to countries around the world , especially the US .
According to Li (2008) , the Molecular and Cellular Biology concentrator in Cabot House , the United States Congress has decided to use 555 billion USD in the formation of an "international fuel nuclear bank" (p . 54) to prepare for  safe reprocessing .
Furthermore , improved technology used in the SCWR "allows plant operators to shut down the reaction completely at the slightest sign of trouble" (pp .
53-54) , said Li .
That means human intervention will be reduced to the minimum to prevent potential terrorist attacks on nuclear reactors .
On the other hand , in his research , Butler (2004) also reported that scientists of the SCWR would add more steps to lengthen the stored time of long-lived waste , especially plutonium , the "key ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons" (p . 240) .
Taking everything into account , because of its achievement in research in advanced materials , effective design and security , the SCWR should be so highly appreciated to pursue the GEN-IV through continuous development and funding .
Jacopo (2002) argues that electricity generated by SCWR may cost 2 .9 cents per Kilowatt hour , much lower than the recent electricity rate .
So if successfully improved and deployed , the SCWR reactor would effectively generate low-cost electricity .
Our natural resources are rapidly consumed to supply energy for  society .
This exploitation of natural resources will result in a shortage of energy in the next few decades .
Therefore , the search for a quick and powerful new source of energy is urgent and vital .
One of the most promising technologies available today is nuclear energy .
Although the construction of new nuclear power plants is strictly restricted , a new concept for the next generation of nuclear power plants has been announced .
This concept , known as Very-High-Temperature-Reactor (VHTR) , is capable of improving our energy supply , clearing all doubts about the efficiency and safety of nuclear power .
Firstly , although the efficiency of nuclear power has been proven by older models , the new VHTR promises an even more effective production .
Despite criticism about its safety , over the past decades , while still undergoing many restrictions , a small number of nuclear plants alone located in North America and Europe has been providing 15% of global total power .
Some countries such as France rely solely on nuclear power for 80% of its nation's energy supply (Gerstner , 2009) .
This shows how powerful nuclear energy was in the past .
Today , with the upcoming VHTR technology , the amount of electricity produced will be increased by 50% (Butler , 2004) .
With the predicted US shortage of fuel by 2025 and VHTR's expected delivery by 2020 (Butler , 2004) , and if this new generation of reactors receives enough funding , it would be available at the right time to ease the lack-of-fuel crisis .
The second advantage of VHTR is that it does not only produce electricity but at the same time create hydrogen fuel as well (Butler , 2004) .
The concept of hydrogen fuel is not new and its efficiency is of course nothing to be doubted .
Being the lightest element of all , Hydrogen is capable of producing the highest ratio of energy-to-mass ratio (Schlapbach , 2009) .
The public may argue that the conversion from petroleum-fuelled to hydrogen-fuelled would be very complicated and costly .
However , the investment in hydrogen fuel will bring us more pros than cons .
The design for hydrogen vehicles is not similar to that of petroleum vehicles .
A car which runs on hydrogen does not need heavy materials and much space for its fuel tank .
Therefore , it would be much more lightweight than a petroleum car .
This allows a higher safety level for drivers and lower production cost (Schlapbach , 2009) .
Although the mass conversion to full hydrogen-fuelled vehicles might be costly , it will bring more advantages as a long-term strategy .
Finally , other than nuclear , there is still one source of energy that is believed to bring us an abundant amount of energy -- solar power .
Evironmentalists argue that solar power is not just unlimited but also safer .
However , our solar power technology is not that advanced yet .
No one can understand the current situation of global power supply better than oil-supplying countries themselves , and these global oil providers are  in the Gulf (Brumfiel , 2008) .
These oil-rich nations include Saudi Arabia , the United Arab Emirates (UAE) , and Bahrain .
With a pessimistic view about the current global oil supply , these countries hope to quadruple their energy supply using nuclear plants .
Moreover , they are willing to pay up to $7 billion for each plant .
We can see how urgent these equatorial nations need nuclear power and not solar energy .
A vast area of solar panel can only provide energy for 6000 houses (Shukman , 2007) .
With a VHTR constructed on the same amount of area , the  amount of energy far outweighs that created by solar energy .
On the whole , the concept of VHTR can clearly benefit the society much more than any other sources of power .
The development of VHTR ensures us a safe and abundant source of energy for the next centuries , before solar power technology is becomes advanced to meet our energy demands .
Generation IV (Gen IV) reactors are theoretically nuclear reactor designs that are undergoing research and are to be completed in 2030 .
They are projects initiated by Generation IV International Forum (GIF) which aims to come up with nuclear reactors that are more desirable for human use .
However , government policies to promote nuclear energy are still met with resistance from the public .
This can be attributed to the fact that the public are not well informed about nuclear energy .
Many of them still see nuclear energy as it was decades ago , when it was expensive , low performing and deemed to lead to nuclear arms proliferation .
As such , we must find a reactor design that eliminates all these concerns of the public .
Out of all gen IV reactors , only the supercritical water cooled reactor (SWCR) can fulfill these requirements , thus it should receive funding for research .
One of public's concerns is the proliferation of nuclear arms .
A nuclear powered nation can also be a nuclear armed nation .
If nuclear arms fall into the hands of rouge states , regional security will be jeopardised .
An example will be North Korea , which threatens East Asia's stability .
Thus , opponents argue that we should stop investing in nuclear energy for security reasons .
However , they fail to realise that nuclear arms can be produced only with recycled nuclear wasted .
If the nuclear reactor runs on an open loop fuel system , nuclear waste will not be recycled .
The SWCR is able to operate on an open looped fuel system which does not recycle nuclear waste (Butler , 2004) .
If nuclear waste is managed well ,  waste from SWCR cannot be used for nuclear arms .
Thus , funding for SWCR should be increase .
Another drawback of nuclear energy is the cost factor .
The public perceive that nuclear energy is more expensive than conventional energy sources (Hughes , 1999) and thus oppose the use of nuclear power .
However , they do not consider the fact that fossil fuel is depleting quickly (How much Fossil fuel are left ?
When will fossil fuels run out ?
n .d ) .
Moreover , the cost of nuclear energy can be made lower through research and adopting nuclear energy in a large scale .
Although nuclear energy is expensive now , we should be far-sighted and consider the potential of nuclear energy becoming an affordable energy source in the future .
With high thermal efficiency , SWCR is able to produce electricity at a price comparable to fossil fuel reactors (Butler , 2004) .
Thus , by investing in SWCR , we are paying to secure an affordable energy source in the future .
For the sustainability of our modern lifestyle , funding for research on SWCR should increase .
Many people oppose developing nuclear energy because of the large amount of money required for its infrastructure (Wald , 2008) .
They argue that by allocating majority of available fund for nuclear power's development , funding for other potential energy sources like solar power is reduced .
Opponents of nuclear energy propose that we should look at energy sources that are cheap to start up instead of expending our available fund for nuclear energy .
Although their concerns about the diversion of funding are valid , they fail to realise that nuclear power has the greatest potential to meet our demands .
Unlike  green energy , which is unstable and cannot be produced on demand (Wald , 2008) , nuclear power is dependable at all time .
In addition , nuclear power is cheaper than alternative energy (Wald , 2008) .
Thus , it is logical that nuclear power receives the lion's share of funding as it is our best option .
An example will be SWCR that is efficient and cheap to run (Butler , 2004) , making it worthwhile to fund its research .
In conclusion , funding for SWCR's research should be increased as it is the best investment for energy .
In conclusion , the public reject nuclear energy for fear of nuclear arms proliferation , the perception that nuclear energy is expensive and the thinking that a nuclear reactor is costly to build .
However , the use of an open loop fuel system in SWCR can prevent the proliferation of nuclear arms .
With technological advancement , SWCR can reduce the cost of nuclear energy .
Moreover , nuclear energy has the greatest potential for fulfilling our demands .
As such , it is logical that we support  research on SWCR .
